column5: 22oz bottle pours out dark brown almost black topped with a tan head. Nose is roast malts some chocolate and a little ash. Taste is more of the nice roast malts light chocolate and a touch of coffee.

Black colour                                                                                                                                                                                           ,medium beige head. Aroma of roasted malt              ,coffee                         ,light caramel and chocolate. Dry lightly sweet taste                                              ,bitter dry finish. Medium body and soft carbocation. Decent porter.

Bottle: Poured a pitch black with a thin light brown head. Aroma is roasty. Taste is a dark bakers chocolate                                                                                           ,roasted and dark malts.

Lynnwood                                                                                                                                                                                               ,Wa - Total Wine & More - 22 oz bomber. Dark brown pour,medium thick khaki colored head,nice film of lace. Aroma of creosote and fresh brewed coffee. Flavor presents some chocolate notes,a touch of bold espresso                                           ,some topsoil earthiness,a bit of caramel sweetness. Smooth,creamy mouthfeel. Enjoyed this with a picnic lunch at North Cascades National Peak in Newhalem at the Trail of the Cedars trailhead. Rating #4 of 2016 vacation.
The last thing you'd expect when you order a belgian ale. Starts bad                                                                                                      ,finishes worse.

"A failed attempt" is the best that one can say about this. A horrible, horrible aftertaste is what you get as the taste of rotten fruit dissipates on the back of your tongue. Some monks would be kicking ass if they knew about this excuse for a beer. And since when can you just arbitrarily call something a "trappist ale"? I'm tired of micros calling their Belgian style beer "trappist", when the word implies that the beer is brewed by real monks with exacting standards. I propose a new category of beer, called "crappist". This one would fit in pretty well.
Youre kidding right? It was like apple juice and budweiser mixed together.
A multi-medal winner GABF Wee Heavy winner. A perfect blend of alcohol, smoke, and malts. Yummy to the max, and easily the signature beer of the BE.

Bubblegum, alcohol, grapes, figs and raisins in the aroma. Clear copper coloured body with a low, fine bubbled, off white head that recedes to ring. Honey, raisins, figs, grapes and bubblegum esters are strong with some alcohol in the vinous finish. Medium full body with moderate carbonation. Perhaps a bit simple, but enjoyable. Sampled at GABF 2005.

Lasting off-white cover over the clear copper-brown hue. Great display of malt power hints at caramel, bread, cereals, coffee, honey etc. It becomes more scotch ale like once the peaches and figgy fruitiness join in, surprisingly late in mouth and pushing the already fatiguing sweetness even further. Spicy anise, pepper and vanilla nuances derivates the mind from the alcoholic nature for a few moments. Full body, oily and liquorous. Mellow acidity may not be the best option to bring a sense of balance, I�d prefer more earthiness or something smoky in there myself, but as a malt showdown, you are served here.

dark brown w/ a small tan head. a dark malt smell w/ some dark fruits carml�d sugar and very weak tart. Palate is light creamy warm and well coated. Light flvr sweet carmel and brown sugar and a touch of smoke.

(GABF05) Clear light-brown body with off-white head. Aroma is moderately sweet, caramel, some peat. Taste is very sweet, caramel, some peach, light peat. Watery medium-full body, low carbonation, some stickiness.

Growler, served considerably warmer that they do at the bar. Poured a nice ruby color with a thin beige head. Rich aroma of honey, alcohol, maple syrup, and vanilla extract. Taste is very sweet, with vanilla, and a nice roasty smokiness. Burning alcohol sensation down the throat, or maybe its just my heartburn, who knows. I could sip this all night.

Pour is deep ruby amber with a thin tan head...smell is mostly sweet maple and molasses...taste is sweet and malty with some smoke and vanilla...also quite syrupy with molasses and caramel...lots of alcohol sweetness to the quick finish...

On draught in snifter. 2003 batch aged. Reddish-brown color with small head. The aroma is malty with alcohol apparent. The flavor is sweet, woody, some vanilla, alcohol, some oxidation (in a good way), heather, earthy, vineous, silky, amd mildly hopped. It gets smoky as it warms. It has a big body with good carbonation and is smooth and creamy. Excellent beer! Thanks for holding back some kegs!

Cloudy red with some head and creamy lacing. Sweet malt and alcohol with notes of oxidation in the nose. Smooth and silky texture. Malt, raisin, plum flavors with notes of smoke in the background. Definite alcohol warming. It gets even more complex as it warms up. Great beer.

Had on tap at the B-Sides (a little offshoot of the Bitter End). Pours a dark ruby red, not much of a head. Pleasant aroma of toffee, a little bit of molasses., some roasted notes. Flavor has all of the same notes, with the toffee coming through the strongest. Some faint fruity notes appear as well. Good smoky, roasted notes round it out nicely. Mouthfeel is thick and warming. Very good.

On draught. Light golden color with excellent head and very clear. The aroma has lavender and other flowery notes. The flavor has some green tea, lavender, honey, grass, and some sweetness. Excellent beer!

Slightly cloudy yellow; unidentifiable spices in the nose. 1st sip is sorta unexciting. Lot of really interesting tea flavors emerge- lavender, elderberry and jasmine. Tell tale "BE" yeast flavor for sure.
Pours murky straw golden with a thin head and some lacing. Green tea and spicy nose. Very herbal flavor. Thick in body and creamy in texure. I�m not big on hebal beers so this one is not for me.

Had on tap at the brewpub. Pours a light, murky golden with a thin, but sticky and clumpy white head. Aroma brings essence of green tea and some spice. Flavor has that same green tea flavor with some green grape notes and altogther "herbal" and flowery. Drinkable, but not in a beer-like nature. Mouthfeel is somewhat thick and it goes down easy. An interesting experiment, but not one of BE�s better ones.

Wow, this is a fantastic medieval gruit. A sparkling golden. Lavender comes across as does other herbals -- fennel? basil? The beer underneath is held aloft by the herbals. It's slightly nutty and those patented Bitter End grain flavors. Very quaffable and fairly low alcohol (5 or so). Delicious and daring. Another far out and right on beer from Bitter End!
Golden color. Smelled like a spice cabinet. Flavors of various herbs, bready. Interesting, but not something I'd drink often.
One of those beers you just have to question. The bartender did say that it was brewed with green tea. Very floral.
I don't know what to make of it either. Didn't the bartender say something about green tea? I felt like I was drinking a plant.
Way too herbal and floral tasting. I didnt really know what to make of this beer.
Nice honey malt aroma. Clear golden colour with no head. Malty flavour strong on honey and caramel with smooth finish. Medium to heavy body with low carbonation.

Dutch interpretation of the old D�sseldorf beer style, with off-white head and deep amber colour, aroma and taste fruity in onset, malty with hints of caramel and nuts as in a German Altbier, bit metallic, herbal hop bitterness in the finish.

30cl bottle from De Achelse Kluis bottle shop. F: big, tanned, good retention. C: dark with coppery hue against the light, clear. A: malty, caramel, bit fruity, cherries touch, bit vinous. T: sweet malty base, bit watery caramel, fruity, chocolate touch, this is like table beer instead of water, soft carbonation, drinkable.
Flesje gedeeld door Inoven. Zeer weinig aroma. Roodbruin, helder bier. In de smaak alleen maar zoet. Geen nasmaak.

30 ml. bottle @ home, bought @ Sant�, Geldermalsen Clear dark brown with a beige head. Sugar and caramel aroma with a hint of roasted malts. Taste is very sweet as fitting for the style. Short finish. Not a very exciting beer but decent for how it was intended.
Flesje gedeeld met Tom. Zeer weinig aroma. Roodbruin, helder bier. In de smaak alleen maar zoet. Geen nasmaak.

Bottle. Dark brown, bronze highlights. Weak off-white head. Low retention. Smells of caramel, toast, some dry fruit. Light body. Oily texture. Tastes sweet with notes of toast, caramel, sweet malt, minimal roast. Low bitterness. Not bad for that ABV. -- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Bottle @ home. Darl brown colour with no lasting head. Smells slightly sourish, cherry peel and malts. Tastes very sweet, very malty. Thin body, low carbo.
Bottle. Brown with ruby color, foam is not bad, a little cream. Sweet aroma with caramel. Taste light, sugary sweet and caramel, too sweet :(
Dunkelbraunes Bier mit sch�nem beigen Schaum. Geruch d�nn malzig, sonst keine Aromen. Geschmack sehr s�� malzig. Kein besonderes Bier.

Bottle 300 ml at home, poured into a stemmed glass. ABV 3.5% Brown colour on the body, looks darker than it actuallis . Two full fingers of light brown to off-white eventually head, with very good retention and nicely formed webs of lacing left on the glass. Aroma is very malty and sweet. A little bit of roastiness, wet corn flakes. Very sweet taste, very malty, ends with a light metallic flavour, some light soft drink acidity as well, like someone poured a 7up in it. Very thin on the body, average carbonation, that still doesn�t manage to make it taste less flat. Overall very sweet, as all of the dutch oud bruins I have tried, ideal for kids maybe.

Deep dark brown, small creamy tan head, disappears after a while; sweet roasty nose, caramel, brown sugar; medium sweet, slightly bitter; light body, thin texture, average carbonation; sweet sugary finish with hint of bitterness.

Donker Amber kleurig met een kleine bruine schuimkraag. Sterke moutige gebrande zoete kruidige karamel smaak. Smaak palette blijft wel op de zoete kandij hangen. Licht zoete kandij geur. Het meest fantastisch is toch de naam met Batavier. Je gaat toch aan van alles denken waar we als Nederland door de eeuwen heen trots op kunnen zijn. Helaas tegen deze schitterende achtergrond is het jammer dat deze Amber in de middenmoot blijft hangen.... Proefglas

Kegvat Oluthoune Kaisla HkI. Boiled veg aroma with a touch of sugar. Very dark amber. Thin white head. Sweet and sour aroma. Similar to aroma. light-medium bodied. Slick. Fizzy carbonation. Abrupt finish. Not great. Not awful.
Lekkere Amber van Budels. Lekker kruidige geur. Beetje slappe afdronk, dat wel.
Amberkleurig bier met een witte schuimkraag. Heeft de smaak van zoete lichte mouten en een beetje hop bitterheid. -backlog de BierApp-
Many thanks to Erzengel for sharing! A clear amber beer with a huge most good lasting off-white head. Aroma of caramelish malt, red malt, grains. taste of caramelish malt, red fruits, grains, toffee.

Smooth mild and fruity beginning. Easy to drink, fruity with not much bitterness. Quite dry and fruity, malty with a neutral malty ending. Moderate sweetish malts there, round and refreshing with a nice sessionable body of red malty. Nice.
Trockener, etwas muffig pappiger Antrunk. Geringe S��e, minimal herb, monoton. Minimalst Schokolade. 12/6/7/6/9/6

resin, floral, grass, spruce, citrus, herbs, roasty, caramel, bread, hay, cereal, chocolate, coffee, nuts, toast, pale, golden, amber, orange, red, brown, clear, hazy, cloudy, sparkling, rocky head, frothy, minimal head, white foam, tan foam, brown foam, light sweetness, medium sweetness, heavy cloying sweetness, lightly sour, medium sourness, heavily sour,
Fles 30cl thuis. Zoettonen, kruidig, maltig. Commercieel. (11-2013).-------.

12-12-2017; bottle; at home (bought at beerwulf.com, #12 of their Christmas advent calendar). The looks of the beer are nice. The beer has the most perfect amber colour. In the light, it has a nice red glow. The beer is crystal clear. On top of the beer some rather rough, off-white foam is formed. Foam retention is low and hardly a drape is left after already some minutes. The smell of the beer is nice. It is quite a sweet smelling beer. I smell a lot of malts. I smell some nice sweet aromas of caramel and toffee, but also a slight minimal roasty edge. There is also a sweet sugary touch. Besides the malts, there are also some sweet fruity aromas. Hops give some rather plain and slightly floral aromas. Not bad. The taste of the beer is also nice. Not to strong, but not bad. The taste starts with some sweet malts. The maltiness is not as intense as it was in the smell. The malts have a slight aroma of caramel and some toffee. The fruity notes are also present, and give some nice additional sweets. Hops give a nice bitter counterpart for the sweeter malts, thus resulting in a well balanced beer. The palate of the beer is fine. Medium body, smooth and rather low carbonation. The finish of the beer is rather sweet and has some alcohol flavours. Not to special in the finish. All in all, a nice beer. Easy drinkable and quite tasty, but not top segment. More of a high average.
Jammer dat dit niet meer bestaat zouden ze terug op de markt moeten zetten. Vooral met die warme zomers
Fles gedronken met Roelzie. Het is een goudgeel helder bier met matig wit schuim. Aroma is moutig en wat citrusachtig. Smaak is fruitig. Drinkt lekker weg.
Lang geleden dat ik het op heb maar ik kan me herrineren dat ik het veel te waterig vondt. En daarnaast, het blijft D(r)ommelsch en dat vindt ik gewoon niet lekker.
@Backlog 1.6 uit speciale �ijs-koeler� totaal geen aroma, veel te koud, en extreem zwak tot matig pilsje. nee geen tweede meer van dit spul.
I don�t like those �special extra cold pilsners�. Mostly because it kills all the taste. This one is kind of ok. But only when it�s crazy hot outside..
Standard yellow golden color, average white head. Not very different from the regular Dommelsch pilsener. Decent, but noting special.

Orange yellow color. White head, fading rather quickly. Sweet nose, malts and corn. Sweet corn flavour, very light on hops. Mostly just watery and bland. Could be refreshing, if that is the main quality you look for in beer. But in such occasion I�d rather suggest ordering tap water. Really boring. (from 33cL bottle)

Bottled, pasteurised, 330 ml from Camping Flevostrand Supermarket. Pale straw, white head. Thin, grainy, corny beer drunk whilst erecting the awning on a hot day. Not pleasant but had the benefit of being cold.

bottle 33 cl. Pours a clear golden with a small white head and an aroma of hay, malt and hops. The aroma is corny, carboardish, malty and dry. With a dry hoppy finish. Tastes like a cheap supermarket-beer, but isn�t all that cheap.
sweet corn, a bit hoppy, watery with corn. Much like a reguarly ice beer, cheap, and bland. Just another pale lager.
It's the 2.5 which'll keep the rating low...................................

Dit bier was vroeger te verkrijgen bij de plaatselijke cafetaria, die geen drankvergunning had en daarom als alternatief deze bocht verkocht. De smaak was zoet en moutig en als het lekker koud uit de koeling kwam, wel te drinken.
Bottled, 330ml at Cafe de Clipper, Delft. Pale carbonated yellow with slight head. Grim is the word I would describe this. Musty malty flavour. Yep Grim.
Golden colour, almost no head, no typical malty fravor, some grainy hinds and very little bitter, boring one
Bottled. Yellow colour with small white sparkling bubbly head. Aroma is bready malts, paper and some hay. Flavour is very mych the same. Hooray.
Bottle. Nice head with ok duration. Color is pale yellow. Aroma and taste are mainly bready malt.
Bottle. Clear pale yellow colour with a small some what lasting head and some lacing. Bad aroma and taste of malt, bread and grain.
Bottle. Frothy white good mostly lasting head. Very pale yellow colour. Ugly bready aroma. Very bad bready flavor. Ugly finish. Disgusting beer.

Bottle at Wildschut Cafe. Another malty low-alc drink. I wonder why these are called malt as that�s a universal beer ingredient. Anyhow, taste not all bad but couldn�t imagine drinking this by choice...
Pours a very light piss yellow. No aroma to speak of. Thin and sweet........
Only drank this because I was driving, although I told myself to have iced tea instead. Why do I keep doing this to myself. :(

Fairly straightforward, mass-produced example of "Nederlands oud bruin", which is basically the same style as brown Belgian tafelbier. Made with unmalted wheat, sugar, caramel and (artificially added) lactic acid. Beige, not too stable foam over a very dark chestnut robe with a ruby glow. Sweetish, weak aroma with some faint wheat, candi syrup, cacao powder and vanilla, lactic acid hardly noticeable. Round, sweetish malt taste, smooth, again the lactic acid is hard to find but could have added some complexity - alas, it remains as simple as it began, with only a very faint, late bitterness in the tail. Even for this totally unambitious style they could have done better.

Opaque dark brown, foamy tan head, vanishes quickly, some lacing; roasted, hint of dark fruits, chocolate; taste is sweet, sugary, roasty undertones; light body, watery texture, flat carbonation; sweet finish, hint of bitterness.
30cl bottle at home. Clear dark brown with a small beige head. Light to medium body with some carbonation, not much. Very sweet caramel. Not my kind of beer, too sweet.

Pours dark copper reddish brown, tan beige foam, nice ring lacong. Aroma is weak fruity, sweet malty, caramely, Taste is sweet, sugary, honey like. Minimal sour at the end. Light body, watery texture, minimal dry finish. Oa its like honey water, not beer except foam and lasing was very nice. update: Now when I know what style it is low alco not beer, I will re-rate accordingly.
Bottle. Clear maroon color, scant head. Aroma of subtle prunes and raisins. Taste is odd sweet, sour and buttery. Calling this one an oud bruin is false advertising.

Bottle of 300 ml at home, poured into a tulip glass. ABV 2.5% Very thin head, maybe half a finger, beige in colour. It goes off quite fast also.Colour of the beer itself is very dark brown, only when hold against the light takes some amber hues, very dark, again. The head has now gone almost completely, some of it lingers around the glass and a big island of foam has now formed on the surface of the beer. Roasted malts on the aroma, very strong, it makes it smell like dark chocolate, quite pleasant. Taste is sweet, and as with most of the Oud Bruins I have tried, there is a metalic aftertaste.Some notes of the roasted malts are being found on the taste too. Light on the body, with very low carbonation, which in combination with the low alcohol makes it very drinkable, although I find it too "light", some more carbonation would be welcomed. Overall, a modest one in the genre.
Bottle at Locus Publicus, Rotterdam Dark mahogany color, medium head. Perfumy caramel aroma. Sweet caramel flavor, no real bitterness. Actually I find it not deep but quite refreshing.
Dark Brown with brownish foam head lacing to the glass. Sweet aroma, taste is pretty sweet, with some wheats. Very little aftertast. (Velp 201206)

Dirty brown-greige head, small, over muddy dark brown beer with an orange sheen whilst pouring. Sweetish nose, bit of liquorice, and a faint sewer-ish smell, just under the warning treshold. Sugarwater with liquorice and some bready malt. Dissolved brown candi sugar, and trace of overripe banana in the finish. After some time, impression of Traubenzucker. Watery consistency, with a syrupy-sticky thread running through it, as an oiltrace running in the midst of a creek. We would call it tafelbier, and serve it to the kids.
Bottle. Brown, beige head - sweet and malty aroma of candied sugar with some metal - flavour is sweet and sugary. Not a lot of bitterness or sourness.

@Backlog verzamelde toen dertijd de etiketten, deze was smaakvoller dan de standaardpils, graan en mout in zowel smaak als aroma, licht, en matig bitter, maar ja weer een dommelsch h�, �t spul kan mij niet bekoren
Looks good, light amber color and a thick head, but only has a grainy aroma. Sweetish and grainy, medium bodied. Some apple. Clean palate, but lacks flavor.
Blond beer with a small head. Dominant hop aroma. Light sweet taste of hop and honey. Very light bitter aftertaste.
Strong pilsener. Hoppy. taste is malty. Not very interesting this one is. Not let me dominate the Force will.

Strong pilsener are not my style, and so this one makes no exception. Skunky and hoppy smell. Everything has been said actually about this kind of beer. Hertog Jan Primator, Brand Imperator, Dommelsch Dominator. What's in a name?
Clear golden coloured, weak nose. Not very hoppy. Sweet, bit alcoholic finish. As with most strong lagers, i prefer the normal pilsener.
It won't dominate the world yet, but this one is okay.......................

Bottle bought from Bedford Beer Festival last month. It's a fine-looking specimen, tranlucent light brown with a thin beige/khaki head. Raisin, malt, some cinnamon, a metallic note. Quite sweet with a light note of bitterness, with leafy hops rounding out the finish. Some cola nut in the aftertaste. Well-carbonated but not over the top. Decent stuff, inconsequential but pleasant.
Fles 33cl thuis. Erg lekker. Diverse hoppen en mouten, koriander, basterdsuiker. Blond met goede bittertonen. (7-2011).

Bottle 33cl. from a local Jumbo supermarket, @home poured into a shaker. Cloudy pale amber, huge loose soapy off-white head, half-way lasting, good lacing; aroma pale malts, orange, lemon, light caramel, marmaladish; taste medium sweet and bitter, malty, grainy, fruity, earthy hops; malty sweetbitter aftertaste, grainy; medium body, oily texture, lively carbonation; not a real IPA but a decent beer.

(Draught at Arendsnest, Amsterdam, 30 Aug 2015) Amber colour with frothy, off-white head. Malty, fruity nose with dried fruit, apricots and orange. Malty, fruity taste with notes of apricot marmalade, orange, dried fruit and a gentle floral bitterness. More than medium body, with a certain candy sugar sweetness. Tasty and well balanced. Quite nice.
fles 33 cl kleur: amber/oranje mooie schuimkraag. Geur: mout en zoetige honing smaak: licht bitter
Aroma of sweet malts, caramel, honey, candy sugar, some spiciness, metallic notes. Flavour is awfully sweet, candy sugar. Not for me.

Bottle. Golden, hazy, average and fully diminishing head. Moderate, malty and caramel sweetish aroma, light floral fruitiness and faint citrus hoppyness, light yeast. Medium, malty and caramel sweetish flavor, light floral fruitiness, light citrus hoppyness. Finish is short to average, malty - light wheat and caramel sweetish, light fruitiness and light citrus hoppyness. For those with sweet tooth.

Bottle 330 ml from a trade with Countbeer, thanks! Poured into a tulip glass. ABV 7% Deep orange colour on the body, crystal clear, with a small white head. Thin, with good retention nevertheless. Medium lacing on the glass. Aroma is moslty malts, candy sugar, some oxidation that gives it wine-like aromas. Taste is quite sweet and malty, lots of metallic notes, more candy sugar, light sour white grapes. medium thin body, okay carbonation. Overall: This was okay, to tell the truth it�s three months past its BBD but I don�t think this played a sigificant role, three months it�s not -that- old! Still it was quite drinkable.
Modest blond beer, made to be easy. Bit fruity, with some spicy sweetness. Mwoah.

Smells of horseradish, very spicey... dill, thyme... and hey i even smell some Dutch Seedcake (kruidkoek). Tastes like wel... actually i tasted the bloembollen (bulbs). Very diverse and many flavours.
Cerveza estilo escoces muy amarga y con un sabor fuerte a cereal, normal pero muy armoniosa

S�uerlich kirschiger Geruch. Holziger Beginn, eher trocken, ohne die erwartete da gerochene S�ure. Leicht fruchtige Noten von Kirschen, dumpf, leer wirkend. Wenig malzig, was meist im Hintergrund bleibt, erst sp�t voller, dennoch hinter den Erwartungen zur�ckbleibend. Eher langweilig. 9/8/8/7/8/8

Bottle (from hetbiermoment.nl). Pours dark ruby-copper with huge brownish beige head. The head stays. Aroma is sweet and slightly bitter, caramel, malt, dark fruits, plums. Flavor is sweet and bitter, caramel, burnt sugar, malt, dark fruits, spices, licorice. Finish is burnt sugar bitter with some alcohol. Overall: feels a lot like good sweet boozy belgian strong ale.

Thank you for sharing people! Sampled draft @ �Gouda Winterbier Festival 2016�. Dark amber, little tanned head. Nose is overly yeasty, pear, umami, herbal, syrup, mocha, licorice. Taste is herbal, dull sugar, pear, boozy, sugar, herbs. Medium bodied. Meh overall with too much yeast & herbal notes.

On tap at Winterbierfestival Gouda 2016. Clear, dark reddish amber. Sweetish-malty, slightly spicy aroma of caramel, brown sugar, nuts and juniper. Sweetish-malty, slightly spicy taste of caramel, brown sugar, nuts and juniper, followed by a short, slightly bitter, spicy finish. Medium body, slightly oily mouthfeel, flat. Okay!
Draft sampled at PINT Winterbier festival Gouda 2016. Hazy brown. Gumball coatings and dry autumn leaves. Medium sweet with a dry finish. Nope.

Tap at Winterbierfestival Gouda. Hazy brown with beige head. Chewing gum, strawberries, caramel, sweet dried red fruits, pear candies, some fake chcolate bars (koetjesreep), rye bread, over medium sweet and light bitter. Medium bodied, quite some carbonation.

Old bottle, the marked date on the side is from 2007. Thanks to Madmitch76. Shared at SX Bottle Share. Murky brown. White lacing. Apple calvados. Brandy. Sweet maple. Plums. Earthy aroma. Prunes. Taste is plums, prunes, redcurrants, and grains. Soft malts. Juicy. Amazing
Bottle at home. Pours murky brown, nose is sugary, caramel, wood, taste is similar, chocolate.
@ Leeuwarden Lentefest 2014. Poured deep dark reddish brown with an off white head. Aroma is earthy, dark fruit, caramel malt, medium bitter, dry finish.
Brown pour, light head. Flavor of old coffee grind, stale nuts, a bit metallic. Pretty bland. Take this off your wants list hellbilly.

A clear dark brown colored beer, with a light beige head. The aroma is a little muggym with some dark malts and nutes. The tatste of some malt with notes of chcoclate and nutes. The aftertaste is some sweet with bitter.
2012 - 02 - 01 330ml bottle darkbrown colour. small creme head. dark fruits and hazelnut in aroma.sweet taste.
33cl, Dutch brew, with hazelnuts, from De Bierkoning Amsterdam, complex Porter, roasted and slightly smoked/spicy, yet balanced, cloudy, rocky head, nice brew
31st December 2007 A light foamy porter. Not fruity, hint of smoke. Some malt and a distinct nutty tone. Dry finish. Could have been better...
Bottle. Dark amber with a nice, fluffy head. Roasted aroma and taste. Fruit, nuts, toffee, yeast and some light coffee. Drinkable but not that exciting.

Bottled@Konttori, Tampere (a while back). Very deep ambery brown colour with mediumsized brown foamy head. Aroma is sweet malts, nuts, some chocolate as well as mild roasted notes. Flavour is quite much the same along with eather strong hoppyness.

Bottle 33cl.
Clear medium red brown color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, roasted, moderate yeasty, barnyard, earth. Flavor is moderate sweet and bitter with a average to long duration. Infected IMO. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20081003]

Bottle. The aroma is light nutty and malty, a little bit alcoholic. The head is very huge, creamy and foamy, the body is nearly black. The taste is very malty and light roasted, a little bit bitter with a medium duration. Dry body, medium strong with normal carbonation. A nice Porter, good one!
Bottle, tasted with William and friends on 22.11.08. Almost black color, with brown head. Aroma roasted malts. Medium body. Taste sourness, roasted malts, some bitterness.
Gusher! Cloudy brown with quickly disappearing head. Not a very good brew. Thin body, too much carbo. Don�t like the taste of it much. It�s drinkable...
(bottled) Fucking beer exploded everywhere . A honey porter that tastes like a honey porter should. Sweet ,roasty and sokmewhat sickly - a beer for novelty only .!

Bottle @ home. Huge off-white head on top of a brownish / amber colored beer. Don�t smell much, just a little bit of sweetness, I guess from the honey. Taste is dominated by too much carbonation, only taste some sweetness, some nuts and herbs or spices. Don�t like it, mainly because the overwhelming carbonation.

Good white head which does not go away even after a while. The drink is grown and dark red. Smell is sweet and honey. Taste is malty, and there�s some frisk hops. I can clearly sense honey. Only thing I don�t find in taste is typical porter. Aroma has caramel, grass and barnyard. The body is medium, texture creamy and carbonation average. Finish is satisfying long.
13th November 2007 Warning! Early amateur rating! A lovely porter with a slightly thick palate. Sumptuos - no bitterness at all. Slightly sweet and very moorish!

Poured a very dark brown color with a ginormous tan head. Subtle malt nose. Taste was very sweet, didn�t taste much malt, more of a cherry flavored taste. Medium body with very little carbonation. Being a big porter fan, I was excited to try this beer, but I was disappointed right after the first sip.
(on bottle) Dark, rusty red, huge head. Sweet, bready aroma. Very low carbonation. No honey to detect, rather dark sugars. Has a tad of raisins in the flat finish.

Chocolatey brown colour with tight foam head. Sweet aroma. Smooth, slightly oily texture. Sweet honey flavour at first then a full bitter porter flavour with hints of cocoa and coffee. Pleasant, sweet lingering aftertaste.

Bottle 33cl. @ home. Clear medium to dark brown color with a average to large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate to light light heavy malty, roasted, nutty, chocolate, light yeasty, dark berry, honey notes. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate bitter with a average to long duration. Body is medium to light, texture is watery to oily, carbonation is soft. [20081110]

Bottle. Average creamy beige head that mostly lasted. Fair display of lacework. Mahogany color. Aroma of mild chocolate, honey, toasted malt, butterscotch. Medium bodied with an average carbonation. Moderated sweet flavor with some counter bitterness. Lingering liquorish and honey finish.

Bottle 330ml. ABV: 7.0%. Clear medium orange yellow colour with a small to average, frothy - fizzy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white to white head. Aroma is moderate malty, toasted, marzipan malt, herbs, spicy (ginger - anis). Flavour is moderate sweet and light moderate bitter with a average to long duration, sharp bitter, herbs, sweet malt, yeasty. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20120316]

Bottle @ Ulfborg Session, Mid March 2012. Pours cloudy golden with a small off white head. Spicy and yeasty nose and flavor. Herbs, corionader and ginger. Medium bodied. A bit one dimensional. Ends dry
Bottle @ FOneFan. Clear golden with tiny white head. Aroma is malt, fruit and a little hop. Flavour is malt, medium sweet, spices, hops, herbal, medical and a little bitter.

Ulfborg Scooper Smagning 2012. Hazy golden with a small white head. Spicy and fruity aroma with obvious ginger and anise. Sweet and spiced flavour with a yeasty touch. Lots of ginger flavour but only a little spicy heat in the finish
Have to agree with benzai here. Not a bad beer i guess, but not something for me.
Cloudy dark orange color. Poor smell, lots of herbs and vegetables. Taste is, considering the herbs, decent. Carbo is a little low.

Medium yellow head, fast disappearing on pinkish-tinted orange beer, well-carbonated. End of bottle solid yeast � but in suspension, and rendering the second glass visually quite unpalatable. Speculoosherbs (sweetish), slightly (masked?) sourishness. Sweet-spiced taste, mainly liquorice (drop) and some green cardamoms. Ginger too. Very flat, as the carbonation gets knocked out at pouring, it seems. Sharp short sourish ending, also in the mouthfeel. Certainly NOT overspiced. But to say that it is balanced, would be saying too much. It is more like � all impressions knocking each other out. Many thanks, Dean!

2 year old example, it pays of to cellar your beer for some time. Golden ale with a small head. Nice fruity and spicy nose. Tastes malty, fruity and some spices can be detected too(!). Oranges and bananas, sweetish and sourish beer, ginger is there too. Nice bitterish finish. Good medium body. This one matured nicely!

Bottled. Orange, cloudy. Diminishing head that leaves some lace. The appearance is not appealing. Thin body. Sour aroma, pepper, coriander, light citrous, clove. The same holds for the flavor. Yet the spices are not as strong as one would expect from the name (�spiced ale�).

Amber color, cloudy. Spicy aroma, ginger and anis especially. Very herbal flavor, in which ginger, anis and kruidnagel dominate. Hint of pear fruit. Thin to medium bodied. Fairly well made, but I don�t like it.

Bottle; pours dark brown with a beige head; aroma of roasted malt with a little chocolate and a hint of coffee; taste is very light bitter with roasted malt, chocolate, and hint of molasses; finish is dry with some light roast; okay
Bottle. This is a thin porter with a slightly tinny taste. Not at all worth the price point in the US.

On tap at the brewpub. Clear, very dark brown with a beige head. Sweetish, slightly roasty aroma of coffee, chocolate and a touch of hazelnut. Sweet, moderately roasty taste of coffee, dark chocolate and some hazelnut, followed by a short, moderately roasty-bitter finish. Medium body, slightly creamy mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Nice!
Bottle. Poured a brown color with a larger sized tan head. Chocolate, some roastiness, and earthy.
Bottle 33cl. Red brown, very dark with a huge beige top. Aroma is a bit metallic, some malts too. The taste is watery and again a bit metallic which gets stronger in the aftertaste.
Red brown to brown colour, a bit shiny. White head, fair flat qua co2. Aroma has malts, not that special coffee or choco like. Neutral palate, some smokey in it. Nice but not special.

Bottle@home. Appearance: gushing from bottle, deep dark brown with beige head. Aroma: strange stale malt. Taste: stale, medium bitter, sour. Palate: not good. Overall: beer was not ok, down the drain.
Lekkere porter, schuim is wat aan de lichte kant, bier is mooi donker. Niet al te heftige smaken, choco, caramel ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours an almost black glass of beer. It is a nice Porter with a chocolaty aroma.

A 11.2 oz bottle. Pours super dark brown, kinda flat with minimal head. The scent of black licorice and dark coffee are big while chocolate cake sneaks thru in the background. I taste a thin watery porter with notes of coffee, chocolate and a hint of cola. Meh
Redelijke bok. Er staat bij ratebeer uit productie maar hij is nog gewoon te krijgen. Gitzwart, moutig, klein zuurtje. Net geen voldoende.
Fles 33cl thuis. Zoet fruit. Moutig. Caramel. (12-2011).------------------.
vrij laf en monotoon bokbier, lichte moutsmaken en wat karamel, komt te kort aan karakter en smaakbeleving.

Te vlak van smaak. Alhoewel: voor een bok drinkt het snel weg; doet de naam Slobberbok dus eer aan. Wie weet was dat allemaal wel de bedoeling. Wat mij betreft te waterig, vlak en weinig smaakervaringen. Light body (Uit notities van een paar jaar geleden; sindsdien is een andere variant op de markt zag ik van 7,5%. Wie weet is die beter).
Mooie chocoladebruine kleur met een volle lichtbruine kraag. Ruikt chocolade, kers en beetje vanille. Smaakt chocolade, vanille, creme, beetje gebrande mout. Best lekker.
Typical dark bock beer. Roasted sweet malt, with some spices. Quite average.
Slightly hazy deep red appearance, medium head. Malty aroma, some bitterness. Overall decent dunkler bock style beer.
Bottle. Color hazy brown with medium white head. Aroma malt, roasted, yeast, fruits. Taste sweet malt, yeast, spicy, fruits.
Draft at De Paas. Pours cloudy amber brown with a tan head. Aroma of caramel, fruits, malt and some bitter. Flavour is over moderate sweet and moderate bitter. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.
Troebel honing kleurig bier. Zoet van smaak met veel CO2. Mist iets. Gedronken met Bryan. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Exploding after opening the bottle; far too much CO2. (And that problem was already mentioned in 2014, as I see). Pity, because this defines everything about this beer: pouring with small gushes brings a lot of sediment, and no aroma breaks through the enormous head; and I'm left with the feeling that I miss a huge part of the beer... So what I see, after the head has fallen down, is a (now) very hazy amber pour. Can not say anything about the aroma; there is none coming through. But the taste is nice; a fresh and fruity, bit hoppy sort of mild sweetness, caramel, with a substantial bitterness in the aftertaste. Carbo differs: at first none seems to be left, but later it's alright or even strong. Well, how to rate this?? I feel forced to count the problem in... Please, Klein Duimpje, adapt the beer, because this is terrible....

Bij openen spuit de koolzuur eruit waarna er een half flesje bier overblijft Naar wat in de keuken dweilen kunnen we pas dit biertje raten..... Veeeeeels te veel koolzuur zo erg als dit heb ik nog niet meegemaakt. Weet absoluut zeker dat dit biertje niet op enige manier gevallen is. Handel with care is mijn advies. Oranje kleurig met licht mee kleurende schuimkraag, zover je het niet meteen in je smoel krijgt. Smaak apart licht fris, fruitig, zoet met kandij heeft een bittertje, hopje en een zuurtje. Redelijk fruitige hoppige geur. Deze beetje droge Belgian Ale heeft duidelijk invloeden van een zoete IPA. Smaak palette is dan ook lastig te defini�ren maar is ondanks zijn CO2 isseu best ok�. Maar door aanwezigheid van extreme koolzuur is absoluut een lagere rating gerechtvaardigd. En als ik zo achteraf bij mijn mede raters lees ben ik niet de enige die hier last van had. Als ze dat weten op te lossen hebben ze goud in handen. Tot die tijd er zijn genoeg andere betere alternatieven. Proefglas
Flesje gedeeld door Roelzie86. Geel bruinig bier, licht troebel. Geur is fruitig en hooiachtig. Smaak is zacht en zoet en toch fruitig. Weinig nasmaak.
Fles gedeeld door Roelzie1986, geprobeerd met Inoven en Benzai. Het is een oranje geel bier met een medium schuimkraag. Het heeft hoppige geur. De smaak is bitter en hoppig.
Een lekker fruitig aroma. Lichte kleur. De smaak is enorm fruitig. Maar goed als doordrinker.
Large white head foaming out of the glas, golden chestnut colour, yeasty fruity apple malts smell, medium to high carbonation medium to high bitter, very hoppy a bit of pine tree a bit acid taste

Sampled @ Tilburgs Bierfestival 2015. Deep dark amber, little tanned amber,� Nose is overripe stone fruit, fermenting fruit, boozy, esters, raw & green,� Taste is overripe boozy stone fruit, caramel, bread, fizzy, rye, caramel,� Fizzy rye bread,� Meh Belgian style beer. (Thanks for sharing!)
33 cl. bottle @ home, gift from Hilde. Hazy amber with a white head. Grainy, sweet and fruity aroma. Taste is fairly bitter, with some earth and flower tones. Nice but a bit strange beer.

Grassy, and alp herbs, some flowers (tulips from Hillegom?) lot of citrus as well. Nice dark yellow colour, bit of white head. Flavours of grass, tulip bulbs, bitter on the tongue. Ok, but expected more...

Gusher, en volgens mij niet de eerste van deze brouwer. V��l te v��l co2. Blonde ipa. Zowel het aroma als de smaak waren absoluut niet om van te genieten, zo erg zelfs dat ik ook geen zin heb om dit misbrouwsel verder te raten.

I remember this beer...had it few times 3-4 years ago. I didn�t like it it was simply sour and stinky... Specially after a party at friend�s place just by the brewery which smelled so much I didn�t think of it...
Croatian bears is not very good, but this one is in my opinion bad bear even under Croatian standards
it is very bed beer ... it don`t have any flavor of usually beer ... do anyone now where can i buy this beer at this moment .. are they selling this beer...

Oooh, I wanted to love this so much, but I just couldn�t. Pours a very light yellow colour (lemon juice colour), with a small white head. Tasted.... sour, hops were quite present, but damn it was sour. Not sure if I want to drink this again.
Bottled, alc. ABV 5.2%, gr. 12% (BB 12/2004) Golden lager color, small white head. Ashy hop and fish food aroma. Medium sweetish malty body with sharp hops. Unbalanced.
A fairly bitterish beer with some hops in the aroma. Nice bitter flavour ending similar. Not that challenging, but hoppy for a Croatian beer and quite sociable. (Bottle from shop, Varazdin)
I'm only giving it a 2 flavor because natural light tastes worse. This beer should have panties on instead of that crown.
Bottled(500ml). -nice pilsener with good aroma and gold colored.............
Canned, 0.50l. Blend pale lager, luckily retired long time ago. The best thing of that beer was a TV commercial with topless girl serving it :)
I�ve tried this beer many years ago and I remember it sucks. It was brewed only a couple of years arround 1995, than disappeared.
i remember that i drink this beer i think 5 or 6 yers before in CELJE ... it was lokal beer and not produced anymore... not good beer ..
Very blond beer with a medium, rather creamy head. Sweet aroma with the typical Slovenian hop. There is definately an awful tequila like taste to this beer. Not good.
Canned(500ml). -awful beer but not as Celjski Grof Pils is..................

Can, 0.33l. Clear deep straw color with large frothy whit head and sparkling appearance. Extremely awful pilsener with dry mouthfeel and clean grassy and grainy taste with unpleasant bitter finish. Light body, watery texture and fizzy carbonation in palate. Naming such shitty beer after such a noble personality as Count from Celje si real shame. Luckily it�s only a reminder of a past history...

Very blond beer with a small head. Really an unusual aroma; It is certainly not beer. My son just said, after smelling, that it probably was beer, with Sprite or something. Anyway, It is the worst I have had as far as I can remember which does not say much. I tend not to remember bad beers.
Bottled(500ml). -awful I drink it warm and it was like drinking urine no taste no aroma --Is this a beer???????
Op vakantie in Kroati� 0'50l fles een zwart kleurig lichaam met een bruinige kop en met een mout chocolade aroma een mout chocolade zoet licht bitter smaak met een lichte bitter einde
Bottle in Croatia. Pours dark brown color, lightly beige head. Aroma of roasted malt, dark chocolate. Taste is sweet, roasted malt, chocolate.
Dark stout with flavours of nuts, coffee and raisins. Smells malty and sweet, nice beer but nothing special.

Bottle at Caffe Bar Kala, Split, 27/04/19. Deep mahogany brown with a decent khaki cap that dissipates to a swirl. Nose is nutty, brown sugars, dried fruits, raisins, toffee. Taste comprises toffee, sugars, dates, stewed fruits, brown bread. Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close. Decent enough for the style if a touch sweet.
Dark brown color, small beige head. Aroma of caramel, malt, grain, butter, nuts. Sweet lightly dry taste. Thin body and average carbonation. Fine dark beer.
Bottle at Svijet. Jet black nice fluffy brown head. Aroma of medicinal cocoa licorice. Taste is watery coffee. Paired with Miss Donut
Bottle at Old City Bar, Pula. Dark pour with head quickly gone. Sweet, some red fruits, roasted malt. Pleasant mouthful, decent beer.

Pivo u fla�i. Na�alost nisam pio ovo pivo u samim po�ecima kad su ga svi hvalili da je izvrsno. Sada mi to izgleda ovako. Aroma je tamno-sladna ali i slatkasta. Okus je iznena�uju�e slatkasto karamelast , �ta mu prividno daje puno�u , ali nakon par sekundi se to nekako sve rastopi i razvodni. E sad volim kad se kod tamnih piva osjeti malko slatko�e , a ne da su samo na tamnu �okoladu i na neza�e�erenu kavu , ali ovdje je to ipak malo previ�e , pogotovo zato �ta nema gor�ine . �ta ja znam ...mislim mo�e se popiti , nije ba� katastrofa od piva , posebno ako ti ne smeta slatko�a u pivu.
bottle 500 ml... pours dark brown colour with small beige head.. roasty caramelish aroma.. medium body..
Da sam ocjenjivao prije dvije godine, ocjene bi bile full 5. Ovako, na�alost ni�e� Kvaliteta se dosta smanjila na moju �alost, s obzirom da mi je ovo pivo godinama bilo broj jedan
Bottle from Croatian grocery store in Fresh Market. Slightly light-struck, slightly metallic too, but otherwise a pretty clean inoffensive industrial piece.
Klassisches Massenbier mit ordentlicher Pappnote. Dazu etwas getreidig strohig und Wasser.
Pissgul med fint vitt skum. Doftar lite malt, h� och halm. Smaken fyllig, lite malt. Eftersmaken t�mligen kort, lite besk.
On a really hot day @ Havregatan 20190606. Bottle (330 ml) from Systembolaget. Malty, sweet and light grassy with straw, light to medium body with a watery texture. The finish is mid bitter.
Draught at restaurant. Golden color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, hops, toast, malts and grass. Bitter finish with citrus, hops, toast, malts and grass. Okay bulk lager.
Trade from Iznogud, through Max, thanks Neven and Max: pours gold with a white head. Aroma is grainy, typical eurolager... taste is lightly bitter. Low sweetness. Ok.
This is brewed to honour the National Space Centre in Leicester (UK). A nice balance of malts and hops that slides down nicely!

Pour on tap at the brewery, hazy yellow pour with white head, aroma brought notes of grass, bread, hints of biscuit, yeasty notes with a touch of caramel and doughy notes, hints of slight spicy yeast as well. Taste was a mix of grass, bread, biscuit and caramel, some spice, grass, almost a floral note with a hint of toast, finishing bitter, dry.
Cask pour at brewpub. Malty with some citrus notes. Bitter finish. Each sip was better than the one before.

Draft... Ugly medium murky honey gold, a bit of brown, ok light tan head... Super sweet nose, this doesn�t look or smell like a esb, very fruity, light wet grain, ok... Tastes bad, wet skunky grains, very hoppy but a weird greeny quality that I hate
Cask conditioned at brew pub. Cloudy pour from the hand pump with a big frothy head. Very smooth on the tongue. Just light spicy bitterness. Clean.

On cask at the brewery. Hazy medium orange body, creamy off-white head. Herbal, citrusy nose. Nice hoppy, creamy body with bright citrus, floral notes, and bready, cerealy malts. Pillowy mouthfeel. Quaffable.

In short: A light honeyed English blonde ale of some kind. From the cask it was quite good. Probably very ordinary on regular tap. How: From the cask at brewpub The look: Partly cloudy blonde body with a little white head In long: Honeyed fruits is the main attraction. Honey pears, honeyed bananas, honeyed peaches, a little caramel touch and a twist of lemon. The juicy/fruity/honeyed body is followed by hops that add a welcomed contrasting dryness with a mild bitterness. Lacks the crispness that I like from the style. However the cask conditioning was top-notch. Smooth bubbles and velvety moutfeel. Overall it is a very average ESB but the superb cask conditioning really ups my score to a superior ESB but if you remove the cask� well� you�re gonna have beer all over the floor.

On tap at the brewpub. Crystal clear orange-tinted gold, with a white rim. Aroma is a real, dry grassy hop, nice and glowing. Flavor is a little flacid. Cask seems a touch warm to me. There�s some buttery, cheesy hop character right off the bat, and then more of the grassy, juicy English hop style. Fresh tasting. Cask carbonation is working well. Pretty heavily hopped. Not much malt to back it up. Not bad. But, I get stuck on the cheesy, butteriness that develops as being unclean.
Not bad! sweet fruit,citrus and hop aroma....tastes just like abitter should and would be a great session beer.

Cask sample at the brewpub: Arbor likes their Bitters! Pours a cloudy yellow/orange color with a foamy bone white head that lasts awhile. Patchy lacing on the glass. Tangy fruit and malt aroma. Medium-bodied and glassy-smooth with an unassertive hops flavor, as well as touches of fruit and malt. The finish is mildly bitter and short. Pretty forgettable overall.

Cloudy golden pour with a thin white head that leaves nice lacing on the glass. Aroma of citrusy hops. Flavor of citrusy hops with a very strong and dominating bitter finish. The body is light and oily with soft carbonation. Not bad but there�s more bitterness than hop flavor.

Medium gold, IPA-ish looking beer, with a surprising bright fruity character in the aroma and flavor - actually quite sweet and honey-like - hard to detect the rye, despite it being 35% of the grain bill - it is a bit grainy, but it remains sweet and lightly floral throughout - like and IPA/Maibock hybrid.

Date: 04/27/2006 Mode: Draft Source: Brewpub hazy amber, thin fine white head, light sweet carmel malt aroma, sweet malt flavor, sharp rye character offering a hint of tartness, nice bitterness coming in at the finish to balance it out, a hint of the house vegitables on the side comes in and takes it down, Aroma: 6/10; Appearance: 5/10; Flavor: 4/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 7/20 Rating: 2.3/5.0 Drinkability: 4/10 Score: *+/4

3 ounce draught sample at the brewpub on June 19, 2007. Unfiltered, glowing gold with a nice puff of creamy head....spicy, juicy aroma, lots of carroway of course, also lemon peel and pepper, very fresh (they had just put it on that day) and pungent....sweet rye-whiskey flavor with hints of corn sugar/bourbon is just what I�m hankering for, being a recent convert to the joys of rye; bitter/spicy/peppery characteristics dominate the finish.....moderate to high carbonation....could have used a bit more tartness perhaps, but quite solid as is.
I like the taste of rye, so extra point bias. It is dark brown with a little head and lace. Fruity malty taste, though acidic bitter finish
On tap at pub. Pours a copper color with a thin white head. Had a little rye bitterness in the flavor. This one seemed to be pretty sweet also.

Draught. Dark opaque orange with no head formation. The aroma is sweet and slightly buttery with a sufficient level of ripe hops, and perfume. Strange flavour is bready with buttery/flowery hops and alcohol sweetness. I was expecting more from this but I got more of an underfermented medley of sugar and hops. Tasted at the brewpub on December 27, 2006.
On tap at the pub.Get some rye in the aroma.Pours copper with a white head.Get some rye and hops in the flavor.Medium bodied with a hint of alcohol in the finish.
On tap at the pub: Cloudy copper colored pour with a white head. Aroma or caramel and some rye. Flavor, rye, caramel, and some citrus hops to it, oranges.

On tap at the brewpub on 4/27/06: Pours a clear copper bronze with a thin ring of white head. Sweet caramel malty aroma has a touch of noble hops. Starts with a sweet viscous caramel maltiness balanced with some German malts turning more bitter toward the finish. Has lots of citrusy hops throughout, but is perhaps a bit too sweet.

On tap at the Arbor Brew Pub. Poured a medium orange color with a small sized off white head. Aromas of very light rye, caramel, and toffee. Tastes of pretty much the same with a light fruitiness to it.

Reviewed from notes. The appearance was a brown color with a film of a little white foamy head that slid off into oblivion. No lace. The aroma had some damp nuts, somewhat sweet with a super mild roast. Cardboard. Light grassy hops. The flavor was towards the sweet side and had a little bit of cardboard. Aftertaste was damp paper. Sweet wet finish. The feel was light bodied with a decent sessionability about it given the weight of the body but that cardboard flavor, well, it�s smooth and quaint. Overall, I�m a brown ale fan and find this to be a disappointment.
on tap atbrewery. pours light brown with not much head. not much aroma either very plain brown. needs more body
I certainly prefer their Stout over their Brown Ale. It is fine, but nothing that I would go out of my way for or even order again.
on tap at brewery. pours a crisp gold with solid white head. aroma of some hop? taste was crisp and clean with some fruitness from the malt.

On-tap at the pub, poured into a mini pint glass...Pours a medium straw, a little murky. The head is off white poor retention and lacing. Served with a lemon slice!...The aroma is too light, but what I do get is nice, cloves mostly, banana finish...The taste is mostly cloves, too light again. There is a weird hoppy middle that is just out of place. Not a thrist quencher at all...The mouthfeel is too watery...Easy drinker. One of my least favorite beers of the flight, I would skip this in the future.
Very much like a budwesier or one of its kin. A light, bright yellow, unappealing. Little, fizzy head.
Golden? More like light yellow and unimpressive, much like its taste. Reminded me off any beer I could buy in the cooler at your local party store.

Actually called Shackleton Gold. Tried a sample of this at the brewery yesterday. Bright gold appearance, mostly clear with a big foamy white head. Smells of lightly sour hops, maybe tettnang and/or hallertauer. Opens up with a lightly grainy hops flavor mixed in with some coppery mineral flavors. High amount of carbonation, mostly dry but has some buttery sweetness on the finish. Pretty good actually, it's not amazingly flavorful, but it's not watery either.
Tap. Blond colored. Slight in aroma and flavor. The archtypical microbrew crossover.

Nice golden color, two finger white head. Sweet malty aroma. Nice tasting malts on the first taste, with a fairly well balanced hop finish presenting itself at the finish. Feels great in the mouth, which was surprising, I figured this would be very light tasting. Lacing presented nicely.
Very plain. A quality brew, but nothing worth celebrating. Very simple. Quite dull actually
Clear yellow, traditional fare, light malty body is sweet, some hops make their presence known in the finish. Nothing bad about this very plain light ale.
No sediment, small head, faint aroma of hops and grain. Yellow. Not worth saying much about, dry, no malt, little flavor, light body, etc, etc.
Weak head and lace, pale yellow color. Heavy hop flavor. Long lasting aftertaste and it seemed to have a touch of cardboard in the flavor.

Ok ok ok, no one on this whole site likes light beers ... and I am included in that. But, on occasion, it is nice to drink about 10 beers in a single session. Whether you are heading out with this endeavor or you sort of slip into it, this is the beer you'll end up drinking once you can't taste anything anyway. Nice and grain-y with hints of sweetgrass. Low hop bittering and virually no aroma. If the corporate domestics put beer this good in a can, I would probably buy a couple of cases now and then.
April 29, 2014 - on tap at Lily�s. Clear yellowish pour with limited head. Aroma was yeast, clove and fruity. Taste was consistent with aroma, but also had some spice.

Draft. Poured an hazy yellow color with an average frothy white head that mostly lasted with good lacing. Moderate spice and wheat aroma. Medium body with a sticky texture and soft carbonation. Medium sweet flavor with a medium sweet finish of moderate duration. Soft drinkable beer.
on tap at pub. pours hazy orange with nice white top. aroma of clove and citrus. very refreshing beer in the summer time

On-tap at the pub, poured into a mini pint glass...Pours a medium straw, a little murky. The head is off white poor retention and lacing. Served with a lemon slice!...The aroma is too light, but what I do get is nice, cloves mostly, banana finish...The taste is mostly cloves, too light again. There is a weird hoppy middle that is just out of place. Not a thrist quencher at all...The mouthfeel is too watery...Easy drinker. One of my least favorite beers of the flight, I would skip this in the future.

Draft serving. Did smell like bananas and cloves but the taste has much to be desired. The flavor was overpowered by astringent taste that some on else noted. After taste hung around in my mouth for awhile. Will not be drinking this one again.
If memory serves me correctly, another reason to leave American wheat beers alone. Little flavor beyond that blandness that such beers carry.

This draft brew from a festival poured a small sized head of foamy finely sized white colored bubbles that was long lasting and left behind a hazy dark yellow colored body and an excellent lacing. The aroma was hoppy floral malty and slightly astringent. The mouth feel was weakly tingly at the start and at the finish. The softly acidic flavor contained floral notes and wheat. Not one that I would drink again.

Draft. Small white head that quickly dissipated, lackluster lacing, no visible carbonation, cloudy, and a pale yellow hue. Nose was that of bananas, clove, spicy, and sweet. Ditto for the flavor. Smooth palate. Light body.
Tap. Hazy blonde color that is clearer than I would like. Very light clove and bananna flavor and aroma. Decent, nothing to rave about.
Very nice fruity smell, not over powering but distinct. The flavors rush into your mouth and leave it feelign refreshed and satisfied.

column1: Lilys Reggies French River Red Ale
column5: On tap, poured into a nonic pint glass. The aroma is a prominent floral aroma, with a mild caramel and lactose note. There�s also a faint roasted grain and/or rye aroma. It pours a clear red brown with an oily sheen to it. A very thin white ring is retained and a very light, web lace is left behind. It�s a primarily medium bitter sweet, with a deceiving medium sweetness hidden beneath. The beer is slick in texture with a medium full body and lots of soft carbonation. It finishes with a full resin, rye, and citrus rind flavor and some toasted caramel. The resin sticks to the mouth with a mild cereal and caramel for a little while, but it�s not strong, nor does it stick long.

column1: Lilys Reggies French River Red Ale
column5: April 29, 2014 - on tap at Lily�s. Clear copper pour with some head and lacing. Malty, hoppy and slight caramel.

column1: Lilys Reggies French River Red Ale
column5: Draft. A decent red amber style that is a rusty amber color and has a light head. Moderate maltiness with a long finish. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

column1: Lilys Reggies French River Red Ale
column5: growler from the brewery. pours an off red with not much head. tatse was kinda generic with some roasted malt sweetness and slight hop.

column1: Lilys Reggies French River Red Ale
column5: 6th Annual MBG Winter Beer Festival, Grand Rapids. Translucent copper body, medium clumping tight buff head. Nose of round caramel, toast, and diacetyl. Body quite dry and hoppy for the style, with toffee brown sugar, leafy, spicy hops, and light diacetyl. Interesting.

column1: Lilys Reggies French River Red Ale
column5: On tap at the pub into a mini pint glass...This just looks terrible, a light copper that was watered down, totally see through. However, the head is amazing, its a super thick dark tope. A decent cap, but the lacing is unreal. It fully coats from the top of the glass to the beer, amazing. Scoring has me quite confused...The aroma is a really hoppy subdued pale ale with a hint of rye. Needs a little more rye in this, but the hops are nice...The mouthfeel is great and this is an easy drinker. Solid red worth trying

column1: Lilys Reggies French River Red Ale
column5: This draft brew from a festival poured a medium sized head of foamy finely sized bubbles that was long lasting and left behind a transparent uncarbonated dark orange colored body and an excellent lacing. The weak aroma was hoppy vinous and Irish Red malty. The mouth feel was weakly tingly at the start and at the finish. The thin flavor contained notes of Irish red like malts and hops.

column1: Lilys Reggies French River Red Ale
column5: Draft. Small ivory head that mostly diminished, excellent lacing, transparent, no visible carbonation, and the hue was orange. Malt, caramel and hoppy nose. Ditto for the flavor with a bit of bitterness thrown in. Smooth mouthfeel.

column1: Lilys Reggies French River Red Ale
column5: Tap. Attractive reddish amber color with a decent off-white head. Decent amount of hoppy aroma which is promising. On the lighter side of medium bodied. Decent balance with a decidedly hoppy finish. Fair to decent beer.

column1: Lilys Reggies French River Red Ale
column5: Amber color with a tiny head. Malty aroma with both a sweet and sour (as opposed to bitter) taste. Some lemon taste that I think shouldnt be there. Not much going on. If going to Lily�s, stick with the stout.

On tap, poured into an imperial style half pint. Fresh off the pour, the beer smells like fresh baked oatmeal raisin cookies. After this mellows, a sweet, roasted espresso bean note and milk chocolate comes through. The very dark, brown-red beer is topped with a sudsy, light brown head. This reduces to a medium thick ring of micro and small bubbles and a light wispy surface. It leaves a clean glass with no lacing. The taste is a medium bitter with a medium light sweet. The medium malty body beer has a gritty, chewy texture and a fuzzy carbonation. Coffee and oats finish the beer with some dark, dried fruits. A resin-y aftertaste is initially strong, but it fades quickly and is replaced by a roasted note and a dark chocolate covered raisin remain in mellow abundance. It�s dry with a crisp touch
April 29, 2014 - on tap at Lily�s. Dark brown pour with some head. Aroma and taste of roasted malt and chocolate. Smooth, but a bit thin.
Draft. Thick black stout that was served way to cold. Got a little better as it warmed but lacked a richness. Would try again but only if I had 30 min to wait. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft. Poured dark brown color with an average brown frothy head that mostly lasted with good lacing. Moderate toasted malt,chocolate and caramel aroma. Medium body with a smooth texture and flat carbonation. Medium to heavy sweet toasted flavor with a medium to heavy sweet finish of moderate to long duration. Good complex stout.

On tap: The aroma consists of chocolate, roast, and light coffee. It�s a dark brown with some orange highlights and a small beige head that leaves behind some nice webbing on the sides of the glass. The flavor starts with moderate chocolate with a touch of caramel. The finish has moderate roasted, light nuttiness, and coffee. Medium bodied with lightly fizzy carbonation. Overall, a solid sessionable stout, but I could go for a less fizzy mouthfeel.
on tap at brewery. pours a medium brown/black with khaki head. slight chocolate aroma and some roasted coffee. taste is on the lighter side of stout.

On-tap at the pub. Strange stout in dead, looks and acts like a porter...Pours a very clear dark brown with hints of amber. The head is an equally light tan but forms a great cap with great retention...The aroma is boring, only a hint of chocolate, sweet...The taste is ok, a little chocolate, bitter roast, a porter but very crushable. Skip this one.
sampled at Lansing Winter Beer Fest 07�...probably the worst beer at the show...aroma was nice and sweet (chocolate and toast)...thin palate led to a bitter, dry roasted watered-down coffee flavor

Sampled at the 2nd annual Michigan Winter Beer Festival, Lansing. Nice chocolate and roast in the aroma, but the beer was of the thin, acidic woody roast variety, with little depth or heft. Not a show-stopper by any means.

This draft brew from the Michigan Brewers Guild Festival poured a small sized head of foamy finely sized brown colored bubbles that was mostly diminishing and left behind a . The aroma was malty roasted malt and toasted malt. The mouth feel was smooth flat and weakly tingly from start to finish with a mild malt bite. The weak flavor contained notes of malt. Not one that I would drink again as it was just too flat and lifeless.
Amber/light brown in colour with big white head. No aroma of any note. Mild hop taste with hint of biscuit/bread.

Tasted 17/01/2005. 500ml bottle from Regional Wines and Spirits. Pours a reddish copper with a light tan collapsing head. Aroma is strongly grainy with a little spice from the hops (Goldings?). Flavour is againy grainy with caramel notes. A hint of whisky in the maltiness but without the alcohol. A peppery hint comes through from the hop flavour. Palate cleans out nicely with a moderate bitterness. A good interpretation of an English Bitter, a style I was more fond of a couple of years ago than I am now.

started out pretty funny but did improve as it warmed. passionfruit frozen yoghurt aroma, the first taste is slightly composty, infected, but later on there was an interesting rockmelon in brown sugar flavour. if they could get their act together they might be able to make some good beers at this place. maybe they should try washing their equipment or something

like kaya i think we had an infected one - this brewery seems to have a bit of a problem, the wasp was off too. very fat, sticky caramel taste, with some fat hoppiness, but there's an alarming amount of rotten rockmelon.

Dirty amber-orange colour. Pours with a tall head at first which quickly fades. Yeasty, very fruiyt aroma. The flavour is way too fruity and borderline defect. Not enough bitter hop flavour at all. This is one that I would avoid.
Tap@TEFAF. Haze yellow. Small head. Spicy. Low carbonation. Faint flavours. Boring.

Draught at Rosie O�Grady�s, Napier. Cloudy pale amber, creamy head. Orangey nose. Sweet, fruity and yeasty with notes of melon and clean mouthfeel. There�s not estery bananaish Weihenstephaner yeast character, rather witbier like curacao falvour. Orange jam dominates thie finish. Not the best offering from Limburg.

Pours a cloudy liquor that fades from a pale yellow to light gold below the blossoming white head. The nose is apple blossom and spice with notes of apple juice concentrate. The body is light with some spice, a little orange, and vinous notes reminiscent of watered-down apple juice.

Tasted 02/05/2005. 330ml bottle from New World, Miramar. Pours a murky yellow with a large, almost uncontrollable, sudsy looking, white head. Aroma is predominantly of green apple chewy lollies with hints of banana, spices and yoghurt. Sweet flavour up front with more suggestion of apple plus wheat. Spicey through the middle with very little bitterness. Watery mouthfeel and palate. This one is a little too thin and overly carbonated. I remember it being better. Disappointing that there are no batch details.

Appearance was a bit on the over cloudy side if that is possible. Aroma offers banana and caramel with hints of clove. Flavour is typical for the style with a long palate that goes from banana in to caramel. Good carbonation on this batch (Best Before Apr 05) a couple of the past batches have been a bit firey at best.

Bottled, at Paddy�s Brewpub, Flemington, Australia. Foggy blond body. Flavour and aroma were really no descript for me at this stage of the night. Weisse beers were being through on the back of stouts and chocolate porters. Stouts were being contrast and shared with pilsners and bocks. It was frenzy time. The gathering: duff, eczematic, Linc, motelpogo, Spiesy, Sully.
strange aroma of apple cider. tasted mainly of cloves with some wheat bix and vanilla ice cream. pretty bland, especially compared to limburg's excellent wit
Light coloured (almost orangey) with a big, fluffy head. Flavour has strong wheat and fruit tastes - particularly banana and maybe a hint of chewing gum. Good stuff.

When Duff and i both had this we looked at each other and thought were is the flavour. Little bit of fruit aromas and a stale finish. I want to give this beer another go and hope that we had a bad bottle.

Hmmmm, maybe i missed something or maybe i had a bad bottle, but it was really lifeless, little lasting head, which is unusual for a weiss, stale wheat and slight banana aroma, quite light aswell, sorry, no stand out flavour, i wasn't really a fan.
Aroma is fruity with a slight amount of hops. Taste is full bodied and fruity esters. Very clean with a slight amount of hops, touch of fizz and a bock-like quality that I would almost call "old".

The aroma is cheap pale malts, metal, and off hops. The appearance is slightly hazy gold with a small head. The flavor is like the aroma and the addition of peanuts. The palate is thin. This is not good but better than expected.

Bottle (identical to the high resolution photo)... Clear yellow lager with a mid-sized, fluffy, white head. Excellent retention. Almost a Belgian/Flemish nose... herbal, peppery and acidic with fuzzy fruit esters. Perfectly balanced flavor, but lifeless and thin. Light to medium-bodied and watery with modest/tingly carbonation. Frail, diluted finish.

Except for the 6.2% abv (which really can�t be detected), this is one mild lager. I think the "Power of crystal-clear water" takes over the show. Mild grassy aroma, some malt sweetness in the nose. It�s got the flavor of "ripe barley ears"... well not really. That�s what the description says. A mildly sweet malt taste and a modest bitterness are all that�s in the flavor. Finishes on a lightly sour note. Interesting, that this brew is retired. My bottle tasted pretty fresh. DiCarlo Fine Wine and Spirits, Mundelein, IL

Well, I don�t know who this "Ryan" guy is, but my Namyslow looked like the Hi-Res Photo of this beer. Bottle pours a witbier-hazed yellow with a fluffy (almost creamy) white head that holds as a thin cap. Aromas are sour dough and grass with dry caramel malt. Flavor is sweet and grainy without adversities, but within a flat, thin body it loses the greater appeal that it strived for. Finish leans towards sourness, but a roasty, malted backdrop is not entirely covered. Purchased from Di Carlo Fine Wines and Spirits, Mundelein, IL 60060

Light gold, vanishing oily head. Nose very sweet, light hops, a bit of fruit. Flavor not particularly good, quite sweet, then minerals, as if somebody brewed a beer with candied rocks. Which probably isn�t what happened, but it�s still not very good.
Gold Coloring wth White RIng. Swet Malty Aroma. Sweet Malt Notes. Grassy. Relatively Smooth Mouthfeel. Simple, Not Necessarily Satisfying Lager.

For a pale lager, this wasn�t bad. Beer 2 of my polish beer night. The head was cotton white with a gold/honey pour. Very clean, but not over filtered with a ez fall down the mouth. Flavour has some citrus, some grains, and a very faint hop thats good. If only every lager was this decent...and shit...its freagin retired!! better go clean the store out.

Tasted from the bottle and poured into a Pilsner glass. Tight, short white head of foam sat atop a brilliant gold body. Aroma of sweet honey malt and caramelised sugars, with a bit of lemon and orange zest. Quite a clean aroma, and similar in the mouth. Flavours of cereal grains mingled with sweet malt and minimal bittering hops to give a relatively sweet lager, with a medium length fruity swallow. Medium-light bodied and mildly carbonated made for quite a good sessionable Lager that was well balanced, and a good thirst quencher for the warmer months.

The beer pours from the 500ml brown bottle the quintessential lager gold with a moderate sized frothy white head as it evaporates; the residual lace forms a velum like jacket upon the glass. Nose is the prototypical lager sweet malt, fresh and clean, crisp and the start has a decent malt presence and is somewhat sweet with the top middling in its feel to the palate. Finish has a stern acidity and the hops apropos to the style, quite dry aftertaste lingers long on the palate, a quite drinkable beer, but at 6.2 percent ABV, I guess not a good session beer.
bottle. nice golden color, small head, pretty decent dry taste, drinkkable.

The commercial description is as confusing as the taste of this beer. The aroma is sweet as expected with paper and malt. The appearance is amber with floaters and a thin head with NO FOAM. The flavor is like the aroma. The palate is thin. This is one to avoid.
slightly hazy gold with a large foamy white head. flavors of light honey, tangy malts, hint of sour citrus(lemon), chewy caramel, and even some spice(clove?). a very nice pale.

Bottle... Clear yellow lager with a mid-sized, creamy/frothy, white head. Good retention. Mead-like aroma... wildflower honey. Flavor of sweet, pale malts... reminiscent of those old time, chewy, Luden�s honey cough drops. Crisp hop balance. Light-bodied with moderate carbonation. Short, crisp finish.

500 ml bottle from Blue Max in Burnsville, MN (I think). Looks pretty nearly identical to the same brewer�s Zamkowe that I just had, giant frothy head leaving lots of lacing, atop a golden body...though this one is a bit hazier and darker....some small amount of sweet malt in the nose, a touch of old lemon, honey and grass....light, clean, crisp flavor, bit citrusy, grassy...somewhat lighter-bodied than the Zamkowe but overall just a touch more character with even a nice hint of sharpness at the finish.

Yellow with an anti-freeze glow/haze and a big, cream-tinted white head that faded quickly to a film. The malts in this smelled really good... bready, almost "cookie" with an odd grape/caramel combo. Slight cardboard smell in the background. Flavor was lacking... bitter and sour with green leaves and a bit of lemon. Malts came out later... it was actually a little better as it warmed (which I�ve never witnessed before in a Polish lager). Palate held the essence of grapeskin, sour and dry with light astringency. This beer was not the worst. It started great but came up short. Bridgeview Liquors, Bridgeview, IL

Great big frothy white head. Slightly skunky aroma but goes away quickly to leave a light crisp grassy meadow aroma. Quite nice actually. Little floral also. Color is a light gold. Flavor is pretty weak with some cardboard, grit and a bit of corn. Dry and chalky palate. Finish is dry and parching in the mouth. Clean finish. Aroma is promising but falls pretty quickly after that.

Bottle. Straw colored yellow with a tall bubbly foam head. Nose is straw, sweet buttered biscuits and light malt. Taste is semi-sweet malts, light grassy notes, some buttery notes and light citrus. Body is light and laden with carabonation feel. Finishes with light grass, buttery maltiness, light lemony notes.
Sweet, thin, watery, no zest or fizz. Nice gold color with a tall head having decent retention. Maybe some hops at the back of the throat on the finish. Makes me write in phrases, not sentences.

Pleasant golden color, decent stream of bubbles for a good head. Highly sweet aroma with a touch of hay. Flavor is also stunningly sweet, a touch of grain, and an almost sour finish. Why do I keep trying these Eastern European lagers?
Golden, small, aroma is grain, malt, light fruit. Taste is the same, bittersweet, ok
Czyste z�oto. Piana �nie�na. Spora zaspa. Aromat chmielowo � cebulowy? Nasycenie s�abe. S�odowe. Nawet s�odkie do pewnego stopnia. No i jest goryczka. Ale taka troch� trawiasta. Przeci�tny lager.
Miko�aj Rutkowski is drinking a Zamkowe by Browar Namys��w S�odkie do�� ale spoko wchodzi
Jak na bieda lagera zaskakuj�co jaki�. Wyra�nie s�odowy w �adny spos�b, mi�a tekstura, ale niestety kompletny brak goryczy. Do koszenia trawy mo�na wypi�.
Can. Looks, taste and smells like random shitty pale lager. Not a horror, but I prefer to not drink it.
Barwa jasnoz�ota, piwo klarowne. Aromat s�aby, s�odowy z mokrym kartonem. Smak podobnie. Piwo wodniste i raczej nijakie. Z wad tylko wychodzi na wierzch mokry karton. Raczej omija�
Ocena wystawiona na podstawie wspomnie� z degustacji. W celu uzupe�nienia profilu

wspomnienia mlodosci / adolescent memories / odrapana budka z piwem gdzies na wakacjach / crappy beer stand on countryside / lokalsi / locals / i ten slodowo kartonowy snak zimnego piwa / and malty taste of cold beer / cieple praktycznie niepijalne / warn undrinkable
Rami Rami is drinking a Zamkowe by Browar Namys��w at Bagno 5 Mokry karton! Zgnile zboze! Troszke kalafiora i tow szystko dosc mocno poslodzone. Wracam do wodki
Ocena wystawiona na podstawie wspomnie� z degustacji w ramach uzupe�nienia profilu.
Cask in the state bar. Aroma is malty wioth grassy and biscuity notes. Taste is similar malty base but lacking somewhat.
Cask Handpump at the Mill Hotel, Chester 21/03/2003 Amber golden colour with some sour aroma. Pale with slightly dry full malt finish.
A great disappointment, I expected better than this from Theakston�s. Bring back Theakston�s Best Bitter.
From a bottle.Light brown,poor head,some malt,thin and bitter,low attention span.

Cask, or is it keg? Soapy brown appearance with nitro head. Death by freezing beer, sharp harsh and confused. The hops can herdly get going. Is this really Theakston or the work of the Ampersand group?
Bottle. Hard mouthfeel - beneath the carbonation the beer is lifeless. Minimal hops. Vanilla notes Looks nice - tastes shite.

I really don�t see the point of this. Take a cask ale and serve it chilled to within an inch of its life (it certainly seemed colder than the 10C claimed) and through a sparkler so tight that it comes over almost identical to the nitrokeg that it is presumably aimed at weaning fizzheads off. Why bother? It�s methadone for keg junkies. Not blatantly offensive though. It would probably be marginally better without the sparkler. "Cask" (handpump), The Bull and Chain, Lincoln
Slight hoparoma. Sweetish flavor with honey and apple. Honeyish with a slightly bitter aftertaste. Not too bad.
Standard malty nose. Copper coloured body with virtually no head. Very weak watery flavour similar to the pretty nasty Theakson Bitter. Not much else to report, a very thin and weak ale.
malty/nutty aroma, pours with a deep copper colour. malty charcarter with some woody notes, little carbonation and a faintly bitter hop finish.
Bottle from Waiheke Wine Centre on 20 November 2018. Perfect beer for a cool wet day . Bitter burnt toast flavour with a nice bitter finish as well.
Draft at the brewery. Black with tan head. Roasted malt aroma. Smooth roasted/caramel palate. Nice.

(330ml bottle, BB 070117) Pours an opaque black body with a thick tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, licorice, chocolate, and dried dark fruit. Flavor of roasted malt, raisins, grass, chocolate, and licorice with a dry finish.
Draft. Pours near black with a beige head. Relatively mild throughout, with light roasted coffee, hints of sweet chocolate, and faint bitterness. Decent.
The head is ok, the body almost black. It smells coffee-chocolate, bit sour-plum, The taste is darkmalty, coffee-chocolate, bit sour-plum. Ok, easy drinkable.

My experience seems a little different from others! Dark body with decent tan head. Spicy zesty sharp nose, then subtle roasty notes. Not what I was expecting! Strongly carbonated. Similarly astringent and sharp to taste. Doesn?t really have a full bodied taste, its rather light. Nice roasted taste coming through late.
