A surprising beer from the dark body to zesty citrus aroma to the initially sharp then roasted taste. Not an every day drink but very interesting! Retaste: none of the sharp or sourness, just a solid porter. (Perhaps the last batch was contaminated?). Not too heavy, easy drinking. Perfect for sumer

Tasted 7/2/2014. Draught at Waiheke Island Brewery, NZ. Poured a translucent deep ruby red colour with a light tan collar that produced poor lacing. Carbonation moderate with small bubbles. Aroma of nice sweet coffee dominates and not really anything else. Taste of sweet caramel malt, slight chocolate on the after-taste, and very slight bitterness. Light body, lighter that I was expecting. Smooth, light, clean with a long slightly bitter finish. More a dark lager that an ale or porter. Quite nice but a bit thin in the body.
Keg at the brewery 31/12/12 Dark ruby brown with fluffy tan head. Chocolate, fruity coffee and redcurrants on the nose. Medium mouthfeel with roast barley, dry coffee and a long malt finish.

330ml Champagne style brown bottle purchased on Waiheke Island near Auckland NZ. Pours dark brown with a small tan head of minimal duration and lacing. Nose is sweet dark toasted malts with dark chocolate and mild coffee notes. Flavour is similar but there is a stronger than average hop bitterness to the finish (they now use NZ grown Styrian Goldings) which earns bonus points. Body is medium-light but with a somewhat creamy mouthfeel. Nicely balanced and easy to drink.

Good looking dark ale, nice colour with a smallish head. Aroma is full of roasty chocolate and some coffe notes. There are some good roasty flavours too but it falls short here for me. The palate is thin and feeble which really lets this beer down. If there was some more weight and mouthfeel here this would be a very good beer. As it is, its just "alright".

column1: Flossmoor Station Panama Limited Red Ale
column5: Houblons terreux et enduit de gomme de pin coinc�s dans plusieurs �tages de malts caram�lis�s. La plus coh�rente et �quilibr�e de la palette.

column1: Flossmoor Station Panama Limited Red Ale
column5: Draft - Amber malts and piny hops. Deep brown and a decent white head. Earthy pine hops, caramel malts and a nice balanced bitterness. Nice and balanced.

column1: Flossmoor Station Panama Limited Red Ale
column5: just as described. hoppy. nice lacing. good color. silky mouthfeel. overall good.

column1: Flossmoor Station Panama Limited Red Ale
column5: I had this at Global Brew. Pours reddish with a off white head. Taste malty, Carmel, zesty/hoppy. I thought this was good. I would drink this again. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

column1: Flossmoor Station Panama Limited Red Ale
column5: On tap at Global Brew. Pours a slightly hazy reddish brown with a thin off white head. Mild spice aroma. Taste is sweet caramel malt, buttery with fairly assertive hop bitterness for an amber ale. Good.

column1: Flossmoor Station Panama Limited Red Ale
column5: Aroma is earthy malts, citrus and fruit. The flavor is citrus, light grapefruit/tropical fruit, malts, caramel, fruit and a long and bitter/mildly dry finish.

column1: Flossmoor Station Panama Limited Red Ale
column5: [Tap] Bright reddish brown pour. Not much head to it. Hoppy aroma with lighter caramel malts and mild fruits also making an appearance. Flavors include moderately bitter pine/citrus zest hop notes, toffee, caramel and dry grains. Sticky palate. Lingering dry and bitter finish is pleasant. A nice beer.

column1: Flossmoor Station Panama Limited Red Ale
column5: I thought this was a really well done beer. A nice malt and hops balance with a smooth and flavorful mouthfeel.

column1: Flossmoor Station Panama Limited Red Ale
column5: On tap at The Chicago Beer Festival 2014. Dark ruby/copper with a very small off-white head. Aroma and flavor of citrus peel, caramel malts, pine resin, and hops. Stale hops aftertaste.

column1: Flossmoor Station Panama Limited Red Ale
column5: Bottle thanks to dtjager! It�s a gusher, lots of foam and overflow immediately after opening the bottle! Dirty brown pour, lasting head and an aroma of spicy/hoppy caramel. Flavor is very creamy spicy malt, herbal hops and finished nice a bitter. Aside from the overcarbonation, this beer was pretty great! Plenty of flavor that you�d get from a great imperial red, without being too high in alcohol. Not sure what the bottles run, but I�d certainly buy it if priced right.
12oz bottle (old Notes)-Pours a copperish orange with a decent head. Aroma of hops and malt. Taste of the same. This medium bodied brew is well balanced and goes down easy.
Copper color with a small white head. Hop aroma. Flavor is bitter and hoppy, but not in a good way. This looks to be an old bottle, but the year was not marked.(Choice of 97,98,99)
Maltier and a bit fuller bodied than what I'm used to in an american pale ale. More english style, I think. Very good, nonetheless, with a pleasant pale malt character and a good hop presence.
Dry, not very hoppy. Brown-orange, stiff foam. Average....................

Note: Another "Lost in Space rating" ???!!! Pours a nice clear gold to amber color, nice white head and fair lace. Malt nose, the front is slightly sweet, the top light, the finish is dry, moderately carbonated, slightly acidic, with a nice hop bite.

This is a great Pale Ale brewed right here on the banks of the Ohio. It opens to a great aroma reminding you of barley waving across the bluegrass. A taste and it�s full bodied on the tongue and smoother than the Call To The Post at Churchill Downs. Then the flavor hits you like a run-away coal barge on the Ohio River. It finishes with a hoppy bitterness that reminds you that life is fleeting and we should enjoy it while we can. I should note here that BBC has bought out Pipkin Brewing and they will not be making my favorite ale any longer so I urge you to enjoy it while you can.
Cask at the King Billy. Glowing golden, this delightful beer is typical of Oakham: bursting with grapefruit and other citrus flavours, fruity, juicy with an abiding bitterness. Lovely stuff.

A yellow to orange gold coloured beer with a thickish white head. A light hoppy nose with a distinctly tropical fruit aroma of bananas and mangoes! A dry, but weak mouthfeel, hoppy flavour with a citrusy taste, with the tropical fruits again. The finish is long and dry. (Cask - The Fox & Hounds, Heacham, Norfolk).
Cask@Criterion, Leicester. Very pale beer with a light head and large bubbles. The aroma is light and fruity and the flavour is very dry. Overall a nice well hopped beer.
NOt too goldy, but nice in flavour, I like it so far, foam bubbling and not annoying.
Cask Handpump at the Freemasons, Northwich 27/04/2001 Golden coloured in appearance with some pale malt present. Very fruity flavours.

Cask at Oakham Brewery Tap, Peterborough. What more can I say about Oakham beers. Golden, zesty, orange/tangerine with some grapefruit, zingy, hoppy dry and completely wonderful. This is no different but maybe slightly more creamy.

This is an Oakham beer so no surprise that is golden and conspicuously hoppy The aroma is grassy with noticeable orange zest notes. Juicy, fruity flavour. But its relatively low key and less ebullient than many of its stable mates. There�s a hint of underlying malt in there too. Rather acidic finish. Fresh, clean and citric but not as much pizzazz as I�ve come to expect from Oakham. Cask (gravity), Cambridge Beer Festival.

Cask conditioned at the 32nd Cambridge Beer Festival, gravity dispense. ABV was listed as 4.9%. The brewery website does not mention the ABV, it might vary. This is another lovely citrussy golden ale from Oakham, a style which seems to be their specialty. Golden colour, low head. Plenty of citrus, tropical fruits and honey in the aroma. Flavour has some citrus, but also some of the dusty hoppiness you�ll find in many Southern English ales.

Cask conditioned - handpump - Out Of The Vaults Leicester. A golden coloured beer. The aroma is real good hops with orange notes. The taste is a real good hop mix with oranges, peaches and sweet fruit cocktail. A really nice hoppy beer.
Cask handpump at the Swan in the Rushes, Loughborough. Nice golden looking beer with a creamy white head. Sweet malts, some citrus, some floral hops. Dryish. Very good.
500ml Bottle - Remember drinking this back in the day. Copper red in colour. Rye, caramel, berries and dried fruit can be detected in both the aroma and in the slightly sweet taste.

BCA (From Southwick Brewhouse). Rubycolour. Slightly flat appearance. Hints of toffee. Malt is dry on the whole and slightly toasty. Earthy hop bitterness. I�m not always a fan of crystal malt but it works well here adding an extra dimension that is well integrated.
Cask Handpump at the Smithfield Hotel, Manchester 09/08/2001 Amber red coloured with a fruity aroma. Bitter on the palate. Malt finish.

Massive head upon pouring which you had to plough through to reach the beer.When you do this its quite a pleasant beer.Reddish in colour with that acid edge that so many bottle conditioned beers seem to have.After a while this bitterness started to dissapear but there was still a sharpness that was a bit distracting.

Bottled. Reddish colour with an explosive pinkish white head. Aggressive zingy (Garrat) aroma that is bad but not as bad as the flavour. Sharp, bitter, sour, citrus fruit flavours. Not a favourite by a long way.
Bottle.Dark red in colour.Zingy and sour,strange with an old wine taste.....
Pours an enormous head. Tawny color, hoppy caramelly aroma and flavor. Hints of citrus and blackcurrant. Licorice. Thin but nice ale, well made.
Bottled. Ruby coloured with lively rich head. Citrusy hop aroma. Crystal malt profile, apricot flavour, sweet, raisiny and fruity. Drier, flowery, lightly resiny finish.

Bottle conditioned. Chestnut red with good head but overcarbonation. Apple and saccharine in the nose, but this doesn`t carry through to the body which has hints of caramel and malt with a nutty background. Finish is sweet and malty but is dominated by the prickle of overcarbonation.
Clearly sweet on first taste, with a flowery essence that gives way to an overpowering and unpleasant flavor of cherry soda pop. The same flavor carries through the finish.

Old notes (early 90s). From bottle (also had it from tap). Brewed at De Hopbloem, Middelburg. Aroma�s: herbs, hopbitterness. Flavor is moderate bitter, moderate sweet. Medium bodied. Bitter finish (from the bottle).
Dark orange color, small to normal white head. Smell some herbs or spices. Lightly bitter, little bit flat overall.
the foamy head is nice. Has more of a dark fruitjuice than a beer. It�s special alright and definitely the best beer from Hoeksch I�ve had so far, but they still need to do some work.
Bottle from Mitra van Bergen. Orange body with huge head. Yeasty nose, some floral notes. Slightly sweet taste, gets a tad dry, then bitter. Warms at the finish. Okay.

Bottle 75cl. @ home. Clear medium amber color with a average to large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, caramel, spicy, walnuts, light to moderate hoppy, orange, light to moderate yeasty, syrup notes. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate bitter with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20081117]

Courtesy of Fonefan. It�s medium golden with a huge, nice and creamy head. The aroma has sweetness and notes of syrup and walnuts. The flavour has sweetness and notes of malt, syrup, caramel and the finish has hints of walnuts. It�s smooth, pleasant and uncomplicated.

Bottle, bought at Kent Beer Festival 2004. Obviously, after a hard day drinking 55 plus beers at GBBF, what is required is a nightcap. Sort of orange/amber colour. Hazy. Didn�t pick up much other than a sweetish malt and light spicing in the aroma. A bit sweet but there�s some bitterness to prevent things getting too out of hand. Yeasty flavour and a treacly feel on the palate. OK but not nothing exceptional.

Cherry, woody aroma. Opaque caramel coloured body with low off white head that recedes to ring. Cherry, woody, caramel flavours with moderate bitterness. Medium-light body with fair carbonation. Bottle sampled post-GBBF with chris_o, daniel_brown and maeib.

Bottle round Chris_o�s house. Opaque orange, with lacing and a thin head. Thick, complex aroma: woody, mossy, wheaty. Nice mouthful: full of sour, sweet, heavy honey tinged flavours. Heavy, but a little discordant. Perhaps too sweet.

Bottled. A mid brown to amber coloured beer with a pleasant coting of white head. The aroma has strawberry like fruits and a little spiciness. The taste is hoppy and peppery with berry fruit and a little pear drops late on. A nice easy drinking beer.
Clear brown colour, white head. Aroma of berries, malts, caramel. Sweet malty flavour. Sweet finish, caramel. (From 30cL bottle shared @ a weekly tasting, Oirschot)

30cl bottle at our holiday cabin. Clear brown with a small tan head. Medium body with moderate carbonation. Medium sweet- and bitterness. Rye, malts, caramel, brown sugar, herbs and spices. An ok dubbel.

donker caramelbruin, ondoorzichtig, met kaki kraag. aroma van caramel, moutig en zoetje, smaken zijn redelijk zoet, licht bitter, matig sterk, matig fruitig (donker fruit, rozijn), aardse en caramemouten, bruine suiker, dun van textuur, niet te overdreven caramel smaken. dun, aardige dubbel.

Bottle 300ml. [ As Hoeksch Eikenbier ]. Clear dark brown color with a average, frothy - creamy, good lacing, mostly lasting, light beige head. Aroma is moderate malty, bread, caramel, bready malt. Flavour is moderate sweet and light to moderate bitter with a long duration, bread, yeast, dried fruit. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20140217]
Golden color with a medium head. Aroma is caramel and honey. Taste is caramel and malt.

Bottle @ Johns, Pours dark brown with a light brown head. Aroma of malt, brown sugar, light dark fruit, oxidation. Flavor is malt, brown sugar, some oxidation, dark fruits, little alcohol. Medium body, lively carbonation. 170217
Bottle @ Aarhus tasting. Clear brown with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel, fruity, yeasty and a bit oxidized. Flavor is quite sweet and light bitter. Sweet finish. 170214
Bottle, 6.5%. Clear dark brown with tiny head. Aroma is malt, caramel, yeast, dusty and dark fruit. Flavour is malt, caramel, yeast, little candy sugar, little oxydized, toasted and dark fruits.
Bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is brown. Aroma and taste are bread, malt, yeast, fruits and hops.
Bottle@tasting (2004), 30cl. Head: beige colored.Color: red copper. Aroma: sour. Taste: bitter, sour. Palate: mild, CO2, lasting. Overall: just trying.
Bottle@tasting (2002), 30cl. Head:beige colored foam. Color: clear, ruby. Aroma: plane. Taste: plastics, some bitter. Palate: sweet, light CO2, medium body, weet finish. Overall: not a real bock.
30cl, at 6.5%Vol, as Hoeksch Bok, exclusive Dutch brewfirm, from Slijterij van Bergen Eindhoven, not complex brew, yet easy to drink, balanced, clear, small head, nice brew

Bottle 30cl. @ [ Back2Bock Tasting ]. Clear medium to dark red amber color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white to beige head. Aroma is moderate malty, roasted, brown sugar. Flavor is moderate sweet and bitter with a average duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20081115]
bottle 330ml shared with FatPhil & Anna Thanks! 150808 reddish dark brown. sweet candy sugar tickling hops, strong taste of dark roasted malts ,bit sour. Very pleasant

330ml bottle (Cracked Kettle, Amsterdam) Very dark red, almost opaque, sticky irregular head. Big sweet malty aroma. Quite watery palate, doesn�t feel like a strong beer at all. Malty body, some slight fruity esters, but more roasty body. Finish is burnt. Very drinkable.

Bottle. Creamy lightbrown good mostly lasting haed. Amber colour. Heavy malty and moderate hoppy aroma. Heavy bitter flavor with powerfull notes of cjocolate. Long wonderfull heavy bitter finish. Creamy palate. Excellent bock.

Bottled (from Cracked Kettle). Ruby red colour with small off-white head. Aroma is malty and quite saltwatery along with some grass. Flavour is sweet caramel malts, some hops and slight saltwatery notes. Basic bock, and not very exciting.

from crackedkettle.com -dark brown colour, hazy; almost no foam; aroma of biscuit and caramel with some red fruits hidden below; medium-bodied, sweet with a tart bitterness; quite dry malty and caramelish, toasty aftertaste - subtle
Bottled, alc. 6.5 % (BB 12/2008) Courtesy of bierkoning, ty Edo! Ruby red color, small beige head. Grassy hops, toasted caramelly aroma. Slightly toasted, grassy, caramelly, very typical Dutch bock.

A 2002 vintage at �t Arendsnest. Deep hazy ruby beer with a lasting and more than honest-sized off-white head. At 5 years old, this is still quite aromatic and the oxidation remains limited. Brightly fruity, cherry-like malts with nutty notes being its only aging features. Where it suffered the most is predictably in its body that feel thinned out, but still offers plenty of soft carbonation to sweep the caramelly flavours� sweetness. Well done, but I�m still trying to figure out where to position dutch boks with regards to german bocks and this one did not hint at many differences.
Golden straw color with good foam. Nose. Malt, there are notes of some sweets. (In a bad sense) The taste is malt, sweetish, pleasant hops in the aftertaste.
Can. Golden coloured beer with s strong white frothy head. The aroma is yeasty and gently malty. The flavour is refreshing, mildly dry and yeasty. Overall a nice golden lager.

In small cup from can. Smell- weak, some hops maybe malt Foam- medium large, white Appearance- clear yellow amber, medium carbonation Taste- weak hops, weak bittersweetness and citrus, weak hops and citrus in aftertaste. Drinkable, but nothing special.
Imperial pint can. Pours clear gold with a tall white head. Aroma is grain, faintly fruity. Taste is light bitter, malt, grain, faint citrus. Light bitter finish. Pretty good macro lager.
Can. Clear golden color, white head. Aroma has sweet malty notes, some fruity notes. Mainly sweet malty taste has some hops and some fruity notes. Could be more crisp with hops.

Can. Light golden, small to average and fully diminishing head. Moderate, malty - lightly grainy and lightly sweetish, faint caramel and light cardboard and faint herbal/vegetable hoppyness, faint metal. Body is light to medium, malty and lightly sweetish flavor, faint caramel and cardboard, faint herbal/vegetable hoppyness, faint metal. Finish is short to average, malty and dryish - lightly sweetish, faint caramel and cardboard, faint herbal/vegetable hoppyness, light metal. Watery lager (from Carlsberg) with notes of metal. Tastes cheap - not very enjoyable.
Clear gold, attractive white head. Aroma: ceareals, light lager yeast, minor apples. Light plus body. Taste: clean, malty, lager-like, somewhat fruity. Tiny bitternrss. So is the final pleasure.
Barwa z�ota, klarowne, piana bia�a, niezbyt obfita, niezbyt trwa�a. W aromacie s�odowe, lekki DMS. W smaku s�odowe, wodniste, niska goryczka. Nuda,
10.11.19, butelka z dat� do 18.02.20 Aromat s�odu i starego chmielu. W smaku tani szampan, perfuma, czerwone jab�ko. �ci�gaj�ce, kwa�ne. Bez goryczki.
Lepsze, niz sadzilem. Przecietny lager, malo ciala, sporo slodu, nut scierkowych nawet nie wyczulem. Takie piwo, kt�re daje tyle smaku, ile powinno za 3 zlote. Myslalem ze gorsze.

Blind test - 25 koncerniak�w. Wygl�d: Barwa z�ota, klarowna z �redniop�cherzykow�, nisk� bia�� pian�, kt�ra szybko redukuje si� praktycznie do zera, nie pozostawiaj�c lacingu. Aromat: DMS, kukurydza, groszek, lekki diacetyl, nuta s�odowa, chlebowa z akcentem korzennego chmielu. Smak: P�aski z nutami z aromatu. W ustach p�wytrawne, tre�ciwo�� niska i wodnista, wysycenie �rednie. Goryczki brak. Finisz wytrawny, estr�w jab�kowych.

(bottle 0,5l) Overall: Meh. Just another international lager. Aroma: Grainy, light cardboard. Appearance: Clear golden. Medium, white head. Taste: Grainy, light sweet, light malty-honey. Palate: Medium body. Light bitter finish.
Pale yellow appearance, sweet lemony aroma with some acidity. Below average. This version is retired now.
0,5l bottle. Taste is a little bit acidic, it has lemon flavor. Not really good beer, but it is refreshing.

Finally got this one from Osijek, as now it�s available only in that part of Croatia. 0.33 l bottle which poured pale yellow body with big very short living head. Flavor is acidly lemon sweet, simply too much and, again, it seems that there is only little bit of beer inside. Alright, may be a bit better than other radlers I�ve tried, but now I am asking a question will I ever find I good radler?
i don`t like any flavored beer`s so this beer is bad .................................................
The lemonade component combined with the acid of ordinary Osje�ko is a bad combination. Tastes horrible.

Not as bad as I expected it to be. Certainly not as foul as some other fruit beers/radlers I�ve tried. Far better than Desperados and Bandidos, and has a more balanced taste than Kronenbourg Panache. The lemonade taste is predominant though, and it�s too sweet.... maybe they�ve improved the recipe ?
Bottled(330ml). -friend told me: "Don't drink this shit" but I tried it. Terrible, taste and aroma like horse urine...
I agree with Ozujsko. Taste is really terrible..............................

Rating from the past. It poured a clear slightly pale yellow color. There was a lot of carbonation, and a generous white head with bad retention. The aroma was sweet and citrusy, lemon-like. The taste started sweet (artificial sugar) and slightly citrusy. No bitterness present, except a tiny level of it in the finish. Refreshing and very drinkable, but never among the popular ones.

Can, 0.33l. Poured clear straw color with medium frothy white head and lively carbonation. Aroma of lemon and light malt. Tasted of sweet carbonated lemon juice. No real beer taste, but it was good refreshing re-hydrating drink after cycling. Light body, thin texture and lively carbonation in palate. Good old roler, retired of course...
While it still existed, it was quite unpopular with crowds. It was a bit sweeter version of typical Radler style beer-lemonade mixtures.

Canned &#40BBE 11/2006&#41. Very pale yellow colour, with small bubbly head that vanishes quickly. Quite sugary lemon as well as some mild maizeish sweetness. Flavour is quite close. No aftertaste at all. Tastes quite much radler, still after all these years.
i drink this one in CELJE and KRANj ...it is mix beer with lemon ... aggly ..very aggly...

Very light yellow colour, almost no white head, no carbonation. Fruity, lemonlike light hoppy aroma, Sweet fruity medium body, Finish is light lemon-bitter, little sweet, but misses some character, Very refreshing when drunk cold.
It�s a Draught shandy made with beer and lemonade. Ok to drink when you�ve had too much of the real stuff
Bottled 0.33l (BB 07/2004) Pale yellow with small vanishing white head. Skunked and sweet nose. Sugary, citrus-type lemonade mixed with corn-based beer. Sour aftertaste. No bingo.
Bottled(500ml). -beer mixed with lemonade; awfull, Desperados is even better
Very blond with a small head. Fruity lemony aroma. This is Lasko''s version of Union''s Radler. Both taste more lemonade than beer and I do not like any of them.
Bottle stracey arms shop. Golden. Fruity aroma taste nice citrus good malt hoppy finish. Nice
Bottle thanks to Ash. Hazy amber. Nose is tangy, sherbet. Tastes wood, cardboard. This seems infected.

Bottle from Beers of Europe. Appearance - a bit lively. Golden with a big head. Nose - suspected wild yeast infection confirmed. Lemon tang and wild woodiness. Taste - more lemon and wood notes. Wild yest prevalent. Palate - light bodied and tangy. Long, dry, tangy finish. Overall - it�s infected.
500ml bottle shared with Ashton McCobb. Pours clear golden with a thick white head. High carbonation. Smells infected! Sherbet and sherry. Taste is bitter, cardboard, woody yeast. Not great.

Bottle shared at the 2015 edition of the chriso Pre-GBBF tasting - London. This was an aged bottle from the chriso rotbox, of unknown provenance. Cheers! Pours clear golden yellow with a white cream topping. Oxidation is quite apparent in the aroma, with secondary notes of mild lemon rind and bread. Light sweet flavour with moderate tang, more oxidation present, faint rindy bitterness. Light bodied with average carbonation. Finishes with tangy lemon notes. Meh, it�s clearly a bit past its prime.

8th August 2015 Pre GBBF tasting at Chris and Ruth�s. Dusty bottle from the Chris O archives.Hazy amber beer, small pale cream colour head. Knackered malts, oxidised malts. Tangy dried fruit. Light finish.
smells like fresh cut straw, tastes toffeeish nice sweet aftertaste really quite nice.

Cask sampled @ St. Arnolds Day Beer Festival 2013, The Old Wine Vaults, Faversham. Practically clear, golden to amber body with a small, off-white head. Not much aroma at all, just a hint of malt and soap. Flavor is light, sweet malt without much bitterness or anything else. Medium body and short aftertaste. Quite boring and uninspired beer.
Golden ale. Hazy golden color with slight strawberry hints. Some bubble gum and pineapple taste are apparent within the yeasty notes ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottled 24/08/12. A slightly hazy golden coloured beer with an off-white head. A fairly zesrt spritzy beer. There are definite pineapple notes. Interesting fruitiness. Nicely balanced. Pretty nice.
Sample @ 6th Annual Strong Beer Festival. Mesa, Az. Wooden barrel aroma for this one. Gold body with white head. Had a good citrus hop flavor with hints of wood. Had a warming effect on the body.
Poured a copper color with very light head and lacing. Aroma sweet malt, hops and nuts. Flavor is hops, a bit of roasty nuts and a creamy sweet finish.

Dark brown, light chocolate head, decent lace. Hop floral nose, malts, some toasted grain tones. Big malt start, medium top, spicy bite at the finish, acidic, moderate carbonation, some what dry and a great beer overall.
Troszk� lepszy i bardziej aromatyczny od Otakara. W tym samym stylu, tylko wi�cej wszystkiego. fajne.

Bottle. Aroma- some grainy maltiness, but that's all. Golden, pale, with a medium, good looking head and some lacing. Taste- typical Czech Svetly Lezak, but bitterness is quite weak. Pleasant, grainy maltiness, which isn't balanced with hoppy notes. Quite full, with butter diacetyl, medium bodied, with a low carbonation. Not bad, but I tried better examples from Czech Republic.
0,5 l. Bottle. Golden color with white head. Malt and herbal aroma. Grain and herbal taste

Barva svetlejsi, pena bohata ale nevydrzi, vune spis sladova nez chmelova. Dobra kombinace sladove a chmelove chuti, spis horci lezak. Jedno z nejlepsich prumyslovych piv. Takovy vyrovnanejsi krakonos.
�wietny svetly lezak, takie piwka moge pic codziennie, bardzo lekkie i mega pijalne, lekka goryczka, troche za lekka i fajna s�odowa kontra daj�ca pe�nie smaku.
Clean, crisp, sharp, with a long dry finish. Lots to like here. Decent lager.

0,5 l bottle. ABV:5,5%. Kem�ny, lassan apad� habkoron�val rendelkezik e ned�. Pont eltal�lt a sz�nsavass�g, testess�g. Illatban �leszt�s, koml�s. �zben kellemes, kiss� �desk�s, szolid keser�vel lez�rva. Nem t�l izgalmas, tal�n a hozz�adott cukor miatt. Szomjolt� s�r igaz�b�l. Nem rossz, de nem a legjobbak k�z�l val�. A csapolt verzi� term�szetesen sokkal jobb.

Butelka 0,5 l zakupiona w Z Innej Beczki - Piwa Regionalne w Cz�stochowie. Barwa jasno z�ota, perfekcyjnie klarowna. Piana nie jest idealnie bia�a, niestety jest te� uboga i szybko opada. Zapach poprawnie s�odowy, lekko chmielowy, jest te� troch� mas�a. W smaku r�wnie� tylko umiarkowana s�odowo��, i nawet nie taka niska goryczka. Delikatna s�odycz. Zbyt niskie wysycenie. Nadal poziom wy�ej, ni� polskie koncerniaki.

0,5l bottle. Clear golden colour with quickly disappearing white head. Aroma: Hay and soft caramel notes. Taste: Sweet and quite malty start with a medium strong classic bitter mouthfeel. Well balanced and a pleasure to drink. Light/medium body with medium carbonation. Short pleasent sweet/light bitter finish. A quite malty but at the same time bitter and soft. Good one.
13.12.12 szansa dla innej partii. Por�wnywalne z Opat Bitterem. Lekko kwaskowe od cytryny, w zapachu bardzo podobny.17.01/+1d przyjemny,zapach dobry. Kwaskowy, trawiasty chmiel, smak jak zapach
Ochutn�no z 1.5 PET zakoupen� p��mo na Hr�av� v hosp�dce Na Vyhl�dce. Pr�m�r.

On tap. Pours is golden clear with medium white head. Aroma of malts, grain, bread, grass, straw. Taste is light sweet, moderate to medium bitter. Medium body, slick texture, soft carbonation, long bitter finish. Good.

Bottled, Cesky Brod-Liblice, CZ, Malt,cereal,biscuit and grassy aroma, Light fruit as well, Clear golden color, smaller lasting head, Sweeter taste, fair bitter ending, Medium body, soft carbon, Pleasant refreshing brew.

Z�ote, klarowne piwo o s�abej pianie, kt�ra pozostaje do ko�ca w postaci cienkiej obw�dki przy brzegu szk�a. Aromat s�odowy, ma�lany. W smaku s��d z nut� chmielow�. Goryczka �rednia w stron� niskiej. Og�lnie do�� przeci�tny czeski pils, nic szczeg�lnego w nim nie ma, ale �le te� nie jest.

Bottled (backlog, thanks Kim N!). Golden colour, mediumsized white head. Aroma is grassy, herbal, some mild bready and a bit toffeeish notes. Flavour is very similar along with a nice slight "yeasty" kind of tone to it as well. Nothing too special, but refreshing indeed.

Clear gold golden body. Off white head, remains a while and makes laces down the mug. Aroma; caramel malt, wort, bread, fruit, spicy touches. Taste, mild hops, caramel malts, butter, sweet bread, butterscotch. Fine on palate. Normal body. Finishes mild, bread, apple, mild hops, bitter back. Decent. [50cl brown btl 4.7%abv ll� BB21.9.14]
Dosc dobre troche delikatne ale wyraznie zatecky chmiel wyczuwalny. Piwo o puszystej bialej i sporej piance, trzymajacej sie dosc dlugo. Kolor jasny wysycenie srednie. Smaczne i typowo czeskie.
Ins Glas ergie�t sich ein goldgelbes Bier mit sch�ner Schaumkrone. Geruch hopfig malzig, grasig, getreidig. Geschmack hopfig bitter, malzig, getreidig.

Bottled, 0.5 l. Clear golden coloured one with small fizzy bubbles and a medium sized snow white head on its top. Buttery, spicy nose. Biscuit malt based aroma escorted by dough, mild herbs and hints of florals, mouthfeel is slick. Medium to long, bittersweet, herbal hoppy finish. Balanced, good.

Clear golden color with big fluffy head. Bready and malty aroma with grassy background. Minimal pinch of diacetyl. Taste is crispy, malty with quite intensive saaz hops. Pleasant bitter finish. Decent pilsener.

Draught in a flight at thew brewpub. Was pretty decent for a pale lager, but still a pale lager. Pours a clear pale yellow color with a small white head on it. Nose has some sweet corn elements to it with the typical sweetish lager taste. Easy drink, but nothing special.
Taster - Mill Creek Brew Pub - Walla Walla, WA � An easy drinking lager that lacks any real flavor. This was a good local beer for the non beer snob.

Does a fine job emulating Pabst Blue Ribbon. A decent pale lager. My friend commented that " it doesn�t taste much like beer." As if that were a good thing. Pours gold-amber with a rapidly fading small white head. Few lacings. Has a mild sweetness with a hard to find hop profile. The hops show up as some bitterness in the finish. Some butter qualities that fades as beer is consumed. Overall a pretty good light bodied lager. abv seemed pretty low also. From a growler fill.

Dark golden with hints of brown, a slight haze, and a thin white head. Bown sugar, light chocolate and toast on the aroma. Seems like and all-malt lager but the brewer says there are some hops in there, which come out on the finish as a very light bitterness. Sweet brew with a light body.

Sweet, corn-like smell with a tad of spice to it. Very carbonated with a thick, foam head. Although this lager has an odd spicing to it which makes it interesting, the beer is disagreeable on the whole.

Draught in a flight at the brewpub. Probably my favorite of their brews. Pours a very clear dark golden color with a moderate white head on it. Nose is a little yeasty, but with a fair amount of citrus in there. Taste is pretty light and ctirusy, and a very easy drink, especially on a summer day. Decent.
Taster - Mill Creek Brew Pub - Walla Walla, WA - One of the better beers for this place. Light wheat flavor with some hops.
Cloudy golden with no head. Very light in aroma however, licorice is pronounced in the aroma with a light bit of roast and molasses which may be confused for petrol and esters. Very little finish.
Cloudy and emitting a subtle wheat aroma, this wheat was just ordinary--with a slight wheat flavor. Okay--just not a challenge to the senses.

12 oz single can from Total Wine & More - Springfield (VA). Hazy yellow colored appearance with a small bubbly white head. Mild aroma of wheat, fruitiness, light esters and a hint of banana. Similar flavor, adding some grainy sweetness and light zesty bitterness. Light and watery on the palate with a touch of peppery spice at the finish. OK.

Can at home just a quick cheap new brewery tick grab. Not the prettiest hazy orange. Nose is dull wheat hint of cloves. Tastes the same very little banana and some esters. Dry as a bone and some cardboard aftertaste.

Poured into a weizen glass, the appearance was a semi-cloudy orange to burnt yellow color with some slight brown hues closer to the center. Two finger white foamy head started and dissipated to leave some semi-foamy lace roaming all around the glass. The aroma had more of a sweet banana to lemony quality about it. Sweet wheat, but somewhat like just there. The flavor leaned towards the sweet side and didn�t have the normal wheat bite to it. And where�s the clove? Sweet wheaty/lemon and banana gripping the aftertaste. No finish. On the palate, this one sat about a light on the body with a fairly big sessionable smooth wet feel. Carbonation feels lower than suspected and so does the ABV. Overall, weird hefeweizen. I almost want to say that�s it just leans towards an odd American pale wheat ale. And if it really is that, well, I would much rather have other APWA�s before this again.
Can, Total Wine, Gainesville. Pours hazy golden-amber with a small white head. Floral aroma, bread, and light citrus. Flavor is grasses, citrus and floral hops.
Can from Total Wine & More, McLean. Hazy amber body with medium head. Nose is floral, hops, spices. Taste is similar of hops, fruits, malts. Sweet bursts. Decent.

12oz bottle (courtesy of Headbanger) poured into a Weizen glass at 44�. Color is a cloudy yellow with a touch of orange. Carbonation is good giving it a thin white head. Aroma is yeast, toffee and corn. It has a lighter medium body with a smooth mouth feel. Flavor is a little light with some wheat, corn and yeast backed by a nice bitterness. After taste is more wheat and the bitterness holds for just a bit. Overall it�s an easy drinking brew but just seems to be lacking flavor.

Can. Pour is orangy hinted light hazy brown. No head. Rather rude up front for a hefe, seems to have a few wheat ale attributes floating around in there. Yes, does not hide the alky well, seems much more than 6%. Could use some carbonation, comes across almost flat like lager left over night. What ever, needs some manners and civility. Could not be in the same styles as Erdinger Weissbier, Schneider Weisse Original, �vyturys White - Baltas Hefeweizen or East End Monkey Boy. Well, near the finish, I do get some watery banana in there. Yea, sure can use some co2 sizzle.
smooth and malty with a bit of caramel. smooth and cloudy mouthfeel the brew is nice and beery with a light hopiness to it. nice.
Too clear for a Hefe. Decent banana aroma. Taste was just sweet and slightly rubbery. Pass.
Pours a hazy lighter golden color with white head. Wheat, yeast, and some light fruits on the nose; follows onto the palate. Light bodied. Finishes with wheat and light fruit.

At Rail Ale Festival 2018. Pours black with halo of lace that disappeared quickly. Aroma has roasted malts herbal notes. Taste is lightly sweet and medium bitter. Palate is medium bodied oily texture average carbonation long finish. Session worthy
Cask at Speedwell Tavern, Staveley. Pours black brown with a light tan head. Porter coloured water. Rubbish.
Tried at the brewpub near Chesterfield. Almost black colour with a thick cream coloured head. Aroma fruity with roasted malt. Taste roasted and bitter. Thick body.
Cask (backlog). Reddish murky brown colour with a small beige head, which leaves lace. Aroma is toffee, roasted malts, ashes and some herbs. Flavour is very similar with the ashes being more evident.

On cask at Speedwell Tavern (Brewery Tap), Staveley - Deep black, lovely two finger cream tan head. Nose loads of chocolate, a little smokiness, cake fruits. Taste rich smooth and chocolatey, a bit of coffee. Great first timer from this brewery.

Cask conditioned at Leicester Beer Festival �14. Dark chestnut with off white head. There is a rich nutty, maltiness to this, quite drying, baked chestnut perhaps. There is a later, plummy fruitiness. Pretty decent.
Cask at greyhound bar derby. A tasty porter, bit of coffee, quite bitter with a small amount of chocolate.
Cask at NWAF 2009. A dark brown beer with a thin lazing tan head. The aroma has notes of malt and caramel. The flavor is sweet malty with notes of roasted malt as well as caramel. The body is light.
Cask (gravity dispense) at Ealing Beer Festival, July 2009. Red/brown porter. Not one in the stout lookalike mould although quite chocolatey. Slight sour note at the end. Decent stuff.
Cask gravity at Ealing BF 2009. Very dark brown, black with lasting beige head. Bit of smoke, some choc. Some interesting darkish fruit, plus raspberry. Decent. Milk choc.

Draught @ Ale Wagon, 27 Rutland Street, Leicester, Leicestershire, England LE1 1RE. [ As Hoskins Brothers White Dolphin ]. Light unclear medium orange color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white head. Aroma is light moderate malty, pale malt, wheat, citrus, moderate yeasty, fruity. Flavor is moderate sweet with a average to long duration, fruity, citus, pale malt, yeast - wheat. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20160221]

Keg tap at the Ale and Wagon, Leicester. Gold, hazy. Very light aroma of lemon and potpourri. Slightly bitter/sour taste, short finish. Not a lot going on but pleasant enough in its own way. Not one to have again though.
Draught at Ale Wagon, Leicester. Hazy golden colour. Nice wheat beer, not too much of a taste going on but OK. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Very light honey larger colour.. thin head. Lovely honey wheat flavour. Served too cold. Nice but little bland.

A Mes rate. Cask at the Market Porter. Golden colour with a thin white head and lots of lace. Lots of wheat and straw plus some good bitter hops all round. Good balance, good malty base. Really good finish. Straight forward but tasty.
Cask Stillage at the Sports & Social Club, Wrenbury 27/12/2007 Small white head. Floral hop aroma. Clear golden coloured with some citrus fruit flavour. Crisp and slightly bitter dry finish.

Draught (Air pressure???) - Ale Wagon Leicester. A slightly hazy orange coloured beer. The aroma is full of juicy orange and lemon citricity. The taste is also lovely fruits. Very highly flavoured and quite deliciously different.
Cask Conditioned, at the Market Porter, Borough, London . Golden with an orange tinge to it. Hoppy and refreshing, very quaffable.
Handpulled at Wellington, Birmingham. A mild sour wheatiness to it, clear straw body, seems to be caught between two stools of wheat/lager and falls flat in the middle.
The appearance is a mixture of a lager and a pale ale,and the flavour and aroma is mainly hopped rather than wheat beerish. A nice refreshing hopped ale, hardly anything like a normal wheat beer.

Cask (gravity) @ Bell Inn, 18 Angel Row, Nottingham, Nottinghamshire, England NG1 6HL. [ As Nottingham Sooty Oatmeal Stout ]. Clear dark brown color with a average, open and frothy - fizzy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, light beige head. Aroma is moderate malty, roasted, sweet malt, dark malt, light chocolate. Flavor is moderate sweet and light bitter with a long duration, malt bitter, sweet malt, dark malt, light roasted. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft to flat. [20151007] 7-3-7-3-13
Tried at the Hop and Barley, Lincoln. Deep ruby to black colour with a thin tan head. Aroma is roasted, malty and light toffee sweet, as is the taste.

[Robin Hood Beer Festival, Nottingham Castle, 2015] - Nottingham Brewery Sooty Stout, 4.8%. Pitch black with a small, beige head. Intense roasted malts,nuts and dark chocolate on the nose, with a sweetening hint of vanilla. Medium body, still a bit watery, very mild carbonation. Dry, moderately bitter start of roasted malts and dark chocolate. Some hop notes infiltrate the middle, countered by tongue - numbing espresso. Bitterness reduced in the finish, but the espresso notes abide. Dry, lasting coffee after taste. Very good middle of the road stout.
Cask conditioned at The Ned Ludd, Nottingham. Black with tan head. There is a richness to the darkly roasted malts with a hint of smoking, peatiness. Drying bitterness later. Decent.
Gravity cask at the Bell, Nottingham. Clear very deep maroon color, fluffy tan head. Aroma of cocoa powder. Taste is bittersweet chocolate. Nice.

Summer isn�t the usual time for a stout but drizzle needs it any day. I�m surprised this isn�t available more often from NB. A champion example of the style.some smoke on the malt for the nose. As dark in the glass as one would wish but don�t expect a Guinness top. Oatmeal stout are thinner headed. There�s a nice spread of flavours on the palate. Biscuit at the back but glossier malt and licorice notes. An old fashioned ale that one can grow old with.

Cask handpull, The Crown, Nuneaton. Good as pitch with a yellow-tan collar. Honeycomb, berries, burnt toast and charcoal aroma. Big cigar smokiness, soapy blackcurrant, swirls of various berries inc blueberry, black choc, ash and burnt bitter finish. Lingers with charred nuttiness. What a thick, mouth-filling slice of good things; burnt and fruity like only an English stout at the top of its game can be. Superb.
Cask at Pig�s Ear fest. Dark, slick and easy-drinking with a firm, sticky bitterness and fairly light roast character. Quaffable and dry but richer would be nice.
Pours deep black, taste is malty, sweet, lots of burnt cereals. Drinks a little watery and finishes weakly. Not much flavour.

Cask at the Bell, Nottingham. This was my third average stout or porter of the day. It has a slight sourness which I find unappealing, but otherwise isn�t bad; it�s an acceptable stout, just nothing special, really.

From Aug 2008 I got this in a trade with joe1510. Thanks Joe! It pours a very dark brown with a small head of tan foam. The smell is both bitterish and sweet; some notes of coffee and chocolate and some grain. The taste is as nice as the nose. I'm getting the bitter/sweet thing with good tasting coffee notes and good chocolate, which I think is adding both sweetness and bitterness. A nice medium mouthfeel here which also describes the carbonation. It finishes with a nice bitterish kick that leaves a good long lasting aftertaste. I like. Bottom line: Here's a nice American style Brown Ale that's plenty tasty, has a good mouthfeel, is easy drinking, and looks good in the glass. A solid example of the style.

Appearance: Holey moley! I�m pouring foam into my glass not beer! Every time i pour, it comes out foam with very little body. The light brown head looks gorgeous though all frothy and whipped. My wife says it looks like a root beer float. After several minutes i eventually see the opaque dark brown body. Though off-putting a little, it looks really nice once it settles down. Smell: Molasses, chocolate and brown sugar. Nice bitter edge to it. Taste & Mouthfeel: Combining these together because the carbonation is way out of hand on this one. I get a little bit of molasses but the carbonation is literally hurting my tongue. I let calm down for awhile and try again. Carbonation is still high but i do get some coarse chocolate and burnt sugar. Other than that, nothing and not quite pleasant i must say. Drinkability: Not really. My wife couldn�t continue after a few sips but i tried to give it a chance but i couldn�t finish my glass. The astringent taste and overly excessive carbonation kills it for me. Reviewed on: 01-21-2010
Older bomber bottle. Poured a dark brown with a large sized off white head. Chocolate, caramel, toasted stale grains, and molasses.

Toasted malts, light coffee. Hazy, very dark, small, creamy, beige head. Light sweet. Intense grain and cereal malts, dark, toasted malts, light coffee, light cacao, soft carbonation. Nice Brown Ale, great malts throughout. Keg at brewery, Flossmoor, IL.

My first time drinking anything from this brewery. I�m surprised to see how many beers they have produced and yet I�m just now learning of this brewery in my home state! Poured from a pint can which did not say NUT brown however all other facts are the same. Pour is so black light can�t penetrate it...has a huge long lasting tan head which is beautiful and thick. The head dissipates slowly and the glass of beer left behind has amazingly so the lowest amount of carbonation I�ve ever experienced. It�s smooth and a tad sweet but I do not get the nut flavor. No doubt the dark color and the slight sweetness is from the black strap.

I tried this brown ale many of times and it was consistent each time. Smooth, with semi sweet from molasses, creamy mouth-feel, toffee, roasted chocolate malt, full bodied ale. Almost a smokey malt nose, thick but easy drinking, pairs well with most meals. Black brown in color with a nice refined head. Try if you can.

This robust, dark brown ale gets its rich flavor from seven different malts and three types of hops. The addition of hand-toasted oats and a generous portion of molasses give the Pullman Nut Brown Ale an incredible smoothness and quaffability. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark cola brown with a smattering of khaki head. Smells of earthy mollasses, vanilla, chocolate. Taste has some chocolate, earthy hop, mollasses, tea. Good flavors, well done brown. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
A nutty flavored brown ale. First one I have had from this brewery. Bitter finish and a bottle pour at beer temple ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours a dark opaque brown with lasting cream head, no lacing. Aroma is "brown chocolate basement" (thanks Huhzubendah) and chocolate dust. Flavor is "Diet Palo Santo" - solid, but not as good overall. Notes 2/15/10.

On tap at the brewpub. Pours a dark brown with a thin tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, dark chocolate, vanilla. Flavor of sweet malt, chocolate malt, roasted malt. A little artificial tasting and sweet. Ok stout. 7/4/5/3/11 (3.0/5)
A very nice stout. Dark brown with thin brown head. Light roasty nose. Smoky malt character with traditional stout notes. Lighter mouthfeel with low carbonation.

[Tap] Black pour with no head. Almost flat, with very low carbonation. Nose is of charred malts, bakers chocolate and light smoke. More smoke is apparent in the flavor. Ash, licorice, dark chocolate, mocha and light vanilla notes round it out. Not overly heavy, which is nice.

Another robust beer. This beer had a nice malty and chocolate flavor. I think this beer could have supported a higher alcohol content which would have reduced the creaminess but added some body and power.
Very low carbonation. Creamy head. Nice dry mouthfeel. Not much aroma. Flavor is light and lacking bitterness. Weak chocolate notes.
Draft: Pours black, dark brown head. Aroma is roast, smoke, chocolate. Taste is bitter, dark chocolate and ash. Light and a bit thin, but good.
Draft. Dark chocolate, cherry, and coffee aroma. Black with moderate head. Sweet chocolate malt flavor. Light ashy finish. Solid.
Draft @ brewery. Peaty roasty malt aroma. Black brown with a small creamy tan head. Peaty roasty malt and slightly lactic flavor. Medium creamy body, soft carbonation.
A really solid beer. A suped-up guiness with cocoa and peat notes but a smooth delivery.

On tap at Brew Pub. Pours a deep brown color with two fingers of thick, creamy tan head. Smell is mildly sweet and a bit roasty. The taste has notes of roasted malts, cocoa powder, light molasses, brown sugar, and toasted oats. The body is medium, with light carbonation and a very smooth feel.
Draft sample at the source. The beer is a dark brown with a white head of foam. Roasty and sweet taste. Some malty notes as well as a bit of espresso. Medium body and medium carbonation.

4 oz. sample at the brew pub. Aromas aren�t overly potent, weak roasted coffee, light roast. Palate is watery and lacking depth. Tastes like a generic porter. The flight of beers started decent but ended with a big fizzle.

Draft. Poured a dark brown color with an average frothy tan head that mostly lasted with good lacing. Moderate toasted dark malt and caramel aroma. Medium body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Medium toasted dark sweet flavor with a medium bittersweet finish of moderate duration. Good complex brew.
On draft at the brewpub. Brown pour, with a light tan head. Mostly roasty, dry, notes of chocolate, and burnt toast. Okay.
Draft @ the brewpub. Pours dark brown color with tan head. Roasted malt and coffee aromas with a hint of chocolate. Similar flavors. Medium body with moderate carbonation.
Taster. Blackish pour with creamy tan head. Dark roast coffee and chocolate notes... Similar flavor profile... This is almost a stout. Well done...
The newer prosperity porter which is a touch bolder at 6.5 percent. Clean malt profile with roast, light nut and coffee roast/bitterness... Easy drinking porter!

Pour on tap at the brewery, slightly hazy dark reddish black pour with tan head, aroma brought notes of roast, water, grain, some slight cocoa but pretty mild. Taste was a mix of grain, coffee, dark chocolate, hints of slight watery grain into a bit of yeast, finishing dry.

Location: Draft at the Brewpub, 3/3/14 Aroma: The nose is roasted malts with a bit of coffee and chocolate Appearance: It pours a brown color with fairly thick light brown head on it Flavor: The taste is much the same, pretty much just a roasted malt flavor profile Palate: The body is medium, it has a somewhat thin feel, a soft carbonation, a dry, roasty finish Overall Impression: Again, this was another Oak Creek beer that was just fun but nothing exciting. It has a solid roasted malt flavor. No major flaws or anything to call out. Just another decent beer.
On tap at the brewpub. Pours a dark tan with a small beige head. Nose is caramel, malt, coffee. Flavor is mostly bitter coffee with some caramel and sweet chocolate on the back end. Somewhat watery.

Many yeast residues sink to the bottom after pouring. Persistent white foam. The aroma has suffered from roasted malt and a distinct aroma of freshly baked rye bread, besides some fruit. Very spicy flavor with creamy mouthfeel. There is revealed sweet fruit tones aforementioned bread, wheat malts typical citrus touch, light roasted malt, caramel, spices (including nutmeg) and a little sharp but moderate hop bitterness at the end. Great fullness carries it all the way through the palate. Very little carbonation, but the persistent creamy foam is also a good enjoyment. Dry aftertaste. Great beer.

Like Saisis, this is another of the original Ellezelloise beers which did not survive the fusion with G�ants. Wheat saison with yellowish white, thick, stable, moussy head and deep peach blond colour, cloudy. Very fruity aroma of orange, strawberry, white grapes, wheat, caramel, liquorice, grassy hops, honey, pepper, white chocolate, aniseed, coriander. Fruity onset with citrussy freshness, full and rounded palate, malt sweet, more spicy in the middle (impressions of ginger and cinnamon), with mild herbal hoppy finish. A bit too polished and not �wild� enough for a real saison, but still a more than decent ale.

11.2 oz bottle from January 2008. Pours flat and dark amber with no head, but some random bubbles around the collar. Aroma is sweet caramel some pepper spice and nothing else. Taste is more of the above with no signs of carbonation or flavor, but the sweet caramel water. Palate is thin flat and blah...

Rated on 4-02-2009 (Bottle) This beer poured as a gusher with a large white very fizzy head, hazy straw body, visible carbonation, and no lacing. The Aroma is malty, sweet, hoppy, spicy, and fruity. Ditto for the taste along with some yeast. The Palate is smooth and watery. This beer is light bodied. Overall, this beer is easy to drink. Almost too easy to drink. It is worth trying.
This review is exported from olutopas.info with no comment. Original rating date 15.7.2010

33 cl bottle. Originally rated on 20100715. Pours hazy golden color with a large head. Aroma of yeast, citrus fruits, mild hops, spice notes and mild pale malts. Flavor of citrus fruits, some apricot, spices, pale malts and yeast. Well balanced. Very nice.

Pours murky brown with very little fizz. Smells a bit funky with some caramel and bready notes. Taste is bready, malty sweet, and a bit fruity. Medium-bodied with a smooth texture and mild mouth-carbonation, Ellezelloise Saison finishes with a mild sweetness similar to honey. This is not like any saison I�ve ever had; it was more like a dubbel than anything else.

The beer in the glass is strong golden yellow with a soapy-pearly head. It smells dominant malty, slightly sweet and fruity. Starts hoppy, floral, very fruity, balanced sweet-sour. The middle part is fruity-sweet, surprisingly hoppy and slightly yeasty in the background. Goes into a fruity-sweet-sour finish with grassy aroma hops. Might as well pass as a german Kristallweizen!
hay, roasty, floral, earthy, banana, white foam, amber, clear, medium sweetness, very bitter, medium body, lively,
Bottle @ home. Clear orange / light copper color, big white head. Smell malts, sweet and something weird. Taste lightly bitter, malts and bread. Decent carbo, low body.
Bottled. Dark with a tuby tint. Sooty aroma with some herbal flavour, too. Liquorice, salt. Different, but I am not convinced about this one.
Bottled. Reddish brown coloured. Very malty aroma. Sweet and boring flavour. No sign of the juniper. Dissapointing.
Nice sweet flavor. Smoked taste. Dry aftertaste. Tastes a little bit like wine. Good beer.

Aroma is a bit winey, fruity and smoked. Clear, reddish colour with a decent lacing. Taste is slightly thin. Bit weird. Herbs, fruit, sweetness, smoked all together well balanced. I had to get used to its taste, but it was good. Pleasant brew.
Clear red color, short head. Aroma of caramel malt, hint of kriek. Sweet fruity taste.

Bottled, sampled in Jerusalem Tavern. Clear dark copper coloured, dying head. Very malty roated aroma with some port notes. Superb smooth flavour. Sweet finish. My personal favourite of the St. Peters brewery.

My bottle had its Best Before Date set at "Feb 2004", but it seemed to have survived in fairly good condition. Herbs (juniper and nettles, the label says) are evident in both aroma and taste: the beer smells almost like vermouth or bitters. The taste is good, strongly malty, with a licorice-like note, and a slightly dry finish, even if the body is rather thin and watery. I suppose this would have been much better if fresh, but you have to understand me, I just can't resist an unusual beer on sale (40% off)...

Bottled. Deep amber approaching brown. The head didn�t stay around very long. Rich malty flavour. The absence of hops defines this Saxon styled beer. Rich mature malt flavour. Medium length on the palate. I can definitely recommend this beer for its historical importance and quality.

This was a disappointment (like all other St. Peters beers) No taste of juniper berries at all. Quite mild, low carbonation. However it is still not a bad beer. The label is just telling you something else.

The aroma is spicy - undescribable special. The color is red and it has a small disappearing head. The flavor is very spicy, noticable juniper, and slightly sweet. This beer is more special, than it is good, but I'm glad I've tried it.
Golden colour with a quickly dissipating head. Sweet flavour with a late dryness.

Had a bottle of this today after some hot sex. I think the fact that I was so thirsty really helped the rating. Clear light sparkling straw. Large tight & dense creamy white head has fair lacing and lasts well after the last of the brew has been quaffed. Mild fruity and perfumed hop nose with plenty of malt grain. Sweet and fresh flavor with a slightly spicy middle, and an average balanced finish. Light and dry body that is lively and finishes clean. Very refreshing.

this wan pastel yellow beer hasn't the strength even to hold it's head up, so it's not much to look at, tho emerging from an eighteen hour shift in a coal mine might improve it's allure. i merely mowed the lawn and find it, predictably, just adequate and refreshing. nose was moderate with some grass, honey, alcohol and sour apple. smooth. a tad watery, dryish, modest bitterness. if the brewer was sitting here, i'd say "hey, pretty good!" and feign some enthusiasm. well, he ain't here.
Good beer for the style. Would be a great hot weather beer. One of the only pilseners I've seen brewed in Colorado, and probably the lightest beer made here.
straw color, no nose. i guess you could say it has some hop charecter, thin
Darker than I expected with a name like that. A little chocolate, not really lager-like flavor (missing that distinctive lager character)
Reddish-amber colour with a quickly dissipating head. Toasted malkt aroma and sweet malt flavour. It actually seems more bock or vienna-like to me. Not nearly dry enough to be a dunkel.
More of a black bier than a dunkel... not as much malt. Light and drinkable.
Nice creamy head, brownish red color. Thin coffee scent. Light coffee taste, with not much else to it.

A Rush inspired name? Probably not. I mised the fine print IDing this as a Munich Dunkel, so I expected this to be a light lager of some sort. Imagine my surprise when I saw this dark stuff pouring out of the bottle. This has an excellent toasty toffee aroma. Its a clean aroma that isn't overdone. Small head - no retention...dark red-brown. Nice clean and crisp malt with caramel toffee flavors. Better balanced than their other beers.
burgundy beige head. thin, first i had of the H.C. Berger Variety Pack. unimpressive

Nice intense fruity beginning. Lots of clove and yeast. very intense and deep, fantastic balanced and fruity. Full-bodied, rich in total, lots of clove and yeast in the aftertaste with a smooth Weizen sweetness. Fantastic.

Hazy deep orange, with a big enough but not as big as usual for the style head. Ok retention and some lacing. Aroma is a bit too subdued, with bubblegum and fruity notes of peach and banana taking the main stage, plus slight clove. Taste is brighter. Obviously sweet (averagely so per style), with hints of spiciness/clove and the slightest sourness to bring balance. Notes are bubblegum, banana, peach. Medium bodied with average carbonation, overall kind of lighter than usual for style and abv. A rather simple, highly drinkable, smooth interpretation of a weizenbock. Nice enough, but not very interesting to me.

Frothy white head stayed on a finely carbonated, cloudy dark orange coloured body. Orange, yeast & spice aroma - smells like a Tripel. Medium bodied, creamy to the fore with a tingle down the back. Wheat, banana, orange, yeast, spices, pepper & sweet citrus with a boozy tangy finish.

This is a backlog rating from�2011 from a bottle, from�notes.�When I had this beer it was average to below average for the style and not something I wanted to have again or I just didn't get back to my notes because of my technology at the time. Words to describe this beer are wheat malts, banana, light spice, caramel, yeast.
Nice, bananey weizenbock with a rather full palate. Looks pretty with a hazy orange colour
Bottle yesterday. Was hazy, fullish bldied, substantial.. nice weissy ripe bananas, but malty.. not as peppery spicy as some, but hints still.
0.5 l bottle from Alko Arkadia, Helsinki. I guess you could call this imperial Hefe-Weizen. A bit heavier but still smooth and easy.
Can thx to tkrjukoff cons 2011-07-09 S�tila AP: golden, wee chemical white head AR: sweet, melas, corn, F: watery, corn
Aarhus, DK. Bottled. Some malt flavor and aroma - quite sweet. Some bitterness and a note of hoppy hay
Clear golden with tiny short lasting head. Aroma is grassy with light malty notes. Sweet flavor with malty and grassy notes. Ends slightly bitter.
Bottle. Aroma of hops and malt. Flavour is hoppy and bit fruity, little bitterness. It tasted a bit better when Carlsberg brewed it.
botlle. pale yellow color. extremly carpy. very factory. mild hops and malts.
Bottle, at No. 5 (040301). Looking typical for a pilsener. Aroma light malty (fruit). Flavor light sweet and acidic, light bitter. Lively carbonated. Blindtasted.
(Bottle 33 cl) Surprisingly fully golden, almost orangey. Absolutely no head though. Quite malty sweet with only a discreet bitterness to balance. 220104

Bottled: Light golden coloured. Nice white lasting head. Malt and some hops notes in the aroma. Some sweetness as well. Earth, sweetness, malt and some hops in the flavour. Not much bitterness in the end.

The nose is very slightly malty. The color is yellow and it has a flat fast disappearing head. The flavor is a boring pilsener flavor - very simple; slightly sweet, slightly bitter - very drinkable. It is good for a discount beer.
Aarhus, DK. Bottled. Some caramel notes with the malt. Bitterness is medium and some hay in the aroma
When Carlsberg brewed this it was actually ok and now that Royal Unibrew brews it its not really changed much. Sweet and malty aroma and flavour.
(Bottle 33 cl) Beautiful amber colour with a fine, small head. Quite malty and lightly sweetish with a very subdued bitterness. 090304

Not much aroma. Plenty big head disappearing quickly. Weissbier-like first impression. But mellow malt flavour and smooth mouthfeel. Aftertaste not overly bitter, but OK. Very good for a "classic" type lager.
Bottled: Yet another danish swill. Light amber. No head. Is light malty and sweet in the nose. Some vague notes of roastyness in the flavour. Light bitter in the end. Under average beer.

A favorite among the many Beer/Cola mixers that sprung up in the 2000s. With Altbier as a basis, it pours dark brown as it should. There is just a little additional fruity/cola-esque flavour, adding to the original taste rather than overwhelming it. Good.

Sampled from 0.33 l bottle from local 'trinkgut', best before July 2018. Clear, very dark red with a thin, frothy, slowly diminishing, off-white head. Sweetish, slightly sourish aroma of cola, burnt sugar and some nuts. Quite sweet, malty, a bit sourish taste of cola, grains, burnt sugar and some nuts, followed by a short, minimally bitter, slightly sourish finish. Medium body, slightly effervescent mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Quite refreshing, not that bad when you're thirsty, still way more cola than Alt.
Bottle. Frothy off-white good mostly lasting head. Amber colour. Light malty and hoppy cola aroma. Light bitter flavor. Short light bitter finish. Watery palate.
Bottle. There is some underlying darkish, maybe bready malt presence but sadly the cola has taken over. Sweet, lackluster soft-drink.
Schwarzes Getr�nk garnicht mal so schlechter Schaum f�r diese Art Getr�nk, Geruch s�� leicht Karamell, Geschmack w�rzig s�� aber auch sch�n malzig

Bottle drunk on a train from Dusseldorf. In God�s name why did I buy this? Dark brown lasting beige head. Aroma somewhere between shandy and cola. Surprisingly not awful. Some malt here somewhere. No real hop presence. Weird but actually drinkable.
*Old rating, best before 27.07.10. Frisches und sch�n s�ffiges Cola-Bier. Malzig, frisch, nicht viel Bier, leichtes Malz im Hintergrund. Lecker f�r ein Cola-Bier.
Ins Glas ergie�t sich ein r�tlichbraunes Getr�nk mit geringer Schaumkrone. Geruch stark nach Cola, genauso schmeckt es auch, keine Biergeschmack zu erkennen.
Smells like a typical Coke-Beer mix. Tastes very sweet with interesting roasty undertones. Nice and comparatively lasting palate.
Dont like that bottle. Beer in the glass zippy, huge head. Starts mild, very sweet, not very beery. Modest malty, finish moldy, still sweet. Nothing special.
Full gold, kind of plasticy and fatty along with some hops. Not into it....
drank this after a hard day moving stuff for some distant relo in northern bohemia. nice and bitter and dry enough to drink hard
Pale golden colour. Very dry, medium bodied with really bitter finish. A plain but well made and tasty pilsener.
# 23; 5/2015. Tmav� zlat�, �ir� barva. Slad��, karamelov� a ovocn�, m�rn� naho�kl�, grepov�.

Der Name "Pr�che�sk� Perla" ist ein Titel, der offenbar weitergegeben wurde. Die Flasche, welche ich jetzt im Oktober 2017 verkoste, kommt von der Brauerei Bakal�� in Rakovn�k. Auf allen Werbeplakaten, wie auch auf dem Etikett ist eine urige, breit grinsende Dame mit extrem tief ausgeschnittenen Dekollet� zu sehen, welche in beiden H�nden ein Bierglas h�lt. Das Bier ist ein typisches tschechisches Helles, das mir ein wenig zu w�ssrig ist, aber sich gut trinken l�sst.
old backlog rating. RBESG08, blind tasting at Modr� Abb�,#7: Light perfumed hops, a hint detergent. Golden, creamy head. Light malt profile, a hint spices, low hop finish, light body. Boring.

Cerveza de color dorado profundo con grandes burbujas que se van desarrollando y una buena cabeza de espuma blanca que dura en la copa durante bastante tiempo.Aroma dulce a malta caramelo y l�pulo. Sabor malteado, afrutado, a l�pulos frescos y toques de manzana. Ligeramente dulce por la gran cantidad de malta que incorpora. Cuerpo medio y se bebe muy bien a pesar de los 6% alcohol. que lleva. Cerveza agradable con un buen sabor equilibrado

Rami Rami is drinking an Otakar 11% by M욝ansk� pivovar v Poli�ce at Kufle i Kapsle Bardzo bezpretensjonalny, dosc pelny, slodkawy ale ma goryczke. Spoko jest, ryli. Moze za slodki jeno. Zbozowowosc niewysoka

Es mag daran liegen, dass ich vorher ein ausgezeichnetes Pale Ale getrunken habe, aber dieses Bier kann nicht viel. Es hat zwar einen netten Buttergschmack, der dazugeh�rt, aber die sonstigen Aromen geben nicht viel her. Es fehlt einfach an den hopfig-malzigen Spiel, das die 11-gr�digen Tschechen auszeichnet. Brauche ich nicht mehr.
bottle @ supermarket (prague) yellow colour, normal body, average carbonated, white head, bittersweet, hoppy, malty, easy to drink
0.5 draft @ Multi Qlti Clear gold, small white head. Bready, pale malts. Sweet, malty, DMS-y. Light, slick average. Finish short, DMS-y, and watery. Overall, meeh.
Bottle. Golden colour, frothy head that stays for a while. Nose is faint. Aroma of butter, malt, a bit of grassy hops. Light bitterness, light sweetness. Soft carbonation, light body. Decent.
w zapachu s�odowe, trawka. W smaku troszk� cytrus�w, mocno gazowane, trawiaste, z wygl�du piana obfita, szybko opada, solidny lacing, przeci�tny pilsik
An alright Czech Pilsner. Nothing done badly. Tasted well, aroma a bit dull
Piwo klarowne, piana pozostawia �adny lacing. W aromacie slodowo, lekki chmiel. W smaku lekko s�odkie, z minimaln� goryczk�.

50cl bottle. A clear deep golden beer with a mid-sized most good lasting off-white head. Aroma of soft metallic hops, straw, spicy hops. Taste of mild sweet caramelish malt, soft metallic hops, toffee.

Bottle at SM�F 2010. It poured a clear pale yellow liquid with a minimal white head. Flavour of sweet malt and earth. Smooth mouthfeel medium thick body. Decent pilsner, didn�t look to good, but fresh and easy to drink.

(draught, at the Pivni Galerie, Prague) clear golden colour, creamy white head, great lacing. aroma is a bizarre combination of earthy and floral hops, camembert and light grain. flavour has strong notes of camembert and almonds, with more earthy hops and grain. works well enough. medium carbonation and body.
bottle from Pivni Galerie. Golden yellow colour, amll head, slightly oily appearance. Malty and sweet, hoppy in the finish, which results in a bitter-sweet impression. Full-bodied and fruity.

After a massive walk with a heavy backpack, I was glad to see the sign Pivini Galerie, and glad to be drinking a cold beer, so it may have sqewed the rating a little. Poured clear golden with an inviting fluffy head. Bready spicy aroma, almost solventy. the mouthful feel reasonably full, but lacks a decent malt flavour. It has some nice saaz to finish it off, as well as a candylike aftertaste.

Bottle (from Pivni Galerie, Prague): Deep golden coloured, medium-sized, firm, but quickly diminishing and lacing white layer; sweet grainy, doughy nose, mixed with a tinge of almost citrousy, herbal hoppiness; slightly sweetish flavour, medium bodied; sweet-malty-.doughy, only slightly bitter finish. Quite well rounded, but not too tasty Special...........
Golden colour. Frothy head that dissipates fast. Banana aroma. Malty, somewhat metallic flavour. Bitter finish.

Der Titel "Premium" wird gerne an Biere vergeben, welche ein bisschen vollmundiger sind (oder sein sollen) als das klassische Helle einer Brauerei. Es war ein durchaus trinkbares Bier, das aber auch nicht mehr war. Derzeit ist die Produktion davon eingestellt.
From old tasting notes. Cloudy yellow gold color. Huge bubbly white head. Sweetish apple peel malt nose. Big hop flavor upfront. Underlying maltiness shows in midtaste. Good dry hop finish.

Bottle, 0.33l, tried 5,3% version before 2010. Premium as any other beer that has got premium in its name. Classic lager with slightly higher ABV than nowadays counterparts, but green bottle certainly makes it less attractive...

Another rating from the past. Poured a clear golden color, topped with a decent white frothy head. Malty aroma, slightly skunky. Sweet start, bittery body, a bit metallic in the aftertaste. Maybe even better than standard Union. Not completely bad.
Clear golden appearance, medium head. Slightly more aroma than classic Union Beer, but nothing special. Not available anymore.

20/10/2011 33cl bottle @ home - BB: 14/2/12 (2011-568) Thanks to Tom and Ivana for bringing the bottle! Clear golden to orange beer, big yellowish head, pretty stable, adhesive, irregular bubbles. Aroma: very hoppy, grassy at first, then bready malts, sweet and sugary. MF: light carbon, could use some more, medium body. Taste: fruity, weird malts, sweet, then some citrus, bitter hops. Aftertaste: vegetables, sugar, some bitter hops but not enough by far.

03/03 0.33 l bottle courtesy of ogivlado, thanks for giving it away, to finally get my hands on this! It poured slightly hazy golden body with head. BB date was 15. March. Crappy aroma, totally malty with rotten cabbage, eggs and cornflakes. Flavor is luckily weaker, sweetish malty and not so bad as one would expect from the stench. Thin to medium body. Sweetish honey finish. A pilsener? No way, but its ordinary, boring and just drinkable all malt pale lager. But again, it was near to its BB date so it might not be in its best shape.

0.33l bottle courtesy of ogivlado who brought it from Slovenia (thanks!), shared with heavy The body is golden and slightly hazy, with a small head that went away relatively fast. Honeyish malty nose, some vegetables. Meh. The taste is honeyish again, slightly fruity, polleny, some wood and grain, dust. Weak background hops that stick a little bit in the aftertaste. Meh, ok, reminded me of Austrian macro lagers, only slightly better, not that that�s saying much.
What's premium about this stuff? A standard thin, grassy and frankly unappealing straw coloured fluid. Next. (Bottle at Pizza Sole, Ljubljana)
Bottled(330ml). -just average pilsener without anything special in taste or aroma

Seriously, who prefers beers like this... might as well have been repackaged Karlova�ko.

Golden color, weak white head. Malty aroma. Malty taste, not too hoppy. Medium carbonation, medium body. Average lager.
A quality light lager, sinilar to a good german helles. Grainy and clean. Beer and burger budapest

Light yellow color, durable foam. Basic beer smell, a little bit maize grits and malt. Taste is too watery for me, but a drinkable basic Hungarian beer. Nothing special, there is no character, but a way more harmonic beer, then the most large-scale Hungarian beers.
On tap at brewery. Pours golden color, white head. Aroma and taste are malty and boring.
On tap. Bright orange color, white, quickly vanishing white head. Sour. Malty. No hops. Poor.
Clear yellow golden appearance, medium head. Hoppy aroma with spices, medium sweetness, some bitterness. Overall average Pilsener.
the aroma is malty with some hints of hop, grains and herbs... the taste is clear and refreshening, malty with some shades of grasses and very light hoppy bitterness... dry and bitter aftertaste...
Tap at Richtar Jakub. Golden color with white head. Malty aroma. Malty taste with bitter hops in finish.
Light orange color with big white head. Aroma of malts, hay, light sweet. Taste is light sweet, light bitter, very drinkable. Medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation. Good lager

Tap at Hostinec Richtar Jakub. Aroma quite mild, mostly malty, pilsner type. Light honey. Clear golden colour, white head, medium duration. Taste is really simple, straightforward industrial pilsner and average at that.

Amber coloured. fruity aroma, Very sweet, neutral flavour, medium bodied. A disappointingly flavourless strong Czechish lager with not much bitterness.

getrunken im Mai 2013 Ich habe dieses Bier in einem Russland-Markt in Wien gekauft. Da die Brauerei offenbar nicht Teil der tschechischen Brauereiinnung ist, habe ich es bis jetzt nicht gekannt...naja, es ist mir nichts entgangen. Bottle at work. Pours golden color, white head. Aroma is malty. Taste is medium bitter, medium sweet, malty, bit hoppy. Refreshing lager.

(Draught at U Vodoucha, Prague, 25 July 2015) Golden colour with frothy, white head. Malty, fruity nose with apricots, orange and a touch of toast. Malty taste with notes of bread, toast, apricots, toffee and a balanced grassy bitterness. Medium body, with a touch of sweetness. Good but fairly average Czech pilsner. Quite enjoyable.

Keg at the bar next to the shot-out-eye with Garth, Archie and Rachel. Actually didn�t realise it was even a different bar until the guy told us. Pours gold with a White head. PET, Cesky Brod, CZ, Malt,hay, some butter and grassy aroma, Hazy golden color, smaller lacing head, Sweeter taste, light bitter finish, Medium body, Soft carbon, Decent beer.

Tapped at hostinc Richtar Jakub in Bratislava/Slovakia. Overall a standard malty lager I have had so many times. Nothing special. Malty aroma and taste, clear copper golden color, white head, malty taste with a tiny bitter hoppy finish. Refreshing.
Hand bottled from Richtar Jakub. Golden color with huge white head. Malty aroma with green apples. Malty taste with very shy hoppy bitterness, diacetyl. Drinkable.

(draught) pours a clear golden colour with a frothy white head. aroma of straw, herbal hops, yeast and caramel, with a hint of butter. flavour is mostly the same, with notes of raisins and bread dough, some herbal hops and a slightly tart apricot finish. medium-bodied with average carbonation.
Bottle. Poured a yellow color with an averaged sized head. Bready and grassy.

Bottle Bready malty beer wih hints of hops and sourish yeasty basement notes. Soft mouthfeel, again very bready, with a rather light bitter finish. Maybe not quite hoppy for a pilsener yet still a good beer.
Very refrshing, with that sandy-sweet taste of the Czech lagers. I liked it a lot although had been in my cellar for long time.
Bottled. ABV 5.0%. Golden color. Very light, no signs of bitterness. Drinkable and much much much better than Kl�ter 10�.

Really malty, bready beer. Aroma carries some alcohol, and various graininess (wheat, corn, bready). Diminished head, not so lively. All bread, a little grassy. Medium to even full bodied, slightly unusual in that regard. OK.

Bottle from Pivonka, Hradec Kralove. ABV 5 %. Pours golden with a moderate white head. Sweet malty aroma, citrus. Taste is light sweet, with floral citrusy notes. Dries up towards the end with a nice hoppy bitterness. Very good and balanced svetly.

5% ABV. Bottle from Quack-Duck, thanks! Pale golden color. hazy. Soft maltaroma with floral notes. malty yet dry flavor with citrus and a floral hopbitterness. Soft hints of butter in the far beackground. Well balanced pilsener of good quality.

16.9 Oz Bottle. Pours a very light gold, slight haze. Good head with some decent retention. Very tame malt on the nose, smells kind of odd but I can�t put a name to it. Tastes like saltine crackers, very light bitterness, mostly malt. Medium carbonation with little body.
Clear golden with a lasting white head. Grainy malt aroma with a hint of grass. Sweet malty flavour with a touch of alcohol.

Clear orange color with a lasting white bubbly head. Aroma is less than appealing. Light malts, soggy cereal, and spoiled hops. Flavor was about the same, mainly sour malts and a little bitterness. Palate is really soft and flat. I could not finish the entire glass.

Pilsner checa sin pasteurizar. Ambar. Espuma media que permanece en capa delgada. Gusto medianamente amargo y retrogusto ligeramente amargo. Menos que otras de la misma marca. Cuerpo ligero. Refrescante. No esta mal aunque para mi sigue siendo un poco amarga.
500ml can from Bliznetsy in Moscow. Pours clear dark gold with a medium-sized white head. Aroma is grassy hops, herbs, pilsner malt. Taste is light sweet, grain, malt, mild grassy bitterness.

Reasonably well balanced. A bit bitter, but has a decent body to keep up. bierborse dresden
Clear golden color with a nice creamy white foam. Hay, grassy, bit cardboard aroma. Malty, bit solvent flavor with a bitter, bready finish, light body.
On tap at Kufle i Kapsle in Warsaw. Orange-Amber bright clear color with a medium off-white cap. Nose: citric aroma, grass, herbal. Mouth: bitter, citric, grassy.

Nicht nur aufgrund des Alkoholgehaltes ein Bockbier. Auch von der S��e kommt es hin. 0.5 bottle. Pours clear copper color with minimal white head. Aroma of malts, hops. Flavor is high sweet, light bitter. Malty. Finish is medium long and sweet. Soft carbonation, medium body.

0.5l bottle. Malty aroma, caramel notes. Clear golden to amber color, white head. Malty taste, caramel notes, light alcohol, light sweet, light bitter. Medium body, thick texture, average carbonation and bitter-sweet finish. Average.
Bottle. Bronze and clear. Poured with a small head. Sweet medium body and easy to drink. Nothing really different about it -just pleasant and worth trying.

Keg @ Zly Casy. Slightly hazy golden, firm lasting white head, good lacing. Faint malty aroma with some booze shining through. Mouthfeel is a bit rough, medium carbonated. Sweet malty taste, honey, red apple, and bread. Sweet sugary finish with some alcohol notes.
