Strong Pilsener, bitter and hoppsey... No malts in this one...after the second litre... your head will explode next morning
Country tick #89, golden, small, aroma is malty, grainy, taste is the same, bitter, fizzy, sweet, ok
Pours clear, light golden with a two finger, white head. Aroma is corn and grass. Taste is corn syrup, moving to light grains. Finish is light corn sweetness. A pale lager, that's for sure.
33cl Bottle. Gift from a friend. Golden colour with a thin white head. Aroma is malt, sweet, grain. Taste follows the aroma. Light body, average carbonation.

Clear pale golden color with a white layer on top. Moderate pilsner aroma. Average carbonation level. Moderate sweetness end bitterness. Decent pilsner on a sunny beach. Malty, herbal, and some grainy notes.[Can from a trade with CH-303] Brewery #1925 Country #142
Clear bright golden color scant head. Papery aroma. Taste is light caramel. Very boring.

courtesy of Nisse666; canned - light hazy pale golden-yellow beer with a moderate white foam left; light grainy and papery aroma with notes of old apples; moderate malt backbone; light grainy and sweet; flowery finish with hints of vomit and candy sugar
Pour thanks to Grumbo - Pours gold white head - nose and taste of corn, light metallic tin and dirty grain - light bodied

Bottle in Ciudad del Este, Paraguay - I was in Ciudad del Este only for a few hours, and all I wanted was a beer from Paraguay, which tourned out to be nearly impossible. All shops selling beer had not one from Paraguay in their shelves, and the clerks looked at me quite funny, when I kept asking for one. Paraguayan beer really seems not to be that great. Finally, I chose to dine in a small shack in a shopping center, just because they had a bottle of this behind the counter. Tourned out to be a good choice - the food. Beer was weak, but it gets some extra credit for me for being so hard to find :)

decent enough copper color..very thin white head. aroma was mostly malts with a hint of floral hops thrown. weird...flavor was all that different. little hops on the tongue, then you swallow the beer and shit, where did any flavor go? i'll have to try this again in the spring (assuming they brew it again) when it may be a little fresher...although i dont think it was a bad bottle, just devoid of most flavor characteristics.

Given the other reviewers comments, I fear I may have gotten a weird bottle. But, rate I must. In the words of Golum "We loves the Spring Ale.......NO!!! We hates the Spring Ale!". By the pour and appearance of this offering I expected bliss. Yet upon tasting, my tongue, riled by deception, scolded and scorned the dreamers purchase. Perhaps it's the dryness that so offended. The aroma was pleasant enough, but there is no malty goodness, no body, no life force from which to draw. Just empty fizz and some lanquid hops. "We must re-rates the beer......NO!!! me must punishes the beer!......".

Picked this one up in St. Louis. Has a clear dark amber body topped by a thin off-white head. Cereal aroma. Flavor is very biscuit-like, reminiscent of a dark, grainy cracker. Light-medium body. Some revile the amber ale; I invite and caress it.
Deep clear amber color, nice white lasting head, malty bready aroma. Sweet caremel malty flavor, the hops stand out with a nice clean dry finish, medium body, pretty tasty and easy drinking, not bad.
Rich amber hue, nice head with a mildly spicy aroma, this ale goes down good and is on the dryish side. As far as I know, it is only available locally. Pretty good really, I'll give it a B.

Definately the Asia�s Best Elite Beer Brand ! but infact Probably the World�s Best, Unique, Great, Awesome, Standard and a Legendary BEER ! which is brewed by an more than 150 year old Glorious Classic Legendary Brewery !

245 ml bottle. Thanks rosenbergh. Pours dark red color with a small head. Lots s and lots of bready notes and rye, some m�mmi and malts. Lots of bread malts and rye on flavor too. Liquid bread. Very unique, but not very pleasant. 5312

245 ml bottle. BB 23/02/2015. From Pakistan. Thanks to Muhammed! Dark brown colour with a small light tan head. Bread, sweetness, rye bread and m�mmi in the aroma. It's liquid bread. Nothing else. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sampled on June 10, 2014, thanks to Nisse666! Bottle 245 ml. Clear dark brown color, light brown head. Sweet, spicy, wort scent. Sweet, light roasted, spicy taste. Light roasted aftertaste. Weak mouthfeel, very low bitterness.
Bottle from friend Ali cons 2014-06-10 M�lndal AR: dry fish food, malt extract AP: coca cola colored body, wee beige head F: dry, malt extract, fish food

250 ML bottle in Pakistan. Muddy brown color little head with a touch of sweetness. Aroma is mainly malt For non alcoholic beer it is quite pleasant. Slightly sweet with heavy malt flavor. I would not clasify it as a real beer but it is refreshing.
Dark ruby red/brown in colour. nice head, slighly roasty flavour. Short flavour of malt.
Dark nut brown. Unusually dry malta with some plum aroma. .................

Un-Muzzling Olde Muzzlehatch Ratings, #83. Draught pint - or probably .5 liter - at the Essen Haus in Madison, WI, August 2008. Pale clear gold with a lasting dollop of snow-white head...grassy aroma at first, more like a pils or helles, but caramelized malts do come through after a minute or two...body too is more reminiscent of a lighter lager style with the caramelization rather muted; there�s also some discernible hops which is unusual, though they are faint...light alcoholic bite, pretty full at the finish and sweet enough that, OK, yeah, it�s a bock I guess, just a very lightly-flavored/textured and dry one. Which isn�t really a bad thing.
Similar to a Heineken. Super skunky flavor and bitter. Had to drink this because i rated all other beers. Pours light yellow in color. Had out of a bottle. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap, clear to slight haze golden color with egg creamy foam, aroma is some doughy plastic, flavor is bready, scrambled eggs, ripe fruit , metallic on finish
Gift from SJ. Not a bad brew. Some sweet malt and bread. A mild floral presence.
12 oz bottle. Pours golden yellow with slight lace. Surprisingly more sweet than bitter. Grainy and full of yeast. A bit of a skunk at the end.
Draft at Moriartys. Bright golden pour with a white head. Lots of carbination. Strong yeasty aroma. Slight nutty taste. Crisp. Low bitterness. Drinkable but not worth savoring.

16 ounce pint - $5.50 at Taco Mac in Kennesaw, Georgia. Appearance: Served up a clear, deep yellow-hued body with a medium-sized, white head that soon settles into a thin ring. Smell: A whiff of pilsner malt, some soft, sweet-accented breadiness, a thin sliver of honey, and spice and dried leaves in the background. Taste: An initially twangy taste of faintly grainy pils malt. Lightly sweet, hinting barely at mild honey. German noble hops provide touches of florals, spice, and a slight leafy quality. Modestly bitter. Drying on the back end, with a final pop of malt on the finish, then a lingering mingling of graininess and bitterness in the aftertaste. Mouthfeel: Medium-light body. Medium-plus carbonation. Overall: A decent, suitable maibock.

Tap. Fluffy pure white head, clear golden orange-yellow. Very fruity in both the aroma and taste - stone fruits and apples. Gets a bit grainy as well, and has some metallic notes in the flavor. Sweetish, and has a heftier nearly syrupy body. Too sweet for me....
Had at Huettenbar. Nice malt sweetness. Not every sip but some had a spicy flavor. Serving: Tap

Like so many things that have attained iconic status, it�s tough to say anything too good or too bad about this. Both the aroma and the palate beckon with so much malt that it hints of sour grapefruit. Yet the body is surprisingly thin, and the carbonation surprisingly coarse for those of us who cut our teeth on American craft brews. A nice beer, but it�s too bad not every classic can be "Casablanca."

column2: La Ribera de Bel�n, Heredia, Costa Rica
column5: Pours golden with a bubbly white head. Heavily carbonated. Aroma has harsh malt notes.Taste is kinda weak, corn and malt. Palate has sweetness to it, otherwise bland. Eh.

column2: La Ribera de Bel�n, Heredia, Costa Rica
column5: 0,33 litre Bottle from Total Wine And Spirits, Laguna Hills, Ca. Golden with white head. Malts, hops, sweetness.

column2: La Ribera de Bel�n, Heredia, Costa Rica
column5: Pours a light golden color with a thin white head. The aroma was kind of malty and sweet with some fruity notes. A little sweet and dry at the end. Not too bad of a beer. This is an OK, drinkable beer.

column2: La Ribera de Bel�n, Heredia, Costa Rica
column5: 350 ml tall can purchased in downtown Limon, Costa Rica. Clear pale gold color with a white head and decent retention. Sparse lacing. Thin, crisp and light mouthfeel. Taste is a little watery, but the flavor is decent. A little grainy. Pretty good for only 3.4 ABV.

column2: La Ribera de Bel�n, Heredia, Costa Rica
column5: My notes are so messy, I can�t really read what I wrote about this beer, but I used the F word several times and gave it the score above. That should say enough.

column2: La Ribera de Bel�n, Heredia, Costa Rica
column5: Bottle. Head is initially small, frothy, white, mostly diminishing. Body is light yellow. Aroma is lightly malty (grain, cereal, husks), with notes of metal and DMS. Flavor is lightly to moderately sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter. Finish is lightly sweet, lightly acidic, lightly to moderately bitter, slightly unclean, slightly husky. Light body, watery texture, fizzy/lively carbonation, metallic. Help, I�m stuck in Costa Rica! Actually it�s a great country but the beer in stores is all this Florida factory garbage.

column2: La Ribera de Bel�n, Heredia, Costa Rica
column5: Bottle in some random bar, Puntarenus, Costa Rica on 29th March 2014: why do I drink these sort of beers? I know I don�t like them: I�ve turned into a ticker haven�t I? In my quest to drink as many different Costa Rican beers during our short stop over as possible I�ve driven myself to this sort of thing (and a bloody Rock Lemon!). Weak, and iffy in all aspects: quench your thirst with this my all means, but don�t expect a beer experience. I�d take a sip then wash your feet in it!

column2: La Ribera de Bel�n, Heredia, Costa Rica
column5: Bottled in Monteverde, Costa Rica. Clear pale yellow, coarse head. Metallic nose with some rotting vegetables. Sloppy and empty, razor blade thin. Corn syrup, water and aluminium. Metallic finish. Useless.

column2: La Ribera de Bel�n, Heredia, Costa Rica
column5: Golden body, light carbonation, thick, airy, etiolated head. Stale insubstantial, low quality, malt nose. Thin, cardboard grain body with a touch of grittyness on the tongue. Terrible, but not quite a drainpour.

column2: La Ribera de Bel�n, Heredia, Costa Rica
column5: to be honest, the reviewer below me sums up my thoughts on these. yet another rubbish beer from floridas bebidas. not much to choose from in costa rica.... granted most do the job for what they are designed - to quench thirst on a hot day.

column2: La Ribera de Bel�n, Heredia, Costa Rica
column5: Jesus, I don�t know why I keep doing this - the depths I�ll go to in order to scare up a rating in this country. Unbelievable what a monopoly on trash Florida Bebidas has in Costa Rica. I wonder what their marketing plan is. Hmmm, let�s try this: another trashy pale lager. We�ll call it the same as the rest only we�ll add �light� or �ice� or something after the name and add one more or less grain of barley where needed so we can say the beer is different.

column2: La Ribera de Bel�n, Heredia, Costa Rica
column5: Cans in Costa Rica. Coors-lightish, moderately offensive. Costa Rica is not a place for beer drinkers.

column2: La Ribera de Bel�n, Heredia, Costa Rica
column5: can. flavorless. fizzy. weak. basically club soda. that�s about all there is to it.
Healthy dash of hop, though coupled with some fruity off-flavours. .........
Best beer in Ecuador so far. I have been in so many places and I really enjoyed this beer. I brought a six pack back to the States. I wish I can get more.
Botella,color dorada clara con espuma blanca,mediana,poco resistente.Aroma malta,herbal.Sabor malta,herbal,ligero dulzor y amargor poco notable

Desperate and thirsty in Guayaquil , Ecuador, with shrimp ceviche, pours a pale gold color. Grainy nose. Grainy taste , malty and flavorless...thirsty so it passes the thirst test and nothing else. Currently I believe 0 for 5 in Ecuador, but no surprise.

This is terrible ! I would have given it zero but I bought it in Ecuador so it has sentimental attachment to me now. Takes like the cheap cheap cheap beer I would drink in college when I was broke. But the bottle is fun! And it was flown here from Ecuador ! I�m sure someone likes it - but not me. Cheers ! ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a clear straw yellow from the bottle with bubbly white head that leaves light lace. Aroma and taste of corn and hay, light grass and crisp lager yeast. It's a mass produced light lager, made by AB-Inbev, and it tastes like it. But its good on a hot day after a long hike in the Galapagos.

Bottle found at a supermarket in Quito, served warm - as the old grandpa said, "kid, if you don't like warm beer, you don't like beer". So here we are. It pours with modest thin head and a heavily carbonated yellow body. Smells like dried shit, the likes of which I saw on the sidewalk near their fancy cathedral this morning and I can only hope it wasn't human. The flavour is that of a non-alcoholic brew with lots of cloying bread going on. Wet and sugary finish. There is essentially nothing to recommend here, I suppose if it's chilled enough and you're poor it could be an okay way to forget about your week. But then again, so is a mickey of vodka.
Not bad when travelling in Ecuador. On a global standard it is no more than an average Lager.

500ml bottle at home, Stuttgart. Atoms is light to medium banana, light malt. Appearance is very cloudy orange with a huge, fast decreasing white foam. Taste is light bitter and very light sweet. Full body, some dryness. A bitter after taste. Good.
Vom Fass. Tr�b gelbes Bier, feiner heller Schaum. Hefeduft. Fruchtig. Antrunk Vanille, Hefe, Banane. Gut zur Weisswurst!
Dunkles tr�bes gelb sehr hefig in Geruch und Geschmack, etwas reife banane getreidig, naja

Pours hazy ochre yellow with a huge white rocky head. Good retention. Aroma: massive fruitiness including apples and pears, light banana, bread, background leathery phenols. Light to medium body. Average carbonation. Taste: medium dry, fairly fruity. Apples and pears dominate. Banana stands by. Spicy farmhouse-like hints. A mix of hop and subtle phenols at finish. Low bitterness. Different hefe. Good one.

getrunken vom Fass am Feuerwehrfest Perchtoldsdorf, einem Vorort im Speckg�rtel von Wier, der offenbar diese als Partnergemeinde hat. Jedenfalls hat dieses Bier hier eine gewisse Tradition. Es ist ein Weizenbier, so wie ich mir es w�nsche: ein traditionelles Weizenbier mit richtig sch�nen fruchtigen Aromen, welche nicht komisch �bertrieben wirken und doch den Mund mit einer Geschmacksexplosion erfreuen. Man kann es als Strandbier als auch als vollmundiges Feierabenbier trinken. An dem soliden Bier gibt es echt nichts auszusetzen.

Chopp @ Bierstube, Aarhus. Cloudy golden, medium creamy white head. Pleasant fruity banana wheat sweet like aroma. Good palate. Flavour is great, classic Weiss bier fruity wheaty. Medium bitterness, dry like. Nice.
Pale yellow, frothy white head. Full of wheat and yeast. A bit of spice. Taste is mildly bitter, texture a bit watery, medium to light body with a dry, chalky finish. Decent.

Tight creamy white left a good cover on a hazy dark golden still body. Banana, spices, sweet floral, yeast & clove aroma. Medium bodied, tingly over the to give with soft creamy back & light clean aft. Wheat, clove, banana, sweet citrus &herbal tastes with long tangy finish.
Cask at the Grape and Grain- Crystal Palace Spring Beer Festival, 2013. Gold pour with a white head. Caramel and citrus aroma. Spicy-pepper-fruit action in the flavour. Long spicy finish.
Cask at GBBF 2010. A dark golden beer with a thin yellowish head. The aroma is dominated by citrusy hops. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt and citrusy hops, leading to a rather bitter finish.

Cask at the Bree Louise. Pours gold with no head. Some sugar in the nose, ripe fruits and caramel. Poor flavor, bland and watery with a little caramelish sugar. Light bodied and flat. Has a faintly bitter finish, bland still with just nips of sugar. Done.

Cask (handpump) @ GBBF 2010, Great British Beer Festival, Earls Court Exhibition Centre, London, England. Clear medium orange color with a small to average, frothy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, toasted, fruity, light to moderate hoppy, earth notes. Flavor is moderate sweet and bitter with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is flat. [20100804]
Cask gravity at GBBF 2010. Gold, thin beige head. It�s a bitter, some biscuit, only a touch of hop. Just not interesting.
Cask conditioned at The Swan & Rushes, Leicester. Gold to amber with slight head. Reasonably roasted malts, biscuity, bready, yeasty with a leafy hop, some dryness. It�s o.k.
Cask@GBBF2010. Golden colour, small white head. Aroma is fruits, nectar, wood and some quite herbal and nutty notes as well. Flavour is quite similar with also some rather salty notes in the finish.
cask at GBBF 2010 ... Earls count... London ... southeast england ... united Kingdom ... Europe ... World ... dull lemon hop nose .. soft toffee bitter .. lemon ... again pealy wally
From cask. Pours clear and golden yellow to orange with a small white head. Aroma is cornish and grassy hops. Grassy and mild citrusy hops flavoured. Bitter and bone dry.
Cask. Aroma is fruity malt, golden, small white head. Light taste of malt. Light bodied, balanced, sweet. Fair.
Geprobeerd tijdens de 24 uur van het belgische bier in Antwerpen in 2002. Ik had toen genoteerd: mooi rode kleur, zeer speciaal met de druivensmaak, een echte meevaller.

750ml shared by callmemickey. Thanks again Ryan for this rare treat. Pours a dark amber, almost brown color with purplish hues and a one finger light beige head that slowly settles into a thin ring. Spotty lacing left behind. Funky, musty aroma with lots of earthy oak and vinous dark fruit. I was really surprised by how funky the nose is. Not in a sour/wild ale way but really damp, leathery and earthy countering the sweet fruit notes. Underneath there is a decent amount of grape and other berries. Medium bodied with soft carbonation and a stronger fruit presence than expected. Also, nowhere near as funky as the aroma suggested with subtle earthiness and leather notes. Very vinous with lots of grape, currant and other dark berries as well as some subtle malt and dry oak. This beer has developed a lot of complexity and has held up surprisingly well. Lots of amazing funk in the nose and still plenty of fruit in the palate.

Leather, wax, earth, cork, herbal hops, wood, cherries, grapes and alcohol are all notable in the aroma. Very hazy, bright reddish-brown coloured body is topped by a fizzy, pink-tinged head that recedes rapidly to ring. Strong earth, cork and strong acidity in the very dry flavour. Grapes emerge in the aftertaste. Dusty and somewhat astringent and puckering with plenty of tannins and vinegary, balsamic notes. Strong, lively fine bubbled carbonation is surprisingly quite prickly on the tongue. This one didn�t work for me nearly as well as for others in the session. Bottle sampled with MartinT, Olivier_MTL, Rastacouere and Siroy.

Purple/red color is gorgeous to look at. The head is initially good sized, but quickly diminishes to a white ring. Cabernet Sauvignon blackcurrant character is attenuated by a huge leather/cork character that evolves as it breathes. Very vinous, pretty dry, somewhat meaty and definitely leafy in its woody, �chewing on branches� character that dries out. Earthy in that fashion, it becomes more Merlot-like, plumy and fleshy. Slightly sweet at first contact, it boasts an infinite funk repertoire. Grapes and hay, blueberries and pie crust, nicely juicy, moisty and toasty. Just plenty of unexpected flavours that manage to work together in a basement/cobwebby yeast atmosphere. Strong carbonation, medium bodied, very soft astringency for what it is. Enormously unclean, like their kriek, but terribly fun to try in that fashion.

Any first impressions? -A veil of head hangs on to the opaque pinkish-red. -Heavily corked aroma, with balsamic undercurrents and hiding hay. -Dirty earth generously spread over sweet black grapes. -Important carbonation enlivens the somewhat lazy mouthfeel. What if you dig deeper? -The sweet black grapiness develops, with time, into a long finish. -Dry earth and leather contribute healthily to that finale. -Some tartness within the fruitiness, but definitely not overdone. -Another dusty but tasty number from Uitzet, but I admit the dustiness feels exaggerated to me. Bottle; no date.

At Delirium Cafe, Brussels, Belgium - Thanks to Olivier (Olivier_MTL) and his friend for sharing. Virually no head on this beer. Clear, reddish brown body. Looks just like a fine red wine. Nose of leather, grapes, cherries, red and white wine, port, cask wood, ... really WOOOW! Just like one of my favorites of Cantillon: St. Lamvinus. Moderately acidic, lightly bitter initial flavour. Moderately acidic finish, averagily long. The flavour is a little bit weak. It is still quite sour, but a little bit softenned out. It is just like a (sweet) lambic with grapes added, but with not that many carbonation yet.

08.25.05 750ml bottle, corked and capped, undated. Dingy red pour looks quite a bit like a dusky beaujolais nouveaux or an organic cranberry juice. Only a tiny, sudsy head of large bubble at first, followed by an upwelling of fine, pink dense bubbles like a soda, and then all is quiet, still. Aroma is musty, mineral, sulfur, some grapey, jam-like sweetness, nothing at all beery. At first, the beer is plain, a bit sour, and very corky and astringent. As it warms a stronger vinous quality arises along with a more assertive tartness. Grape skins, astringent tannins, must, and a light and lasting vinous quality.

Beautiful red color with a small pink head that quickly dissipated. Vinous, grape and cherry aroma. Flavor reminded me of a mild homemade grape wine with just a touch of carbonation. Expected(and hoped for) a little more tartness. Was mildly impressed after the first couple of sips, but by the end of the bottle I really started to enjoy this. Nice dry finish.

75 cL bottle, (corked and capped): moist cork, but it slides out with only a minimal release of carbonation. Mostly headless, with a beautiful ruby body that practically sparkles. Musty, tart red grape aroma mixed tannins, limestone and hints of cherries. Extremely acidic on the tongue and especially in the back of the throat. Full fruit flavours with a bit of gueuze-like funk (which I like) and astringent grape skins. You know, this one was definitely too old (I would love to try a fresh one), but I think it held up pretty well, especially if you like funky beers with a fruity tinge.

Absolutely gorgeous deep-red colour; head pinkish, gone in secs. Fruit nose: is it cherry, is it grape, is it anything else? Vinous anyway, bit of tobacco as well. Grape juice with the sugars removed, fruit acids - without the tannines from the kernels - dominate the taste. Great, but somewhere I preferred their former grapes (I�m told they changed) - the preferences of the rich. Bit of cork, earthy as well. Medium bodied, acidburn, fruitesters, dry. Impressive any way to look at it.
Aroma is yeast, lemon rind, bubble gum, wheat and pepper. Taste is brett, pepper, malt, pine, and bitter citrus. Enjoyable.

330mL bottle from Beer Run. Aromas of lemon zest, barnyard, green apple, hints of caramel, slight vomit. Hazy orange with a fairly lasting white head. Dry, funky, orange zest, herbaceous, peppery, faint toffee. Medium bodied.

Bottle in Seattle. Soft head, a touch of yeast haze on a light orange body. Yeast and apples on nose. Sip is a bit flat and muted, peppery apples and a bit of tripel-like ester. Some honey flavored dustiness. I suppose this might be old, no real hops coming through. Any Brett is highly muted.

Pours a golden with a white head. The aroma is of sugars and fruity esters; there is an intense blend of tropical fruit. The taste is fruity and yeast. Later, this finish becomes more dry and bitter with a hint of grapefruit and hops. The taste also becomes more complex; a yeasty flavor takes over as well as hops that balance the sweet tone.
"Flemish Primitive Wild Ale (Surly Bird)". Poured a clearish golden color with white head. Some light funk and hop character. Notes: On tap at Aces & Ales (Nellis), Winter Beer Fest, Jan �17

330 mL bottle. Labeled Reinaert Flemish Wild Ale. Pale yellow. Huge white head. Smells medicinal, fruity, and yeasty. Tastes medicinal, too. Brett and a little bit of sweetness that turns medicinal. Super high carbonation. Takes a while to swirl out the carbonation. Medium body. The medicinal sourness is unpleasant.
Pours with a big head. Cloudy yellow color. Big pretty lemon rind. Long astringent finish.

750ml. Hazy golden color with a big, foamy, sticky white head. Funky, bretty, hoppy aroma with Belgian notes and hay. Dry flavor, not really sour, just funky, with a bitter finish. Medium-bodied, very highly carbonated. Actually really nicely done overall.
From a 33 cl bottle shared at home. Pours a cloudy gold with a thick off white head. Aroma of butterscotch. Flavors of butterscotch with some brett funk. Pretty subdued.
Technically good, but some odd flavors. Not terribly exciting. Good body. Everything else is average.

Kolsch??? Not even close. This tastes like a wheat beer. It is slightly hazy gold, it has some body, it has lemony, peppery, and yeasty tastes. This is a wheat beer, regardless of the grainbill. Kolsch is in a different time zone.

12 oz. can purchased as K�lsch Style Ale poured to a fest chalice at home displaying a clear & bright, golden tone, with a decent layer of soft white/light cream colored froth that remained for awhile, and waves to spots of lacing. The nose was soft grain/biscuit-like malt, with a touch of sweetness, and subtle fruitiness as a combination of pit variety & apple. Light to medium bodied, with lively enough carbonation, the taste was similar, clean & smooth, with slight tanginess that coupled with modest, grainy astringency. An enjoyable representation of one of my favorite session styles.
Was not a fan. Grainy accented with lemon-pepper. The color is a bright yet dense lemon-gold. Simple and balanced beer with a long finish, but too much of a yeast aftertaste for my liking.

3/14/19. 12oz bottle as Alaskan Kolsch on clearance for 99 cents at Family Beer & Liquor. Enjoyed from the bottle. Golden, I imagine. Malty aroma, dough, a spicy bite. Clean flavor, dough, pale maltiness, crisp, a touch of citrus, grass, spice. Not bad.

On tap at Tattooed Dog as Alaskan Kolsch. It poured a golden color with a white head. The aroma was of grains, pale malts and herbal hops. The taste was similar to the aroma with more grains, malts, hops with mild carbonation and a nice smooth aftertaste. Tasty.

355ml can into schooner glass. Thanks to bitterlady. As Alaskan K�lsch. Golden amber beer with a thin white head and high carbonation. Lightly perfumed malt nose. Flat and easy to drink, touches of grain leading to a slightly sour/bitter finish. For better or worse, definitely a K�lsch!
Drank on an Alaskan Airlines: pours light orange with white head. Aroma is mold appleish fruitiness and pale malts. Low bitterness. Somewhat sweet. Thin malty backbone. Good enough.

Well I have recently enjoyed several bottles of this kolsch from an Alaskan Brewing mixed 12-pack that has traveled by car across the continent all the way down to South Carolina, thank you so much Megan! So for starters, this rendition of the lagered ale kolsch hybrid style tends much more towards the lager end of the spectrum, with an overall very clean and smooth lager flavor profile of bready malt and herbal hops, and no yeasty notes to speak of. On the nose, this was all malt, sweet and slightly caramelized, pleasant but not very delicate or aromatic. I should mention also that this poured a perfectly clear burnished gold with lots of carbonation and white foam. The flavor is more sweet malt and grain up front, however with a grassy and herbal hop aftertaste that gives an authentic German accent to this beer. The palate is a solid medium-bodied with a smooth finish that leaves a bit of residual sweetness from the malt. Overall this comes across as a very enjoyable and balanced golden lager, but doesn't appear to be particularly true to the kolsch style, as the maltiness is too sweet and has notes of caramel that are more reminiscent of a Marzen. There's nothing crisp and delicate about this beer either, but that being said, if it were more available down here in SC I would definitely drink this more often as a go-to casual lager.

In terms of no-frills refreshment, Alaskan Summer Ale is tough to beat. As a Kolsch this earns a close-enough verdict. It manages to be grainy and sweet without being cloying. Finish is pleasantly clean. That closer definitely could use some more happy flavor. Still, this is a reasonably crisp beer, and in terms of sheer drinkablity, it's on par with Alaskan Amber. Overall, it's simple and satisfying.
GNBF 2018, Werner Park. Bottle. Golden, white head. Aroma of dough, grass. Taste was light bittersweet, bread, light bitter finish.

In the bottle at the 2004 Crescent Moon Vintage Beer Tasting. This was a bottle of the original Boulder Brown Ale made in the early 1990�s. Dark brown in color. A very solid and tasty beer. Roasted aroma and chocolate flavor. Aged very well for the last 10 years.
Brown, with thick, rocky lasting tan head. Intense small bead. Good malt nose. Smooth malt flavor but slightly gassy
Lt Brown color, med head. Medium malts, lightly hopped. Nice malty flavor, nutty overtones. A little hoppy. Finish is clean. Aftertaste is slightly malty, no bitterness.

Nutty malt aroma. Slight mustiness...I really hope this bottle isn't too old! Fairly even, standard head and carbonation, but my suspicions about this being old have now increased...there are "floaty things" in the beer. I know this is supposed to be totally filtered. Well, here goes... Hmm. Sweet, bready malt flavors with a hint of nut and butter. Finish has a slight amount of hops and an almost imperceptible twinge of sour. Medium body, slightly watery finish. Ummm...I can't tell if this beer is supposed to taste like this or not, so I'm going to assume no. Oh well, maybe I can find a fresh bottle next time. At least I didn't buy a whole 6-pack!
25-08-19 // bottle shared. Thanks! Clear golden an with a white head. Boring macro Pils with a unpleasant hop bitterenss thats not fitting in.

This "pilsener" has quite strange and unconvincing flavor, creating only a distant association with beer. Blind tasting could mislead you and it wouldn't be easy to guess that it's the beer in the glass. Well, it's that bad.
Pours a clear golden with white head. Clean light malt aroma and taste, light cardboard notes. Notes: can from Bosnia, Apr �19
Clear golden beer, small head. Aroma is malt, sweet, taste is the same, sweet, bitter, nice.

Enjoyed: Poured from a can into footed pilsner glass. Appearance: Clear golden colour, with rich head. Aroma: Malt, grains, hay. Palate: Light body, moderate carbonation. Taste: Malt, grain, gently sweet, bread, hint of hops, gently bitter and dry aftertaste. Overall impression: Quite good - it is drinkable and enjoyable, but after a while it leaves usual industrial stale mouthfeel.

From Carrefour Brewed in Holland. Big green 90c can. Vile. Aroma of glue, dried grass, meaty dead yeast and butterscotch. Taste of glue, dead yeast, carpet, tinned veg, raffia and unadulterated poison. Piss. One for the camp drain.

0.5 bottle @ Lviv Consulate Clear, gold color and a large, white head. Aroma of pale malts, some alcohol. Taste is malty, alcoholic. Medium, oily, average. Finish is medium long and somewhat bitter. Overall, substandard.
Hazy amber/gold color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of malt, yeast, some floral hops, & fruit/citrus; Flavor of malt, hops, some cereal, and fruit/citrus; Decent lager overall.

Bottle from Harrods cons 2014-07-15 wee hotel outside Stanstead I asked the guy at Harrods why the didn�t have moore beers in stock then the other 3 variants. But he claimed that there was a risk the beer might get old - and customers wouldn�t purchase "olz beer" AR: bready, roasted malt AP: amber, frothy semi transparent white head F: bready, wee citrus, smooth
Bottle had at Harrods. Pretty average lager. It is very clean so I�ll give it that. Unfortunately was the only beer on the list
Pours a clear and golden beer with a white head. The aroma is malt and DMS. The flavor follows the nose. The palate is sweetness. Overall a beer below average.
Black pour with a small creamy head, aroma is light malt. Taste is coffee and roast malts, quite watery though. Fair mild
On tap. Very smooth, enjoyable mild. Lovely flavour, al the malt but in a longer drink. Nice.
Keg @ Cradock, Leicester. Nice mild. Easy drinking but its a mild isn't it? ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Fine traditional mild, pours dark with an aroma of malt and caramel. Flavour is roasted malt with some chocolate, watery mouthfeel. Minimal aftertaste of dry sweet liquorice.

First tasted this in Coanes, Johnstone in May 1997. Cask, handpump dispense. Black in colour with ruby highlights and a thick creamy buff head. Pleasant roast malt in the long aroma. Thin but creamy mouthfeel and good lacing. Dark malts give a burnt toast note from the black malt and then roast grain flavours with treacle toffee, plain chocolate and creamy coffee. Slight prickle of hop resins in the short aftertaste. Finish is slightly dry with hints of liquorice and molasses in there. An excellent session mild.
Keg. Old Horse, Leicester. Not bad at all. Medium white head, blackish body. Malty. Sweet, some mild bitterness. Smooth and silky, sweet finish.

Cask, The Abberdale, Leicester. Dark mahogany with a cream head. Aromas are light toffee and weetabix with cola and yeast. Flavours are dry, light roast malts with low maltiness. Yeasty with some cream. OK mild.

The Plough, Littlethorpe, Leics. Pale ruby with a nitro creamy beige collar. Very faint roasted aroma buried by the slickness of the head, lace like cream, watery house chew of sultana , Hobnob crumbs. Watery dull mild Vs the Pitch Black I�m afraid.

Keg at the Queen Victoria, Syston, Leicester. Very good Mild, my favourite so far. Creamy and slightly more opaque than my previous experiences with the style. Soft and smooth on the front of the palate, with a small burst of roasted malt to finish. Punctuated throughout with tasty chocolate notes. A very good session beer, so much so that I spent my whole Christmas Eve supping it - high praise indeed!
Dark creamy looking beer, with a smooth but slightly chemically after taste.
Goregous amber color with thick handpump head with large bubble size. Distinctly british hop aroma. Some butteriness in both texture and in flavor. Attractive malt and hop characteristics.

Utter garbage, a huge disappointment. I felt like I was licking an ashtray. Even the food was mediocre, overall I left the Steelhead premises feeling somewhat cheated... dark brown, a little light shining through, nice head, but it doesn't matter, can't get past the ashtray taste...
Black with brown head.Roasted nose. Good heavily roasted malt flavor........

Served on handpump. Attractive deep brown-black, with a slightly medicinal liquoricy bite that fades quickly. Leaving a beautiful flavorful stout with wonderful real ale mouthfeel. I realize that every brewer can't do handpump stouts, but they are infinitely better that those crappy nitro stouts. The mouthfeels of nitro and handpump are actually reasonably similar, I'd say that the handpump ones have larger bubbles, but they leave behind a beer which you can taste all the flavors that are there. The roasty malt, the hops, which I really enjoy. It just bugs me when brewers fo through the effort of making a flavorful stout, and then serve it on nitro tap and effectively rob it of most of its character. Sorry for the rant.
Thames valley yeast all the way. Extremely sweet cloying finish. Hops are all fuggles which go poorly with the sweet finish.
Bottle pours golden with good head. Basement citrus aroma, some wood barrel. Highly sour, no off notes, wood barrel, lemon citrus, mild white wine notes. Delicious, straight forward sour. Very nice.
Fat @ Russian River. Disig gyllenorange �l med ett gulvitt skum. Doft och smak �r citrus- och vin�s syrlighet med inslag av j�st, l�tt funkighet och l�ttare fattoner.

Draft @ Toronado, San Diego. Hazy golden straw, creamy white head. Citrus acidic, white grape, nicely balanced soft funk, light vanilla, white wine, dry oak. Medium body, superb fine lively carbonation like a champagne.
Golden color. Big white head. Fruits, oak and light funky notes in the aroma. Moderately sour with dry finish. Extremely drinkable.
Insanely complex. It�s like talking to someone uber trendy; I�m not sure if their response was a compliment and or an insult. I�m going with a compliment. I think.
Aroma and taste of white wine. Slightly tart, with hints of citrus. Moderately sour woody aftertaste
Fat @ Russian River. Gyllenorange �l med gulvitt skum. Doft och smak av malt, karamell, frukt, j�st, ljust br�d och l�tta honungstoner.
28-09-19 // bottle shared at Mon Petit Cafe Suttgart on Zwanze Day 2019. 2015. banana clove flowery.
golden, hazy, fruity esters, banana, ripe apple, spicy, dry in finish, alcoholic warmth.
On tap at Toranado, SF. I didn't know what style this was (didn't look it up), assumed a sour. It's not, but it's a really nice Belgian strong ale. Yeasty, sweet, pretty classic.

Cant believe I haven't ticked this yet, at least 5-6 bottles over the last 10 years or so. Cloudy golden with a small white head and decent lace. Notes are yeast, banana, rich malt, fruits, citrus, and other classic Belgian stuff. Medium in body with a complex close.

375ml bottle. 12/21/18 bottle date. Appearance: Cloudy light golden with a massive fluffy white head driven by aggressive secondary fermentation. Aroma: Grass, hay, and herbal hop notes. Some bready and cracker malt as well. Low yeast fruity esters. Taste: Bready maltiness is fairly light sweetness, a touch of pear and apple esters, and an herbal, earthy hop bitterness that builds strongly against the light malt base. Mouthfeel: Light to medium bodied. A surprisingly light creaminess given the light color. Really high carbonation. Finish: An interesting mix of light fruity esters against a fairly strong herbal hop bitterness. Nice contrast. Overall: a wonderful light Belgian pale ale, balancing the lightest touch of fruity esters against a fairly aggressive herbal and earthy bitterness. Beautiful head driven by a really high carbonation. Awesome beer.

Cork popped out as soon as I took the cage off (be careful people). Highly carbonated hazy yellow with a huge growing, rocky head. Took 4 separate pours and a lot of waiting to get it in a large Duvel tulip. Moderate esters on the aroma with mellow bubblegum, pear, and mild phenolic spices. The flavor is much like the aroma, with added pineapple notes that start sweet, then finish with a well balanced bitterness and dryness. No real trace of alcohol. Well done.

(375ml bottle shared @ Nische's tasting, thanks Niko!) Pours rather hazy pale gold with a decent sized white head. Notes of rather sweet fruit, with banana, orange, mixed tree fruit all in there, rather floral (fresh and dried), some sweet pale malt with cereal hints, some herbs, touch of clove, yeast has a bready sparkling wine quality and is slightly dusty, finishing quite dry with orange and grass, slight zestiness, a little dry earth in the back end too, light bitterness. Medium-bodied with mouth-filling effervescence. Quite nicely brewed blonde Belgian type thing, rather delicate and perhaps blown out late in a big tasting. Refreshing.

Taste at Trail's End. Pours a clear, golden color, with a big, frothy, white head. The aroma is guava, mild earth, rosemary, leather, roses, and caramel. Sweet and yeasty, with a mellow, dusty bitterness. Light body, with a creamy, dusty mouthfeel. This is a nicely balanced, complex, and delicious beer.

July 27th, 2015 - The marathon plowing through the Russian River approaches an end with the Damnnation. A brighter beer with a brighter scent, it has some lemon juice on the nose and a touch of champagne and orange juice. So, maybe a mimosa on the scent? The flavor reminds me of a bright blonde, with gentle grain notes offering glimmers of orange citrus. It's tasty, but light, and inconveniently placed near the end of the race.

column1: Beer Works Yawkey Way Wheat Bock
Beer Works Yawkey Way Wheat Bock
column5: No real outstanding flavour about this beer but damn is it good. Wheat in the aroma, but not much in the flavour. Malty on the onset with a slightly bitter bite at the end. Fantastic pallate, definately "full bodied". I would definately recomend trying this beer.
Bottle from the brewery. Amber colour with a little if any head. Aroma malty hints of berry and caramel. Taste light sweet. Medium body.

500ml bottle from Chiltern Brewery. Golden amber colour, white foam head leaving some lacing and aroma of metallic hops. Taste is malt, grains, sweetish, bready with fruity notes and tangy bitterness. Medium bodied, soft carbonation, dry metallic bitter finish. Quite drinkable
Golden and poured with a small head. Not a lot of flavour although there is a trace of hops. Compared with some of their other beers this is a bit lack lustre. In fact its very disappointing.

13Oct2018 Sweet grain and cereal malts, caramel, molasses, honey. Clear gold, medium, creamy, white head. Light sweet. More sweet grain and cereal malts, caramel, honey, bread, soft carbonation, medium bodied. Very nice for the style. Bottle from Clivenden NT - thanks to Rog! Earlier Rating: 9/6/2018 Total Score: 3.1 6Sep2018 Grain and cereal malts, floral notes, wet straw, caramel. Clear gold, medium, creamy, white head. Light bitter. More bitter wet straw, grass, floral notes, orange peel, soft carbonation, malty, sweet finish. Boring, but inoffensive. Bottle from The Craft Beer Shop, Little Chalfont.

500ml bottle. Poured a crystal clear copper colour with a short-lived frothy white head. The aroma is caramel malt, woody hop. The flavour is moderate sweet light bitter with a smooth rich sweet toffee malt, light hop bitter palate. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.
Bottle from BEER:shop, St. Albans. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are caramel, malt, fruits, flowers, hops and has a light hoppy finish.
Bottle from BEER:shop, St. Albans. Clear amber with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and light fruity. Flavor is medium sweet and light bitter. Sweet and light bitter finish. 170218
Bottle. Backlog rating from bottle collection and historic scoring. Source not recorded. No tasting notes kept, just rating.

Bottle at home, 29/01/17. Clear golden amber with a decent off white head. Nose is bready malts, vanilla, pear drop, fruit esters. Taste comprises light bread, vanilla, straw, fruit loaf, light spice. Medium bodied, soft carbonation, semi drying close. Adequate ESB.

Bottle from Hughenden Manor. Pours a clear copper, with a thin white head. Aroma of Fuggle hop, floral and some vanilla notes. Soft fruit flavour, some grass and bready malt. Finish was nicely balanced toffee, grain and light resin.

on tap @ ribs & beer Milano. Ramata, limpida, schiuma beige fine non molto peristente, quasi effimera. aroma intenso, toffee, burro, liquore, caramello, erbaceo, leggermente tostato. gusto dolce abboccato, quasi amabile. liquorosa. calda, poco carbonata, corposa, quasi appiccicosa, rotonda. abbastanza equilibrata, piuttosto armonica.
On tap at Malta Festival outside European Parliament (Brussels). Dark amber with a creamy head. Taste is quite sweet of hops, fruits and some caramel too. Nice and bitter finish. Enjoyable.

Draught: Poured a dark brown with a thin off white head. Aroma is sweet with malts, yet has a suttle soft hops presents. Taste is similar with a sweet thick chewy malt upfront and a bitter hop leaf finish.
An impressive beer, full-bodied, huge, long bitterness......................

Sampled draught at The Scotsman, St. Julians, Malta. Dark copper, no head. Medium sweet and near full bodied with rather thick mouthfeel. A big resiny hopppiness is lingering on until the bitter grapefruity finish. It is chewy and robust but perhaps not overly complex. Sadly this beer is no longer bottled and only available draught at a handful of places in Malta. Old rating for the now discontinued bottled version: Nut brown. Flowery hop aroma. Full bodied, fruity, very malty with some crystal malt flavours. Bitter finish. Not exactly what you expect to come out of a sunny tiny island nation, but surely a very pleasant surprise.
Bottle of 25cl, in a Pint glass; from the fridge. A nice, malty and refreshing pils. Light golden in colour, with malty aroma and taste. Maybe a little bit too sweet.
330ml Dose. Klar und golden mit kleiner Schaumkrone. Getreidig. Leichter K�rper. Milder-s��licher Geschmack.
W sumie zwyk�y lager, ale porz�dny. Aromat s�odowy, leciutki chmiel. Pijalne, �rednia goryczka, nie�le si� to pije.
My wife and I stopped by, at the source. This is a very relaxing, full-bodied beer that has both flavor and a kick. It's got the doppelbock sweetness, but does it with a lot of flavor and complexity.

This is an excellent beer. It has a great appearance, very dark and interesting. It also tastes great, which is a good combination. I like a tasty beer and this one does the trick. Come down to Nashua and try one.
Pours dark amber with medium head. Aroma is dried fruit and caramel. Taste is caramel and plum, working to a richer malt backbone. Finish is very smooth. Excellent doppelbock.

Keg pour into taster cup at NH Brewfest. Appearance is dark brown with no sparkle, small ring of off-white head. Aroma is strong, sweet caramel, candied sugar. Taste is brown sugar, dark fruits, and almost like it was aged in oak--nice. Palate is light-to-medium bodied with soft-to-average carbonation and sweet finish. Overall, very enjoyable with most interesting feature being the taste.
Draught. This is a nice simple dopple B with a nice malt character and good hopping.

Draft on 10 March, 2013. Served in Martha�s unique glass ware. Dark brown color with lots of ruby highlights. Aromas are ripe dark fruit, bread, and caramel. Soft carbonation with a sweet mouthfeel. Taste of malt, dark fruits, light roasted grains and a hint of toffee afterwards. This batch weighed in at 8.8 % ABV. And honestly only a very little hints of it on the backend. Very nice and worth a try.

on tap-pours no head and hazy amber color. Aroma is mild sweet malt then some dark fruit-towards vinuous, dusty/grainy. Taste is sweet medium malt-slight chocolate, some dark fruit-towards vinuous, dusty/grainy, alcohol. Minimum carbonation.

On tap at Martha�s, served in a tulip style glass. Pours a nice clear brown color with a tiny off white head. Aroma is sweet malt and caramel. Smooth, silky palate with a substantial body. Flavor is all malt with caramel and toffee in the background. Finishes with a warm, glowing alcohol burn. Very nice.

i had no idea what to expect from this, comming from an almost unknown brewery. I bought a growler and reallly enjoyed it. redish amber hue, malty nose. very malty mouthfeel, not watery at all. Pretty intense bock. I like it a lot, congrats to marthas
Pours a beautiful, deep red. sweet, malty aroma, alcohol very present, but not so much that it�s overdone. Very nice and well done. reminded me a bit of the sam adams double bock.

Canned. Worse stout I have ever had. But this is the best product I've had from what appears to be Britain's worse brewery. Cheap and nasty seems to be the brewing theory here. Calling this a mild might prevent people from becoming too shocked at the thin texture and low flavour profile, but that would be doing mild a disservice.

Can bought in Hong Kong at a Park N' Shop. How a beer like this ends up in Hong Kong is beyond me. Solid black but basically no head after the pour. Minimal aroma. Weak and watery flavor with some roasted malt. Maybe I found it because it is an Asian lager equivalent of a stout.

This stuff tasted bad. What else can be said. Now, I don't know whether it was because I had two nice beers before tasting it, and the other alcohol may have screwed up my taste buds, but I rather doubt it, especially since I also had a nice one afterward. The strangest thing was how it tasted more like a 10% Faxe or Crest and not like a 4.2% stout! I just tasted alcohol and little else. And, unless the ratings for it suddenly move upward, I have no interest in trying another to confirm my thoughts on it.
Awful stuff. Ultra-sweet, thin, bland. Not sure you could even call this a stout.

RE-RATE: I must have had a pint from a bad batch the first time, I've come back and had this several times since and enjoyed it. Perfect with their pub grub. Original rating 3/28/02: 2.4. Pretty weak, I only called it a stout because they didn't have anything specifically called a stout and it's like, a law that all micros must have a stout in their rotation. The roasted barley in the flavor was surprisingly nice, even though I don't have much else good to say about this beer. Not such a great smell, bad aftertaste, and it looked pretty poor for a stout.
Wow this bock falls flat. I cant believe that this brew is so sweet and lacking the promised hoppy goodness.
This beer was tried in right place and right time. It was just great time to celebrate. Do not remember the notes of aroma but i do not care this time.
bottle. amber with small head. medium malt base with light hops. a bit on the thin side.

Draught@RNH. Clear amber color, small off-white head. Barley, fruit sugary aroma. Light bodied. Really watery for this ABV. Light sweetish flavor, honey, green apple, short harsh finish. Quite far from the normal bock.

Location: 12 oz bottle from Giannone, 11/10/13 Aroma: The aroma is fairly sweet, caramel, brown sugar, some molasses, and earth Appearance: It pours a dark reddish color with a long last beige head and lots of lace Flavor: The flavor is medium-heavy sweet, quite malty, a little roasty, and a very mild hop Palate: The body is light-medium, feels a touch watery and a little cloying, with a short finish Overall Impression: It�s a little thin and a little too sweet overall. Not terrible, just not a well-rounded offering. Lacks balance.
One of the better breckenridge beers. Decent balance. More watery than I would prefer.

Pandora�s bock is a rich coppery brown beer that is just a touch hazy. it pours with a thin head of small bubbles. Nose is a touch sharp smelling with a bit of caramel and roasted malt. Body is thin and watery. Taste is dry and nutty that becomes more relevant as it finishes. no bitters. finishes clean. a decent bock.
Murky brown with a thin disappearing head. Very little visual carbonation. Aroma of toffee and caramel. Big malty taste that is slightly on the sweet side. Finishes sweet and malty.
12 ounce bottle purchased at Total Wine Pembroke Pines, FL for $3.99/6-pack Very good!

Cloudy amber pour with a thin off-white head that vanishes quickly. Aroma of roasted malt, banana, and caramel. Some grain, roasted malt flavor with a big shift to raisin, banana, and caramel. Quite sweet.
This one still survives in Swaziland. Clear gold with a small white head. Still yelllow and fizzy.
Hellgelbes Bier mit geringem Schaum. Geruch leicht malzig, muffig, Geschmack w�ssrig malzig mit minimaler Herbe, metallisch.

Aroma: Cooked corn, light spice Appearance: clear yellow body. Small white head. Lacing Flavour: grain, light sweetness, light bitterness, crisp, dry, Palate: Light body, medium-high carbonation. Overall: Drinkable, refreshing. Nothing special though.... 330 ml can, poured. Thanks Amanda! 1C. Premium American Lager
Can @ Swaziland. Extremely pale light yellow pour, no head. Aroma of soapy grains. Flavor is watery and soapy. Very unpleasant lager.
This is the best tasting beer SAB�s ever made. Unfortunately, very bad marketing and very good marketing by it�s competitors brought an end to this magnificent golden nectar.

One of several African beers brought back by the generous pfoxyjohn. When I opened this beer and poured it�s crystal clear golden body into a glass, the smell reminded me of every country i�ve ever been to that has had that similar tasting pale lager which is advertised all over the whole country. When you�re there, it�s not about the beer. It�s about the experience and the beer just happens to be a small part of it. Corn, hops and grain on the palate. Slightly watery finish. I wasn�t anticipating a world class beer, but i was looking forward to another country�s proud offering. Thanks John!"

Smells of alcohol, corn starch, some grain, and a bit of unwashed male buttocks &#40I should know after travelling through Africa for a month!&#41. It has a very faint yellow colour and not much head at all. Flavour is some slightly sorry grain notes, breadiness, and a little hint of alcohol. This is a weak excuse for a beer and definitely nothing special.
Bubblegum aroma. Bland & stale flavour......................................
Another sweetish golden coloured lager from SAB. Indistuingishable from the flood of similar cheaply made lagers from around the world.

column4: Sabeco - Saigon Beer Alcohol Beverage Corp. (ThaiBev)
column5: Color amarillo p�lido, transparente. Espuma blanca de dos dedos de espesor y buena retenci�n. Aroma escaso a cereal y heno. Sabor igual, final escasamente amargo y dulce. Textura acuosa. Carbonataci�n media. Sin fallos evidentes y muy refrescante. Decente.

column4: Sabeco - Saigon Beer Alcohol Beverage Corp. (ThaiBev)
column5: 0,5 l. Bottle. Golden color with white. Malt and herbal aroma. Rise, herbal and watery taste.

column4: Sabeco - Saigon Beer Alcohol Beverage Corp. (ThaiBev)
column5: Flaska. Klar ljust gyllengul �l med ett snabbt f�rsvinnande vitt skum. Smak och doft av s�t malt, majs, h� och l�tta citrustoner.

At the source. Amber color (yes Caesar, "Helmut Bernstein, de bonkige spits von W�rzberg") with an off-white head. Smell and taste malts, nice and smooth rauch, a bit sweet, malty base underneath. Full body, suitable carbonation. Good, very pleasant. 7-5-8-4-15.
08-07-19 // tap at Brauerei Spezial Clear amber brown. Caramel nutty with a smoky touch. Smooth. A bit lo low carbonated for me. Sweetish. Great.
Sehr sch�nes und kr�ftiges Rauchbier, dabei nicht so aufdringlich und s�ffiger wie das Schlenkerla M�rzen.
Bottle at the brewpub - Hazy light amber. Peach, banana, spicy and faint smoky notes in the aroma. The taste is even less smoky with notes of banana, caramel, sultanas and orange peel detected.

Das Bamberger Rauchbier ist weltber�hmt. Das von Schlenkerla ist am bekanntesten, weil am leichtesten verf�gbar. Aber da gibt es ja noch die kleine, feine Brauerei Spezial� Geht farblich gerade noch als dunkles Weizen durch. Feine Rauchnote � im Geruch und geschmacklich (deutlich dezenter als beim Schlenkerla Rauchweizen). Malzige, getreidige, s�uerliche und fruchtige Noten (in dieser Reihenfolge) sind ebenfalls vorhanden und f�gen sich harmonisch ins Gesamtbild. Einen echten Kritikpunkt gibt es: Viel zu viel Kohlens�ure. Das passt gut zu hellen, fruchtigen Bieren. Bei einem dunklen, malzigen und (in besonderen Ma�en) rauchigen Bier ist dies aber meistens recht unpassend. Hier darf es gern weicher sein.

At the source. Misty orange color, off-white head. Aroma is a bit smoky mixed with orange peel notes somehow, at least that's what it reminds me of. Flavor is wheat, slightly a tart hint and a tad sweetish yeasty banana. Medium to full body, but annoying high fizzy carbonation. Meh. 5-4-6-2-9.
Bottle @ Albert Inn, Manchester. Copper-amber with a small head and a light toffee sweet nose. Has a slight sweetness in its taste but is less stated in these flavours..
Bronze with a small head. Some bitterness and slightly malty.Pleasant but uninspiring with nothing to make it stand out.
Manchester Finest: Clear amber colour, off-white head. Nose is caramel malts, a little fruity. Flavour is caramel malts, fruits, bit of toffee. A bit watery.
Amber colour with a thin head, malt aroma and taste, not the best thing to come out of Manchester, the M62 is (only joking).
Bottle. Drinkable, refreshing. No massive aroma, slight fruits. Taste is a little bitter, but would be a good session ale.

Bottled, pasteurised, 500ml from Booths, Longton, Lancs. Gold, carbonated with white head. Quite a bright, lightish bitter, some reasonable hop character, bittersweet and a little dried fruit. Pretty reasonable for a pasteurised bottle.
rich fruity and malty aroma, bronze hue with a large frothy head, smooth fruitcake like malt flavour with a slightly dry hoppy finish, very tasty.

Chestnut coloured with a reasonable head, aromas of malt balanced with fuggles hops. Tastes slightly salty and dry but with enough fruity malt to redeem itself before finishing softly with a little burst of hop

Bottle 500ml. [ Vintage BBF 0905 ]. Clear medium amber colour with a small, fizzy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, caramel, oxidide, honey, light nutty. Flavour is moderate to light light heavy sweet and light moderate bitter with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20110615]
Bottled. Goldeny ambery colour, small foamy head. Aroma is honey, sweet malts, some fruity notes. Flavour is raisins, honey, sweet malts, some mild dryish wooden notes as well. Semidry palate.

500ml bottle from Shropshire. Vintage 1997. Very sweet. Sugary rather than malty. few hops. Some light caramel. Sugar water. Quite light for a 5.2% ale. Drinkable, but too sweet and lacking interest or character.

Dark golden with a nice and lasting head. The aroma has a nice hoppy note with hints of caramel. The flavour is however a bit thin with notes of caramel, hops and an Ok bitterness i the finish. Daniels Hammer doesn�t hit me hard...
Sweet sugary taste mixes well with the malt for me. Nice bitterness comes through too. One of the finest bottled beers iI�ve tried for a while. Nice looker when poured too.
Bottle, a dark ambe with a white bubbly head. Grainy malt aroma with a definite critus tang and I also get that touch of pepper. Juicy malt in the mouth, with a gentle hopping. A good premium bitter.
A ruby coloured ale, with a malty with hint of lemon nose, fruity sweet malt finnish.

Pours a nice bronze with a dense medium white head, good lacing. Aroma fruity, slightly peppery. Solid mouthfeel, creamy with gentle malt flavour, tangy hops, good complex flavour and well balanced, finish quite short but overall a decent premium bitter.
500ml bottle from Booths. Copper colour with thin off white head. Some hop, but more mineral really. Some caramel malt, bit of candy sugar. Over carbonated in mouth. Some hop on end.
Bottle. Amber colour with small withe head. Aroma and flavour of roasted malt and caramel.

column2: Neumarkt in der Oberpfalz, Bavaria, Germany
column5: Die Neumarkter Lammsbr�u-Brauerei braute schon "bio", als es noch gar nicht cool war und �berzeugte duch wohlschmeckendes Bier bis heute. Die Beschriftung "w�rzig" auf dem Etikett verspricht nicht zu viel. Es ist ein sch�n ausgewogenes Bier mit einem vollen K�rper nach Malz und auch etwas Kr�utern. Hat mir recht gut gefallen.

column2: Neumarkt in der Oberpfalz, Bavaria, Germany
column5: Not sure whether I got a bottle which was off, but this is not a beer. It's a watery sugary drink, which doesn't resemble any beer taste. I really thought I opened a radler by mistake. Will give it another chance as I don't think anyone intended it to be so bad. But still giving it half a star as this batch shouldn't have passed the quality control.

column2: Neumarkt in der Oberpfalz, Bavaria, Germany
column5: 500 ml bottle. Clear dark golden, foamy head. Hay, straw, pale malts, grain. Malty sweetness, minimum dryness. Light bodied, watery texture, lively carbonated, light dry sweet finish. Decent, but needs more hops!

column2: Neumarkt in der Oberpfalz, Bavaria, Germany
column5: Nice clean and crisp beer. Not much flavour, but it hides nothing, everything is out in the open for this light beer, and there�s nothing off at all. Dresden supermarket bottle

column2: Neumarkt in der Oberpfalz, Bavaria, Germany
column5: Amber beer. Head disappears fast. Malty grainy beer with hints of grass and a strong cardboard taste. Not my beer.

column2: Neumarkt in der Oberpfalz, Bavaria, Germany
column5: L: -pours a clear amber with a small to medium,foamy,offwhite head -medium carbonation visible S: -cooked vegetables,grainy,caramel,leather,earthy,malty,faint fruits T: -caramel,malty,very spicy,slight roast,Forest honey F: -medium carbonation -light to medium body O: With it's rustic Aroma and amber colour this is more in line with a Franconian Dunkel (and a bit of Vienna Lager) and pretty far from a traditional Helles. I still liked it though.Solid, organic everyday Lager

column2: Neumarkt in der Oberpfalz, Bavaria, Germany
column5: Flasche 0,5l: Kr�ftiges Gold, glasklar, kr�ftiger stabiler mittelporiger Schaum; frische + leicht w�rzige Nase, dezente fruchtige S��e, Malz, Getreide, etwas Karamell, dezente Hopfennoten, Brotteig, leichte Hefearomen, Sauerteig, leichte fruchtig-malzige Bitterkeit; frischer K�rper, leichte fruchtige S��e, Malz, Getreide, etwas Karamell, cremig, deutliche Kohlens�ure, dezente Hopfenaromen, Brotteig, etwas d�nn; angenehmer fruchtig-malziger Nachgang

column2: Neumarkt in der Oberpfalz, Bavaria, Germany
column5: Nutty and bready aroma. Medium sweet, buttery taste with almost no bitterness. Decent.

column2: Neumarkt in der Oberpfalz, Bavaria, Germany
column5: Clear deep golden color with off-white head. Aroma has vegetal notes like the ones you find in non alcoholic beers, bread crust and some plum preserve. Taste is mostly bready, slightly astringent, grainy, slightly hoppy with light bitterness on the finish. Medium to light body with medium carbonation. Not bad but the aroma is quite weird.

column2: Neumarkt in der Oberpfalz, Bavaria, Germany
column5: Fles 50cl thuis. Maltzoeten, wat kruidig, ergens hoptonen. (4-2017).------.
Dank orange/amber with minimal head and light carbonation. Aroma of fruit compote, caramel and alcoholised straw. Tastes of resin, sugar, pine and tropical fruit. Light bitter finish. Boozy. Good!
Bottle from the brewery. Deep chestnut brown colour with a white head. Aroma has caramel and citrus hints. Taste moderately sweet full boozy body.
Lovely bronze appearance.Clear with a small head. Sweet and full bodied with a trace of citrus. Powerful and smooth yet so easy to drink. An excellent beer which goes down well on a winters night.

21Oct2018 Sweet grain and cereal malts, caramel, molasses, straw, hay, bread. Hazy gold, small, creamy, white head. Medium sweet. More caramel, sweet grain malts, molasses, bread, cake dough, soft carbonation, full bodied. Decent palate, bit weak in aroma. Bottle from The King's Head, Aylesbury.

28/9/2018. Bottle from BEER:shop, St.Albans. Pours dark golden with a big foamy white head. Aroma of hops, malt, toffee, fruit and nutmeg. Towards heavy sweetness, light bitterness, and a very slight underlying sourness. Medium to full bodied, oily texture, average carbonation.

Fluffy off white head stayed on a still, tea coloured body.. Deep malty aroma with tea, jam & spice. Medium to full bodied, super smooth with a cloying aft. Sweet tastes of honey, over stewed fruit, grape & sherry. Good one
Bottle from BEER:shop, St. Albans. Nice head with good duration. Color is amber. Aroma and taste are sweet fruits, warming alcohol, caramel, malt and hops. Sweet finish.
Bottle from BEER:shop, St. Albans. Clear amber with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and dark fruit. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Sweet and moderate bitter finish. 160218

Bottle. Chestnut/deep amber in colour. Rich Malty; nutty, toasted malts, caramel. Fruity; over-ripe fruits. Balanced by leafy hops, but not at all bitter. Alcohol warming and very evident. Sweet malty and fruity throughout. (2008)

330ml bottle (StABF2016, St. Albans) Yucky malty aroma, gluey. Yucky taste, yeast, rough. So much burnt plastic. Horrible, (Smells of sweet gluey nastiness, looks pale with an acceptable head, tastes of bread yeast and glue and things that ought to make a person go blind... Not good. -anna)
330ml bottle in 2015. Super dark ruby with a beige head. Aroma of dark malt, prunes, cocoa and oak. Smooth body with sweeter malty notes, fruitcake and plums.
Dark brown poor with a medium head. Roasted malt, nuttyness and a touch of coffee. �Creamy� experience breaks into light malts then bitters. Its nice, quite a light stout given the 6%.

Bottle at home, as LL 'cream' Porter, 10/08/19. Extremely dark mahogany brown with a decent beige head. Nose is dark fruits, dark malts, toffee, hint of cocoa, brown sugar. Taste comprises light roast, toffee, fruit slice, hint of coffee, brown sugars. Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close. Ok porter.

(Gravity cask at White Horse, Parson�s Green, London, 24 Nov 2018) Dark ruby colour with frothy, beige head. Malty, roasted nose with caramel, chocolate and spices (nutmeg, cinnamon). Malty taste with notes of caramel, black rye bread, coffee, a touch of smoke and a dry finish with a mild roasty bitterness. Medium body, quite dry. Tasty and well balanced porter. Quite nice.

Second last county is down;) many thx Grumbo 2019-03-09 G�teborg AR: first julmust, roasted malt bakers chocolate, coffee AP: dark brown, very high and over carbonated steady brown fluff F: roasted malt, coffee, bakers chocolate, sweet and bone dry, salty liqurice
Bottle from the brewery. Pretty much black colour with a deep off white head. Aroma is malty hionts of fruit. Taste is malty bitter, full creamy body
Dark Brown and lively upon opening.Poured with a big head. Nice nutty flavour with a medium body. Creamy and slightly malty. All round a pleasant beer.

21Oct2018 Dark, bitter grain and cereal malts, toasted malts, burnt toast, cacao. Hazy, very dark brown, massive, frothy, beige head. Light bitter. Bittersweet dark chocolate, cacao, dark fruits, figs, raisins, Christmas pudding, burnt toast, medium carbonation, medium bodied. Not a great beer, feels overcarbonated and maybe flawed in its production process. Bottle from The King's Head, Aylesbury.
Bottle from BEER:shop, St. Albans. Nice creamy head. Color is dark brown. Aroma and taste are toasted malt, caramel, fruits, chocolate, licorice and hops. Sweet licorice finish.
Bottle from BEER:shop, St. Albans. Clear brown with a beige head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and dark malt. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 160218
Klassisches Helles, leicht s��liche Malznoten mit einer sanften Hopfennotebittere. Recht schlank, mittlere Karbonisierung. Aus der Flasche getrunken daher keine Angaben zu Aussehen und Schaum.

From tap at Bierschiff Thun. Very pale, clear golden color with a white head. The aroma is lightly to medium malty - sweet grains, some honey, hints of raisins, butter. Medium body with a light sweetness and a very light bitterness. The flavor is similar to the smell - sweet cereals, some sweet buttery notes - with a light earthy hop presence. Aroma: 6 Appearance: 2 Taste: 5 Palate: 3 Overall: 10

0.5l bottle from coop in bern. pours a clear pale golden with a medium head. aroma of hay, sweetish grains, a hint of butter and honey. flavour of jam, sweet malts, vegetables. slightly bitter finish. medium body. upd, 01/18: now I got some sour grapes and overall some unpleasant sourness. hopefully it is just one bottle which is off.
Kurze Review von Untappd: Momou, gw�ss fei e chly s�ffig u besser als di meischte Lager woni afe ha gha.
Clear golden liquid with white head. Aroma: rasberry jam with honey. Taste: medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour. Palate: light body, thin feel, sticky, average carbonation, bitter finish,
Bottle. Pours golden with small white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, honey, hay, clover flower, yeasty. Taste is sweet, slightly hoppy, malty, hay, slight honey. Thin + body.

(bottle) hazy golden colour with a frothy white head. aroma of buttered pale malts and walnuts, slightly perfumed, with a touch of grass and chalk. flavour is mostly the same, more buttered pale malts and straw, with a light touch of hay and some alcohol in the finish. medium-bodied with average carbonation.

500 ml. bottle sampled @ Barley Legal Tasting Room. Thanks to Kraddel! Clear light lager golden, little white head. Nose is heavily metallic with light sorbet & white sugar. Taste is light yeast, sorbet, white sugar, mildly sweet, faint grain & finish heavy on iron unfortunately. Lightly yeasty & strongly metallic body. Not bad but way too much iron for me.

Bottle at barely legal tasting room . thnx to the brewer ! Pours clear blonde . Small to no head Smell is german yeast . High carbo Taste is bit bitter . grainy , malty , bit sweet . Very damn well made yet again .
Clear golden color, good white head. Papery malty aroma. Light bodied. Mallts, oily palate, light citrus. Easy going, not very interesting.
bronze colour, big creamy head, nice lace, grass and toffee aroma, touch of undefined spices, sweet, medium-bodied, dry finish with a hint of peanuts
red-amber colour, big creamy head, no lace, aroma of wood, caramel and blood, notes of plum, sweet, dry and bitter, a little bit metallic - strange
Bottled, 500ml from Morrisons in Banbury, Oxon. Pale gold with white head. There is a boiled vegetable note to this, sharp cereal notes, thinnish palate. Wasn�t over keen on this.

Bottle. Golden in colour. Malty; sweet malts, caramel, vanilla. Fruity; light sweet citrus lemon. Hoppy; floral and grassy hops. Sweet malty fruity and quite dry throughout with light hops. Easy drinking but pretty uninspiring. (2010-09)

Brown bottle (which might make a huge difference). Clear pale yellow color with white head. Aroma is sweet stuff, grains, fruits. Taste is the same. Oily mouthfeel with low carbonation. Meh, but not offensive.

Bottle courtesy of Moritz, cheers Moritz!, at home Attenkirchen, Saturday 21st September 2019. Pours gold with a white head, soft carbonation, rather pedestrian, light cereal, but it's having a go at being ok.
Aroma is harsh peas some straw and some lager stuff. Taste is sour fresh citric and slme bitter straw. Pretty drinkable but bland of course.

Bottle, thanks Moritz! Very light gold, thin head. The bottle is not green (thankfully). Flavor is very thin, tinge of malt sweetness and a hop has possibly been waved over the wort during the boil. Benin has done it much better than a lot of such lagers from the USA.
Bottle. Super pale, low head. Hay, sour grain, light off aromas. Medium body, sweet sugary, light grain, ok grass, unclean finish.

630ml bottle from Afrika Market. Pours pours clear golden colour, white head. Aroma is sweet, toffee, molasses, grainy. Taste is sweet, grainy, bit corny. Light body, average carbonation. Not the worst one for macro, especially ugly design, +0,1 for this.
630ml bottle. Pours golden yellow colour. Whit froth. Malty, bit sirupy, grainy aroma. Grainy, sweet, sirupy taste. Sweet, sirupy aftertaste. Loght bodied, sweet beer. Bad.
Bottle (thanks juks). Pours golden with whiteish head. Aroma is sweet, grainy, malt, cardboard. Overall: nah.

column2: New York, New York, United States
column5: On tap - Typhoon bar - Dull golden colour with a noticeable vegetable (cabbage?) aroma. The taste isn't as bad as the smell, but is still not a particularly good experience and is a bit tart. This beer was served far too cold for me, and put me off trying any of their other beers.

column2: New York, New York, United States
column5: Clear yellow color, little head. Aroma of grape and insecticides. Flavor brings in some dirty notes. Later it hits more and more like a dull American lager, but it at least has aspired to greater things and thus has achieved a slight measure more.

column2: New York, New York, United States
column5: Looks and tasted like the style. Nothing special at all about this beer. This brewpub is going for the NYC Bud drinkers with this one.

column2: New York, New York, United States
column5: Unremarkable. Yucky yeast and a little flat................................

column2: New York, New York, United States
column5: A bit crisp and perhaps citric. Hops are noticeable but not prominent. The bartendender told me this is their biggest seller!? Why? Perhaps because it''s the closest thing they have to Bud.

column2: New York, New York, United States
column5: Clear light gold. Thin white head. Hoppy aroma. Clean and fresh with very tasty citric and herbal hops. A session brew to the gilt.

column2: New York, New York, United States
column5: Although the beer menu lists this merely as "wheat", I'm told by the manager that it's the Winter Wheat. Not sure I believe them since my rating will differ significantly from the others. This beer is extremely wheaty with a strong Belgian angle. You can taste what appears to be Belgian yeast along with a German hefe flavor. Odd, but I'd drink another. It was also warm when I got it. Could the beer be infected?

column2: New York, New York, United States
column5: An unusual wheat. Marzen colored and clear. Good body and nicely hopped. Doesn''t look much like wheat. Nutty.

column2: New York, New York, United States
column5: Slightly hazy light orange. Lightly frothy white head. Moderate carbonation. Wheaty aroma, some citrus, sans lemon slice. Clean and refreshing wheat flavor and clean body. Tasty wheat malts, some light citrus elements. Very respectable American wheat, which I tend to loathe.

column2: New York, New York, United States
column5: Ahhh, a terrific red ale. Fairly sweet and red like the setting Autumn sun. Extremely mind and lightly carbonated. Terrific. This is their best brew, IMHO!

column2: New York, New York, United States
column5: Deep reddish/dark amber with a fat creamy off white head. Malty aroma laced with earthy hops. Too winey, not much hop balance. Very strange fruity flavor, after a promising start. Sampled after the excellent Thai food was devoured (not too spicy though) which may have skewed the flavor profile. Still, a weird mix of flavors.

Ruby-mahogany with thin head. Sweet aroma of caramel and toffee with hints of vanilla. Taste a little sweet with similar tasting notes to the aroma. Mild hop. Slick mouthfeel. Tastes more like a Belgian triple. Nice.
Bottle. Pours a dark brown color with small beige head. Aroma of caramel malt. Quite sweet with just a touch of hops to balance. Enjoyable.

Pours cherry-red, dark brown with dense mocha head. Aroma: caramel, whole-wheat bread, some hop, sourish, red currant, spicy. Tastes quite syrupy and creamy but not too sweet: dark roasted caramel, dried plums, fruity hops as well, some vanilla. Soft carbonation, excellent MF. Well made, excellently balanced array of tastes.
Pours a reddish brown color with light brown head. Smells sweet like maple syrup and brown sugar. Pretty smooth and creamy. Bit fizzy at the end. Tasty tasty
12oz bottle. Pours deep brown. Biscuit, raisins, booze, strong caramel, sweet toffee, little plum and prune stuff. Good silky body. Good.
carico quasi limpida buona schiuma buona nota maltata frutta matura uvetta frutta secca caramello discreto etilico amaro contenuto un po di cioccolato

Pours reddish brown with a thick brown head. Aroma is of weak malt and sweetener. Taste is earthy, has some grass and floral notes to it. Palate is much of the same, contains woody notes that are fairly heavy for the style. Ok beer.

Can. Clear amber red beer with a small white head. Aroma is malty with notes of bread, herbs, grass, honey and syrup. Flavor is malty with notes of caramel, bread, herbs, hay and toffee. Well balanced.
Found out of bottle from Ingles in Franklin, NC. Clear dark copper with no foam. Nice malt aroma and a good malt bite. Pretty enjoyable Fall option.

1/12/2018. Bottle from New Beer Distributors and shared at the 1st Kesgrave 50/50 bottle share. Pours clear bronze with a small off-white head. Aroma of golden syrup, hops, malt, toffee abd berries. Medium plus sweetness, moderate bitterness and a hint of sour. Medium to full body, sticky texture, soft carbonation. Sweet caramel and alcohol finish. Good.
Brown-red. Light bodied. Oily with coffee aroma, amd all kinds of other strange flavours. A strange brew...

Another funny little mild from the Channel Islands, like the Mary Ann Brown from Jersey. The aroma, slighlty metallic, shows some dark fruits. The character is very rustic - yeasty, with plums and raisins, and a sourish, vinuous finish. This would have its ass handed to it at any brewing competition, but in the manner of Bavaria Svetloe from St. Petersburg, it's the flaws that make it an interesting beer to drink.

Guess the only guy, hailing right from Kalyani, where it all started, right from the time of my golden youth, the beer that we drink whilst alone, with a cigarette. Its Golden, frothy, sweet, amazing aftertaste, 6.6% OH, 90 bucks and a great feeling.!

Golden lager with absolutely no flavor. Roughly foaming with good taste of malt and hops. Lovely German-style lager. Absolutely type really. No distractions and it stays in length a little too monotonous.

From notes. First reviewed 1/29/2009. Poured from a bottle into a pint glass. Appearance: Pours a golden straw yellow, with a small head that fades quickly. A fair amount of carbonation is visible. A rather odd smell. Soapy, metallic, a little bit sweet (adjunct sweetness, but still sweet), and ethynol. Pretty bad. Wow, this has to be one of the worst five beers I have ever had. There is some light corn sweetness in at the beginning, but the other flavors that come in are almost poison: aluminum, soap, and ethyl alcohol. It almost tastes like this beer was made, but then after brewing they put in all of these additives. Awful. It�s light and fizzy, which normally would be a slightly higher ranking, but the additives just bring it down another level. I could not finish this. I had the 650 ml bottle, and I needed to get rid of the last third. My head literally started to throb before I finished half of the bottle.

Bottled. A golden beer with an off-white head. The aroma is sweet malty combined with a skunky note - that could stem from the clear bottle and light. The flavor is sweet and skunky - the sweetness seemingly artificial, leading to a dry metallic finish.
C;ear golden with tiny white head. Sweet malty aroma with caramel notes. Sweet flavour with cardboard and malty notes. Loads of cardboard in the finish.
