Hand pulled at the Wellington, Birmingham. Yellow. Dishwater flavoured. Ragged paper dryness and rather slight hop near the end. Probably taste this is a what bitter like should.

Cask at Wellington Arms, Bedford. Amber with a small white head. Wet dog and toasted malt aroma. Sweet honeyed taste with a faint burnt edge: treacle tart left a tad too long in the oven. Some bitterness. Attractive and a bit unusual.
Cask@The Red Lion, Isleworth, WLondon. Deepish brown in colour. Quite a sweet, fruity flavour. Some caramel notes, with a slight nuttyness. Some apple and also berry fruit notes.
Cask Handpump at the Pot Of Beer, Manchester 17/01/2004 Golden coloured fruity and hoppy. Smooth on the palate with a slightly bitter malt finish.
Sampled cask conditioned. Chestnut brown. Fruity, roasty aroma. Medium bodied, sweet and somewhat ashy with medium bitterness. Slightly salty finish.

500ml bottle in 2012. Very dark brown with a thin offwhite head. Aroma of cocoa, raisins and prunes. Moderately sweet flavour, but more from maltiness than any sugary notes. Dried fruit and cakey notes.

Cask at the Cherry Tree, Woodbridge. Pours almost black with a small off-white head. Aroma of chocolate, malt, Christmas cake spices and dried fruits. Medium sweetness, moderate bitterness. Medium body, oily texture, very soft carbonation.

Bottle at sister-in law�s house. Poured beautifully and looked gorgeous in the glass. A really rather delicious porter. Coffee and vanilla that was balanced against an underlying savoury flavour and texture. The toasted malt was present and the mouthfeel was very good. Overall this was very good and I would happily have this again.

Cask. Black with ruby highlights. Burnt malts (caramel, toffee, coffee, vanilla). Very fruity (damsons, plums, berries). Rum notes. Sweet. Very smooth. Drying roasty finish. Very drinkable. Nice!! (2008)

Bottle. Pours an opaque black with a fading brown bubbly head. Aroma is of chocolate, biscuits, caramel, coffee, grassy, raisins. Taste is of caramel, bread, raisins, figs, chocolate, nuts. Light oily mouthfeel, medium carbonation.

Bottle from Booths, Media City. Extremely dark with a very thin off-white head. A good winter warmer, although al little complex with its darker malt character. Its aroma is lightly roasted, some washiness, sweet and rich, and these latter aspects also apply to its taste. Here there�s also hints of marzipan and a light toasted taste

500ml bottle @ Shrewsbury Beer Share, Feb 16, courtesy of Mike. Pours dark brown, small tan head. Spicey pepper aroma. Taste is peppery, old kitchen spice cupboard with added must and tobacco tin on the finish. Not for me.

Cask at The Green Dragon, Leek (JDW) A deep brown colour with a medium beige head. Aroma of chocolate, some coffee, slight toffee, a little raisin, red berries, maybe some liquorice and subtle molasses. Taste of raisin, red berries, some prune, chocolate, slight toffee, a little liquorice, a hint of coffee and subtle blackberry. Medium bodied and soft carbonation. A dry, chocolatey, fruity bitterness in the finish. Wouldn�t say it�s rum but this is quite fruity, lots of red berries and dark fruits mixed with classic porter characteristics. Ok.

Decent tasty porter you can relax with by the fire in a dark pub on a cold evening. Black body with a fine tan head. Ok intensity in the aroma. Medium body and a soft carbonation. Toffee, quite roasted and some crystal malt in the flavor. [Handpull at J.J. Moon�s (JDW) in London, England]
Cask at Auld Brig (JDW). Dark and slightly smoky. Little carbonation. Very smooth. Dark berries and prunes. Bit of chocolate and a little coffee. Nice.
Cask conditioned. Per summs it up, dry, bitter and floral, some bready malts, some toffee, with a nice floral citric finish, summery. Quite a satisfying bitterness, a well made ale.
Sampled cask conditioned. Amber coloured. Big flowery aroma. Medium bodied, dry and very bitter. Dominated (in a good way) by the flowery hop aroma.

Draft at the brewpub, 29 Dec 06: Don�t know if this is the same recipe as the one rated in 2002. Explosively big head that took forever to draw. Deep amber. Puckery like a sour orange at first. I was looking for orange seeds or a piece of orange rind. Head left nice lace tracings. Very citrus-rindy, relatively thin.
Oh my, this is a really poor IPA. My mother always told me if you have nothing good to say, say nothing. Nothing. GABF 2002

Light to medium amber-gold color. Rather slight head, no visible effervescence. Distinct hop aroma (as expected) but seems to be more of a British hop aroma, along with a tad of malt fruit. Very distinct buttery diacetyl and malt fruitiness, followed by the hops, which are not what I've come to expect in an American IPA. They are quite subdued, citrusy. Some tangy apple and pineapple in the finish. Finishes very "wet", also. Fairly light-bodied brew. A bit too smooth & malty for an IPA (not to mention mine had almost no carbonation), but quenching.
Very sharp nose on this local brew. Not nearly as hoppy as I like my IPA's but still a damn fine brew. Great maltiness and drinks quite easy. Had this on tap.
The foam stability is good, the body deepbrown. The Aroma is darkmalty, roasty, a bit dry, light alcoholic. The taste is darkmalty, creamy, alcoholic, a bit liquery, light roasty. Delicious!

33cl from tap at Caf� de Toeter, cask from 2014. Appearance: mahogany with medium off-white head. Aroma: candied/brown sugar, dark red fruits, raisins, dried apricot, wood, sweet spices. Taste: high sweetness and medium bitterness. Notes of brown sugar, dried fruits, raisins and a trace of marzipan and fried banana. Palate: medium bodied, quite sticky texture and lively carbonation.

33cl glass from tap at caf� de toeter in Groningen. Cask from 2014. Pours a dark amber colour with a small off white head which recedes to a thin layer on top. Aroma of wood, candy sugar, brown sugar, dark malt, rye, slight cocoa, dark ripe fruit, raisins. Taste is fairly sweet, soft bitter with a moderate dry finish. Notes of candy sugar, caramel, dark malt, rye, bread, wheat, raisins, prunes. Texture is oily, medium bodied with moderate carbonation
Bottle from Blau-Weiss - clear nut-brown color, nice stable head. Taste is malty, toffee, overall very smooth and far too easy to drink for a Doppelbock!

Sofort nach der �ffnung entfliehen der Flasche komplexe Aromen von Malz, Trockenobst, Karamel, Vanille und ganz hinten auch Espresso. Toll. Ansehnlich Kupfer/Amberfarbend mit leichten Rotweineinschlag, inklusive tollem Schaum, der erst gut haltbar in einer angebrachten Geschwindigkeit zusammensackt, aber nur um dann ein filigranes und samtig br�unliches Netz auf dem Bier zu hinterlassen. Klasse. Das Munggef�hl angenehm moussierend (wenig Kohlens�ure) und explodierende S��e folgt auf dem Fu�. Auch hier finden fast alle Aromen, die zuvor erschnuppert worden, statt. Allerdings zus�tzlich umh�llt von einer unaufdringlichen Bittere. Der gut sp�rbare Alkoholgehalt f�hrt zu einem bockbiertypischen Finale, wobei auch hier die Bitterheit das Aussergew�hnlichste ist. Nicht �bel. 0,33l Flasche von einem Getr�nkemarkt in M�nchen. Ca. 80 Cent.

Longneck bottle 33cl. Poured into a teku glass. Clear amber brown, good two finger frothy beige head, diminishing slowly, light lacing; aroma roasted malts, caramel, cocoa, rye bread; smooth mouthfeel, light heavy sweet, light bitter, roasted malts, toffee, bit chcolate, nutty notes; sweetbitter middle part leads to a bittersweet finish, roasty touch, chocolate, bit boozy; medium body, oily texture, average carbonation; smooth and rich doppelbock, nice.
Klasse dunkler Doppelbock. Hat aber lt. Etikett nur 7%. Sahnig dunkelkaramellig im Glas.

Flasche (33 cl) im Brauereigasthof Eichhofen. - Tiefes Kupferrotbraun, klar; sahniger beigefarbener Schaum. - In der Nase Noten von Mokka und Erde. - Antrunk sahnig und schmiegsam weich mit Dunkelmalz, Mokka und Zartbitterschokolade. Vornehme dunkle S��e. Mild rezent, vollmundig, kremig. Im Abgang stark dunkelmalzw�rzig mit etwas erdiger Herbe. - Sehr dichter, mokkaartig schwerer Doppelbock mit einzigartig �tiefen�, dichten aber runden R�staromen. Gro�e Klasse!

On tap at PINT Bokbierfestival 2015. Clear, reddish amber with a creamy, slowly diminishing, tan head. Sweetish-malty aroma of brown sugar, caramel, nuts and hints of coffee. Sweetish-malty taste of brown sugar, caramel and nuts, followed by a short, slightly bitter, coffeish finish. Medium to full body, creamy mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Good.

Sampled from bottle @ Eindhovens Bierfestival. Clear dark amber to amber - brown color, small to average sized off-white to beige head that diminishes fairly quickly. Smell and taste malts, a bit sweetish, malt sweetness, a hint of leaves, a hint of chestnut, hazelnuts, lightly a malt bitter hint in the finish as well. Decent body and carbonation.
Nice creamy head. Neutral aroma. Delicious nutty light caramel flavor. Little hop flavor, easy to drink.

500ml bottle, thanks to Kolshtrinker! Pours a deep clear amber, off-white collar of foam. Good caramel nose. Taste is rich malty caramel, brown bread, smooth grain, good balance and drinkability. Nice Marzen.
Bottle, thanks to Beerhunter111. Pale amber color. Floral, bready aroma. Malty sweetish, bready, floral flavor. Hint of orange. Full bodied. Hint of metal in the finish.

Sampled at the brewpub in Deuerling. This years best beer on our 5 day beer trip through Franken. Lasting light brown head. Clear amber color. Small clean aroma. Very nice malt taste and no sweetness just the malty body to build this beer.
Many thanks for this beer to Beerhunter111. Pours dark amber color. Malty nose. Full-bodied, pleasantly malty with hints of caramel and roasetd malts.
A bottle 5,5%. Clear golden color with tiny off-white head. Aroma is malty. Taste little bitter with sweetish finish. Sticky mouthfeel. Well balanced and enjoyable.

50cl bottle. Pours clear dark golden colour with a mid-sized good lasting off-white head. Aroma of sharp grainy malt, toasted malt, bread. Taste of mild toasted malt, grains, spicy hops, soft carbonation.

500ml bottle [A big "thanks" to Maddie!]. Clear, orangey amber colour with average to huge, thick, creamy, fairly lasting, moderately lacing, off-white head. Grainy aroma, a touch of horse piss-soaked straw. Taste is slightly sweet caramel malty, minimally doughy yeasty, a touch of butterscotch, mildly grassy hoppy overtones.

Flasche (50 cl) im Brauereigasthof in Deuerling (wo mittags so wenig los war, da� der Zapfhahn nicht in Betrieb war). - Goldbraun, klar. - Antrunk warm und f�llig dunkelmalzig mit kr�ftigem Toastbrot, Nu� und gebrannten Mandeln. Aromatisch malzs��, perfekt mit zarter S�ure abgeschmeckt. Mild rezent, vollmundig, weich und f�llig im Mund. Abgang mehr karamelmalzig-w�rzig als hopfenherb. Etwas leerer Nachtrunk. - Sehr sch�n malzaromatisches M�rzen, dem der letzte Bi� fehlt.
0.5 l bottle from the brewpub in Deuerling... Tasty and aromatic M�rzen variante... More significant aroma than the Helles...
Bottle @ Bj�rn tasting. Pours a clear pale amber golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty grainy aroma. Fruity malty grainy caramel flavor. Has a fruity malty grainy caramel finish.
Dumpf getreidiger Antrunk. Etwas herb, kein Hopfen. Oxidiert s��lich, leicht herber Ausklang. Meh. 8/7/6/6/7/7
Bottle from Beerhunter111. Blonde. Hay and floral notes in the aroma. Grassy hopbitter flavor with hay. Firm pilsener.
Pours a clear golden color with a offwhite head. Malty hoppy aroma, cereal notes, bready.
33cl bottle bought at the brewery. A clear golden beer with a small white head. Aroma of moderate spicy bitter hops, grains, cereals. Taste of spicy bitter hops, straw, pale malt, crisp hops, okay.
Sampled at the brewpub in Deuerling. Ok white head. Clean yellow color. Low hop aroma but big hop taste. Dry finish and medium bitterness.
0.33 l bottle from the brewpub in Deuerlingen... Clear golden color, average head... Quite bitter Pilsener variante... Strong aroma, tasteful...
Bottled. Clear pale golden, small head. Grassy bready nose. Dry, crisp and slender where firm crisp-bread malt meets grassy hops. Balanced bitter finish.

"Jura Weizen hell", Flasche von Edeka, Kallm�nz. - Dunkel goldgelb, klar - die Hefe klebt am Flaschenboden. - In der Nase sch�n s��es Weizenmalz, milde Aprikose, zarte Kr�uter. - Antrunk satt weizenmalzig mit f�lliger, mild karamelliger S��e, ausbalanciert durch milde Fruchtigkeit: etwas Aprikose, Trockenobst. Zarter s�uerlicher Touch. Milder rezent, hefeweich. Im Abgang sehr milde kr�uterige Herbe. - Schlichtes aber sch�nes Weizenbier.

0.5l bottle. It�s odd, but it�s crystal clear after the first pour. After I swirled the bottle and poured the last drop out of it, it has become hazy though. Classic weizen character with notes of banana, cloves, honey and some bread. The finish has a bit of lemony sourness to it. A bit weak bodied, but otherwise nice.

hvala mom priajetlju bizonu na ovom pivu ...kupio ga je prijatelju Juri pa tako i meni jedno ...vidim da su svi zadovoljni s ovim pivom ali kod mene skroz obrnuto ..lose pivo slatko smrdljivog okusa...katasrofa prozirna boja ...i kolega vedran je isto potvrdio da je ovo pivo dosta lose...

Bottle looks very simple but okay. Beer in the glass zippy, huge head. Yeasty aroma. Starts mild, dry, malty, more and more yeasty. Fruity notes of apricot. Finish again milder, could be more fruity. Okay.

Bottle50cl. Cloudy yellow golden, a lot of bubbles, large frothy white head, good retention, good lacing; aroma is wheat, banana, caramel, yeast, coriander, citrus; taste is medium sweet and light sour, wheaty, fruity, light toffee, spicy notes; light to medium body, watery texture, average carbonation, aftertaste is sweet �n sour, finishes with a tad of bitterness; overall a fresh and pleasant Weizen.

This beer tastes amazing. My mouth is very happy. It is creamy, sweet and smells a bit like a banana. I absolutely love it!! It is my favorite beer. When we move, we will go broke ordering cases of this. I have tasted more than twenty different beers here in Germany. I�m very picky and I don�t enjoy most beer, but this is off-the-charts excellent! I consumed a banana beer up in Hamburg that I also absolutely loved. I wish I could remember the brand.

(bottle) murky golden-amber colour with a frothy white head. aroma of wheat, peanuts and custard, slightly phenolic, with a hint of hay and floral hops. flavour is heavily yeasty, with a touch of green apple, some more wheat, light vanilla and a semi-dry finish. medium-bodied with lively carbonation.

50cl bottle. BBE 19.02.15. Pours golden, slightly hazy, thick white head. OK lacing. Wheaty aroma with banana and candy. Flavor has sweet banana, slight soury crispiness, whatever that means, smooth wheat finish. Pleasant hefeweizen, refreshing. Light to medium bodied.
Ins Glas ergie�t sich ein tr�bes goldenes Bier mit sch�ner Schaumkrone. Geruch hefig, fruchtig, w�rzig. Geschmack hefig fruchtig, reife Bananen, leicht w�rzig.

Bottle 50 cl. Pours pale golden in color with a creamy off-white head. Gets hazy when pouring the yeast from the bottle making it look like a belgian wit. Wheaty sour notes, ripe garden fruityness and mashed banana in aroma. Sweetish taste with notes of mild toffee and ripe banana. Light tartness together with some fruity sweetness and bready wheatness appears in aftertaste.

On tap at Brewpub. Dark brown color. Frothy tan head. Nutty toasted malt aroma hints at chocolate. Flavor is roasted malt, chocolate and caramel. Sticky mouthfeel. Bittersweet finish. Decent. Tasted on 8/19/19.

Draught @ the brewpub, N�rnberg. Pours cloudy dark brown with stable beige head. Clear aroma of caramel malt and yeast, with mild touches of hops. Bitter, roasty onset, giving way to sweetish notes og malt, caramel and yeast. Roasty and malty aftertaste. A decent beer for the style and not bad as such, either.

Draft. A- Malty, nutty. A- Dark red color, hazy liquid, off white head. T- Nutty, malty, bready. P- Medium body, average texture, average carbonation, smooth finish. O- Creamy but otherwise tasted about like the Rotbier. Meh.
From the tap at brewery - dark brown with a brownish head - aroma is toasted caramel toffee and spicy -taste is smoked sweet and some bitter smoked

Draught at Hausbrauerei Altstadthof, Nuremberg, Germany (�3.50/0.4l). Poured a hazy deep coppery red with 1cm of light tan dense foam that diminished slowly to a collar that laced OK. Carbonation high, lively and coarse to very coarse. Aroma is earthy and with musty grain. Taste is very slightly roasted with sweet malt and hints of musty grain. Light body. Smooth and slightly dry with a short finish.

Day 3 of the post Xmas Bamberg Jolly, bottle from the Rewe Bamberg shared on the train from Nuremberg to Freising, 26/01/14. I simply wrote down �Jura Weizen� so bowing to the majority here on which one to rate ! Murky orange amber with a decent biege head. Nose is tangy orange, light bready notes, hint of noffee pie, light spice. Taste comprises orange, toffee, yeast, light spice. Medium bodied, moderate carbonation. Ok stuff.

Bottle on a train during Jolly to Bamberg 2014. Hazy dark amber beer with a nice beige head. Wheat aroma, caramel, citrus, spicy notes, yeasty, some earthy notes. Malty wheat flavor, bready, citrus, roasted notes.

26th January 2014 Bamberg Bash Day 3. Train swig. Hazy deep amber - brown beer, good pale cream coloured head. Palate is light and airy. Tangy mellow dark malts. Little chocolate. Light tangy fruits. Dry finish. Not bad.

500 ml bottle in Amberg, Germany. Is a very dark brown color with an off white frothy head. Aroma is dark malt, sweetness and yeast. Taste is roasted malt, bananas and some fruit. Palate is a full malt with smoothness. Plank makes much better but this is good.

Bottle 50cl. Light unclear medium amber color with a average to large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white to white head. Aroma is light to moderate malty, wheat, caramel - roasted notes. Flavor is light to moderate sweet with a average duration. Body is light to medium, texture is watery to oily, carbonation is soft. [20081128]

Bottle 50 cl. Courtesy of fonefan. Pours an almost clear orangey brown with a creamy, off-white head. Discreet aroma of yeast and roasted malt. Medium-bodied, a little roasted malt, yeast and overripe fruit. Dry finish. 281108

50 cL bottle, courtesy fonefan. Pours hazy dark brown with a small, dense and light tan head. Yeasty, wheaty and roasted malt aroma. Sweet wheaty and light roasted malty flavoured. Medium dry finish. Subdued on the estery and yeasty notes in favour of the roasted malt.

Bottle. Hazy, reddish-amber coloured, mid-sized stable fluffy off-white head. Sweet dry berries in the nose, mixed with wheat and dark malt, accompanied by a light phenolic touch. Moderate sweetish-sourish flavour, light to medium bodied. Fruity and caramelly finish with a touch of cacao-powder in the aftertaste. Very pleasant, well balanced Dunkelweizen.............
Bottle, 5.0%. Cloudy dark brown colour. Slightly metallic flavour. The flavour is also roasted and slightly citric.
28-03-19 // tap at Hausbrauerei Altstadthof Dark. Dark malts. Coffee. Smooth. Roast bitter. Good.

Vom fass at brewery. Black long lasting head. Sweet cookies on the nose. Good body long sweet and fruity taste. Cocoa, dark friut, sweet and not at all boozy. Great dunkler bock, by far the best from today's session of the brewery's tapped beers

Score: 8 / 4 / 8 / 4 / 16 Draught at the brewpub. Almost black body, with a big, fluffy, rocky, lacing, dark beige head. Aroma of dark chocolate, cocoa powder, toast, dark bread, coffee, honey, some caramel, some dark fruits. Tastes of chocolate, toffee, cocoa, toast, dark bread, coffee, some honey, some dark fruits. Medium, oily mouthfeel, with an average carbonation. Finishes roasty, toasty, a bit sweet, a bit dry, with dark chocolate, cocoa, toffee, bread, some fruits Really tasty! Rich and diverse, with almost Porter-like notes, while also with a lovely chocolate/toffee sweetness. Greatly balanced and very smooth to drink. Outstanding Dunkler Bock, propably the best I've had so far!
Dunkler, s��lich schokoladiger Antrunk. Etwas brotig, s�ffig, steigend schokoladig. W�rzig-herb, dunkles Getreide. Langer, weich schokoladiger Abgang. Gut. 13/10/11/11//12
Frisch vom Hahn in der Brauerei getrunken. Fast schwarz mit hellem Schaum. Vollmundig mit sch�n ausgepr�gtem Malzk�rper. Abschlie�end guckt sogar der Alkohol um die Ecke.

Aroma: caramel, bread, dark grain and cereal malts, honey. Appearance: hazy, dark brown, medium, frothy, beige head. Taste: medium sweet. Palate: caramel, dark malts, grain, light molasses. Overall: nice Dunkler Bock, nice sweets throughout. Pint at the brewery, N�rnberg.
Dark body with a decent tan head. Bread and caramel nose. Bitter nut flavor with a nice wet nickel and sweet toffee flavor. Some lingering caramel with just a bit of vanilla in the finish.
caramel, coffee, nuts, roasty, leather, Take a tour of the brewery when you visit and learn how this beer is made in this special location. You can taste the history in it. One of the best.
On Tap @ the brewpub. The head is ok, the body red-brown. It smells malty and a bit darkmalty. The taste is also a bit alcoholic- bitter. 9/9/9/10/-/10

draft at the brewery in nurnberg. ruby-hued chestnut brown. medium-full body; creamy, frothy, smooth and a little bit oily. toasted almond and caramel malt is mildly rough. flavors together are all very mild and tend to come through mostly late on the palate. straight-forward munich malt nose and red apple / black cherry / plum / toffee flavor. drinkable but nothing special.
50cl bottle from the brewery. A clear dark brown beer with a beige head. Aroma of mild caramelish malt, nuts and cereals. Taste of moderate sweet caramelish malt, nuts, cereals, low bitterness.
Ruby to brown colour with a lingering head; taste of butterscotch and just plain butter. Drinkable albeit unexciting

Bottle, Sl�va pivnizubovi! During my visit to the brewery in 2007 this beer was not available, so thank you very much for completing their selection. Clear mahogany colour, large and persistent beige head. Full-bodied Dunkles, pleasantly malty with hints of chocolate, caramel and toffe, as well as some shy hints of wild berries from the Bavarian forest... Good!

(bottle) Clear, dark mahogany colour with a light-beige, medium-sized foamy head. Moderately sweet and slightly roasted malty nose with cacao, caramel and a whiff of hops. Bitter-sweet flavour, dry and rather slim roast-malty taste; slightly roasty and bitter finish. Average brew and more a Schwarzbier than a Dunkel (12.07.08).

Bottle (purchased at the brewery): deep chestnut-amber coloured, rather quickly collapsing beige head; caramelly to dark-malty nose with a tinge of hops; moderate sweet-bitter flavour, quite light bodied; light sweetish-malty finish, some traces of fruits and roasted malt, light bitterness in the aftertaste. Not bad, but a bit one-dimensional............
Barnyard and light roasted aroma. Dark brown, off-white frothy head that diminishes fast, nice lacing. Sweet, light toffee, bit watery, bit roasted. Long sweet finish.

50 cl bottle @�Timo A. Pours clear mahogany color with a small head. Bready and malty on the nose, caramel, yeast and wood also. Caramel malts, rye, some bread, nuts and molasses. Slightly bitter malty palate. 4314

500 ml bottle. Thanks Timo A. Pours a dark brown colour with a small head. Aroma of toasted malts, bread, syrup and earth. Flavour of rich toasted malts, bread, nuts, syrup, chocolate and mild bitterness. Medium bodied. Rich malty finish with sweetness. Great stuff.

bottle (Gru� nach Bochum!). Deep dark brown colour with a decent and creamy beige head. Aroma of chocolate. Full-bodied, intensivele malty with flavours of caramel, chocolate, raisins and plums. Very nice indeed.

(bottle) Clear, reddish brown colour with a foamy mid-sized tanned head. Sweet toast-malty aroma with notes of molasses, caramel and subtle fruity notes. Sweet flavour, full bodied with a moderate, slightly crispy carbonation. Toasty malt-character with a tinge of molasses; sweet and slightly toasted finish with light but rounded hoppy notes. Reliable Bock. 23.X.09

Bottle: Clear, copper-amber coloured, small and quite quickly diminishing beige head; solid, not too sweet, caramelly toasty nose with a very faint touch of hops, dried fruits and molasses in the second row; moderate to solid sweet-bitter flavour, medium bodied; slightly lingering sweet fruity and almondy-malty finish with a little bitter-chocolatey aftertaste. Very decent Bock......
Malty aroma with a hint of licorice. Thick texture with some roasted malt and pepper. Very malty. Some grapes. Tasty bock beer.
Prun and dark malts aroma. Clear, ruby, off-white rocky head. Sweet, hopbitter, full, prune flavors. Hoppy, sweet and bit sticky finish.
Sampled at the brewpub. A medium lasting bright white head over a solid golden beer. Clean but small aroma of pils malt. Light malty taste. Easy to drink in large amounts.
50cl bottle. Pours clear pale golden colour with a mid-sized good lasting white head. Aroma of grainy and mild sweet malt. Taste of grainy malt, straw, cereals, mild hops.

Bottle:Golden. small foamy layer, visible carbonation, grainy-strawy nose with an almondy-fruity touch; light sweetish-bitter flavour. slim; light fruity-lemony traces in the delicate sweet-malty and bitter finish. Not bad, not boring, only a bit thin.......

(bottle) Clear, pale golden colour with a big foamy white head. Slightly grainy pale malty aroma with a tinge of sour dough. Mildly sweet flavour, light to medium bodied with a crispy carbonation. Pale, slightly strawy malt character with grainy notes; moderately sweet and slightly bitter hoppy finish. Clean without being too exciting. 02.X.09
bottle, thank you pivnizub! Clear yellow colour with a mid-sized white head. Malty, slightly grainy with a nice grassy hop character.
Maltaroma and flavor with a bit of butter. Just a bit grassy and a hint of apple. Some hopbitterness in the aftertaste.
An unexpected nice beer. Grain and straw aroma. Golden colour, white frothy head. Hoppy, light sweet, nice bitterness. Hoppy finish.
Caramel, date aroma. Dark amber, white frothy head. Sweet, good hops, full. Long sweet hoppy finish.

Hazy, murky brown appearance with a thick (dense) head showing the color of a Norwegian goat cheese. Very malty sweet aroma and a sweet flavor that is nicely put in balance with the floral hop character. A very enjoyable beer.

Has an almost citrus bitter aroma. Pleasant amber color, and full of flavor. I really like this beer. It truely reminds me of an English IPA. It has the bitterness, balanced with malt, and lacks the hoppy aromatics. Cheers!

a drinkable brew that has enough dimension in the body,drinkability,and flavor to be given some respect. hint of hop and waft of molasses more so a quality lighter brown sweetness. again some body, not sure from where probably layered sweetness in the brown. Not exceedingly red but there you go.

On tap at 2 Shamrock�s. It poured an amber color with a white head. The aroma was of malts and some hops. The taste was similar to the aroma with a bittersweet finish. It had a medium body with a smooth texture. Just ok.

Pours a hazy amber with a ruddy brown head. Minimal lacing. Heavy esthery scent, with just a hint of banana and rosewater. Absolutely disgusting buttery malt backbone, accompanied by sour milk and old newsprint. Thin mouthfeel and bitter, bitter finish.

Couldn�t see it too well in the dark bar lighting. It looks like a fairly dark amber from what I could tell. Nice head that went down kinda quick. Lots of lacing. Smells kinda plain. Mostly malt. Tastes pretty decent. The aftertaste has a surprising bite. More full bodied than most anything from AB. Not bad, but I think that the adjunct aftertaste might start to pile up after awhile.
Santa Fe Cattle Co Restaurant Clermont FL]-on tap-pours an off white head and gold/amber color. Aroma is light malt, some herbal hops (bite?). taste is light malt, some herbal hops bite. Light body.

I had this at Caliente Resorts in Tampa, they had it on tap under the name of "Caliente Red". I was underwhelmed when I learned that it was from AB (or is it InBev now?). It poured a fairly clear red, small half inch head. Tasted fairly watery. Very cheap knock-off of a Killian�s. Though for an AB product, I can�t say I�m not impressed I give and E for effort.

I am assuming this is the beer i want to rate, i had this at a restaurant the other night in gainesville called ballyhoo. The beer went by the name of ballyhoo amber and i asked the bartender what it was and she said Anheuser made it for them. So in the light i sat in it poured a reddish color with a thin white head, flavor was pretty subtle, it was malty with slight hop flavor, not much going on with it nothing that stood out too much for me anyways.

At the Fox and Hound in Fort Worth (downtown), they serve a beer called "Red Fox Amber." Couldn�t find it on here, but since the bartender told be that Budweiser brewed it for them, I am assuming this is it. I also assume that all Fox and Hounds have it and that by Budweiser, he meant Anheuser-Busch. Anyway, pours a clear amber-reddish color, with a very frothy, pure white head. Taste is pretty tame with a little caramel malt mixed with a hint of hop bitterness. This would be a good beer to drink a lot of. On tap.

At the Fitzgerald�s Irish Pub in Bonita Springs Florida, we were served Fitzgerald�s Red Lager. It was later learned that this was a contract brew from Anheuser-Busch that was known there as the American Red and that it was a quote white label brew made for distribution to various pubs under their own label. It is assumed that this is that American Red. It poured a small sized head of light brown colored foamy finely sized mostly diminishing bubbles that left behind a transparent dark red brown colored softly carbonated body and a fair lacing. Its mouth feel was tingly from the start to the finish. It also had a caramel red malt aroma. The flavor was of red malt, caramel malt flavoring. It would make a good session brew with its easy drinking quaff-ability.

Draft at Tina�s in Cincinnati under the name of Tina�s Red Lips Ale. Was told it was made for them by Budweiser. Poured dark amber with an average frothy white head that diminished slowly with fair lacing. Moderate balanced malt and hop aroma. Medium body with a smooth texture. Medium sweet flavor with a bittersweet finish of moderate duration. Drinkable at $1.50 a pint.

Vibrant head; yellow-orange with gold highlights. Starts off with a mouthfeel not unlike milk - cold, smooth, and soft. Becomes a little more carbonated in the middle. Finishes with a nice dose of flavor: some "bread-dough" maltiness, cookie, and a little hop bitterness. Aftertaste is enjoyable and lasting... rather bitter (nice). Although not over-the-top with charisma, it is a very well-balanced, easy-to-enjoy beer with enough flavor to satisfy just about anyone.

27/6/2018. Draught at the Gordon Biersch Brewery Restaurant, Las Vegas. Pours murky dark brown with a frothy off-white to beige head. Aroma of chocolate, coffee, roasted malt, hops, caramel and a hint of liquorice. Medium sweetness and moderate roasted bitterness. Moderate body, slight oily texture, average carbonation.
Sampled cask conditioned. Golden coloured. Flower, fruity aroma. Medium bodied and rather sweet. Dominated by Fuggle hop aroma. Bitter finish. A very nice and flavourful bitter.

Bottle. Black. Very malty (very roast/burnt malts, lots of milky chocolate, coffee, caramel, toffee). Slightly sour fruity (berries). Some hops. Smooth creamy but full-flavoured. Roasty chocolate malty sweetish stout with slight sour edge. Dry roast malty finish. (2008)
Bottle at home. Pours black, nose is light smoke, roast chocolate, taste is bitter, roasted chocolate.
Rich chocolate malt aroma. Black colour with poor head. Dark chocolate flavour, slightly nutty with a coffee finish. Heavy body with low carbonation.
Bottled 0.5l ; Devon ; UK ; Malty,roasted,chocolate and oat aroma ; Dark brown color with no head ; Sweeter taste with light bitter finish ; Almost flat ; Pretty good.
Cask from Barista Winter Beer Fest, Chelmsford. Almost black with minimal tan head. Smooth but a little thin for a stout. Roasted, smokey aroma. Quite bitter.

Cask at the sportsman croxley. Opaque black with caramel tones. Big light tan head that lasts the whole way through the pint. Soft roast some choc earthy hop some berry. Flavour is really earthy, some farmyard manure. A bit slick with soft carbonation.

Lovely rich dark brown colour with a tiny lingering head. Smells roasty slight chocolate/coffee- it's a stout, innit? Taste is sweet with lingering bitterness. I never thought I liked stout really but this is nice, I think I will drink more stout even though this has a slightly watery mouthfeel. Nice. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Cask at Live and Let Live, Cambridge. Dark mahogany pour with a bubbly tan head. The flavour is smooth, malty and bitter. It has the smoothness and palate of a milk stout. An excellent and well balanced beer and perfect for a session.

Cask at the Alexandra Arms, Rugby - 19/09/12. Mid black in colour with a decent tan head. Roast malt and chocolate dominate the nose with a little coffee at the rear. Taste follows nose but a little blander, malt seems lighter, oats are present. Lightish body for 4.8%, low carbonation, a little on the thin and watery side.

Cask at Great British Beer Festival 2012, Olympia, London. A dark brown/black coloured pour with a medium beige head on top. Roasty, malty aroma. Tastes roasty, malty, some chocolate, slightly sweet. Nice enough.

Beautiful mediocre foam. The aroma is very rich and revealing both malt, yeast, hops and easy fruit. The taste is predominantly caramel, but there is also a light gentle taste of rowan. It is also a good hoppy aftertaste with a touch of sweet gale. It is a very rich and delicious bock.

660 ml bottle sampled in 2008. Clear, reddish golden body with an off-white head. A bit week malty aroma with some caramel. Flavor is sweet, moderate malty, caramel, light fruity and moderate bitter. Medium body and aftertaste. Nothing specially really, but definitely drinkable.
Tasted November 17. 2011: Brewed in 2007. Taste of cellar first, but this disappeared after some time. Very heavy beer. Could be very good in combination with food. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle @ Home. Pours golden with a offwhite head. Aroma of malt, sweet dark fruit, light grassy hops. Taste is malt, caramel, plums and other sweet fruit, light grassy hops. Medium body, soft carbonation. Decent bock. 210409
Bottled, from thewolf. Clear copper color, short head. Aroma of malt, prune, some hop. Bit sweet malty taste, fruity. Bit dry palate. Little bit spicy. Ok bock.

Bottle@LCRBM08. Aroma has caramel and gariny hops. Clear, copper-amber coloured beer with an off-white head. The taste is slightly bitter, has grainy and a bit grassy hops, some caramel sweetness. Nothing interesting.

Bottle LCRBM08. Light amber coloured with a small, slowly diminishing off-white head. Sweet nutty-caramelly nose with a molassy and hoppy background. Moderate sweet-bitter flavour, quite light bodied for a beer of 7.1%. Delicate malty-nutty and slightly bitter finish. O.K. .....

Bottle. A clear, dark golden beer with a small, off-white head. Caramel-malty nose with some fruityness and a grainy touch. Caramel-malty flavor too, with the same fruityness found in the aroma. Also a touch of alcohol. Medium to full body, slighlty warming. Caramel finish with some alcohol. Sure, it�s a decent beer, but also quite ordinary, or maybe boring in a way. Like it though. (080829)
Tastingsession LCRBM08. Golden colored brew. Sweet aroma. Crispy, sweet, malty flavor. Dull.

Clear pale chestnut with just a rim of yellowish head. Very sweet nose, alcohol, malty, old hazelnuts and cashews, sweet honey bread. Sweet bread returning in the taste, with autumn leaves, nutty, but not oxydized. Rather sticky MF, and in fact not very well-bodied. Average. Carlsberg can do better.

(Bottle 50 cl) Fully golden and hence darker than your typical Maibock, not much head though. Very soft and malty beer with a marked sweetness, but in no way cloying. Potent and solid with a warming alcohol. Maibocks are rarely a favourite of mine, but this one I really liked. 060802
Nice Amber color and pretty head, but no significant aroma or taste (zero hops).
Bottle from Tesco Nov� Sm�chov. Golden body, white head. Cardboardy, creamy aroma. Sweetish taste, cardboardy, tired maltiness, some hoppiness... just sub par in this shape and form.
Beer with light color, light body, flat carbonized, some foam on top (drunk it in Mlada Boleslav, during the CZ pivo tour).
bottle from Hopfenkurier. Pale yellow, fluffy white head. Light-bodied, malty background with grassy-saazy hops. Light and simple, easy-drinking des�tka.

50cl bottle. A clear golden beer with a huge most good lasting white head. Aroma of metallic hops, straw and soft grainy malt. Taste of grainy malt, spicy hops, mild metallic hops, corn, nothing special.

Bottle 50cl. poured into a stem pilsner glass. Clear pale golden, good two finger frothy white head, mostly diminishing, light lacing; aroma sweet malts, grain, grass; taste medium sweet and light to medium bitter, malty, bready, grassy; dry sweetbitter aftertaste, malty, grassy, bit burnt caramel, light pepper note; light body, oily texture, soft carbonation; rather nice for a low-alcohol pilsner.

Bottle with expiry date 28.06.2017. Pale colour, rocky head that quickly disappears without any trace. Shame! Aroma is not very intensive, with pleasant grassy hops, malt. Light bitterness. Light body. Decent one.
Norm�ln� klasick� �esk� pivko.. :) Na takov�to posezen��ko v pohod� sta��... Jinak �esk� klasika.
330ml bottle from Premium Czech Beers online. Pours clear golden with a thick white head. Standard cooked corn nose. Light astringent taste. Lager.
Tap @ Prague Beer Museum. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are rich grass, hops, malt and has a semi bitter finish.
Bottle. Clear pale straw with thick white head. Aroma of malts, grain, bread. Medium to moderate bitter, light sweet, straw like .Light body, thick texture, light bitter finish.

On tap. Clear amber with an off white head. Malty aroma with a some German hops. Sweet malt flavor but balanced well with the hop bitterness. Medium body, actively carbonated and a soft smooth mouth feel. There was a light fruitiness in the finish too.

Amber Color with Off White Skin. Something Off in the Aroma. Possible Infection. Little Metallic..Musty Clean, Crisp and Dry Malt Flavor. Simple Easy Drinking Red. Flavor Much Better Than the Aroma Suggested..Still Some Metallic Notes at the End.

On tap at the Birchmere. A decent looking red ale. An average aroma for a red with a nice red hue. The flavor had a slight adjunct/cheap beer flavor to it. Was able to finish off the pitcher, but there are more drinkable beers out there.

Bailey�s Pub and Grille - Crystal City, Arlingotn, Va. - on tap. Slightly funky, homebrewy like sweet aroma with hints of nuts and cotton candy. Light copper pour, tight white head, brief lacing. Flavors of maple syrup, some peanuts and homebrew funkiness, similar to the aroma. Slightly muddled and unfinished. Decently thick mouthfeel. Needs work.

Ruby-amber colored body with a medium thick white head. Smell is faint, but what I can detect screams delicious hops. Taste is wonderful combination of sweet, fragrant and bitter, sour hops. Aftertaste is pleasantly bitter and fresh. This is a very good, hoppy APA that I enthusiastically recommend.
Had this on tap at Union Public House in Alexandra, VA. It was just o.k. I expected more from it's name but I wasn't all that impressed. Decent color but nothing else notable.

Somewhat red in colour, but basically golden. I immediately flagged down the waiter and asked if this was the correct beer, but it was. The smell was nothing great, just a typical ale. No large presence of hops nor malt in this beer, just an average amount of a decent tasting beer. Aftertaste was acceptable as well. Could use a little work, but is better than any Macrobrew at anytime of day. Tasted at RT's in Court House (Arlington), Virginia.
Almost no aroma, what there is of it was vaguely sweet. Pretty tasteless initially, finishing with a bit of sweetness and ginger, but also some astringency.

Vaguely reddish-auburn, looks a bit thin. Nice firm head with staying power. Very enjoyable nose, pleasantly malty with hints of vanilla. Flavor is smoky with sweet malts. Finish is a mite grainy and puckery, as if there was some alum in the mix.
Bottle from the Batemans brewery shop. Backlog rating from bottle collection and historic scoring. No tasting notes kept, just rating.
Tried at the brewery. Golden colour with a white head. Light fruity aroma and taste mid sweet. Not as citrus as deScription suggested.

From cask at The Crown Rivers at Heathrow Airport 09.03.15. Hazy pale golden. Off-white head and fine lacings. Aroma of yeast, bread and biscuits. Same in taste, with a hint of lemon and lime in aftertaste.
Cask six chimneys.hazy gold colour halo white head. Aroma slight citrus. Taste citrus sweet malts slight bitter finish medium body soft carbonation. Ok stufff
Cask@the imperial, walsall. Golden amber beer with small head and good lacing. Aroma of malts and a touch of toffee. Taste is malts, toffee, citrus and a dry finish. Below par bitter.
Cask at JDW Charlie Hall; dark amber pour with thin off white head, malty aroma, taste has some zesty citrus and some sweet caramel.
Cask, in London, UK. Pours clear golden, thin and fast disappearing head. Medium body. Slightly bitter. Decent, but nothing special.

Cask,hand pulled at Coombs Wood Sports Club,Halesowen.17th march.Light amber pour with a medium sized unstable whitish head.Very light aroma but slight malt,caramel and hop hints.Flavour of Caramel malt,hop,citrus and biscuit.Average tasting beer.
This bitter is copper golden in colour with a large malty nose. Less malty in taste but better for it. Full bodied and has a great body.

March 2011: Hooker is brewed every spring (for the annual Six Nations Ruby Tournament) and is currently (2011) sitting at 4.1%ABV and with a new front label on the bottles and a changed font if on cask. My 500ml brown bottle was best before 31 Mar 2012 and was drank/reviewed 7 Mar 2011. Poured into a vase shaped pint, �Old Speckled Hen� badged. The body is a light amber, clear and showing carbonisation rushing upwards to the full snowy white foaming head. Very little aroma, some hops and yeast present if you sniff long and hard enough, otherwise not a lot of anything. The flavours are a dry tasting blend of hops and unsweetened barley malts. It isn�t bitter in taste, but certainly isn�t sweet either. The dryness seemed to increase as the tasting progressed and I thought it dry in the first mouthfull! I suppose you could call it refreshing, but I found it wanting in all aspects. Almost odourless, too dry and bland in both texture and taste. The worst beer I�ve had from Batemans. I can only assume the cask version is a whole lot better.

500ml bottle from Wynard Hall Shop, as the Snaffling Pig Co. Blonde Light Golden Beer 4.3%. Pale yellow gold colour, large stable white foamy head leaving lacing and aroma of citrus, metallic. Taste is pale malt, some grain & biscuit, sweetish with citrusy hop bitterness. Light bodied, soft carbonatioon, dry bitter finish. Quite OK

6/4/2019. Bottle from Rebellion Brewery Shop, Marlow Bottom. Pours very pale gold with a white head. Aroma of grass, caramel, hops, straw and sugar water. Medium plus sweetness, light bitterness. Light body, watery texture, soft carbonation.
Hotel in Egham, bottle. Vague citrus and malts aroma. Gold..Thin head. Some bitterness but more malt. Light. Thin. Flat. Abrupt. Gold verging on a lager. Poor.

29Jun2018 Straw, grass, dusty malts, dough, bread. Clear gold, small, frothy, white head. Light bitter. More wet straw, grass, bread, biscuit, floral notes, soft carbonation, medium bodied. A tad boring. Cask at the brewery, Marlow.
Bottle from BEER:shop, St. Albans. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are fruits, grass, straw, malt and hops.

Bottle from BEER:shop, St. Albans. Clear yellow with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, light bready and light citrus. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and light bitter finish. 160218
500ml ml from Waitrose. Pours golden with medium white head. Aroma hops:citrus and a hint of peach also some malt. Taste refreshingly bitter.

500ml bottle. Clear golden colour with a small white head. Aroma: fruity malt, citrus, very lager-like. Taste: sweetish malt, citrus fruit, slight buttery hint, gentle hop bitterness. Light bodied, soft carbonation. Brewery playing it very safe with this I think, not bad but I won�t remember this one.
500ml bottle. Pours clear gold with a small white head. Aroma is sweet and malty, with citrus notes. Taste is malt, butterscotch, biscuit.

Cask at the Hope and Champion, Beaconsfield. Poured a clear medium amber with a thin white head and some clingy lace. The aroma is light cItrus grassy hop. The flavour is moderate bitter with a light yeasty hop bitter palate. Medium bodied with average carbonation.
good looking reddish brown. smell red fruits caramel and hint chocolate. taste is fruity sweet front and bitter finish with hint of chocolate. over carbed. nice though
2017.11.03: Aroma with notes of roasted malt and herbs. Dark-brown appearance. Fine ale!

Donker Amber, tegen bruin aan, beige schuimkraag, troebel, weinig koolzuur, goeie lacing van schuim. Aroma: Licht geroosterde mout, karamel, geroosterd brood/biscuit, houtachtig/noot achtig, licht gerookt en licht fruitig/donkere bessen. Smaak: Heel licht gerookte en geroosterde mout, licht chocolade, licht fruitig met een zuurtje van limoen en een scherpe bitter. Medium body, zacht koolzuur, zacht mondgevoel, afdronk is redelijk bitter en droog

Tap at Bath Ales. Filtered ruby red brown body. Thin, syrupy chocolate tones don�t really merge well with the rest of the ale. Kind of awkward. Nutty, but not much depth. Sort of a buttery sweet finish.

0,5 l bottle from kappldav123. Thanks a lot! A darkest red brown in the glass, small beige frothy short living head. Malt and some dry berriefruits on the nose. Taste starts a little bit thin, getting more malty and alcoholic in the second row. Some caramell and low sweetness. Not very complex, expected a little bit more.

Many thanks to Erzengel for sharing! Pours clear reddish brown colour with a mid-sized most good lasting off-white head. Aroma of dark malt, a bit sweet, caramel, some red fruits. Taste of sweet dark malt, some chocolate, caramel, hints of red fruits, okay!

Many thanks to kappldav123 for this bottle! Malty-grainy beginning. Fresh and easy to drink with a nice malty caramelly body. Moderate bitterness, fresh and smooth, nice carbonation, not much bitterness. Easy to drink bock.
At Internationales Berliner Bierfestival 2016. Dark amber with a small head. Aroma and taste of roasted malt, caramel, light dark fruit. The body was full and the finish warming.

0,5 l Flasche. Aroma: Malzkaramell. Erscheinung: Rotbraunes Bier, cremefarbener Schaum. Geschmack: Malzig s��, leicht w�rzig, leicht btiter, recht mild f�r den Alkoholgehalt, leicht rauchig. Nachgeschmack: Etwas zu wenig Kohlens�ure. Gesamt: Kann man gut trinken, ist aber nichts wirklich besonderes.

Bottle, danke David. Pretty ruby brown, golden brown head. Nutellalike aroma - Marzipan/nut, roast grain, light chocolate notes. Vineous berry notes add to the flavor. Chewy body, sparkly mouthfeel. Sustantial and interesting bock, very nice.
Bottle. Dark brown color. Lasting head. Malty roasty aroma with a hint of licorice. Full bodied. Malty sweet flavor, very bready with hints of caramel and milk chocolate. Lovely warming bock.
Dark amber colour. Average, brownish head. Aroma of roasted malt. Full body, surprisingly no sweet but malty notes.

bottled, at mowbeer�s 29th birthday celebrations. a deep ahde of purple with a small fuzzy head; aroma of prune juice and stale cola; some brazil nuttiness with tinned pear and a bit of a dull finish letting the side down

Das Bockbier startet au�ergew�hnlich mild, man will sagen hohl. Dann kommt eine rauchmalzige Note zaghaft hervor, verharrt aber dort und bildet so h�chstens einen Unterton. Es fehlt aber der Hauptton, nach wie vor ist das Bier merkw�rdig mild, einfach neutral, nicht einmal w�ssrig kann man das Bier nennen. Erst im Abgang wird das Malz kr�ftiger, w�rzig, etwas herb. Ein sehr eigener Bock, den ich in dieser Form bisher nicht kenne. Zu mild, ja. Irgendwie aber doch gef�llig. Komisch! Test vom 20.11.2007, Gebinde: Glasflasche Noten: 11,8,14,11,10,9 - 10,15

500ml bottle from the brewery bar at the Erkelenz Bierborse on 5th July 2019. Really enjoyed this sitting the warm afternoon sunshine. Pours a deep golden colour, white head. Good malty and alcoholic feel to the brew, a very good Bock all round, I love the styles sweetness and this didn't disappoint.

Bottle from Alko, Somero. Pours golden with shades of orange. Small white quickly diminishing head. Aroma of bready maltiness, citrus, alcohol and some peat. Taste is pretty much on the same line, with sturdy sweetish malty backbone spiced up by some earthy and citric notes: lemon, apple, peat and potato. Alcohol pushes through a little too much and runs over hops in the finish. Smooth mouthfeel, but a little watery body. The taste is quite nicely balanced, except for the bite of alcohol. Not at all a bad performance for a (strong) lager, but on the other hand nothing unique or spectacular.
03-04-18 // tap at Sp�tzle & Kn�del Berlin. Clear golden, solid white head. Grainy smoothness, low bitterness. Okay.

50cl MHD: cant be arsed to look for cap, Maruhn. - Part of a Kiste filled with random mystery beers and new entries, this incognito Riegele Helles/Export apparently brewed for export markets is possibly one of the dullest beers I've come across lately. Aroma of damp hayish grains, drinks like pure grainy mash, some cornflakes, some residual starches and nasty cardboard sulphurs in the finish. Beyond literal whilst remaining drinkable. "BS Export & Marken"
Tap at Sp�tzle & Kn�del, Berlin - clear golden color, white head. flat, sweetish and grainy. not refreshing at all. not a nice helles.
Bottle. Malty bready soft floral aroma. Malty sweetish bready flavor with hints of Apple Peach And orange. Medium to Full bodied. Friendly helles.

Bottle: Golden, nearly clear, creamy and stable white head, lazy carbonation; sweet grainy nose with an honeyish touch, illusions of herbal hops from far behind; mild to moderate sweet-bitter flavour, soft MF, almost medium bodied; lingering - a bit more bitter - malty and strawy finish. Nothing special, but well quaffable�
Draught. Clean and rather anonymous helles with notes of herbs, grass and light bread.

Just another poor Helles from Bayern. There�s nothing much to say really, and for the beerlover in you, better avoid this. There�s hardly ANY carbonation, and it�s kust about the worst/laziest Helles I�ve come across. Avoid!
Ins Glas ergie�t sich ein goldgelbes Bier mit sch�ner Schaumkrone. Geruch malzig, leicht w�rzig. Geschmack angenehm malzig w�rzig, minimale Bitterkeit.
Bottle @ Home. Pours golden with a white head. Aroma of malt, light grain, grassy hops. Flavor is malt, grain, light honey, grassy hops. Medium body, lively carbonation. 191213
From tap. Pours clear and golden yellow with a small white head. Aroma is grassy, light toasted malty and bitter. Toasted malty and light grassy flavoured. Light bitter and grassy finish.

Draught at "Fermento" in Brescia. Dark brown color, impenetrable and deep. Optimal head of long resistance. Nice aspect. Roasty aroma; notes of ash, roast malt, wood, liquorice. Much bitter taste (pleasantly), alcoholic, good prickly, long final.
Bottle, 4.9%. Rough, roasted aroma. Very dark brown colour. Small, unstable light brown head. Sweetish, roughly roasted flavour with bready notes.
Bottle from Drankenhandel Leiden. Aroma is malt, caramel, notes of darkish bread and nuts. Moderate sweet flavour with a light bitterness. Body is medium. Fine Amber Lager.
Uklar gylden med offwhite skum. Aroma malt hvete krydder. Smak karamall moden banan malt krydder. Fyldig smaksrik frisk. Flaske k-citymarket Tornio via DjOeye

500ml bottle in 2016. Bright amber, with a dense and fluffy white head. Aroma of lightly roasted malt, dried fruit, yeast, bread and brown sugar. Nicely sweet malt and raisin flavour, with chewy grain and honey in the mix.
Kupione wiek temu przez ojca dla robotnika remontujacego cos przy domu. Stare czasy ale zapadlo w pamieci. Delikatne i spokojne, nieco nudne. Ale dlaczego utkwilo mi w glowie to nie mam pojecia

Brown bottle from Armanetti�s, Mundelein, IL. Clear golden yellow hued having average white diminishing head with spare lacing. Light nutty malt aroma. Soft carbonation. Medium �bodied with creamy texture that starts with light sweet, nutty malt flavor and finishes dry with light hop bitterness. Some detectable slight oxidation off flavor. An old bottle?

Pours orange yellowy with lively carbonation and lots of suspended particles. Quickly disapearing white head. Aroma is light malt and urine (yeah I know). Flavor is much better, initial sweet malt. Middle is yeasty dough and hop bite and the finish is clean and quite dry. Not a bad brew.

Flat-looking orange beer with a bit of an orange candy smell. After the disappointing start, it actually tasted OK ... a bit of sugary malt with sweet bitter edge. I suspect mine was a bit old, which didn''t help. Average.

Nondescript aroma, except for a little hop. Medium to light gold with little head. Malty flavor with polarized hop profile that didn't blend in super well with the maltiness. I hate the squat bottle that it comes in. Enjoyable.
Pale yellow. Light bodied, surprisingly dry. Clean and bitter. Remarkably light bodied, dry and pilsenerish for being 6%.

D�nner bitterer Antrunk der stark an Alkoholentzug denken l�sst. Leicht s��, was zum Mittelteil hin aber schnell erlischt. Pappig bitter-flacher Abgang mit kaum zu erkennender Malznote. Ein weiteres Beispiel daf�r, dass dies tats�chlich die schlechteste Brauerei Europas ist! 5/4/4/3/4/2

Bottled(500ml). -from Plus market in Budapest. Pale golden coloured, medium sized white head, strong skunky corn nose (like n/a beers). Some weak lemony hoppyness, grassy and watery with notes of corn. Typical Pecsi beer.

0.5l bottle courtesy of and shared with ogivlado who brought it from Budapest (thanks!). Very palle dull gold body with a medium to big white head leaving heaps of lacing. Ooh, skunk, and some herbal notes. lemon too. Ogi had a somewhat favorable first impression (for a cheap Hungarian lager) but whatever optimism I had in the deepest recesses of my mind before tackling this one got stuck in the wall of stale dust that dominates the taste. Very light malt, some cardboard. Watery. Useless, crap. Unlike some of their other beers this might actually contain the hops. Heck, I think that the hops are on the label only to say "Hey, this is our crap beer, hop edition". It�s better than the cardboard and salt editions. Maybe.

One cheap hungarian beer again...Pale yellow body, small white head what dissapears...Minimal aroma and flavor of a pale lager with minimal malt and grassy hop, weak bodz, waterz texture. Only for 49Ft( at the moment it is 0,16 Euro)...What did i expect?

My Bottom Line: This shameful semblance of a Pale Lager throws dust and citrusy cleaner together in the hopes of getting things worked out. The rest is water. Further Personal Perceptions: -A slim veil of foam covers the pale gold translucence. -There is a lot of carbonation, but it remains palatable. -There are long, mineral oxidized notes in the finish. -This starts out like a failed Svetle Vycepni, and then all descends into rusty, dusty hell. Bottle; best before 2009/02/03.
Bottle. Golden colour with a small white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, hops and watery.
Bottled. Pale yellow colour, minor white head. Aroma is salts, diacetyl, paper and harsh hops. Flavour is salty, malty, papery, grassy and some harsh hops in finish. Watery, and not very pleasant.
Bottled (BB 02/2007). Golden color, small white head. Cardboard, malty, grassy hoppy, very cheap nose. Very watery, grassy, cardboard flavor. Very cheap, very thin.
Bottled, pasteurised. Pale yellow with short head. With a risk of repeating myself, this is a low impact, sweet, malt beer. Very little hops, very little to write about.
Another Hungarian that consists of maize. Pale golden. Soapy aroma with a slight herbal tone. Flat palate. Bad metallic taste, bad aftertaste.
Bring it back! It was the best stout I ever tasted. Sadly missed. A great sweet end to it that set it apart from its competitors.

18.01.2014, 0,44l can @ home: My father in law got me this one from a colleague of his, having used it for displaying in his apartment for ages. Best before date 27.03.1997. LOL!! Just had to test it, just for fun... Tiny bubbly shortlasting head. Aroma is slightly sweet malty, something like malt candy maybe, dark sugar, hints of chocolate and soap. Taste is very watery and slightly sweet, malt candy, dark syrup, hay, grass, hints of chocolate. Little bitterness, as watery mouthfeel as it gets. Basically it�s just bad. But given that it�s bb. date expired almost 17 years ago, and it�s only 4% ABV, it�s actually kind of drinkable. I kind of expected it to be worse than worst actually...

First tasted this in Coanes, Johnstone in October 1995. This was in cask and NOT in nitrokeg form. Cask, handpump dispense. Dull black in colour with a thick tight creamy off white head. Slight aroma of barley grain, very short in intensity. Thick creamy mouthfeel and superb lacing throughout. Dark malts give a smooth maltloaf base with sweet raisin fruit, hints of coffee bean and bitter plain chocolate. Slight prickle of hops in the short lived aftertaste. Finish is really creamy and ultra smooth with currants, tobacco smoke and grain husks full in the mouth. An excellent session sweet stout, but very hard to find in cask form - more�s the pity.
Sitting in the pub of a Friday evening with fond memories of supping a smooth pint of the good stuff. Wish it was still around!
the scottish guiness. it is not as smooth as guiness. I dont know if this is still brewed. It used to be regularly available on draught in certain parts of scotland.
Possibly the finest stout around. Very creamy texture without being thick, making it easily drunk. Haven''t seen it for a few years though - is it still made??
very thin. vaguely nutty and nuthin else....................................
Brown-black coloured. Creamy, but thin. Slightly roasty, but rather one-dimensional.
330 ml bottle. (Maruhn) Darmstadt, Germany. Enjoyed on Aug 30, 2019. Clear golden color with a small white head. Grassy hops. Moderate bitterness. Grainy malt. Dryness. Tasty.
A nice German style Pils. Hoppy, crisp and smooth. Nothing too fancy, but great for a sausage or barbecue.
Can. Clear gold. Tall white frothy head. Nose: subrle neutral malts, spicy hop. Light body. Taste: hoppy, medium bitterness. Decent pils

50 cL bottle. Pours pale and clear yellow and with a white head. Fresh hoppy and almost citrus fruity fresh. Starts mild sweet and has a mellow malty flavour into the finish. Soft finish, not much bitterness. Nice and refreshing.
Erster Eindruck ist herb, Hefe und leicht grasig. Hinzu kommt ein leicht metallischer und bitterer Beigeschmack. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

courtesy of Thomas Kr�si; rest in peace Thomas - clear golden beer with a poor head retention; oily grassy hoppiness; medium-bodied, light sweet and with a moderate herbal bitterness; spicy and herbal hoppy finish - ok

Pours clear straw colour with a white mostly disappearing head. Aroma is malty but has some dryish and sour notes too. Taste follows the aroma. Smooth and sweetish maltiness combined with dryish grass and herbal flavour. A tasty and refreshing pils. (Poured from a 0,5l can)
Aroma is lightly roasted Munich malts, rice adjuncts and light rye spice. Pretty bland bitter finish.
Standard Pils but with a focus on hoppy bitter flavors, therefore standing out slightly from the mass of indifferent Pils. Very drinkable.

Draft @ Malm� �l & Whisky Festival 2017. Pours a golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty grainy weak grassy aroma. Fruity malty grainy weak grassy flavor. Has a fruity malty grainy finish.
It's the only spring bock i've ever had. It's ok............................
Fine lente bock. Comparable in my opinion to Alfa and Hertog Jan, this bock agreed to my expectations. But 'spring bocks' will never be my personal favorites i guess.
Tried it long time ago in Hungary. Bad beer even when speaking about Hungarian macros.
This, once good name has been rusted. It has been derogated to a redundant, unpleasant cheap beer. Better not to buy it.
Second cheep hungarian beer today. I don�t know wich is the worst...Acidic, grassy, unpleasant. Brr...May it be the worse than the riesenbrau.
Bottled(500ml). -awful Hungarian beer, too sweet, bad aroma and bad taste...
Golden coloured. Sweet, thin and unclean. ..................................

Bottled. I long time I didn�t dare to buy this beer. I heared so many bad reports over the years that I never tasted it. The last couple of years there were no sounds at about this brewery and beers what made me wonder whether they still exsisted. And yes the do! I finally came across a couple of bottles. The labels improved very much but the beer was also surprisingly good. It really made me feel like "this is how beer was brewed in the old days before commercialization". Like geuze! Aroma of flowers, lemon, quite hoppt and a little yeasty. Hazy, amber color, beige head, very nice lace. Sweet, citric sour, lemon, hopbitterness (quite hoppy), wood, malty, hay, sticky and a vinegar-like burning sensation. Reminded me a lot of a good saison.
aroma is fresh , almost like la chouffe. wonderful taste of sweet fruits but a bit watery. finish is a bit sour. overall very nice.
Aroma is yeasty, bit sour and hoppy. Cloudy, yellow coloured with a thin white head. Taste is yeasty, hopbitter and sweet spicy/fruity. I'll completely agree with Sigmund & Caesar; This beer is a 3.
Cloudy golden color, short frothy head. Aroma is sour yeasty, bit spicy and hoppy. Sweet and sour yeasty taste. Bit dry and sticky palate.

I expected of some reason this to be a Dutch copy of English cask ales, but it has a more yeasty and spicy flavour than any English brew I've had, and is also more carbonated. (But not as carbonated as Belgian ales). Flavour is otherwise dominated by rather bitter hops (but not as bitter as the barman made me expect). The colour is light brown, slightly hazy. You'd think the ABV was higher than it actually is. It is not a bad brew, but I'd prefer most English ales / bitters to this one. Still it's nice to find Dutch alternatives to the inevitable macrobrews.

341 ml bottle @ Maxwell's Sports Bar Goose Bay. Pours a clear light gold with a large white head. Aromas are light grain and mildly sweet malt. Tastes are chalky grain and a light hop presence. Light body, smooth and almost creamy, light carbonation and mild hop bite on the tongue, medium grain finish. A macro for sure. ---Rated via Beer Buddy

This beer is a little known gem in the Molson product line. It was aquired by Molson in the Carling merger of the early 90�s, and they got it in a similar manner some time long before that. In an era of tasteless beer drank ice cold purely for the enjoyment of the alcoholic effects, sadly this brand is little appreciated, and if you don�t get it at a very busy vendor, it probably sat on the shelf for too long. I�m not sure if the Molson still sells beer from the brewery on circular road, but this is the best way to get their little known brands and I would suggest trying it this way. Otherwise, pay attention to the julian calendar date found printed on the case when buying this.
Maybe I got a bad bottle, but I was underwhelmed by this beer. Nose of sweet malt, so e fruit. Taste of metallic funk. Maybe a hint of pepper, but then strong malt. No hop character.

Small white head over corn-golden beer, clear. Very neutral nose, like still water, muddy. Grain taste, neutral to light sweet. "Crisp" is the word, for better or for worse. Light bitterish aftertaste, very light body. Dull ale. Maybe �t wasn�t such a bright idea trying it, whilst watching a TV series where they were trying Saison Dupont, Saison de Pipaix and other gems... Thanks, Stef C!

Straight up the best lager out of the marintime provinces. Standard solid gold beer with tons of little bubbles, very smooth, creamy white crown and very impressive lacing. Good retention too. No lack of aroma here - quite sweet with over ripe nectarines or peaches, some pee - don�t matter though �cause this is a solid brew. My description for taste doesn�t entirely reflect how much I enjoyed this beer - notable background bitterness throughout, cardboard malt and a solid wheat taste. More tongue drying bitterness has made this waaaaay more bitter than I thought it would be. Some sourness and alcohol as well - contributes to the nice stomach heat I got. I like! Mouthfeel is pretty plain and a bit harsh but I enjoyed the dry, dry bitter finish that left me parched. Excellent unassuming brew that really surprised me. Is it 3.7? As far as Canadian lagers go, it has to be. Don�t confuse this for being better than a better than average Belgian ale or something like that - for me it just excels in its class.

Dark golden yellow, no head was really produced during the pour, just some small patches bubbles linger around, wow I�ve never seen a beer that resembled urine so much mmmmmmm�� looks tasty. Malty and sweet, smells just like every other low-grade beer. The taste is all darker tasting malts and corn maybe just maybe I can detect a faint hint of hops buts its hard just like sniffing a fart in the wind. I wont lie this beer isn�t good but you could probably drink a ton of them and not get sick of it."

Yup. Pale golden color, white fizzy head. Grassy, sweet aroma with some cornbread. Flavor is "meh" with a slightly bitter-sweet finish. Definately improves with warmth. My fave macro Nfld session beer.

Pours a pale golden color, darker than the average macro, but still pretty light. Head is medium and white, reasonably quick to leave and left a tiny tiny bit of lacing. You can smell the corn in this brew, and a little bit of fresh cut grass smell. There might be a tiny bit of caramel to it as well, but I doubt it. It�s a rather dry beer, with corn overtones, medium bitterness and a cirtusy aftertaste. Pretty watery, and mid to low carbonation.

Bottle in St. John�s. No matter what the name says, this is NOT an ale. This is a lager. Colour, taste, and probably even in fermentation, this is a lager. But as far as lagers go, this isn�t horrible. Golden-yellow, yeast and grain aroma, grain and corn flavour. It�s not mind-blowing, but it�s drinkable.
This is one of my favorite beers when letting off steam or just hanging out with the pissants. Thankfully this beer is now availavle in Val Verde.

Another run of the mill beer from a large brewery. This poured from a bottle that was purchased at the "Liquor Store" in St. Johns, NL. It poured a light straw color with a white fluffy head that dissipated quickly. This tastes just like you would expect from Labatt, very light and watery. I guess it tastes fine but a very boring beer.

341ml bottle from a pub on George St. Only available in NFLD as far as I know. Sweet and slightly metalic, it was macrobrew at its most representative. May have seemed better than it was because I had just finished four double White Russians at Lottie�s across the street.

This ale pored a crystal clear, light yellow colour with a nice, bright white, foamy head. To the nose... scents of rotten eggs and corn... mmmm, mmm! First sip was watery and had a flavour of wine. Typical white bread beer from Labatts...crap!

Crystal clear typical lager gold, with a thin cap that disappeared before I could right this sentence down. Slight chemical sent mixed in with a ton of cheap malts and just a touch of apple for good measure, not a good smell but could be way worse. A dusty stale flavor that�s all malts no hops can be found, very surprisingly there is no bread flavor to found in this cheap ass crap lager from the east coast of Canada. The after taste is a strange flavor that reminds me of grape bubble gum that you�ve chewed for way to long. This stuff is swill but still kind of drinkable, you could find better beer any where, even in a Mexican back ally probally.
Taste is a personal thing and Jockey Club is one of my favourite beer. I really like this beer. It�s one I can drink all night.

From bottle in a pub on Gerge St, St Johns. Attracted to this beer by the name and the label. The aroma reminds me of a lager. Clear, light yellow with a very thin head. Sweet and a little scenty in flavour, however got a bit watery. I actually thought this beer was drinkable, well maybe only one. Pleasnt beer I thought.

Crystal golden colour with a thin white head. Aroma of malt, sugar and some cardboard. Light-bodied; Malty flavour with not much else. Overall, bland and horrible...funny name though! I sampled this 12 ounce bottle on 15-May-2004 at the May RB Party in Toronto, Ontario.

Maybe I�m going out on a limb, but I don�t think it�s as bad as everyone else does. The best part: poured a beautiful pearly froth of suds on top of a nice rusty gold water. Then the head vanished to a slight lace. I could see huge amounts of carbonation. This beer looks like the beer conjured up for most everyday folks when the word �beer� is spoken aloud. Smells of hops, a light grassy aroma. A crisp mouthfeel. Nothing to write up gloriously. Tastes of a slight sweet malt, some lemon, some hoppy-round-bitter, but with the usual macro adjuncts. The worst: the aftertaste is not complimentary. It�s essentially morning mouth. Very close to most macros, but marginally better because of the awesome appearance. Not as good as Black Horse in the drinkability department.

You�re kidding right. Jockey�s - and everyone else - should stay away from this "Corn on the" club. Good as a wet liquid when the water needed refilling and between big beers - otherwise, you�re kidding right?
Pale golden colour, with a thin fast fading white head. Malt aroma, slightly fruity. Very thin body however with zero hoppiness or bitterness.
I had this at the hotel bar in Port Au Choix Light yellow color with a bubbly white head. The India in the name fooled me, shame on me. Middle of the road even bland golden ale.
Bottled. The aroma has yeast. Not good. Clear yellow body with huge white head. The taste is quite nasty as well.

341 ml bottle @ Battle Harbour, NL. Pours a pale straw with a moderate white head. Aromas are light caramel and florals. Tastes are light grains and some crystal malt sweetness. Light body, effervescent, little to no aftertaste. A little bit more character than most macro lagers. ---Rated via Beer Buddy
Draft - Light Apple and pale malt. Clear gold with a rich white head. Light apple and not much else. Pretty tasteless.

Smells like a typical adjunct lager, maybe just a tad more presence. Appearance isn�t bad, with a decent head, good retention, and surprisingly good lacing. Tastes pretty much like it smells, certainly not much hop presence or IPA character. Light to medium body, moderate carbonation, off dry finish.
Nose of malt and grain, not much else. Taste Initial brightness and slight floral, but fade quickly into all malt. Mild bitterness. A little better than lots of the pale lagers.

This beer is one of my favorites. I am, for the most part, an ale drinker. If you try this beer, I would suggest allowing the beer to come to room temperature before sampling. It tastes best at is fermenting temperature. Excellent compliment to fish and chips. Cheers.

341ml bottle from the NLC in St. John�s. Only sold in NFLD. Not over-carbonated in the artificial sense of having that terrible acidic nastiness, but this beer seemed to be all effervesance. Is bubbles a taste? This stuff just seemed to disappear in my mouth which make for some easy drinking.

341 ml bottle. Darker than the average pale lager, but still only a pale gold. Very thin quickly dissipating white head. Medium to high carbonation. Flavor is pretty sharp, tastes slightly yeasty, slightly appley, and a lot like an offshoot of a macro beer. Very sweet, not really malty though. A little bit bitter, but not incredibly so. It isn�t bad, a good beer to drink lots of.
341 ml bottle. Medium carbonation. Clean golden color. A bit nutty. Reminds me of Molson dry.

0.65 bottle @ Gigi's Clear, gold with a medium, white head. Aroma of pale malts and alcohol. Taste is bitterish, alcoholic, syrupy, DMS. Light, slick, average. Finish is medium long. Finish is long and alcoholic. Overall, relatively bad.
Lekker biertje, beetje bitter, maar zeker met het warme klimaat heerlijk verfrissend! Aanrader!

33cl flesje gekregen uit India Alcoholpercentage van 7,2% Uitgeschonken in Jopen glas Uiterlijk: goudblond met redelijke witte schuimkraag Aroma en smaak: neus is zoetmoutig, smaak ook zo, gepompte alcohol, veel koolzuur Conclusie: niet mijn ding
Draft at an Indian place in New Zealand. Clear gold with a fizzy white head. Aroma is artificial grain and booze. Flavor is grain, booze, not much else. Medium light feel, fizzy, not pleasant.
very alcoholic taste and not pleasant at all. Couldnt drink more than half a bottle of this.
I have tried almost every (popular) beer from all around the world. And hands down Kingfisher is the BEST!!!
Blik 500cc tijdens desert Safari in Dubai. Smaakt kruidig en licht zoet. Verrassend goed hier midden in de woestijn.

Crisp and smooth with a decent head, just like lager should be. Packs a punch with the high alcohol content. Pretty high on the bitter scale. Kingfisher beers are an acquired taste, but boy is it value for your bucks! The daily/weekend poison of many an Indian beer drinker.
I am die hard fan of King Fisher strong beer.I am drinking King Fisher strong beer since 5 years. Nice beer. Thank you sir

Can in the Firkin Alehouse Folkestone. Clear gold colour lasting white head.clearly over carbonated. Corn aroma. Yes syrupy strong lager. Aroma is awful syrupy mouthfeel Some lemon on the finish. Yes its pretty bad.
Bottle shared by dad. Nice dark red color with a medium sized beige head. Smell and taste malts, caramalts, a hint of raisins, a bit sweet. Quite pleasant. 7-4-7-4-15.
Fles gedronken tijdens feest met Benzai. Amberkleurig helder bier. Weinig aroma. Lichte smaak van gebrande mout. Weinig nasmaak.

zapach s�odki, przyjemny, s�ody, �liwki, ciep�e chleby, lekka melasa i s�odki karmel, �adnie zbalansowany. pite z butelki. w smaku do�� s�odkie, ale jak na ko�laka niespecjalnie pe�ne. karmel, przypieczony chleb, ciastka, troch� zi� w tle. do�� wyra�ne nuty alkoholowe i acetonowe. goryczka raczej niska, karmel, alkohol, piwnica. nasycenie umiarkowane

Flasche 0,5l: Dunkles Braun, glasklar, fl�chtiger mittelporiger Schaum; w�rzige + kr�ftig s��e Nase, Malz, kr�ftig Malzzucker, dunkles Karamell, dunkle/getrocknete Fr�chte, dezente Hopfennoten, leichte R�staromen, angenehme fruchtig-w�rzige Bitterkeit; frischer + w�rziger K�rper, kr�ftige S��e, leichte R�staromen, Malz, kr�ftig Malzzucker, Karamell, cremig, deutliche Kohlens�ure, dunkle/getrocknete Fr�chte; angenehmer malzig-w�rziger Nachgang

Geruch; s��en Malze, �berreifen �pfel, Kr�uterkaramell. Aussehen; fruchtiger rehbrauner Kopf auf einem bernsteinfarbenen K�rper. Geschmack; geizige Hopfe, s��en Malze, �berreifen �pfel, Kr�uterkaramell. Ende; Karamell. Gef�hl am Gaumen; gut. Gesamteindruck; keine �berraschungen. [50cl.btl 6.9% t@home DDR-4ever-dead-project] 5474'12
Kolor herbaciany wchodz�cy w wi�nie. Piana przeci�tna szybko opada. Aromat s�odowy, w smaku podobnie lekko wytrawny finisz. Przeci�tny
Transferring Old Data - This was quite a nice Doppelbock from Northern Germany. Booze-taste, malty, sweet. Drinkable.

Mitteldunkle rotbr�unliche Farbe, schnell zusammenfallende, kleine Schaumkrone. Stark hopfig, mittelstarker Lakritzgeschmack, Alkoholischer Geschmack vorhanden, h�lt sich aber noch in grenzen. Fazit: Mittelm��ig, aber der Alkohol wirkt! Test vom 19.10.2008, Gebinde: Glasflasche Noten: 7,8,9,8,8,8 - 8,05

Das Bier ist nicht so Geschmacksintensiv wie vermutet. S�ffig ist es f�r 9% allemal, dennoch sit der Mittelteil recht alkoholisch. Im weitern Verlauf einigerma�en malzig und leicht s��lich. Nicht schlecht. Test vom 1.10.2006, Gebinde: Glasflasche Noten: 10,10,10,11,12,11 - 10,65

bottle,vintage, bbf 2009-may, i�ll be re-rating this when i get a fresh one. clear amber, smooth white head. Caramelly, malty aroma, hops are gone, slight berryish note too. quite sweet aroma. flavor is caramelly, malty, somewhat oxidized, Alc. better hidden than i feared, Quite amazing how well those germans keep themselves. Only faint vineous notes and the old hops reveal that this one is like 3 years old, and it s even a discount beer to begin with.
Clear amber of color with a beige head. An aroma of malt and toffee. A flavor of malt, bisquit and a weak bitterness.

Medium offwhite coarseish head doesn�t last. Reddish brown body with light carbonation. Fruity papery alcoholic aroma with oily meaty notes. Sweet-dryish malty dusty taste with roasty alcoholic wooden notes. Full-bodied. Sharpish mouthfeel with some alcohol heat. Dryish wooden papery roasty aftertaste with dandelion notes. It�s OK, but not very good. &#400.33l bottle from some supermarket in Kiel.&#41

Canned. Amber colour with small white fluffy head. Aroma is alcohol, caramel malts, some bready malts, metal and also mild sugary notes. Flavour is sweet alcohol, some caramel and bready malts and that�s pretty much it. 9% in this one feels quite much burning...
Can at Leif, Ringsted. Dark orange with a small head. Aroma heavy malty (caramel). Flavor moderate to heavy sweet. Almost full body, with lot�s of alcohol.
33cl bottle @ Germany. Pours an clear amber with a small white head. Nose is sweet and cloying of sugar and bread. Fruit, caramel and alcohol. Unbalanced & alcoholic.

Bottle. The aroma is sweet-alcoholic, a little bit malty. The small yellow brown fizzy head disappears fast, the body is red and clear. The taste is medicinal bitter, especially in the finish. The body is dry with normal carbonation and a medium body.
Golden coloured. Neutral aroma. Light bodied - actually quite watery mouthfeel, not much flavour, low bitterness.
tap @ beer museum (prague) golden colour, normal body, average carbonated, fruity, hoppy, malty, bittersweet, fresh, easy to drink

Lots of dark fruit, dark chocolate, some alcohol and oxidation on the nose. Pours dark brown, almost black with no head. Nice flavors of dark fruit, a touch of light tartness, dark chocolate, roasted malts in the background and throughout. Caramelly sweetness as well.
