Flavors of vanilla, honey and white grape. Medium body is smooth and dessert-like, but not cloying. Dangerously well-hidden 10.5%.

Sampled at 3rd annual RI Brewfest. Clear yellow appearance, with an aroma of a moderate honey with some floral hints. Flavor has a lot of sugar, with the honey and a mild floral. The alcohol is well hidden. My only negative is the thinner �watery� body. Thinner than most meads. Not knowing the cost per bottle I would say this is more of a bargain type mead.
Aroma of honey and notes of orange. A straw yellow pour preceeds a taste of honey, and orange, ad some florals. Overall, this is one of my favorite meads.
Aroma of white wine, honey, acidic. Brilliant golden honey color. Sweet, slick , cough syrup like texture, somewhat dry finish. Eucalyptus, honey, orange blossom
Just awful. Not my kind of beer. Even wheat.................................

Imperial pint can from RusBeerShop in Moscow. Pours almost clear gold with a small white head. Aroma is slightly fruity, yeast and grain. Taste is light sweet, malt, again some fruits. Light bitter finish.
Malty aroma, malt and bready taste. Just a smooth honey sweet malty lager with simple flavour. Drinkable and satisfying.
Pours light golden, malty aroma with notes of hops, smooth taste of malt and bready notes. Smooth Lithuanian from some beershop in Sikupilli, Tallinn.

Gubernija Extra art drink series. Smell- weak to medium, some hops, bit of non alco feel. Foam- thin, soft, not watery, some weak bitter notes. Medium foam, cant pour 0.33 into 0.5. White, creamy color. Sticky. Appearance- quite clear yellow, with bit of orange. some carbonation inside but no bubbles at sides. Taste- simple, citrus, light, refreshing, some hops. Aftertaste weak bitter notes. Quite drinkable beer, refreshing.

Butelka 330 ml w ciemnym szkle z d�ugim terminem przydatno�ci. W zapachu s�odowe, troch� mokrego kartonu, przywodzi na my�l koncernowe lagery. W smaku na szcz�cie odrobin� lepsze od typowego eurolagera, s�odowe, ale okraszone wyra�n� zio�ow� goryczk� upodabniaj�c� je do czeskiego pilsa. Jako ca�o�� piwo jest jednak przeci�tne.

Pours clear deep gold with tall rocky off-white head. Aroma: cereals, light lager yeast, restrained esters. Light to medium body. Taste: malty, clean, with light hoppiness to it. Some honey. Spicy ending. Light bitterness. Drinkable.

275ml bottle (Snow@ChrisO) Has a rather odd aged aroma. Rather unsurprising, given its ~22 years of age. You can tell it was at one point a sweet brown ale. But the taste has suffered a bit with age. Dull. But thanks for sharing it, it�s a lesson not to age 3.1% beers 22 years!

Bottle 275ml. @ ChrisO Snow Tasting. [ Vintage ???? ]. Clear medium brown colour with a average, frothy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, caramel, oxidide, light bread, nutty, dark fruit. Flavour is moderate sweet with a average duration, bread, oxidide. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft to flat. 20+ years and only 3.1% not bad. [20130120]

Bottle at the ChrisO Snow Tasting, London - thanks to Chris, I presume. Pours clear ruby with a fine, off-white foam. Big oxidised aroma, light caramel. Light sweet flavor with semi-dark malts, raisins and toffee. And of course there�s an overriding character of oxidation. Light bodied with fine carbonation. Moderate dryness in the finish, some dusty caramel, cardboard. It isn�t completely bad when you consider this beer�s age (20+ years, I would say) and that this is NOT a beer I would ever consider aging; but it certainly isn�t good, either.

Bottle at ChrisO Snow Tasting, thanks to Chris. Nice to see waxing was popular at Young�s back in the day.... It pours deep brown with a small white head. The nose is musty, oxidised, wood, but actually has some dark fruit in there (prune, plum & cherry). The taste is not so good... cardboard, old wood, musty, oxidised, and a hint of caramel/brown sugar with a dryish finish. Not much to it really. Glad I tried it, but it was a challenge to get through a small serving.

Bottle, big thanks to Chris at Chriso Snow Tasting 20/01/13. Wax seal - god knows how old this is/was! Mid brown with a thin off white head that clings to the edge. I don�t blame it - bet it thought it would never be drunk! Nose is malty, nutty, wood, oxidisation evident and no surprise, background boozey notes. Taste comprises malts, heavily oxidised notes, treacle, syrup, sweet sugary meh meh. Medium bodied, a surprising amount of carbonation for the age of this bottle, sweet finish. 20 years old perhaps, just about palatable but glad to be sharing this 275ml bottle !
Bottle at Chriso Snow Tasting. Brown clear thin white head. oxidised aroma. some vague brown syrupy stuff. i drank it. its the vest i can say

275ml bottle from Shropshire. Vintage 1990. Opened with a healthy hiss, and then poured with a generous head. I looked in the bottle and there is a decent ring of yeast at the bottom - when the remaining beer is swirled over the yeast it foams up nicely. This must have had a dose of sugar in the bottle in the tradition of the Southern England bottled milds which were termed Brown Ales. Foamy carbonation in the mouth with a taste of milky chocolate. Really quite lovely. As the bitterness came from the roasted malt this doesn�t have much in the way of hops, so hasn�t suffered from aging at all. Indeed there�s a pleasant creamy softness to it all. Firm dry finish with chocolate giving way to coffee and then to a smoky tea flavour such as lapsang souchong. Perhaps a little simple, and without the exciting sweetness it would have had when younger, this is like Mann�s Original Brown Ale or Mackeson Stout but with the seriousness and maturity that comes with age. Damn good.

the aroma is malty and herbal with shades of grain, hay and some grasses... the taste is malty and cereal with notes of grain, straw, white bread and some grasses... the aftertaste is dry and bitter...

[50cl bottle from a liquor store in Buena Park, CA.] A pale straw coloured pour with a loose white head; floral aroma with some yeast; odd floral taste, quite dry and not unattractive with a grainy body and a touch of grassy bitterness; and then something spicy in the finish. Odd, I won't be rushing to get another one.
Getrunken auf einer Kaukasusreise im Sommer 2014 Ein einfaches, karges Bier, das nichts falsch macht, aber auch nicht viel ist.
Faint floral hop aroma, white lacing, classic seltzery Pils: slightly sweet malt, lingering hop bitterness, brilliant light straw color.
At folklife festival. Pours clear, white head. Rich bready aroma. Taste is bready, apple corn , very light hops. Aroma slightly better than average pale lager, taste slightly worse. Light mouthfeel.
THT May - Kermis Leaving. Bottle shared. Clear golden with white head. Sweet malts, bitter earthy and vegetal pils hops. Moderate sweet and bitter. Under medium body and soft carbonation.
Shared at Kermis�s leaving THT. Pours a clear pale golden. Bland, grains, bread with a heavy grassy note. Ugh.
Bottle at tht. Aroma of malt and lager yeast. Taste has sweet malt and lager yeast. Bad.

Bottle at Kermis� last THT. Clear pale yellow with small white head. Light pils palts, soft hop extract, light honey, dusty herbs, rotten lemon. Medium sweet and bitter. Over light bodied. Standard pale lager.
Bottle - pours yellow white head - nose and taste of corn, skunk, light metal and malt - medium body

A "continental" style pils, good head, initial flavour is not unpleasant - that is, if you can find any flavour at all. Lightly hopped - in fact, lightly anything. Metallic aftertaste. At least this one is slightly better than Gran's "Premium" pilsner.

Can from Rema 1000. Clear straw yellow. Notes of malts and butterscotch, floral and slightly citrusy. Fizzy carbonation, some body, taste of bread, malts and butterscotch. Decent Pilsner that actually dare to have some diacetyl. Balanced bitterness. An interesting commercial Pilsner for an ok price.
The foam stabilitiy is medium, the bodydeep brown. The aroma is sourish, malty. the taste is darkmalty, sourish. Nah
Botella 500ml Color cobrizo con espuma de color beige,moderada,resistente.Aroma malta tostada,caramelo,frutas secas,nueces.Sabor dulce,oleosa,malta tostada,caramelo,frutas secas,nueces,pan negro

Butelka 0,5 litra, zakupiona w Kauflandzie. Barwa ciemno-rubinowa, klarowna. �rednia, zbita, be�owa piana, kt�ra opada w umiarkowanym tempie, zostawiaj�c troch� �lad�w na szkle. Aromat wyra�nie chlebowy, palony. W smaku mocno chlebowe. Goryczka �rednia.
Bottle. Clear amber pour with a beige head. Malty aroma. Taste is malt, caramel notes, nuts. Finish is a bit sweet.

Aroma: tons of caramel and malt; Appearance: clear, dark amber pour with thin white head; Taste: follows nose - way too much caramel with odd sour taste at end; Palate: heavy body with long, sweet and cloying finish; Overall: not as bad as feared, but still pretty gross.

2016 06 21 Butelka 0,5 l. Piana be�owa, obfita, ze �rednich i grubych p�cherzy, zostawia szcz�tkow� koronk�. Piwo jest koloru miedzianego, pod �wiatlo ciemnobursztynowego, klarowne. W aromacie nuty chleba razowego, karmelowe, opiekane, wyra�na metaliczno�� na minus. W smaku do�� wytrawne, minimalna s�odycz, nuty s�odowe, karmelowe, razowca, lekko zio�owe. Odczucie niskiej pe�ni i �rednio wysokiego wysycenia. Goryczka jest ma�o intensywna, kr�tka, lekko ziolowa.

25.04.2019 -- 0.5l bottle at kuvshin, kiev. pours a clear amber with no head. flat carbonation. aroma of toastrd malts, leaves, nuts, very malty bordering with prunes. flavour of dark bread, nuts, molasses, a hint of coffee. at least it is not too sweet.
Dark red color, almost no foam. Caramel notes in aroma. Sweet and slightly tart taste.

Found in bottle from euromarket in Asheville, NC. Pours a dark brown with a thin long lasting white head. Brief caramel with medium coffee notes. Very different than standard marzens but not near as bad as ratings suggest.
500 ml bottle. Clear chestnut brown color, good foam beige. The aroma is caramel malts, dried fruit. Taste is similar of brown sugar, caramel and barley. Sweet, syrupy texture.
Not the worst of the lagers around in SE Asia and definitely the recharge I needed between temples. An Angkor in Angkor. Bottle

[12oz bottle from Total Wines, Brea, CA.] A straw coloured pour with a fast fading white head; cereal aroma; sweetish with a cereal grain taste - despite the label saying malt; and a vague grassy bitterness to finish. Better than most south east asian lagers I've tried.

Can sample courtesy of Grumbo, many thanks Graham! Country #100. Yellow golden colour, white foamy head leaving some light lacing and aroma of malt, corn grain, molasses, honey, papery. Taste is sweet, malty, grainy, corn with some cardboard notes and light bitterness. Light bodied, foamy carbonation, tangy earthy light bitter finish. A bland lager.

Tuesday, October 1, 2019. Bottle, 33cL. 5%. Gift from Pascal ! Merci :) Home. A sparkling yellow clear beer with a medium white head ; few bubbles ; short retention ; ok lacing. Grainy notes, herbal note, water. Light sweet, medium dry refreshing. Light body, thin texture, soft gaseous, sweet dry short finish. Overall, disappointing.

6/10/2019. Can courtesy of Painy, cheers Martin! Pours clear gold with a white head. Aroma of corn, grain, sweet boiled jammy fruit and grass. Medium to heavy sweetness, very light bitterness. Moderate body, oily texture, average to soft carbonation. Sweet finish. Fair.

Can @ Slovak tasting 08/2019. Medium, white, quick diminishing head. Colour is gold, clear. Aroma is malty, caramel, bready, bit diacetyl. Taste is medium malty base, watery caramel, mineral, weak bitterness, medium carbonation, ok for country tick not for taste.
Bottle at a tasting. Quite clean, sweetish, corny, rather thin, characterless. Okay, drinkable on a beach.
Can, from my friend, many thanks. Golden color with small hit empty head. Aroma of malt, diacetyl, corn. Taste, corn, old malt, diacetyl, DMS.
Can at tasting, thanks Cuso. Malty aroma and taste, wet cardboard, light to medium bitter. Light to medium body, malty bitter finish. Not good.
County #122. Bottle at Slovak tasting 08/2019. Pours golden color, white head. Aroma of piss, malt. Taste is medium sweet, malty, caramel.
Bottle @ mr voon, Stockholm. Pours a amber colour beer with a medium head with a medium head. Fruity and malty with notes of citrus and yeast. Dry finish.
0,33 l. Bottle from Vrutak Zagreb. Amber color with white head. Herba, sweet, watery taste
Mahogany color . Medium-sized, off-white head. Malt , grain some herbs and caramel in the aroma. Moderately sweetness in taste. Interesting and very drinkable.
Brown with no head. Smell of cocoa. Chocolate and vanilla taste. It tastes good, but far away from the usual beer flavour.

Bottle. Color: Reddish amber, white head. Aroma: Malty with herbal and spicy hints, Light flowery hints. Taste: Rice, floral and herbal notes. Sweetish notes of flowers and strawberry. Moderate sweet and light to moderate bitter. Medium to above medium body, just below average carbonation. Mild mouthfeel. Something different than usual, nice to taste this rice beer, but no favorite for me.
If you don''t guzzel this beer it taste alot like vomit. Just swig it and enjoy the alcoholic properties.
Standard amber body and small head. Sweet apple juice aroma which thankfully doesn't carry over to the flavour. There's very little flavour at all, but it was cheap.
on tap@the brewery. very sweet stuff with some metho fumes. improved as it warmed with light peach and watermelon flavours. still pretty sweet
Tap@21st Amendment Brewery, restaurant and bar under the name "Mission Bay Maibock", bready sweeet malts, dryish finish, a little unconvincing, but drinkable.

Strong hop aroma for a Maibock but with only 25 IBUs. The aroma is much like St. Ides minus a few phenolic elements. Tastes primarily malty with strong cookie/cracker flavor and a distracting malt liquor metallic element at a low-medium effervescence. Tastes lighter than 6.2% ABV.
Cloudy and hoppy. Has some citrus notes. Only available on tap, and quite affordable. Try Piece Pizza along with it.
On tap at the brewery. Pours a cloudy ruby with no head. The aroma is strong berry and wheat. Medium mouth, jammy berry, light finish, good.

On tap at Johnny Brenda�s. Aroma is Kool Aid, oatmeal cookies, and malt. Pours dirty dark pink/red with a light carbonation and small pink head. Taste is fruit punch, cherry, strawberry, black cherry, and a big malt presence. Thankfully, it is not too sweet and drinks fairly cleanly. Certainly a necessary beer for many folks. Kind of exactly what I expected. Wouldn�t drain pour it but certainly not impressive.
Sampled at AC Beerfest (2014). Poured a reddish amber color with no head. Aroma of tart raspberries and not much else. Taste of tart raspberry seltzer water.

This liquid they call a raspberry ale is just something to pass by. It has a horribly unnatural sour aftertaste and its more like they dumped razzmatazz in it after brewing, rather than brewed with fruit. Perhaps the sour taste is the downstream taste provided by all the upstream sewage plants that ALL dump and overflow into the Schuylkill. At over $40 a case of cans, it doesn't work. Maybe $18 it could be sold along with the Four Locos. ---Rated via Rumors Bar Pottsville, PA 570.622.8687

From notes: Poured clear coppery-red, with a 2-finger bone-colored head. Light aroma of berry, with a woody note. Body is on the lighter side, yet lightly syrupy. Dry finish. Raspberry flavor, but more restrained than expected, with an earthy note at the back.

Really pungent berry aroma, ruby red color. First sip is fruit, but with a very dry finish. Not sweet at all, which is welcoming, but there is a sour note here that is really distracting to me (for some reason).

Hazy dark reddish brown with a thin rimming off-white head; soft sweet light aroma of raspberry; flava is of tart fresh raspberry jam and hints of wheat; feels light crisp fizzy almost ciderish; finishes softly sweet mainly tart just like a fresh red raspberry with some notes of wheat; this is much better than the Schuylkill Punch of a few years back
Reminds me of a water down New Glarus Raspberry Tart. Aroma and flavor are spot on. Raspberries are huge in this. Tart but sweet. Love the contrast. Beautiful looker. Just a very thin body.

Attractive 12 oz. can. I usually like Manayunk products but not this one. Very thin body with, as indicated, a tart but somewhst sweet flavor. Some folks may like this rather unique product but, for me, it was a drain-pour.
Light, slightly malty, with a candy-like fruit aroma. Thin at first, then a tart fruit flavor, leading to a bland finish.
Draft - pours yellow white head - nose and taste of dry bread, corn and light toast - light body
on tap at the brewpub - super pale in appearance. Just ok compared to all of their other beers. Better than a mass-produced light beer though.
Goldig, klar. Geruch leicht malzig. Im Geschmack dann leicht, dazu estrige Noten. F�r ein Leichtbier ganz gut.
Aroma schwach und haupts�chlich heftig, aber irgendwie auch erdig. Geschmack muffig und etwas nach frischem Efeu und alter Hefe.
From tap at the brewpub. Pours clear and golden yellow with a small white head. Aroma is mild citrusy and smooth fruity. Bitter, toasted malty and light grassy. Dry and bitter finish.
Dumbed down pilsner that is more of a miller lite clone then anything else. Light pale malts and minimal hop character. Light bodied. Nothing off, just nothing to enjoy.
On tap at brewery. Clear gold visible carbonation thin head. Faint yeasty nose. Light flavor finish is slightly dirty and lingers.
Straw yellow, somewhat translucent. Light bodied, nice lemony sweetness and small hop character. Mild corn taste. Barely an aftertaste but the light sweetness is refreshing. I like it
Pours clear gold with a light and airy white head. Aroma is grain and faint citrus notes. Taste is light bitters. Crisp finish, very light bodied.
Draft at the source. Pale yellow, huge white head. Peppery aroma. Taste is bitter straw. OK.
500ml bottle. Pours clear amber with a small off-white head. Aroma is toasted malt, caramel, biscuit. Taste is light sweet, nutty, caramel, a but earthy. Ok.

500ml bottle in 2015. I don�t know quite what it is about this beer, but I really don�t like it, and I never have. In bottle or cask. There�s a weird musty, but somehow sugary sweet aroma to it and the flavour really echoes that. I just get big candied peal mixed with cardboard.

Thanks minutemat for sharing! (Euro Summer Santa 2019). Clear amber body with a minimal vanishing ivory head. Aroma is fruity, floreal with biscuits and caramel notes. Taste is malty (caramel and toffee). Mild floreal and hoppy note. Mineral and mild hoppy finish. Medium body, soft carbonation oily texture.

zapach bardzo przyjemny, z�o�ony, s�odki, ale do�� subtelny, s�ody, s�odkie wypieki, lekkie toffi, lekki jasny karmel, mo�e odrobina jasnej kr�wki, do tego dobrze ukiszony tyto� i drewno. kolor g�eboki, br�zowo miedziany, klarowny, �adny, piana w kolorze z�amanej bieli, �rednio obfita i �rednio trwa�a. w smaku pe�ne i bogate, ale jednocze�nie do�� delikatne, lekko skarmelizowane s�ody, karmel, odrobina popio�u, przypieczona sk�rka od chleba, ale wszystko to zaskakuj�co lekkie, troszeczk� toffi, czarnego pieprzu, ziemi, tytoniu. goryczka niska, lekko drewniana, przyprawowa i tytoniowa z nut� karmelu. lekkie, ale bardzo bogate w ustach. nasycenie wysokie, du�o bardzo drobnych b�belk�w.

Bursztynowe klarowne, niska gesta biala piana. W aromacie chlebek, karmel, lekka nuta bialego wina. W smaku chlebek, troszke wieksza slodowosc, delikatna palonosc, karmel. Pod koniec wychodzi herbata oraz biale wytrawne wino. Odczucie w ustach przyjemne, lekki gaz, piwo lekkie, pelne smaku, jednak dosc spore odczucie alkoholowe jak na 4.8volt Ogolnie bardzo dobre wytrawne, w sam raz do obiadu.
Nice beer, I enjoyed drinking 4 of them, good session ale, nice colour and aromas
Malty caramel flavour, a little sweet some bitterness. Quite well balanced but not my taste, pours Amber with a fine white head. Ok.
Keg draught at the Bristol Hotel, Bristol (July 2013). Attractive dark amber body. Thin white head. Nose is bags of citrus, marmalade, fruit and spice. Bitter. Dry finish. Crisp mouthfeel.
Bottle from CO-OP, South Wales. Lightly fruity with a malty body and smooth finish. The taste of a malted milk dunked in a cup of tea, brewed and bottled.

Bottled chilled. What can I say about this wonderful bitter Amber, from cask to bottle always hits the spot. Perfect balance of bitter to malt on the palate with a satisfying finish. In a new world of ipa I still feel classics like this are hard to beat, highly recommended especially if you can find on cask.
Amber and well-topped. Hoppy malt nose. Well bittered, hefty malt goodness. Great substantial lager to accompany dinner.
A pretty odd beer. Deep amber-copper color, creamy colored head, slightly fruity malt aroma and flavor with a nice balance. Seems like a Vienna lager but too big for style.
Amber hue with a bone tinged head. Clean looking with a slight hop nose. Decent hop/malt balance. Decent, but unimpressive.
Pretty average lager, copper color, little to no head, similar to a Yuengling's but maybe not as good
Cut and paste all these mass produced beers would have a hard time telling any of them apart
Basically a watered down version of the original, just cereal grain on the nose, a hint of skunk, very light, not much flavor.
Bottle (Old Notes)-Pours a light clear golden with a small head. Aroma of corn and sweetness. Taste of the same. This light bodied brew is just another light calorie pale lager. Better than expected.
Can from discount bin. Just thin watery malt and corn soda, higher abv than most light beers.

Poured a light gold with a small head and lace. Not much aroma. What�s there is mainly corn/grains and malt. Taste was similar with corn/grain adjunts predominating at the start and a mild hop finishes it off. Palate was a bit thin. Overall, a typical macro-light that is similar to other Pabst �lights� that are brewed in Milwaukee by Miller.

Harder to find these days. Better than a lot of light beers that are out there. I�d take it over Bud Light or Miller Lite any day. It actually has some TASTE for a light beer...and okay taste at that. Too bad Heilemann ended up going under...Miller seems to have no interest in even selling this beer unless they have to.

Sampled at friend�s party and not much different than the full strength Special Export. Pours a light golden pale blonde brew with a fast dissolving white head that leaves behind a film and white ring. Aroma of light corn grits, citrus hops and a touch of green vegetables. Taste is light bodied, well carbonated with a popcorn malt flavor with a slight bitter character. Finish is crisp clean cut and no aftertaste. A very watered down lager. Remember to serve this at about 35F degrees or colder.

Served in a green bottle. Skunky-flavored beer originally from LaCrosse, Wisconsin. Staple of my college and early post-college days. Golden, small head, skunky beer smell that let you know it was there. Quite quaffable, actually. Watered-down version of the original.
I keep trying to get my friends to drink better beer but they like the cheapness of this one. Tastes of water and butt.
I couldn�t agree more with antisnobJP. This is one of those beers (Point Special is another) that people bitch about as they guzzle can after can on a hot day.

column1: Rock Bottom Scottsdale Gila Pale Ale
column5: (tap) From Scottsdale... well, it said it was this places speciality or something, but I thought it rather average. It was quite fine to drink, a decent pale ale, but I guess I was hoping for something better.

column1: Rock Bottom Scottsdale Gila Pale Ale
column5: Scottsdale: Light copper color with a lacing head. Very little hop presense, especially for a pale ale. Very uninspired.

column1: Rock Bottom Scottsdale Gila Pale Ale
column5: Amber color. Little head. Slightly sweet aroma. Start slightly sweet also. A little thin for an IPA. Finish was hoppy wuth a good bitterness. The marketing stuff says it is citrusy....I did not pick that up.

column1: Rock Bottom Scottsdale Gila Pale Ale
column5: Pours a nice amber color, what head there was, beige, fair lace, malt nose, the start slightly malt sweet, the top thin, the finish was over carbonated, dry, acidic, but had a nice "Hop Head" finish or it would have been a total loss.

column1: Rock Bottom Arrowhead Road Runner Brown Ale
column5: (on draught at Rock Bottom Arrowhead). Pours a clear mahogany with a khaki head. No real lacing and moderate carbonation. Wow! Pungent. Weird fruity and malt notes. Taste is sweet with caramel and some roasty bitterness. Thin bodied and oily texture. Didn�t like this one at all. Just weird.

column1: Rock Bottom Arrowhead Road Runner Brown Ale
column5: Pours mahogany brown w/ a medium sized head. Nice residual lacing. Malty, mildly sweet aroma. Medium nectar w/ ample residual effers. Very mellow w/ mild nuances of malted cocoa. Posseses a strong flavor impact. The finish is bittered nicely.

column1: Rock Bottom Arrowhead Road Runner Brown Ale
column5: Had this at the Ahwatukee location. Maple syrup color with a good head and lacing. Heavy, sweet malt aroma. Flavor is sweet malts with a light roasty finish.

column1: Rock Bottom Arrowhead Road Runner Brown Ale
column5: Full malt aroma, a little hoppy in the end. A pleasant smooth character a little light in the mouthfeel. Finish was dry and then bittersweet. The no carbonation from the cask made this more enjoyable I think, too drink.

column1: Rock Bottom Arrowhead Road Runner Brown Ale
column5: (tap) I rated this 1.8 on Jun 11... Hmm, I had it again and am increasing the rating. This really hit the spot after playing golf, maybe not overflowing with flavor, but a good beer to drink, solid malty character.

column1: Rock Bottom Arrowhead Road Runner Brown Ale
column5: Scottsdale: Dark copper color and a light nutty aroma. Semi-sweet body is thin and watery. This is an easy-drinking beer, but is dull and uninteresting.

column1: Rock Bottom Arrowhead Road Runner Brown Ale
column5: hop nose, extreme hops balanced by choclate.................................

column1: Rock Bottom Arrowhead Road Runner Brown Ale
column5: Not bad. I had it with the Southwest Chicken and Shrimp Pasta at the Rock Bottom in Scottsdale. Nothing new Newcastle.

column1: Rock Bottom Arrowhead Road Runner Brown Ale
column5: Brown Ale. A head that didn't stick around too long. Sweet malty/toasty nose. A fairly sweet beer that was pretty thin. A good amount of bittering in the finish. Nothing spectactular. The pizza they make with it though was good ;)

column1: Rock Bottom Arrowhead Road Runner Brown Ale
column5: Deep brown in color, beige head and quite nice lace. Nose sweet, caramel, lightly toasted grains. Sweet front, the top thin, the finish had a nice bit of hops, dry, moderate carbonation, slightly acidic, maybe a bit to sweet.
The best beer they offer. Good head, not too thick. Chocolate and toffee hints. No lasting flavor kills the rating. A great way to end a dinner if you still have room.
Pours dark and rich with chocolate and roasted aromas. A little thin for a great stout...lacks depth. But good smooth stout, if you like it a little sweeter.

Pours midnight brown w/ ample froth. Good head retention w/ full, residual lacing. Aroma has a defined molases component. Medium nectar w/ silky residual effers. This is very creamy. A dry stout w/ defined molases playing a big role. Mildly roasted. Moderately bitter leathery hops showing through. The finish is bittered w/ leather and lingers a while.
On tap in Phoenix, AZ. Almost black in colour with a small head. Palete a bit too thin. Roasted and malty with notes of chocolate and coffee.

This beer is a deep dark brown color with a hint of ruby around the edges when held up to the light. It is topped by a creamy brown colored head. I smell aromas of burnt caramel, lightly roasted coffee and dark chocolate. This beer is soft and creamy up front with a bit of sweet malt that moves to a roast coffee note and then finishes with a hint of astringent roasted grain huskiness. This is a nice, light quaffable stout.
Had this at the Ahwatukee location. Black with a nice thick head and lacing. Roasty chocolate aroma. Flavor is roasty chocolate with a smooth creamy finish. Body is a bit too watery.

tap at brewery-pours almost black with a big foamy tan head. big char/roast aroma-pretty one dimensional. lots of burnt notes here. flavors are similar, but the body lacks sufficient depth. flavors are bigtime char and roast. not bad, but not great either. probably the best beer at this location.
{Ahwatukee), Pours your typical dark stout with minimal head. Decent fresh malty roasted aroma. Average mouthfeel, a little sweet and creamy. Like Gusler said, "begginners stout."

(Ahwatukee) R.B. Very dark pour, the head diminished quicker than I would have liked. Thin mouth feel, with good amounts of roast espresso, coffee, and burnt malt flavors, some creaminess, and overall somewhat unfulfilling. Very drinkable, but not outstanding.
(tap) Typical stout. The head was not as frothy as other stouts I've had. It had the nice deep color stouts have. But alot of stouts have, this lacked in much character or flavor, quite a thin beer.
as hoppy an IPA as i've tried....i thought this beer was pretty darn good...

7/25/03: on tap at the smokehouse, served with a lemon. pleasant lemon aroma. cloudy, lemon yellow body (possibly a bit too yellow for the style). some lacing. wheat taste with only a slight bite (i think that a hefe should have more of a yeast bite than this one has). overall so-so.

An opaque yellow body with a thick, white head. Some lacing. Smells of lemons, yeast and bananas. Lots of lemon and yeast in the flavor. Nice crisp wheat bite at the end. Smooth and full on the palate but not heavy.

This beer poured a cloudy straw color. It formed a nice white head that didn't hold but left some nice lace. It had an aroma of hops and some citrus. The flavor was of hops and very light hint of citrus. It had a light finish. Overall, not an extremely hoppy beer, which I like.
Pretty good for a Hefeweizen - but I must admit, I'm not a big fan of the style. I don't care for my beer to be served with a lemon! Next they'll want to stick a little umbrella in it!
Similar to Pyramid's Hefeweizen. This is a light, clean pineapple colored beer with a fruity aroma. Served with a lemon.

What an interesting beer. Maybe too gimmicky for some, but I thought it was spot on for a sweet stout/dessert beer. Really strong iced coffee and cream nose and tongue. These weave well with the low alcohol to deliver a flavor unlike any I have had before. Well nuanced and fun.
tap. black with small head. huge coffee -- i�ve had other stouts with elements of coffee, but this is way more coffee forward. dry finish. smooth.

Location: Draft at the Brewpub, Princeton, 11/17/13, as Small World C&C Stout (listed at 5.7%) Aroma: The nose is full of dark coffee along with some roasted and burnt malts Appearance: It pours a dark brown color with a smooth and creamy brown head and heavy lace Flavor: The flavor is heavy coffee, not particularly sweet, but quite roasty and a little burnt Palate: This one is very smooth and creamy on the mouth with a pretty much flat carbonation Overall Impression: I thought this was a pretty solid beer. It has a really nice, smooth, almost cask like feel to it, but it is served very (probably too) cold. Nice beer for fans of coffee fronted stouts, and very drinkable at around 5%.
Pours dark brown with a creamy tan head. Smells of coffee (from Small World), dark breads. Taste is sweet, mildly bitter - coffee with cream, sweet cocoa.

A: Pours pitch black with a creamy, Guinness-looking head. Retention is excellent and the head is light brown S: Delicate, lactose, light coffee, roasty and toasty malts. Seems really balanced and delicious T: Lots of lactose, coffee grounds, caramel, toffee, roasted malts, and light cocoa MF/D: Smooth, creamy, medium body, velvety texture. Really drinkable and sessionable at 5%

On draft at Triumph in Princeton. Pours a coca cola brown with a creamy beige head. Creamy beer but the coffee flavour could have been more robust. Weak aroma of coffee and not much else. Flavour of watered down coffee, malt, milk, sugar. Really bland flavour.

On tap at the Triumph Brewing Company in Philadelphia, served in a shaker. Pours deep black with a creamy tan head. Head has great retention and lace. On the nose, the aroma is primarily coffee, with burnt malts, herbs and a touch of earth. The flavour is coffee bitter throughout with a slight sweetness. It is nearly balanced, but it accomplishes this with coffee; the hops are hidden. The finish is clean. On the palate, is it full in body with a creamy texture and slight carbonation. Overall, this is not a great stout. It is too light in body, so that it feels watery and empty. It also overdoes the coffee--I feel like I might get a caffeine rush! A larger malt profile would be nice. 2010-08-02
Nitro Draft @ triumph princeton. Black pour with some tan head. Sweet chocolate and coffee aroma with some light cream essence. Bitter coffee and chocolate flavors. and lactose flavors.
Dark brown black with a creamy tan head. Aroma and taste are all coffee, but the beer loses it at extreme undervarbonation and mouthfeel.
11th October 2008. GABF. Smooth palate. Toasted malt. A little bit of cream but not much. A little porterish. More cream please!

column2: Garden City, New York, United States
column5: This beer deserves some credit. It's partially cloudy and has considerable color. Massive flavor for a lager, yet mild enough to be consumed in quantity. Nice aroma, too. The Saaz is muted but the Munich malt is clearly present.

column2: Garden City, New York, United States
column5: Amber color, decent balance, below average lager ..........................
I bought a sixer at Hatch�s package store 2 yrs ago. i enjoyed this beer. gosh i wish they could make it again.

Deep orange- iron rust/ cloudy- yeasty; Nice sized head with alrge bubbles?!; Aroma is appetizing in an unsettling way- like your own farts. Lots of action on the tongue- malt, nild hops, metal, coconut (I hate coconuts), all in the first sip. Possibly a bad bottle. BLAH!

Auburn color with a well maintained off white head. A rather fruity and somewhat caramelly aroma. This ale starts off very bitter on the sides of the tongue and moves to being somewhat malty as the finish smoothes out. The last of a case bought last year on the Cape. I'll be in Falmouth looking for this again in December!

From a 22 oz bottle, different label than in your stock photo. Poured into a Caracole Saxo chalice. Pours amber-copper with minimum head and lace...in fact there was barely a fizz when I popped this cap. Minimal carbonation and moderate mouthfeel. Flavors of rich malts, caramel, sorghum, sweet prunes and raisins. Overall big and rich and sweet...bottle may have lost the appropriate carbonation.

"kinda sorta doesn�t work as a barleywine - the weird mix of citrus and vanilla/caramel/oak makes it not fit the style, per se. but - as an overall beer, it was quite tasty and unique. the feel was excellent."

Hazy copper with a thin ring of head. Aroma is strong and malty boozy, with some burnt caramel and rich nutty stone fruit. Flavor is just a bit too hot and bitter, with some earthy floral hoppiness throughout and a big boozy malt backbone. A great and flavorful sipper, just a bit 2-dimensional and hot.

On tap at the brewery. Dark orange, brownish amber and hazy with a small head. Malty caramel aroma with light alcohol. Sweet, strong and lightly bitter. Medium to full body with a oily, creamy texture and low carbonation. Finishes on the sweet side. Nice, my favorite GCB to date. Update: 2013 vintage. Similar to the above. Rich, malty and smooth. Good English style barleywine
Well-aged bottle (2008), provenance unknown. Copper-amber pour, oxidized hop nose as expected for the age, sweet honey and raisin, slightly sour, some alcohol burn. Pretty tasty all in all.

Pour out of 12 oz bottle, dark ruby red almost brown with thin ring of off white head, aroma brings notes of big toffee, caramel, some dark fruits with hints of raisin, touch of heat in there as well with a hint of earth and nutty notes as well. Taste is a mix of sweet caramel, toffee, and a nice vanilla note, some even slight marshmallow notes with fruity dark fruits, hint of cocoa powder and chocolate notes as well, hints of some slight earth finishing fairly sweet, but little to no heat on the taste. Pretty nice! Would like to try one with a year or two of age.
Bottled. A hazy amber beer with a thin beige head. The aroma has notes of over ripe fruits. The flavo ris sweet iwht notes of malt, caramel, alcohol, and over ripe fruits.
33 cl can @ home. Pours clear brown with a white head. Aroma and flavour are malt and caramel - with a slightly smooth finish.

500ml bottle brewed in Germany at 5.5%. Dark, dark brown reddish amber, pretty clear though. Good-sized head, fair duration. It's a dark lager and it smells like a dark lager - imagine a typical lager aroma shifted down an octave (or two!) - damn thing nearly smells like toasted soda bread. Low-moderate carbonation. Grassy lager hops and there's a lager malt in there too, but also roasted malts and toffee malts, biscuit malts and maybe even a bit of chocolate in there to boot. Classic dunkel, itself a classic style. Very enjoyable, as a somewhat sedate drink - no song and dance in this glass. The German equivalent of an old-school brown ale. Has lager's refreshing aspects while bringing a multiplicity of malts to the table. This style really ought to be more popular outside of its homeland! Pleasantly thick mouthfeel lets you savour the nuanced sweetness and malty flavour, but unlike a stout it's got more hops, and light and refreshing ones at that.

Bottle from the Offie, Leicester, drunk at home. Mid-brown and translucent with a quickly dissipating beige head. Light aroma of chocolate malt, caramel, carob. Tastes sweet like most Dunkels, but there's an almost immediate bitterness, yielding notes of berry skins, bittersweet cooking chocolate. Light mouthfeel, carbonation is medium to heavy. I'm liking this one.

Butelka. Ciemny,mahoniowy kolor z rubinowym refleksem. Piana bia�a ,obfita opada do�� szybko. Aromat s�odowy,sporo karmelu ,toffi oraz nut czekolady, w smaku palony s��d, karmel,czekolada, w tle pieczywo razowe,sk�rki chlebowe. Oleiste o ma�ym wysyceniu.

Bottle. Clear dark red, thick, creamy, generally stable, off-white head, some lacing. Aroma malty, roasty, caramel, a little nuts. Taste full, sweetish, roasty. Carbonation medium to high, tingling. Bitterness medium, roasty, adequate. Aftertaste roasty, malty, a little bit herbal, liquorice. Not bad.
From old tasting notes. Bright amber orange color. Beige head is bubbly and tight. Soft fruity malt nose. Light tangy malt flavor hints at berries and orange peel.
355 ml bottle from The Beer Store in Monticello, New York This stuff seems like most of there beers. Just thier normal beer with flavoring. This time it is some kind of berry. Not great
Mildly sweet malts and mild berry flavor. Not bad but a bit thin, similar to most Saranac beers.
Pours amber in the glass. Nose and taste of all kinds of berries, honey and malts. Rated 6/17/02
Bottle. Pours an amber body with a thin lacing. Sweet berries with a malty backbone and a dull dry finish. Still pretty bland despite the name.

Well what can I say? It�s a fruit beer. Pours an amber body with an average sized head and some lacing. Nothing really stands out. Aroma is sweet, somewhat malty and full of berries. Raspberries, blackberries and pretty much whatever other berry you can think of dominates the flavor. It is pretty smooth though, without the tangy sour mouthfeel fruit beers tend to offer, but it�s still the worst of the Saranac�s I�ve tried so far. I guess I just don�t like fruit beers... or anything that can possibly resemble a wine cooler.

12 oz. bottle. Pours a light amber color with a medium white head that diminishes quickly. Very strong berry nose and cherry, smells amazing. Taste is very fizzy and pretty flat but a decent overall flavor. A decent summer beer in my opinion overall.

Date: 04/13/1997 Mode: Bottle Source: Sherlocks, GA light amber with a slight redish hue, whispy head, sweet malt aroma with slight berry essence, light body and malt flavor, just a touch of berryness Aroma: 4/10; Appearance: 3/10; Flavor: 2/10; Palate: 4/10; Overall: 5/20 Rating: 1.5/5.0 Score: */4 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.

Yeast aroma and a little like butt. Amber color, no head. Yeasty berry flavor with alcohol, but not very beery. Not very good either. There�s an average amount of hops on the palate, which is the best thing I can say about this beer. I doubt it�s a freshness issue since I had a fantastic hefeweizen from the same summer mix pack.
Of all the beers in the Summer Sampler 12 pack this is the only one that I would care to have more of. Its fruity, but not to sweet. As good as I could have asked for with a fruit beer.

29/9/2019. Can courtesy of Painy's travels, cheers! Pours clear bright gold with an average size foamy short lasting white head. Aroma of corn syrup, sweet malt, hops, sweet fruit, light caramel and grass. Medium plus sweetness, light to moderate bitterness. Moderate body, oily texture, average to spritzy carbonation. Crisp finish but turned a bit watery. Pretty good, certainly best of the pale lagers Painy brought back.
330ml Dose. Klar und golden mit minimaler Schaumkrone. Getreidig. Bisschen Malz. Fad!
A light beer, not toffee tasting like Hanoi, not bier blonde tasting like Saigon, avoid the beer snobs and try it, not a bad beer at all
330 ml can from market in Vietnam. Yellow color with white head. Little malt flavor, slight bitternes.
330ml can @ 5.0% ABV. Pours clear gold with a small white head. Aroma is malt and corn. Taste is the same. Usual minor bitter finish. Another exotic lager.
Can at Vietnam Airlines flight. Clear pale yellow, smooth white head. Nose some mild Belgian-style yeast (quite interesting in a lager), taste mainly on the sweet side.
Lichtgeel bier met weinig schuim. Smaak is licht bitter hoppig. Best er nog aardig bier als het warm is.
From a 330 ml can purchased in Sapa Town. The aroma is of corn and wet grain.the taste is thin sweet malt.
From a 330 ml can purchased in Sapa Town. Aroma of corn and wet grain. Flavors are of sweet malt. One of the least pleasant pale ales from Vietnam.

On draught (5/12/05). Light brown color and clear. Small head. The aroma is malty with some hops. The flavor is quite nice. It has a very nice balance with the sweetness & bitterness. I had to have a second one. :-)
Some head and lacing. Color was nice and the flavor was smooth, but rather weak
The weakest thing that's ever called itself a "brown ale". Watery, only slightly more to drink than the blond. I tried to register something on my tongue with it but I just couldn't.

You've got to be kidding me! This stuff came from the same place that brewed all those beers whose samples I could barely finish?? Quite nice! Yes, it is a somewhat feminine stout, but it's honestly quite good. Prominently vanilla, which fades into a more coffee flavor in the finish. The only beer from LJ's I've had so far that I'll buy a glass of. I might even go for a growler if I didn't have so many bottles of homebrew in my fridge that I'm not too eager to drink.

Many thanks for this beer to Jacek Wigier (wineofdreams@gmail.com). Bottle 375ml. Piwo ma mila i puszysta spora piane, trwala, co ju� robi wrazenie, jasna barwa, zapach pilsnerowo- lagerowy wiec specjalnie nie ma o czym pisa�. W smaku ju� powiem ze jak na globalnego lagera jest calkiem niezle, bije sporo piw w tym gatunku i nie jednego egzotyka zw�aszcza. Fajna butelka, Nazwa Bitter tu pasuje bo gozkawo jest, ma�o, bardzo ma�o slodowo. Jedno z najciekawszych zaskoczen smakowych je�li chodzi o piwa egzotyczne
Bottle from Beers of Europe. Low carbonation, sweet malt with some bitter hop to balance. OK beer.
355ml can from beersofeurope.co.uk. Gold colour with large white head. Sweet malt, watery, light bready, light lemon, light corn, paper / cardboard.
Clear golden beer with small white head. Aroma is grassy and malty. Taste is sweet malty and some bitter. Light body. Overall simple beer, but ok after sauna.

Where and how: new country # 105, bottle 375ml ml @ home Aroma nice hop profile herbal greens with mild floral backing Appearance : Top: dense, snowy white top with good lace on glass. Base: almost clear amber gold. Palate : medium bodied, average lighter carbonation. Taste:malty with good substance, hops less pronounced here. Slight creamy softness and hint of cardboard, but this was minor. Better than expected.

Sampled from a bottle. Copper colour with a whitish head. Quite sweet flavour with low carbonation and very little bitterness or hop flavour. Quite pleasant, but not much character. Best served cold as a cooling drink for summer.
On tap at resort, Fiji. Fills a glass with clear gold and white froth. Grass, grain and slight bitterness. Good to drink on holiday. Bula.
Very run of the mill commercial bitter. No highlights to be found here! At least it's cheap... ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from fijistore.co.uk. Pours dark amber with a frothy bubbly off-white head. Aroma of malt, caramel, fruit, hop and molasses. Heavy sweetness, moderate to light bitterness. Medium body, sticky texture, soft carbonation. Finish is sweet and malty. Not bad.
Sampled at GTBF 2006: Amber, big stable golden head. Big piney and orangepeel hop nose. Light toast, oranges, herbs, gras. Sand endnote. Medium body. Fruity and nice.
"a little more punch than your average amber ale, that�s for sure. I�m not sure thats better, but it�s not worse. darker, hoppier, with a hint of spice. fairly aggressive. recommended."

Bottled@Monks Caf� Wallingatan, Stockholm (backlog from 2011). Deep amber colour, small off-white head. Aroma is mild floral notes along with some sweet and bready maltyness. Mild toffee as well. Flavour is toffee, sweet malts, mild bready notes along with some slight floral, grassy and a bit cardboardy notes.
Deep amber pour with a cream head. Nose is heavy caramel, light hops, sweet, sticky, and bread. Nice on the palate, very sweet, chewy malts, faint bitterness from the old hops.

Leading up to beer 666 for me, I feel a need to tame it with Redemption Red. Clear and very dark amber with a tan head. Aroma of dark berries or cherries. Taste is very malty with chalky dirt flavors along with flavors of dark fruits. There�s a good bitterness in the finished mixed along with more cherry flavor.

Pours a dark brown color with a thick white head and lots of lacing. Aromas are sour jolly rancher and floral hops. The taste is lightly hopped water, some caramel malts, and a slight sour taste. It�s pretty thin and not all that enjoyable.

Pour is more of a dark red with a small tan head. Aroma is roasted malt with a little chocolate in there. Flavor is more of a chocolate with a little caramel malt toward the end. Nothing over the top good but this is a fairly decent red ale

Nicely hopped clean pine/medicinal aroma. For a red ale it pours brown. Upfront toasty malt flavor with a dry bitter aftertaste. Overall, it�s decent. Not much that stood out but at least it�s drinkable.
Pours ruby brown with thick creamy tan head and foamy lacing. Notes of roasted malt and licorice. Taste is a bit harsh and bitter.

Poured from bottle. Slight floral nose. Pours a flat red-brown with very little head. Flavor is overwhelmingly burnt toast with very few other notes. Tastes like someone took a flamethrower to a bag of caramels.
22oz bottle. Poured a black color with a medium sized tan head. Roast, some coffee, and chocolate.
Sampled at GTBF/Tucson trip 2006: Black hole. Creamy brown head. Big chocolate. Roasted, light nutted. Creamy mouthfeel. Chocolate aftertaste.
can�t really taste the honey, but it seems to lend itself to the exceptionally smooth body of this beer. other than that, it�s a good-but-not-great stout. recommended."

Bottle. Pours a deep black with a huge tan head. Aroma of toasted malt, chocolate, coffee, brown sugar. Rich taste, of sweet and bitter chocolate, coffee, malt, caramel. Lingering sweet chocolate and malt. Nice.
Very dark brown pour, a light brownish head. Roasted aroma, some light peaty notes, molasses, raisins. Flavor is light smoke, roast, light epsresso, and a bit of a metallic note.

Tasted on 12/29/11 from a 22oz bomber bottle purchased at Binny�s Lincoln Park. Pours a completely opaque, nearly black, dark brown with a thin tan head that recedes to nothing more than a thin collar of lace. The nose is milk chocolate, smoked malt, dark chocolate, coffee, and a sour, lactic aroma. The flavor is more sour than anything else, with lemon juice, with all of the classic chocolate and coffee stout notes underlying, and some light dust and smokiness. The body is pretty thin, and somewhat watery, with lively, fizzy carbonation, and a long sour lemon, dark chocolate, coffee, dusty, and smokey finish. Normally I wouldn�t rate a beer that is this obviously infected, but I have had this beer several times over the past few years from what I assume to be different batches (there is no batch info anywhere on the bottle), but it has been soured every time, not to mention, it is still pretty enjoyable.

Dark black color with light brown suede head. Getting an overwhelming sour feel with aroma/taste. Very toasty malt, dark chocolate coffee aroma, but sour still there. Taste of bitter chocolate, overtoasted malts and unsweetened chocolate. Sour throughout. Bitter dry finish. Not bad, just didn�t like the sourness.

Bottle. Pours near black with a beige head. Roasty and sweet malty aroma with notes of honey and chocolate. The flavor has a nice balance of bitter roasted malts and sweet chocolatey notes, has some light brown sugar, and ends with a smokey note. Solid.

Bottle, somewhere during RBSG, July 2006 (but not at the Grand Tasting - can only assume some kind soul opened and shared it at some point). Almost black with just a slight ruby tinge. Quite roasty. Some chocolate and coffee. Not the biggest strong but quite tasty and surprisingly drinkable.

(bomber, 5/4/10). Black color. Large dark tan head, which is mostly diminishing. Moderate roasted malt aroma, with light sourness. Flavor of the same, with more light sour and light chocolate. Avg duration. Light sour & bitter finish. Slick/thin texture. Soft to moderate carbonation. Spare lacing.

column1: Rio Salado Monsoon Maerzen Amber Lager
column5: 12oz bottle(10/02)-A light amber body with a decent white head and a lot of floaties and an aroma of malt and slight hops. Taste of the same with some caramel and sweetness. Not bad.

column1: Rio Salado Monsoon Maerzen Amber Lager
column5: Tart and tangy, a bit like pickled peaches. Substantial mouth. Odd vanilla-tinged aroma. Think my sample may have been a bit old. Good orane coloring, lasting head. Clean label.

column1: Rio Salado Monsoon Maerzen Amber Lager
column5: Shared with Aurelius who brought it back from Arizona - light orange pour, spongy white head. Ripening vegetable aroma with a hint of vinegar. Hint of olive oil in the flavor with some caramel and a dusty back end wih some wet paper accents. Mouthfeel, slightly thin. Misses the mark.

column1: Rio Salado Monsoon Maerzen Amber Lager
column5: Aroma of dried fruits and some what malty. Light amber color with white head and some lacing. Flavor is balanced for this one. Malts seem to hold back the hops, otherwise this one would be too bitter for me. Smooth on palate.

column1: Rio Salado Monsoon Maerzen Amber Lager
column5: Body color is similar to iced tea. Aroma and flavor are dominated by a burnt diacetyl quality. Some toasty malts underneath and fairly hoppy, but the diacetyl kills this one. Poor rendition of the style. Thanks to Brady at Il Vicino for sharing.

column1: Rio Salado Monsoon Maerzen Amber Lager
column5: bottle. golden body with a small white head. aroma is malty with yeasty notes. very tasty, lots of nice toasted malts. smooth and well balanced. Yeah, I�ve only had three beers from Rio Salado so far (one of which I haven�t rated yet) but this is definitely my favourite.

column1: Rio Salado Monsoon Maerzen Amber Lager
column5: Amber in color. Aroma of day old coffee, freshly brewed unfermented wort, medicine, munich malt, herbs and light fruits. Flavors of honey, munich and caramel malts, bread and coffee. A nice malty body but not the flavors I enjoy in this particular style.

column1: Rio Salado Monsoon Maerzen Amber Lager
column5: 12 oz bottle-I had the same thing pigfoot had-lots of cloudy chunks in my bottle. pours an hazy hue with lots of floaties. citric almost wheaty aroma-sligthly sour. flavors of sour apples and citric hops (not in the IPA way though). Is this a belgian beer? i taste lots of candy-ish yeasts. Wierd! This has no marzen characteristics.

column1: Rio Salado Monsoon Maerzen Amber Lager
column5: Appearance: a muddy amber color, the body accompanied by various floaties swimming around, and the bubbly, white head is large at first, but short-lived. Aroma: clean, and empty. Taste: sweet, and a little sour, too, not at all what I�d expect out of a marzen. Citric acidity leads the flavor profile, and, frankly, ruins it These flavors balance out a bit, as we drink it down, but, ultimately, it�s not enough. This brew doesn�t quite cut it. Thanks, though, to Gusler for sending it out. (P.S. Reading other reviews lead me to believe that I have an inferior sample, somehow? Anyways, I calls �em likes I drinks �em!)

column1: Rio Salado Monsoon Maerzen Amber Lager
column5: poured a medium amber in my glass,,,very cloudy could not see through glass..nice head that stayed to the end. great aroma nice tang all the way.
On tap at brewpub Pours clear copper. Aroma of caramel malt. Sweet caramel taste, goes down easy, pleasant beer.
On tap at the brewpub. Deep red-amber color with a good of-white head. Malt forward flavor with hints of toffee and dark bread. Some darker roasted malts.
Draft at the source. Clear ruby amber color, medium off white head. Aroma of lightly toasted caramel. Taste has caramel and very light butterscotch. Easy drinking. Guess this needs to be unretired!
Geruch karamellartig, Geschmack geht in Richtung Schokolade trotz einer relativ hellen, r�tlichen F�rbung.
Farbe amber bis braun. Geruch malzig und r�stig, auch im Geschmack ein bisschen Bisquit.

Draft @ the Capital Hill location. Pours a reddish amber color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty caramel aroma with weak hoppy hints. Has a fruity malty caramel flavor with hoppy hints. Has a fruity malty caramel finish.

This was a full flavored Irish Red. The unfiltered brew got in its own away a little bit, though. There was a thickness to the aftertaste. I drank and enjoyed one, but moved on to another, cleaner beer to continue the evening.
I had this beer a while back and from what I can remember I enjoyed it. I�ve had this at the pub/brewery so it was fresh. Nothing special about it is popping into my head at the moment.
Pours clear reddish-amber. Nice malty session ale, soft hops in the flavor - but also something metallic in the finish. Not bad.

A lightly hazed reddish amber ale with a thin off white head. Light caramel in aroma, not too much butterscotch, and a bit of roasted nuts. In mouth a nice woody nutty malt, not cloying. Medium bodied. Tasted at Downtown location, April 14 2008.
Butterscotch nose, pale copper color, low head. Perfumy mix of sweet malt and hops. Oily mouth feel. Not good at all.
GBof A PA-on tap-pours an off white head and gold color. Aroma is sweet grassy, secondary hops. Taste is sweet grassy, secondary hops. OK carbonation.

A slightly substandard generic lager. While this has a bit of a hop backbone, it's a pretty flavor-challenged brew. Has a mite of skunkiness that gives it some flavor, however good that might be. The palate is actually a mite on the creamy side, which I didn't expect but did somewhat enjoy.

On tap at Capitol City, Downtown location in July 2006. Cloudy straw colour. Decent, quite authentic estery wheat aroma. Rather too much lemony citrus on the palate with some rather unexpected and slightly harsh bitterness. OK but not a standout.

On tap at brewpub. Pours an opaque pale orange with a short-lasting white head. Smells like orange and cloves. Tastes like orange, bananas, cloves, yeast and bread. Very soft dry finish. Medium bodied, velvety mouthfeel. Very refreshing!
From tap at the DC location. Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma is estery, dry fruity and light yeasty. Dry estery, fruity and light bitter to malty. Ends dry and estery fruity.
Draught. Cloudy yellow colour. Small frothy white head. The flavour is yeasty, slightly sweet, papery. Not so good, but OK for the style.
Pretty refreshing hefeweizen. Light yellow-orange pour with an aroma of citrus and lemon. Mainly orange and sweet malt flavor with a yeasty finish.

Draft @ the Capital Hill location.Pours a hazy yellow color with a small white head. Has a fruity wheat malty yeasty banana aroma. Sweetish wheat malty spicy yeasty flavor. Has a sweetish wheat malty spicy banana finish.
Yet another disappointing American hefe. Pours from tap somewhat cloudy a tad orangish. Not a lot of aroma off of this one or flavor for that matter. It finishes but not fast enough. Meh!

From a draft pour at the brewpub on New York Ave. This came a cloudy yellow color with a small white head and light lacing. The nose is banana and clove. Light body and light mouthfeel. The flavor is fruity with banana and peach. Light sweet finish. Decent.
Draft. Pours hazy gold with a thin white head. Yeasty banana aroma with light spicy notes. The flavor is on the bland side, with banana, lemon, bubblegum, and a hint of spice. Not awful.

Tap at Capitol City - Capitol Hill. Pours hazy straw with a small, fizzy white head, low retention with light lacing. Aroma is heavy malt (bread, hay, straw), light hops (spicy), and average esters (banana) with notes of peaches. Flavor is heavy malt (bread, hay, straw), light hops (spicy), and average esters (banana) with notes of peaches and sweetened orange rind. Light body, low warmth and creaminess, medium carbonation with a dry and biting finish.

On tap at Capitol City Downtown. This is not too impressive for the style, but nowhere near as bad as the crappy ratings would suggest. Pours clear golden with a small white head and not much lacing to speak of. Aroma is sweet malt, light fruits, banana, alcohol, and very mild spice. A little odd but not terrible. Flavor is very sweet for the style with pale malt, banana, pear, and fruity esters, mild spicing, white grape, and a touch of Belgian yeast. Not very similar to the good Belgian versions of the style, but definitely enjoyable. Palate is sweet with medium-body and some boozy warmth. Overall a below-average tripel but an above-average beer.

Location: Draft Postal Building Location - From the sampler glass and ordered a full one too, 3/7/09. Aroma: Slightly fruity, sweet Appearance: Slight cloudiness, yellow color, nice white head Flavor: Nice beer, taste was very similar to the Tripel Karmeliet to me, fruit stands out the most. Palate: Medium body, nice finish Overall Impression: I liked this one, glad I got to try a Tripel from these guys. Pretty enjoyable beer.

Draught at the Capitol Hill location. I�ve come to learn that getting the tripel in a DC brewpub is like watching a car crash; it�s not pretty, but you just can�t stop yourself from ordering one. Well, to be perfectly honest this was only my second one. After the triple car pileup in the DC Chophouse yesterday, I had high hopes for this being some sweet redemption; not quite. While this one seems to probably be in the ballpark of the attenuation they were going for, (not complete syrup like yesterday) it was still way too sweet and messy for a tripel. Lighter yellow color than the InaugurAle, with a thin white head that quickly and completely went limp on me. Doughy, almost dirty, sweaty yeast, and corn sweetness in the aroma. Sweet, sugary flavor with a little cleaner yeast flavor than the aroma, some chalkiness, fruit, and honey. Medium bodied with some stickiness. Something tells me the yeast in this one were not well-loved. They didn�t seem to completely finish what they started and put some weird flavors in.

A golden ale with a thin big bubbled white head. Aroma of sweet bubblegum and grapejuice. In mouth, a sweet malt with light orange peels, and warming alcohol. Medium bodied. On tap at Downtown location, Jan. 6 2009.

2009-10-11, draught at the brewpub, Downtown location, 5-3-6-3-11=28 Hazy blond color. The aroma and flavor are lightly spicy; it has a medium body, light simple malt flavor, and overall it�s a bit too boozy. Drinking a full glass can be difficult. 2007-10-05, draught at the brewpub, Downtown location, 7-3-8-4-16=38 Oct 2007, 9% ABV Hazy blond color; creamy head. The aroma is malty, spicy and citrusy. Very good flavor, malty, a bit sweet and spicy and citrusy, boldly hopped and with a long final.

(Shirlington) Cloudy lemon body with off-white head. Aroma is mild, medium sweet, some pear, clove, light bubblegum. Taste is medium sweet, bubblegum, some orange. light banana. Medium-full body, some stickiness.
Tap. Very cloudy yellow color. Smells of bananas and bubble gum. Cutrusy and fruity taste.
Very very very odd for a trip. No aroma, light on taste. A little sweet and mildly citrusy.
This beer had little to no aroma, which is strange for a belgian trip. Very standard for a trip with really nothing intresting other the the standard citrus and spice flavors. next?
Very neutral Tripel. No particular taste stands out besides the fruity overtones. At 10% it�s a dangerous beer during happy hour when it�s $2.50 a pint.

column1: Beer Works Crimson Clover Irish Red
column5: Tap @Beer Works Canal Street Clear copper color, small off-white head. Light herbal malty aroma, kind a perfumic. Light-bodied. Pale malty, low bitterness, light caramel and herbal harshness. Not much going on in the this beer.

column1: Beer Works Crimson Clover Irish Red
column5: Cask at GBBF 2010. A hazy red beer with a thin beige head. The aroma has notes of malt and caramel. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt and caramel, leading to a dry and bitter finish.

column1: Beer Works Crimson Clover Irish Red
column5: Cask gravity @ GBBF 2010. Pours a clear copper color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty caramel aroma with some hoppy hints. Fruity malty hoppy flavor with hints of caramel. Has a fruity malty hoppy finish.

column1: Beer Works Crimson Clover Irish Red
column5: Cask (gravity) @ GBBF 10, Great British Beer Festival, Earls Court Exhibition Centre, London, England. Clear medium to dark amber red color with a small, fizzy, virtually none lacing, fully diminishing head. Aroma is moderate malty, toasted - caramel, weet malt - fruit, light to moderate hoppy, apricot ! Flavor is moderate to light heavy sweet and moderate bitter with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is flat. [20100803]

column1: Beer Works Crimson Clover Irish Red
column5: Cask gravity at GBBF 2010. Some red fruits, yes, bit of strawberry cheesecake on the flavour. Touch of tea flavour, perfectly acceptable.

column1: Beer Works Crimson Clover Irish Red
column5: Cask Stillage at the GBBF, Earl�s Court 03/08/2010 Fruity aroma. Amber red coloured fruity and a little rich on the palate with a hint of dryness and bitterness in a full malt finish.

column1: Beer Works Crimson Clover Irish Red
column5: Cask@GBBF2010. Amber colour, small head. Aroma is fruity, mildly bready as well as it has some wooden and quite sappy notes. Flavour is quite muich the same. A bit basic, but yet an easy to drink brew.

column1: Beer Works Crimson Clover Irish Red
column5: 3rd August 2010. GBBF Clear amber beer with no real head. Light dry palate. Sweet red fruit - strawberry and raspberry leading to a very dry finish. Nice flavour let down by an over dry palate.

column1: Beer Works Crimson Clover Irish Red
column5: Cask conditioned Gravity Dispense GBBF 2010. An amber coloured beer. Tired dry hoppy nose with a sweet fruity minimally hopped mouth. Quite ordinary.

column1: Beer Works Crimson Clover Irish Red
column5: CASK at BSF GBBF 2010 ... copper ... bubbly head ... sweet toffee malt nose ... nice and easy ... little spice malt ... decent
Not my style of beer. Still a good flavor on this one......................

Honey coloured and cloudy. Faint wheat aroma. Smooth palate with a good balance of carbonation. Nice flavour of oranges and wheat though. Very smooth finish. I found this beer to be more like an American wheat than a Belgian. Decent, but I've had much better witbiers.

Reviewed from notes. The appearance was a light brown color with a bar pour�s kind of slim off white semi-foamy head that dissipated at a moderate pace. Trim lace. The aroma had some caramel/toffee malts, light nuts, some bready/yeastiness. The flavor moderately leaned towards the sweet side through the prior mentioned aromas. Bready sweet aftertaste with the same sort of finish. The palate was somewhat close to medium bodied, perhaps a tad under with a decent sessionability about it. Decent carbonation. ABV felt fine. Overall, decent easy drinking amber lager worthy of having again preferably with food.
This dark lager pours reddish and offers a nice feeling of sweet malt. This malt then gives way to the hops that allow for a nice crisp balanced finish.

Sample from tap at the brewpub in Canal street. Pours red with a light brown/off-white head. Toffee caramel malty aroma. Flavour is malty, slight yeasty, minor metallic note. Good hoppiness blending in with the toffee malt.

Sample at Beer Works Fenway: Pours a clear light amber color with a thin light khaki head that dissipates rapidly. Spotty lacing. Aroma of crystal malts and a bit of hops. Light body with a sweet malt flavor offset by hops. The finish is creamy and sweet with not much aftertaste. Overall I am firmly in the "Where�s the fire?" column.

(Canal Street) Crystal clear copper body with beige head. Aroma is medium sweet, caramel, earthy. Taste is moderately sweet, caramel, some bread, earthy, light chocolate. Light-medium body, low carbonation.
(Canal St. Location) Camamel flavors. Very sweet tasting. Hops blended in. Not 9-alarmy at all... not on fire, certainly. Very relaxing. Light copper color.
tap @ canal boston. deep orange sunset copper hues...sweet caramel aroma...nice and smooth... "Why the alarms... What�s the emergency?" This is a beer to sit back and relax with.
Amber golden color, I was told this was actually a bottom-fermented brew. Some bitterness of finish, and some flavor, but only marginally more than the general urine-yellow lagers.
Very different beer. IT's called an amber, but it really tastes like something between an ale and a belgian white. Creamy palate, but very strange spice in the flavor. Not a big fan

Cask Conditioned. Cloudy dun brown appearance with a huge beautiful head. Head had texture of whipped cream and stayed for the whole beer, leaving thick lacing. Highlighted the creamy palate overall. Interesting spicy aroma. On first taste, a very intersting beer. Still spicy, fruity, with a fairly bitter finish. Couldn't keep it up though. A harsh minerally water taste came through, the bitterness lost its edge, and became very bland. Recomended purely for the palate.

Draught at the Empire State location. Copper colour. Sourish(milky acidic), fruity nose. English Style hops dominates the flavour. Fruity, light bodied. Dry and crisp(Maris Otter?). Light bitter finish.

On tap at Empire State location. My favorite of the five seasonals on tap. Poured a clear orange amber. Aroma was spice almost cloves with orange underneath. Taste was like a crisp clean breath of cold air. Started light then went deeper. Had a woodsy taste that moved into black cherry with some slight hoppiness and a taste of copper to it and then a burn again on the aftertaste with almost a sense of chestnuts underneath it all and spice coming through near the end. Would drink again JUST to try and sort out all these flavors.

Thanks to my wfe and daughter who brought me back a growler of this brew from their trip to NY. Excellent, my wife wasn�t sure which beer to pick, but she did good! Great hop/sweet flavor and nice amber color. This reminded me a bit of my favorite "go to" beer - Yard�s Phila Pale Ale.

Draught @ Times Square Location: This was a good steam beer. It pours an amber color, with a bit of an off-white head. It had lots of lacing. There was a slightly floral, spicy aroma. There was also hints of sour fruits in there also. The taste was dry, with a hint of hops. A very solid steam. Made for session drinking!

Very good! A surprise, a solid beer for rounds. Good beer to hold a conversation over. I tend to like this style, however. Somewhat of a whiff of smoke on the taste of it, good brown color and appeasing feeling it gives to your throat and head as you sip. This one makes you feel like a manly beer drinking conneisseur. Empire State location.

Crystal clear, bronze/copper lager with a small, creamy, off-white head that leaves a thick, creamy lace. Very pretty. The nose is earthy, woodsy and grainy much like a steaming mash tun. The aroma and flavor are well-hopped with notes of pine, grapefruit rind, hay, wheat and grass. Medium-bodied with a watery mouthfeel and fizzy carbonation. Short, crisp, bitter finish.

All the Heartland beers I have sampled were on draught at the Heartland Brewery Chop House in Times Square, New York. As well as the beer they also do great food! Deep dark rusty copper hue with a small off white head and good lacing. Pronounced hoppy nose of flora. Predominantly nutty roasted taste with a pleasant hoppy floral finish.

Faint aroma, but what's there is hoppy and citrus. Quite orange-peel bitter and woody. Initially dry and then finishes sweet. A little unpleasant penicillin note in there that kinda killed the beer for me. Decent mouthfeel. This beer got fumbled somewhere in its execution.
Golden color with a nice white head. Very FRUITY and light. Would drink again.

Old notes, from maybe 2007. The aroma is nutty, cola, brown sugar, caraml. The appearance is deep amber brown, off white head. The flavor is nutty, cola, caramel, malty, sweet. The finish is slightly pine, sweet. Medium in body. Standard brown ale, not bad at all.
On tap at Heartland Times Square; brown to red in color, nice malt flavor, lasting filmy head, aftertaste was spicy and enjoyable, I had another.

Hazy chestnut. Interesting beer, smother and good. Odd candy aroma, like root beer and caramel, with some interesting flavors. Some bite and bitterness, some sweetness too and all-around curious, but not bad. (on tap, Heartland Brewery, Union Square West, NYC)
Pretty much an average brown ale, the typical brown color, had a decent lacy white head, the usual charactertistics of a usual brown ale, nothing too special about this one
Aroma was non-descript, maybe slightly malty. Brownish red in color, smallish white head. Flavor is malty and slightly sweet, but palate is a little thin. Overall an ok brown.
Nut brown, with filmy head that clings to the glass. Faint vanilla and roast aroma. Grapefruity, but pretty well balanced. Medium hoppy finish. A 'clear' bitter flavor to it.

Murky deep red, not particularly brown. Nose is very malty, bit spicy and sweet. Significantly drier than expected based on the nose, good hops with a nice, bitter bite. Reminds me of a scotch ale, has that smoky-peaty character. Plenty of malts.
Very hoppy/bitter. Not my cup of tea. Nice color and aroma, though........

column4: Emerson's Brewing Company (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
column5: 500ml bottle, 2017 vintage. Pours dark brown with an off white head. Cinnamon, nutmeg, biscuit, chocolate, red fruit, dried fruit, bit of banana. Quite a light body doesn't suit it great. Nice.

column4: Emerson's Brewing Company (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
column5: 500ml bottle. Pours dark copper. Aroma fruit cake, honey and metal. Taste is cloves straight off the bat. Its a touch sweet, again like fruit cake. Very minimal bitterness. Good body and not too cloying or heavy but still, not that drinkable. One to share on a cold night Id say.

column4: Emerson's Brewing Company (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
column5: 500ml 2017 vintage Dark brown/black with OK head. Aroma is spice/brown sugar. Sweet palate with notes of nutmeg, cinnamon and raisin and a smooth finish. I�d best describe this one as Liquid Hot-cross Bun. Yummy.

column4: Emerson's Brewing Company (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
column5: 2014 vintage. Pours deep dark ruby red, almost opaque, with thin off-white head. Aromas hit immediately of sweet cola, carrot, juicy raisin and nutmeg/cinnamon spiciness. Flavour is very similar, with distinctive cola aspects, something I�ve never tasted in a beer before, but it works splendidly. Like the description says, very reminiscent of hot-cross buns. Mildly bitter aftertaste with cola coming through again. Delicious, will definitely be drinking again!

column4: Emerson's Brewing Company (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
column5: Aroma, first hit was like a long-forgotten chewy, orange-flavoured sweet from childhood. Put me off a bit, it was so sugary. Then the spices came on, like they say, hot cross buns, cola, cinnamon, nutmeg, some vegetal I can�t put my finger on. Taste is same. Full mouthfeel, now with raisins and christmas flavours. Very cola-like finish. Much more enjoyable than I expected.

column4: Emerson's Brewing Company (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
column5: 500ml bottle (2012 vintage). Appears hazy deep brown with reddish highlights and a firm cream-white head. Aroma is spicy with notes of cinnamon, cloves, orange peel and raisins on top of dark chocolate malts and alcohol. Palate is smooth and rich with the complex flavours of the nose coming through nicely before a dry spicy bitter finish. Body is fullish with a just right carbonation. A superior strong spiced ale from this admirable Kiwi brewery.

column4: Emerson's Brewing Company (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
column5: Bottle from Slowbeer. Dark brown, aroma of cola, dried fruits, caramel. Light sweetness, taste of spices and cola with slightly harsh bitterness. Not one of my favourites.

column4: Emerson's Brewing Company (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
column5: Bottle from bottleshop in Dunedin. Aromas of cola, caramel, dark fruit. Taste is sweet, with bitter notes, long length. Palate is velvety, and medium bodied. Dark brown, with a thin head.

column4: Emerson's Brewing Company (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
column5: 2012 Vintage: Dark, slightly hazy color with a fairly dense head that slowly fades. Sparse lacing. Toffee and gingerbread aromas and complex quad-like malt driven flavour and silky thick mouthfeel -Rated via BeerBuddy

column4: Emerson's Brewing Company (Lion Co. - Kirin Holdings)
column5: After cleaning my computer screen and changing my pants due to this bottle exploding when opened I finally get to rate this beer. Over carbonated. Nice spicy nose and deep rich colour. Never been a big fan of the flavour profile though, hence the poor rating here. Did I mention over carbonated and the bottle exploding? Never going to get a good rating after this.
Botella 0,33l Color negra,espuma beige,fina,alta,resistente.Aroma cafe,chocolate.Sabor muy suave dulzor con notas finas de amargor,cafe,chocolate,malta tostada,acuosa
Pours black with a two finger, tan head. Aroma is lactose and roast. Taste is brown sugar and lactose, moving to cafe au lait. Finish is light roast. An OK stout.
Poor white head. Aroma of dried fruit. Taste is sweet and watery. Not much to remember this but has some lovely aftertaste.

330ml bottle from LCBO. Pours a fairly small frothy tan head and has a deep dark brown appearance. Decent sticky lacing. Moderate carbonation. Aromas of roasted malt, vanilla, licorice and mild spices. Flavours are the sweet side, some notes of coffee, chocolate, lactose, brown sugar and licorice hints. Slight bitterness on the palate in the finish. Smooth and slick mouthfeel. Not bad overall.
Near black very short lived off white head. Aroma of dried fruit. Taste is sweet and watery. Not much to remember this by.

It pours jet-black almost opaque; the head is off white and foamy. The aroma has notes of: chocolate, slight coffee, and cardboard. The taste is lightly sweet that finishes lately better. The palate is medium light bodied with medium carbonation; the finish is short. Overall, it's not that interesting.

Big ol bottle with some age on it shared by Stacey on 10/13/18. Glassy ruby-mahogany. No head. Smells like prunes. Wow thats weird. Pruney. Fig raisin plum no roast. Soft and watery with prune and light acidity. Weird lactic prune raisin.

On tap at Kiuchi brewery, Naka, Ibaraki, Japan. A dark brown/black coloured pour with a medium beige head on top. Roasty, malty, chocolate aroma. Tastes roasty, malty, chocolate. Lacking in complexity.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Yoav's place. Thanks Yoav. Deep brown with brownish head. Sweetish aroma with notes of chocolate, licorice, date honey, kvass and dark bread. Very sweet flavor with notes of kvass, dark bread, date honey, sourish. Medium-bodied.

Bottle sample at a tasting. Thanks Yoav. Reddish-brown with a beige head. Smell of burnt sugar, bread, honey, treacle, toffee. Very sweet, sourish, caramel, honey, lactose, chocolate. Medium-bodied, syrupy.

Near to black, moderate beige head. Aroma: dark malts, roast, citrus hop, blueberry, nice esters. Medium body, soft carbonation. Taste: rather dry, roasted, fruity, coffee and hop at ending. Soft and balanced. Nice stuff.

1/22/19 - 12 oz bottle - sable black motor oil like pour, mocha colored head initially thick, simmers down to cling to the edge of the glass. Creosote and blueberries in the aroma, quite aromatic. Solid flavor, baker's unsweetened chocolate, espresso roast, hint of berry jam sweetness in the finish. Nice, dry chalky mouthfeel. Thanks to Aurelius for holding one out for me!

Pours like Old English furniture polish. Somewhat more carbonated than some of their other stouts. Head is chocolate ice cream brown. Aroma is of well toasted blueberry Pop Tarts - lightly sweet, fruity, browned. Foam is metallic. Slightly tangy, blueberry, roast. Finish is a little astringent, and the body isn't as sturdy as some of the other stouts in the mixpack - Oatmeal, Too Cream. Enjoyable, entertaining, pretty rock solid just not their best. ABC Liquors, Bull Run.

Pours a dark black with a great ambitious creamy head that stays the course for some time. Aromas of fresh raw blueberries (finally a beer with real blueberries!), chocolate, roast, slight brownie. Flavors slightly less attractive with medium blueberries, slight wood/smoke, light roast. Light to medium sweet slight smoke aftertaste. Perhaps the first stout I've had with genuine blueberries added.
