Aftertaste: sweet, malty, bitter touch, sugary. Weird, tastes as if it�s already 3 years past expiration date, but it still has almost a year to go.
Troebel donker geel bier met schuim. Smaak is hoppig bitter en licht zoet, caramel, drop en anijs. Blijft lang hangen.
Pours yellow color. Flavour is mild wheat, medium sweet, and balanced bitter.
Pale golden colour. Thin body. Watery with bitter finish. Rather unbalanced.
pours clear golden small white head smell has some earth aspects ( weird... ) too high carbo . very green, but not hoppy . more like spices.. carbo destroys much of the taste though
Golden beer that tastes like a pilsner. Apparently it�s high-fermented, but it was hard to detect.
Has a clear golden colour. Aroma is quite sweet as is the flavour. Slightly metallic taste.
Thanks to bu11zeye for sharing this bottle. Golden pour with a white head. The aroma is full of wheat and grass, as is the flavor. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation.
300ml Flasche. Klar und golden mit minimaler Schaumkrone. Getreidig. Mild. Leichter K�rper. Okay.
0,3 litre Can at a party. Clear Golden with big white head. Malts, hops in aroma and taste. Sweet, bitter.

Appearance Clear light gold, decent white head, some lacing Aroma Lots of lightly kilned cereals, some wort and continental noble hops Taste Mildly sweet, medium bitter Palate Medium-light body, with moderate carbonation Overall Honestly, it�s better than most Norwegian pale lagers, even if it doesn�t get you shitfaced

AROMA: Dull, light sweetness, grain/straw, slight diacetyl. TASTE: Thin watery mouthfeel. Medium plus carbonation. Moderate sweetness, low bitterness with OK balance. Slight citric acid touch. Cardboard, grain/straw, slightly vegetal, some wort flavour. SUMMARY: Very nice for the style, a toned down and almost unoffensive non-alcoholic beer with lots of shortcomings.
Pours a quite normal lager body with a thin, disappearing white top. Nose is worty pale malts, taste is wort with sweet pale malts and hints of dry hops in the back.

Got this at Nile�s Ethiopian restaurant in Orlando. Wanted to try something from Ethiopia since I was there. They had a lighter beer which was 4.5%, and since this was in the 5% range and was a �stout� I went with Hakim. Had a medium brown appearance, far from a dark brown or black which I expected from a stout. Taste didn�t resemble a stout, actually reminded me of drinking Newcastle or honey-brown. Had some caramel and coffee in the flavor, but was probably average at best. Tried something new, but for the price charged felt like I was better off ordering a Beck�s, or just drinking soda and water.
Not a stout but really a dark lager. Only had in draft in Ethiopia where it takes a welcome change from standard pilsner-type beers. Often known locally as Obama.

Caramel and toffee malts, a touch of milk chocolate in the aroma; brown color, small tan head; lots of caramelized malt flavors, including demura sugar, molasses, hints of anise; medium body, smooth; I think this is my first Ethiopian beer and I really like this for what it is... Not quute stout, but lots of interesting malty flavors.
Bottle at Ethiopian restaurant. Hmmmm, super brown copper color. Pukey caramel sweet malts. Same as the amber beer.
Butelka 0,33l.wypita w Etiopii. Kolor br�zowy, piana lekka. Aromat palonego s�odu, lekka kawa. Smak karmelu z dro�d�ami, lekka kawa. Nagazowanie �rednie jak i piwo.

Perhaps this is an unfair rating, but I was just remembering that i used to always get this at the Ethiopian restaurant near my house and thought it was interesting if nothing else. They don�t carry it anymore, and this rating doesn�t say anything of interesting, but its a pretty decent beer for y�know...ethiopia.
Dunkel bernsteinfarbenes Bier mit geringer Schaumkrone. Geruch r�stmalzig, s��, harzig, Geschmack leicht r�stmalzig, harzig, muffig.

Poured from bottle, pours more of a dark amber brown than anything, wouldn�t think stout just looking at in in a glass, the aroma is of sweet malt and roast, the flavor is pretty weak, some sweetness at first with an off finish, metallic almost, meh.

Poured from 330mL bottle. Clear mahogany brown with dissipating beige head. Sweet malt, molasses, dates on the aroma. Caramel and dark fruit flavour with molasses. Very light watery body. Should not be called a stout.

This is honestly, my favorite beer I have ever tried. I travel internationally 9 months of the year and have gotten into the habit of trying local beers everywhere I go. Yes, I have even been to Ethiopia. I was so excited to find the Ethiopian restaurant near my home carries it. It is truly fabulous. Every friend I have brought to try this beer love it. It has a very special, unique taste, unlike any other beer. If you are really into beer, you may not appreciate its taste. If its hard for you to find a beer you love, then you�re going to dig this beer! REally, the best I�ve had, anywhere in the world. Its special!

column1: Rio Salado Summer Typhoon Cherry Weisse Ale
column5: Courtesy of Bockyhorsey. Strong aroma of cherries with a touch of sour twang. Red with a two finger head. looks like a raspberry lambic in the glass. Sour cherries in the fore. Light bodied with a bit of a lager crispness. Tart, sour and dry in the finish.

column1: Rio Salado Summer Typhoon Cherry Weisse Ale
column5: Bottle found at a liquer store that had some dust on it. Aroma was of a fermentented cherry and malt. Dark cherry color body and big pink head. Head diminished to a small one but stayed with drink till finish. Flavor was light on the cherry side. Some tartness and seem to have a malt backbone. Dry aftertaste on the palate. Need more cherry for me, but dencent drink none the less.

column1: Rio Salado Summer Typhoon Cherry Weisse Ale
column5: bottle. bright read with minimal head. vinous aroma along with real fresh cherries. flavour is bursting with sour cherries. acidic body. reasonably refreshing and an interesting fruit beer. finish is dry.

column1: Rio Salado Summer Typhoon Cherry Weisse Ale
column5: Pours a brilliantly clear copper color with an off white head. The aroma is a mixture of wheat, sour yeastiness, and a hint of cherry, though it is definitely fruity. The taste is dry and slightly acidic in the finish and the cherry flavor is light, but definitely contributes something to this beer. This is a very light and refreshing beer, enjoyable in its refreshing simplicity.

column1: Rio Salado Summer Typhoon Cherry Weisse Ale
column5: nice red color with head thet fades fast. tart bitter sweet taste with that tagny bite at the swallow. good beer,,would drink a 6 pack at one time,,maybe one a day.

column1: Rio Salado Summer Typhoon Cherry Weisse Ale
column5: There's a pinkish cocktail called a Shirley Temple and this beer reminds me of it because The Typhoon Cherry Weisse is soooo very, er,...RED! Hint of cherries in the aroma. Taste is of a strong tartness, almost lambic in its sourness. Light ale body with lots and lots of tart cherry flavor. It's actually quite decent and it's a pity I'm not sipping it in the heat of the Manhattan summer rather than in January. The creepiest thing about this beer is its pink head, which looks a bit like that of Cantillon's Rose de Gambrinus. Enjoyable if you like a tart beer. Thanks GEOBRAU!

column1: Rio Salado Summer Typhoon Cherry Weisse Ale
column5: i love rio salado there a local brewing co so i support therm whenever possible, buit this ber sucks watery cherry taste and its color is kinda vile..sorry i just dont like this stuff

column1: Rio Salado Summer Typhoon Cherry Weisse Ale
column5: Cloudy pale lightly earthy red in color with a thin, tight pinkish-grey foamed head that faded fast, leaves low lying patches of lace. smell is faint of wheat and cherry tartness, not to much to it. Taste is mighty fine easy, smooth crispness of wheat and malts with nice acceptable amounts of cherry tartness and souring, the real kind, not arificial, at least it seems that way anyway. Smooth and light crisp medium body with excellent souring tartness lingering from midway throughout and into the finish leaving a slight souring dryness for a bit. Very drinkable, quite a decent cherry wheat brew, enjoyable and flavorful, a good summer refresher.

column1: Rio Salado Summer Typhoon Cherry Weisse Ale
column5: Rich cherry color. Fairly thick carbonated head. First taste is the impression. Semi-sweet, acidy, sour, sharp on the tonque. Cherry flavor is not overwhelming, but good. Not bitter in the aftertaste. A good summer refresher.

column1: Rio Salado Summer Typhoon Cherry Weisse Ale
column5: Medium red-brown color, cherry nose. A medium bodied wheat beer, with a sweet/sour cheery flavor. Cherry flavor is not too sweet, but add an interesting balance to the malts and hops. Mouthfeel is full. Finish is clean. Aftertaste is slightly bitter. Interesting beer.
4 oz. taster at the source. Crystal clear gold, foamy head. Aroma is mild straw, yeast. Light body with a thin finish. The lightest note of bitterness. Typical brewpub lager.

Draft sample. Poured clear amber color with an average frothy white head that was mostly lasting with good lacing. Light to medium balanced aroma. Light to medium body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Light to medium balanced flavor with a light to medium sweet finish of short to average duration.
On draft at the brewpub in Sedona. Slightly hazed yellow pour, with a white head. Grain, light sweetness, biscuit, and lightly hopped. Decent, but nothing special.
Draft @ the brewpub. Pours clear golden color with white head. Aromas of cereal grains, biscuit, and grass. Similar flavors. Light to medium body with average carbonation.
Taster in Sedona. Pale yellow, mild hop and malt flavors. What Budweiser wishes it was... Nice for the style...

A very nice easy drinking bohemian pils. Clean finish with a bit of crispness from the hops but not as sharp as a bohemian should be. Up the Nobel hops and this will be a gem... Nice clean pilsner yeast profile.

Pour on tap at the brewery, clear yellow pour with white head, aroma brought notes of grain, biscuit, bread, slight honey into a bit of grass, slight yeasty note. Taste was a mix of grass, earth, touch of yeast, hints of biscuit, vanilla, finishing watery, slightly sweet.

Location: Draft at the brewpub, 3/3/14, as Forty-Niner Gold Lager Aroma: The aroma is light crystal malts, some grain, sweet malt, and hop notes as well Appearance: This beer pours a clear golden color with a small, fizzy white head Flavor: Light and clean, some fine, but not overwhelming sweetness, and a light bitterness Palate: The body is light, with a decent enough feel, and a clean dry finish Overall Impression: I thought this was a solid enough example of the style. It isn�t a super exciting beer, but it has some flavor and it has a nice, clean, hop finish to it that makes it easily an above average example of this style.

Draught @ Oak Creek Pub and Grill, Sedona, AZ Pours clear golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt hint of orange. Taste is light sweet and light bitter. Body is light, texture is thin, carbonation is soft.

On tap at the brewpub. Pits golden with a white head. Aroma of malt, fruitiness, some herbal notes and grains. Flavor is sweet and fruity with some malt, herbal notes and bread. Medium body, average carbonation.
Bottle. Something off about the nose but good taste. Weird. Dark black with no head. A decent rich flavor of chocolate and roasted barley. I don�t find it too thin at all. OK.
Poored from a a bottel. Good taste but disappointed as it was a bit watery for a stout. Was expecting a bit more of a mouthful.

Pour from a 12 oz bottle. Inky dark brew with quickly passing tan head. Aroma of toasted grains, coffee, chocolate. Taste is sweet malts, burnt grain, toasted grains and lightly bitter, dry finish - very appropriate for a dry stout. Very good.

Tap at Back Road Fall Fest. Faint caramel and chocolate malt aroma. Black brown with a small tan head. Light roasty coffee flavor. Thin, light body, dry finish. Overall, this beer was light and thin for the style.

Very dark amber, good head medium lacing. Nice balance of burnt malt/caramel and smooth bitterness moving through the finish. Clean water finish similar to Murphy�s Stout. Big brew, especially for 5%.

12 oz. bottle that shawnm213 picked up for me at City-Wide in South Bend. Why the hell is this rated so low? It�s nice! Aroma of roasted malts, coffee, dark chocolate, smoked hickory, smoked meat, and earthy hops. The flavor is also smoky and meaty, with notes of hops, chocolate, dried dark fruits, metallic notes, and a metallic sharpness. Medium bodied, with low carbonation and a smoky, metallic mouthfeel. I like this one- a weird combination of smoky, fruity, roasty, and earthy. Cool beer- get your hands on one.
Thanks to hopdiggitydog for this one. Pours a deeper brown with little to no head. Aroma of oats, chocolate, tobacco and nuts. Flavor of toasted and light roasted malt, chocolate, tobacco.

12oz bottle acquired in trade with dmschefke (thanks!). Poured a dark brown color with a small sized off white head. Aromas of chocolate, some roastiness, and a little earthy. Tastes of chocolate, roast, and lighter coffee.
Bottle courtesy of shawnm213. Pours dark brown with a light brown head. Smells of chocolate, soy sauce, egg dye, vinegar. Tastes of chocolate, peppery, some coffee, watery.
Notes of roasted malts, bitter chocolate. A lot of flavor for a relatively low alcohol beer. A nice session stout!

Intense grain and cereal malts, lager yeast. Clear gold, small, creamy, white head. Light sweet. More caramel and bread malts, soft carbonation, light bitter finish. Not ab bad Lager at all. Well balanced. Keg at brewery, Flossmore, IL.
Tap at brewery. Pale golden with small head. Very mild body with a hint of hops. Rather bland.
[Tap] Golden pour with a small amount of foam on top. Nose is of cereal grains and light hay. Pale malts, grass and mild floral hop taste. Light, but not watery. Better than expected.
This beer was really, really light. A pale pour with a white head. Aroma of grass and wheat. Not much in the flavor and it was not a stand out to me.

Sampled at the brewpub. It poured a clear golden/yellow color with a white head. The aroma was floral, citrus and some cereal grains. The taste was of lemon, sweet grainy maltiness, crisp and refreshing with just a touch of bitterness. Decent.
Just incredibly average. They might have tried to make this unique but not enough.
On draft at Flossmoor, poured a light yellow color, aroma of hay, light earth, light lemon, and some grain. Flavor follows suit, ok beer overall.

On tap at brewpub, pours a clear light yellow with a thin bubbly white head, the aroma has a touch of lemon and grain, the flavor is very simple with a slight lemon touch in the finish. Very light mouthfeel but pretty boring overall.
There is so little to this beer that it�s hard to rate. Little taste or flavor, it is almost like a Coors Light.
Draught at Flossmoor Station - brewpub. Cloudy yellow - white head. Flowery, wheaty, candlewax, fruity, straw, light rice, light herbal, light body and finish.
Had it on tap. It was a dark chocolate brown color, not much of a head. chocolate, malty, and whiskey is the best way to describe it. It was good.

09.29.05 GABF Dark, dark brown is nearly opaque even in this tiny sample glass. Little head. Loads of chocolate all around, only noticable bitterness seems to come from heavy roasting, yet it�s not heavy bitterness. Mostly it�s chocolate and cocoa flirting with the palate and sticking to the teeth and lips, sticky and oaty. Warming indeed, it�s as boozy as that DFH Old School I keep getting samples of, but, well, uh, not at all similar. Cheers, this stuff rocks. I think they ran out fast.

Liquorice and grape notes are strong in the roasty aroma with plenty of sweet, thick chocolate character. Opaque brown body is topped by a decent tan head that recedes to cover. Deep, rich, thick chocolate flavour with light fruity and roasty notes but chocolate is the diva in this ensemble and lingers on the tongue seemingly endlessly. Medium full body is velvety smooth and thick. Some pleasant alcohol warming is apparent. Sampled at GABF 2005.

GABF- Pours deep black with a deep brwon tightly knit head. Caramel ad chocolate nose. Huge body. This is one of the most caramely beers I have ever had. Really great. Don�t know if I could drink it every day but this is awesome. Only thing lacking is a little more complexity.

Pitch black, wearing a good light brown head. Certainly woody in the nose, but this is not dominant, the whiskeyish undertones remain at the complement level. The most intense flavors remind of double concentrated espresso and cocoa through soily and woody roastiness. Interesting mango and prune nuances don`t quite push it to world-class level, but certainly sets it apart from the trend followers out there. Medium bodied, oily vanilla laden texture, well contained alcohol heat. Top 50? I think not, this is just a straightforwardingly well made imperial, focusing and roasty, but certainly not one of the most complex, to me anyway. I had to go back 3-4 times after Stephen convinced me I underrated it, he was right I must say, perhaps it would grow on me if I had a full snifter, but I can�t compare it to stuff like Jaywalker that makes you watch the ceiling from the first sip.

Nice and dark and black. Vinous, inviting nose. All kinds of stuff in attendance, with multiple dark fruits, silky caramel, aged wood, smooth bourbon, rich chocolate, and aromatic vanilla. Roasty-bitter finish with an incredibly rewarding aftertaste. AWESOME ... I loved it.
Nose-smells like a cold brownie. Opaque body with a beige ring of bubbles. Taste-hHershey�s chocolate syrup, tootsie rolls, roasted marshmallows. Good roast and chocolate combo. Simpily excellent.

GABF 2005. Fully opaque black body with a persistent creamy tan head. Aroma and flavor have great qualities of toasty rum raisin, plums and grapes with a nice hop profile, medium high sweetness, and a good bitter counter-balance. This is a great imperial stout.
Tap @ Great taste of the Midwest- Pours a very dark brown, no head. Aroma is coffee, chocolate whiskey. Flavor is whiskey, dark chocolate, tons of roasted malts and the barrel dominate the hops.

(GABF05) Ink black body topped by a tan head. Aroma is medium sweet, coffee, chocolate, roasty. Taste is moderately sweet, coffee, cherry, some chocolate. Smooth and creamy full body that eclipses the alcohol very well.
Bottle Sainsbury�s. Amber beer that�s both hoppy and quite fruity. Not bad but nothing exceptional.
From a bottle.Light orange in colour,no head,quite fresh and fruity,not bad for Wychwood.

Pasteurised bottle from Sainsbury�s. Nice golden colour, fizzy head dissipates quickly. More subdued typical whchwood aroma than others, with tangy citrus hop character more dominant. Light mouthfeel and good hop finish. One of their better efforts.
Plenty of flavour and that clean taste you asociate with a good organic beer.New Zealand hops give it depth and an all round sharpness making for a pleasant drink.
Standard wychwood nose with golden hue and a white foamy head. Highly hopped taste that is long lasting and bitter. Better than most Wychwood beers where the sterile taste and blandness rules.
incredibly sterile aroma, so bland so Wychwood, copper hue with no head, bland taste with some "traces" of hops, Wychwood beers eh...zzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzz

Wychwood is a wonderful brewery - starting off in 1983 as a microbrewery, it now produces a wide and complex range of draught and bottled beers which are increasingly available in most supermarkets. This recent organic ale has the typical Wychwood depth of strength and flavour. The hops are very evident - deliciously dry with a flowery burst: hints of rose petals and geraniums. These hops come from New Zealand (hence the Kiwi name). But there is a satisying malt sweetness coming through all the time - marmalade and brown sugar. A very robust and delicious beer.
A bit fruity - a little dry other than that not really much going on........

Amber coloured moderate head and condition. Buttery golding hop type nose, malty body with balance of hop flavour and a bitterness that dominates the finish. Quite tasty for an organic beer but still quite bland for the strength.
Amber beer with a fruity, hoppy taste mixed with bitterness and coffee. A Wychwood brewed beer I actual liked.

Bottled for the Craft Brewers Conference for 2002 in Cleveland, AND MY # 500 BEER!!!!! I hope this isn�t terribly oxidized since the bottle was only full 1/4 of the way up the neck: Golden honey color with a very short lived white head. Clarity has improved greatly since I had it on tap @ the CBC in May of 2002. Probably having to do with sitting in my fridge for almost 3 years. Ginger still very apparent as is cardamom. Some plummy fruit and pepper from yeast as it warms. A lightly floral character (probably from the chamomile). A lightly grainy malt pops in, but is mostly drowned by the spices. Flavor is majorly ginger...STILL!!! Well balanced, chamomile has the flavor of chamomile tea! Light clove flavor from yeast, slightly sweet finish and aftertaste which is still ginger. Very light fruitiness is like dried apricots. Very crisp finish. Lighter medium body, dry m/f, higher carbonation, and well hidden alcohol. Overall a very tasty beer. Not your typical saison, but good anyway.

Thanks Kujo! Not much of a Saison, but very enjoyable beer anyway. Honey colored, small head that dissapates to none. Aroma is sweet, cinnimony, alspice, coriander. Mine tasted like a spicey pumpkin pie minus the pumpkin. No alcohol flavor to speak of. Slightly tangy finish.

4/2002 on tap, brewed for the 2002 Craft Brewer's Convention (I was in the right place at the right time!)- hazy orange/deep golden color. thick yet light tasting body (?). coriander/orange peel flavors burst out, almost like different tastes with every swallow - a cornucopia of flavors. 7.5% alc., but it didn't taste like it. very well done.
Aroma - coriander, grassy, cloves, some higher alcohols, very busy. Flavor - malty, dry, orange peel/ coriander flavors mixed with pepper and tea. Finish - dry & lightly malty

A nice beer,slightly hazy,orange in color,friuty,with hints of corriander, ginger,slightly malty,low to med body,spicey on the tongue,and a little phenolic,a little sweet on the finish with a nice warming from the alcohol
Old notes from 2000. Vacation in Cambridge. Cask @ The Castle. Golden color. Malty in aroma and flavour, hardly bitter. Not the "perfect Summer bitter" as they advertised it, but tasty enough.
Cask at the Bricklayers in Colchester. Lightly hopped, lemony, a little yeasty. Refreshing.
Tried at the Hop and Barley, Lincoln. Golden colour with a thick head. Very light lemon aroma and taste. Medium body.

Cask handpull at The Crosse Keys London as Adnams Regatta. Pours a dark golden yellow, clear and still with a dense creamy beige head, full lacing. Aroma is airy, very light with some faint lemon cake, sweetcorn. Very much an airy aroma. Body is light and smooth with soft carbonation. Taste is biscuit, rusk, crispbread, touch of carpet underlay and faint sweetcorn with a long understated bitterness. Plain but I do like that simple breathy malt character. You need to appreciate subtlety to enjoy this one. An everyman beer that can be consumed in large quantities. (4-4-5-4-13=3.0)
Quite a light easy drinking pint. Lemon overtones and keeps it's head well. More of a summer beer than one I would drink in winter.

Cask@Charlies, Copenhagen - light golden pour with thin white head. Light fruity and malty, biscuity malt, cereal, some lemon citrus accents, grassy green hoppy notes into thin close. Great condition. Nice.

Handbill cask at the Bowling Green, Leicester. Blond, clear with a small white head. Floral buttery and grainy aroma. Taste is worse: malty, buttery and messy. Unfortunately the finish is long. Not tasty but I don�t completely hate it.

Cask at the Greyhound, Ipswich. Pours pale gold with a bubbly off-white head. Aroma of sweet malt, hop, grain, fruit and grass. Toward heavy sweetness, light bitterness. Light body, watery texture, soft carbonation. Had this a fair few times years ago and I remember it being a lot better back then.
Cask at Prince Charles, Euston. Very warm, in fairness. Malt heavy, and quite metallic. Some floral hop aroma.
Cask half at the King�s Tun, Kingston. Pours golden yellow with a white head. Malty aroma and taste with biscuit. Sweet finish

Cask Half Pint � JDW Fest Autumn 2012 - Dark Brown in colour with Reddish tinge. Malty; roasty malts, bit of toffee, dark chocolate, hints of liquorice and roasted nuts. Fruity; dark fruits. Hoppy; slightly earthy hops. Sweetish malty fruity throughout. Decent; but is it a Bitter or an Old Ale. (2012-10-25)
Cask at standing order. Pours reddish brown, nose is light toffee, taste is creamy, malty.

Cask-conditioned at the Commercial Rooms, Bristol, November 2012. Dark, ruddy brown with a decent, off-white head. Spices, tobacco and roasted malts, slightly out of place milk chocolate and a moderately bitter finish. So so.
Dark bitter with a glow. Deep malts in the aroma and a slightly sweet taste. Fairly crisp.
Cask by handpump at Counting House, Glasgow (29 Oct 12) - deep red tan, no bubbles, tan head, coffee, roast malt aroma, roast malt flavour, sweet, oily feel

Cask at JDW. Dark amber shade with a small ring of bubbles. Deep, malty caramel flavours dominate but there�s a very noticeable toasty character and some interesting hints of spices. Credit to them as this does taste like something I imagine a stereotypical fisherman might drink.

From cask at The Hengler�s Circus. Pours clear and golden deep brown with a small off white head. Aroma is toasted malty, breadish and roasted. Light herbal, breadish to light sweet caramelish. Toasted and lingering caramelish together with a good bitterness to counterbalance. Dry and bitter, malty finish.
The Felix, Nuneaton, 08/11/12. Sesame oil aroma, slight sulphur. Good complex malt sweetness with sesame, black cherry, cocoa sprinkles, hints of burnt toast and dried fruit. Unexpectedly deep.

Cask at The Greyhound (JDW), Maidenhead. An amazing colour - raspberry red when held up to the fire, otherwise magohany with a ring of white head; earthy malt aroma; rather thin and sweet in the mouth with a soft, berry fruit flavour; and some dry chocolatey malts to finish. Needs a bit more weight.
cask at Sorder ...deep red brown ... thin tan head ... soft toffee roast malt nose ... creamy malts ... soft woody toffee
Cask at the Monks Retreat (JDW), Reading. Bright mahogany with a beige head; caramel aroma; thin, milky, body with a malty flavour and a toffee and biscuit finish. A pleasant mild.

Cask-conditioned at the Cayo Arms, Cardiff 16/05/10 as "Hanson�s Classic Mild". Reddish brown with a slight, off-white head. Raisins, apples and caramel, with a light, sweet finish. Instantly forgettable.

Draught: Deep amber coloured, small lacing white head; fruity nose with a very faint touch of roasted malt and a tinge of yeast; light dry (fruity), light bitter flavour, light bodied, not really watery; delicate, fruity-bitter finish. Not bad, but not very aromatic........
Hand pulled at the Wellington, Birmingham. Rather light and bland Mild. Tawny brown, with a little froth. Not much flavour or aroma, save a little toffee and gentle, dried tobacco.

Handpump at The Wellington, Birmingham. Dark brown colour with a foamy head. Caramel scent, perhaps with a hint of an oak-aged whisky. Taste is disappointing, however, fruit and toffee, but not much there. Watery.
Cask Handpump at the Head Of Steam, London 03/08/2001 Amber red coloured with fruit aroma. Malt and hops in the finish.

12/7/2019. Cask at the Crossways Inn, West Huntspill, Somerset. Pours golden amber with a small off-white head. Aroma of hops, citrus, malt, caramel and flowers. Medium plus sweetness and light bitterness. Moderate body, slight oily texture, soft carbonation. Fruity biscuit finish.
Decent traditional bitter. Soapy caramel with bitter finish. Some apples in there too. Lingering aftertaste.
Cask at Durant Arms, Ashprington, Devon. Well kept session beer, more flavour than abv suggests
Tap at Sand's End, Imperial Wharf. Pours an amber/copper body with slight haze and a small white head. Aroma is malts, apple/fruit, grass, honey. Taste is smooth bitter with apple, honey and malts.

Pint on cask at The Maypole Inn, Thurloxton, Somerset. Pours clear deep golden brown with a creamy white head. Aroma: malts, caramel, berries. Taste: bready malts, caramel, a hint of orange, light spices. Light to medium body, soft carb. Creamy mouthfeel. Short dry finish with low bitterness.

Pint on tap at The Union ,Paddington. Still golden amber beer with thin creamy white head. Caramel malt nose. Some lacing, smooth but light mouthfeel. Taste and finish are herbal and grassy with touches of burnt toffee. Nice pint, just needs a bit more body.

Great example of the traditional (great?) British ale. Usually good in bottles and on cask, but I wasn�t really feeling it this time. Guess my time with �real ale� is slowly coming to an end. You�d do a lot worse than Otter Bitter, though.
Cask at the Otter. Very pleasant drinkable session bitter with a malty taste
cask lieve ambrato limpida bilanciata non molto aromatica filo terroso media secchezza
Cask at The Anchor, Beer. Distinctincly average ale with very little to talk about but a nice taste of England with a view of the sea in Devon to go with.

Handpull cask at the Pilgrims Progress, Bedford. Light greenish yellow, clear and flat. Very low aroma, some gentle fruity hop. Sweet taste with aome white grape. Bitterness in the finish. Oily body. Disappointing.
Bottle at home with a pizza. Well chilled with lots of malt, nice abrasive hops and a slight, but welcome sweetness. Good drinkability.

Cask at Jolly Sailor, Farnham. Vague malty aroma. Pale gold. Thin translucent white head. Medium sweet. Very fruity and sugary. Some malt and a hint of bitterness. Light-medium bodied. Slick, with some stickiness to the mouthfeel. Average carbonation. Long finish. Surprisingly enjoyable. Thought it was going to be completely average I like it's fruitiness.

Bottle from Morrisons, Birtley, Gateshead. Drank 17 years after I first tasted this beer. Bright golden coloured with a thick white head. It has a toffee and grassy flavour with a very gentle citrus fruity finish. Ok.

On cask at Halfway House, Pitney, Somerset. Pours clear pale golden with a white head. Aroma: biscuity, floral, berries, earthy hop. Taste: light sweet & bitter, light grains, mellow citrus, grassy. Light to medium bodied, average carb, short light sweet close. Not bad
Nice v light golden ale. Biscuity floral smell. Sweet hop profile hint. Bitter aftertaste

Light straw colour with slight head. Light but consistent Delicate aroma of lemongrass peachy hop and pineapple undertones on Cask at The MaltHouse Willenhall. Goes well with summertime foods and desserts
Cask at the Bull and Blacksmith, Chillington, Devon. Pale gold with a white head. Very light but rather sharp citrus flavour. Overall another dull, pointless golden ale.
6 3 6 3 12 Bottle shared. Hazy golden with a big white head. Aroma of earthy hops, malt, caramel and toffee. Flavour is moderate sweet and light bitter. Light to medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Cask at the ledger building Jdw A clear pale gold yellow coloured pour with a fading white head. Aroma is subdued pale malts, apple, berry. Flavour is composed of light grains, watery, green berries, apple cider.. Palate is semi sweet, watery, low carbonation.. Light mineral in the finish. Very bland.
Cask @ Crossways, West Huntspill. Nice head with good duration. Color is amber. Aroma and taste are rich caramel, toasted malt, little nuts, hops and has a nice warming fruity finish.
Pours mahogany with off white head, aroma chocolate malt with summer fruit. Taste foregrounds the malt with some caramel notes, but overall the beer is balanced and the alcohol is well hidden.

Cask at GBBF 2017, Olympia, London, Aug 2017 - Clear dark brown in colour. Medium foamy off-white head. Good lacing. Malty; sweet malts, grainy, caramel. Fruity; sweet dark fruits. Syrupy mouthfeel. Hoppy; slight hops. Sweet-bitter malty and fruity throughout. Easy drinking. (2017-08)
Cask @ GBBF 2016. Pours an amber color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty caramel aroma. Fruity malty caramel flavor. Has a fruity malty caramel spicy finish.

Pint at the Tilley Stone in an English pint/ Clear dark amber with a creamy off white head. Certainly good looking. Muted toffee aroma, leaning towards a milky fudge. I�m going to stick with "muted" as far as flavour is concerned. Some red =currant, raisin and toffee, but nothing assertive or taste bud catching. Alcohol well disguised. Drank more like an old fashioned premium bitter. Not great, but not bad.
Mahogany colour. Chocolate malts aroma and taste. Jammy fruits and toffee malts in there.Great strength. Lasting head. Nice on palate. Overall excellent.

Cask hand pull at the moon under water Watford Jdw. A deep amber copper coloured pour with a lasting beige head. Aroma is burnt toffee apple, brown sugars, little hot alcohol. Flavour is composed of.. Flavour is composed of sweet jammy fruits, toffee and liquorice,. Palate is sticky sweet, liquorice, smooth Cask condition. Not bad. Little hot alcohol in the finish.

Cask handpull at Hamilton Hall as Otter Head, 5.8%. Dark amber orange, still and translucent with an enduring foamy beige head. Aroma is toffee, bread, golden syrup and honey. Body is smooth with soft carbonation. Taste is honey on toast, some astringent resinous hops, spicy with some booze. Not too sweet despite the rich malts giving a honey vibe. Actually pretty good but I�d only want a half.
Chocolatey. Smell and taste. Hint of red fruits in aftertaste. Nice strong chocolatey red ale

Cask at The Green Dragon, Leek (JDW) A clear deep amber colours with a medium off white head. Aroma of dark fruits, red fruits, slight chocolate, a little orange and subtle earthy hops. Taste of dark fruits, spice, slight chocolate, a little bready malts and subtle spicy, earthy hops. Medium bodied and soft carbonation. A bittersweet, spicy fruit bitterness in the finish. A sweet, malty bitter with fruit and subtle �english� hop bitterness. One of Otters best.
Pint at the Tilley Stone Gateshead. Dark brown bitter with an off white head. mocha and toast aroma. Bitter chocolate, red fruit flavour hint of overripe banana. Chewy palate. Good winter ale.

Poppy Otter: cask pint in The White Hart, Shifnal Shropshire on 16th Nov 2016. Deep amber pour, full white head that gave some good lacing. Malts to the fore here, but the finish is fairly bitter. A woody flavoured brew with enough going on to keep you interested until the last drop.
As Poppy Otter. Pours an amber brown colour. Taste is quite malty and biscuity

Tasted this in the Salt Cot, Saltcoats (JDW) on the 6th January 2016. Cask, handpump dispense. Clear pale copper in colour with a thin off white head. Malty aroma with a subtle hint of dark fruit. Thin creamy mouthfeel and good lacing. Mixed malts give a moist maltloaf base with a sweet flavour of raisin fruit. Damp earthy hop resins give a light bitter aftertaste which is rather short in the mouth. Finish is malty with dry currants and oak cask notes present in the palate. Easy to drink despite the 5% ABV. A decent ESB.

Appearance is amber and clear, lots of bubbles rising, with a large, thick white head. Aroma- hops, caramel malt, sweet bread, nutty hints. Taste- fruity hops, which bring some bitterness, balanced against sweet caramel and toffee malt. Quite a thin mouthfeel, with a short finish.

Cask at Crossways Inn, West Huntspill. Pours chocolate brown with an off white head. Quite sweet, some spice, choc. Ok. Earlier Rating: 10/17/2015 Total Score: 3.2 Cask at Victoria Lounge Bar, Hanley. Pours copper with an off white head. Quite malty, bitter hop, dencent enough ESB.

Gravity, The Mortar and Pestle, Hinckley, 08/12/15. Hammering the table football with Pops MacDrunkeasy. Decent rounded bitter with soft sesame and berry fruit dusted with enigmatic spice. Complexity and balance: proper beer at last. Nose of praline, nuts and berries. Deep red gold with slick head and condition. Nice. Earlier Rating: 12/8/2010 Total Score: 3.4 1) Beers of Advent day 8. Bottle chilled in the snow, as last night. Good yeasty aroma a bit like banoffee pie, with some oily hop presence. Pours out pale, brilliant ruby with a beige swirl of head. Crisp, solid bitter with caramel, mulled apple yeastiness, hints of redcurrant, chalk, nut husk and a malted milk biscuit aftertaste. Finishes hop dry with an underplayed fruitiness that reminds me of an alt. Like it. 2) Spoons, Hinckley, 15/12/11. Deep chestnut with a slim, well behaved cream lid. Walnut, polished wood and chocolate aroma. Fine, full bodied and slippery with notes of praline, walnut, dried figgy fruit, a hint of orange and a lingering, husky, cocoa-dusted malt finish. Milk choc Hobnob afters. Rich and heady- couldn�t session it. Festive stuff. 637414.
Hand pulled. Looks like it�ll be a little creamy, but falls flat. Bitter with little in the way of aroma.
Hazy golden color. Aroma of floral hops. Flavor of floral hops with caramel, strong bitter finish.
On top. Dark amber/brown color with small white head. Decent amount of hops with a nice citrus finish, but nothing special.
Art of Beer Fest �04. Deep copper in color with a small white head. Huge orange aroma.Overly sweet and malty with a touch of citrus and pine.

Has a nice orange/amber color and a fruity/hop smell. Taste is hopped, but slightly acidic and finishes with a nice fruity/hop bitterness. Overall not a bad IPA, but a little too much acidic/grapefruit flavor.

On tap: I enjoyed this a bit more than the cask version. This local brew was a nice change from SNPA. NERAX '02 cask: Moderate pine aroma, light orange color, slightly acidic bitter taste. Gets better as it warms. More subdued in the hops department than most American IPA's.
NERAX '03 Clean,hoppy beer,very soft and easy drinking, a great session beer.
Cask conditioned. funny looking. Citrussy and sweet with a slight wheaty feel about it. Nice and crisp.
On cask at NERAX '02 &'03: Very light flowery hops in the aroma, thin bodied, however the taste is very hoppy and fresh. Clear yellow color and a soft mouthfeel.

Cold on tap: Pours a clear and very dark amber color with a medium sized alabaster head. Aroma is of rich malts with earth notes. Taste is of rich malts and well blended earthy hops. Light bodied and smooth with ample carbonation. Ending is of rich malts and caramel notes.
Pale golden amber hue. Floral malty nose. Sweet, medium bodied, faint floral hops in the finish to keep it balanced. Decent.
Cask conditioned. highly drinkable beer. very smooth. faint malty aroma, slightly fruity and floral. Very slight hop finish, to keep it from being to cloyingly sweet.
CASK- I thought this beer was a nice pale. Pleasnant fruit flavors on the aroma and initally on the palate. It's sweet, would be a nice summer afternoon beer.
On cask at NERAX '02: Light straw/flowery aroma, amber color, starts and ends slightly sweet. This beer was better than the sum of its parts.
Rated 16.05.18. Clear golden. Diminishing white head. Aroma and taste of slightly sour pale malt, grass and lime.

(bottle) slightly opalescent deep golden colour with a frothy off-white head. aroma of resin and bran flakes, with some notes of marzipan, floral hops and yeast. flavour is herbal hops and more bran flakes, with lots of caramelized malts, some manure and yeasty sugar-icing finish. medium-bodied with average carbonation.
Bottle at home. Pours clear golden amber, sweet, light malty spicy and fruity.
500ml bottle, golden ale. Unusual taste but very drinkable. Would be great for a warm summer�s evening.

500ml bottle from Alesela. Pours clear golden amber, thin short-lived head. Sweet aromas, mostly honey, caramel. A very faint floral hop note. Something odd that isn�t quite metallic. Sharp though, perhaps acidic. Taste has more of this sharp bitterness. Didn�t enjoy it much.
500ml bottle from Aldi (presumed pasteurised) - clear deep golden, thin bubbly white head, malty, honey, caramel aroma, highly carbonated, herbal, bitter flavour
500ml bottle shared with mr_h. Amber brown, good foamy head. Resin grain malt aroma. Sickly sweet toffee malt flavour. Sour aftertaste. Not a good beer.
Bitter after taste with nice complex flavours. Well rounded and finished beer. A little too light possibly

50cl bottle. Pours a caramel colour with no head to speak of. The nose has honey and malt and then caramel on the end. More of the same on the taste. The palate is light to medium bodied and textured with a clean finish. A solid bitter.

Gravity dispense at Ascot Racecourse Beer Festival 2012 - 06/10/12. Clear golden with a thin bubbly off white head. Pale malts on the nose, light hop tones and a little citrus. Taste follows, a little caramel. Medium bodied with a bitter finish. Boring.

Bottle of 4,5 % ABV shared with TO on board Baluba at Fair Isle 15.05.18. Clear dark golden. White head and lacing. Aroma and taste og bread, dough, carrots and marmalade. Strange aftertaste of burnt toast.

(bottle) clear deep golden colour with a frothy off-white head. aroma of bran flakes and earth, with some notes of caramel and cornflakes. flavour is mostly pale malts and herbal hops, with lots of nettles, some sugar icing and a light-bitter candle wax finish. medium-bodied wirth average carbonation.
Bottle at home. Pours clear golden, nose is light citrus, taste is toffee malts, light bitterness.

Bottled at Sumburgh Hotel, Shetland. Pours clear dark golden with a small creamy white head. Aroma is malty/toffee, and nutty malts. Taste is light herbal bitterness, toffee, light dry moutfeel, good for the low abv, tasteful and clean.
Cask (Town Wall, Newcastle) - Amber in colour. Earthy hops and biscuity malt in the aroma. Earthy hops, nuts and dried fruit feature in the taste. Quite refreshing.
500ml shared with jeevan. Pours clear golden orange, no real head. Aromas of grapefruit and caramel. Taste has light sweetness. Slightly buttery at the end. Ok.

Pours mid amber, light lacing. Nose is biscuit and barley. Tastes malty, reasonable viscosity with mid range carbonation and good bitterness. I�m sure the Shetland water adds a delicate edge. Overall an ok beer but for my taste lightweight in the flavour stakes.
Bottle from Aldi pours a clear light gold with a moderate head. Aroma of biscuit and malt. Taste mild malt sweetness modest bitterness. An OK ale.
500ml bottle from Aldi, High Street, Glasgow - clear golden, good foamy off-white head, sweet malty aroma, biscuit, bit of citrus, grapefruit, bittersweet, fruity finish

50cl bottle. Pours a very light golden colour with a small head. The taste has a very obvious combination of hops (grapefruit) and malt (biscuits). The nose has the biscuits evident but more of a caramel. The palate is light to medium in body and texture with a fairly clean finish.
Bottle 0,60 ltr: Opaque black coloured brew with an sweet sour taste and the bitterness is low. Hints of roasted malts, cacao, dried fruits and an presence alcoholic burn.
Cask Conditioned at The Grapes, Oxford. Amber brown beer with whispy head. Boiled maly flavoured, sprout and cabbagy note. Then a hop blast with strong bitter sweet taste. Plenty of spare alcohol.
Cask@the bellwether, wednesbury. Hazy golden beer with medium head. Aroma of butter. Taste is butter with some citrus coming through. Diacetyl through and through I am afraid. Will try again.
Hand pulled at the Boldmere Oak, lovely guest ale with a good creamy white head, beautiful hoppy flavour rich golden colour, short lived as it was so popular!

Cask on stillage at the Stag & Hounds, Binfield, at 4% ABV. Amber with a thin translucent head; light, spicy, hoppy, aroma; sweet and full in the mouth with some chewy malts, fruity and spicy; with a lingering finish. A rather good bitter.

Cask, Lord Keeper of the Great Seal, Oadby. Amber with a white foam. Aromas are autumn fruit with berries and grain and honey. Flavours are sweet toffee with honey and autumn fruit. Lightly peppery on the finish. OK.

First tasted this at the Mossend Beer Festival, Lochwinnoch in July 1994. Cask, gravity dispense. Clear garnet in colour with a thin white head. Hint of berry fruit in the short malty aroma. Thin but creamy mouthfeel and good lacing. Mixed malts give a maltloaf base with raisin fruit and maple syrup notes. Dry earthy hops give a tart resiny aftertaste which lingers on the palate. Finish is again dry with oak cask notes. An ok session bitter.

Cask athe prince Albert, Wall Heath. Pours deep brown with a large head. Aroma is faint malt, toast and some citrus hops. Taste is some slight bread to start and a light piney hop finish with some orange. Medium bitterness.

Unretired, The Anchor, Burbage, 10/09/10. Nitro creamy bronze, fat Gilette head. Orange peel and cream aroma- not bad. Monster munch, milk, orange flesh flavour. Yep, beef Monster Munch afters. Holds up surprisingly well against the festival stuff, with some distinct orange hop character. Not bad.
I hate students as well, and rugby is ok but cricket, WTF is that. Perhaps drinking this in a dank, darkly lit, cigarette-fume- soaked basement in a great hall of learning merits an average grade

1. Cask Handpump at the Penny Black, Northwich (JDW) 18/11/2002 Copper amber coloured and slightly sweet on the palate. Some dryness in a pleasant malt finish. 2. Cask Handpump at the Penny Black, Northwich 19/11/2002 Copper amber coloured and slightly sweet on the palate. Some dryness in a malt finish.
I had this beer many years ago at one time when I was too lazy and stupid to write my thoughts. I will update this as soon as I get my hands on this beer again.

Bottled. Clear golden colour, medium, fast fading white head. Sweet malty aromas with some yeast and grassy hops. Taste of bread, honey and hay, some herbal and grassy hops, slightly metallic aftertaste. Light body, moderate carbonation, watery texture, dry finish. Drinkable, but characterless.

2016 11 30 Butelka 0,5 l. Ciemnoz�ote, klarowne piwo z obfit� bia�� pian�, kt�ra szybko opada i lekko oblepia szk�o. W aromacie nuta zio�owa chmielu �ateckiego, wyra�na �elazista, s�odowa, oraz co� co przypomina st�ch�e zbo�e. Niezbyt. W smaku wytrawne - czu� zio�owo��, s�odowo�� oraz lekk� metaliczno��. Pe�nia niska, wysycenie wysokie, goryczka zio�owa, niska ale wyra�na. Piwo z wadami, bez sza�u.
Do not liked it. Too bitter and some caramel taste. Probably will be better with salty food

Barwa z�ota, klarowne, piana bia�a, do�� obfita, do�� trwa�a. W aromacie DMS, zbo�owe, nieco mokry karton. W smaku s�odowe, zbo�owe, kukurydza. Goryczka �redniowysoka, jednak t�pa. Wysycenie wysokie, cia�o w normie. Wadliwe niestety.
boca 033L - kupljena u ROTOu - prosje�no pivo, Imperial valjda zbog malo vi�e alkohola u odnosu na obi�ne Kru�ovice

On tap at Metzer Eck in Berlin, Germany. Medium gold pour Finger high foamy white head. Malty nose hints at grain and cut grass. flavor is light grainy malt, mineral and some hop spice. decent flavor, but not in the class of Urquell or Budvar. Tasted on 8/22/19.

De Tercertiempocervezas. En vaso de hefe de Bavaria. Jugando a Transistor, luego a Journey of a Roach. Muy buen feel. Sin ser un dechado de sabores, se bebe bien agusto y tiene un fondo maltoso bastante superior al de una pilsen industrial

Family Mart summer beer campaign, 500ml. can. Aroma: yeasty. Appearance: clear, dark amber, head dissipates to nothing. Palate: light-bodied and slick, average carbonation, slightly bitter at the finish. Taste: lightly bitter, Czech cardboard.
Enjoyable Czech Pilsner. Very pleasant taste, pours clear golden with thick white head. Good both in appearance and taste.

Sampled from a can this beer poured a vibrant dark amber color with a medium sized creamy white head that left minimal lacing. The aroma was sweet, tangy, yeasty and a bit skunky. The flavor was tangy and yeasty with artifical grape, a bit of skunkiness and some astringency. Long finish. Medium bodied and smooth.
Golden pour. Floral spruce hop nose. Taste is standard lighter bodied IPA. Rated 10/21/04

I have never seen such a head from a bottled beer--thick, tan, four-fingers thick. The lace is just as thick, and sticky too. The color is dark copper, close to a brown ale. It�s also very clear. Close to perfection! Complicated aromas of malt and hops. It has an almost cinnamon sweetness. Awesome dry hop smells waft as the head recedes. Now, I�m detecting strong crystal malt (burnt sugars) aromas. Nice. Starts like a brown ale: dark malt sweetness that quickly captulates to soft hop flavors providing a nice balance to the brew. It is a smooth transition. The aftertaste is all hop which lasts a long time. Dry and moderately carbonated, this is a very good beer.
some bite. worth the money. Similar to samuel adams but perhaps more body and less balance. really enjoyed this from a bottle with friends during a BBQ in Somerville, MA.

12oz bottle-pours a foamy tan head and amber color. Aroma is medium malt, medium hops. Taste is medium malt-caramel, medium hops-flat bitterness. Maltier than a standard IPA approximates a standard PA.

draft - Pours amber with a medium sized head. The nose is of pleasant citrus hops. This ale is lightly carbonated and has the bold hops taste one would expect from the style. The malt balance is decent and the finish is dry and lingering. It�s not a great IPA, but it�s not bad either. Try it.
A pleasant dark caramel colour with a long-lasting peaky tan head. Strong citrus start with a bitter finish.

Poured a reddish brown color with a thick tan head that left a clear body with some yeast in the bottom. The nose is caramel, funky citrus hops, and a soft candy aroma. The taste is acidic upfront, it has a tart bitterness that smacks your palate around. Their is a sour presence that is pretty strong, the date on the bottle is 7/06 but maybe this went before its time. The finish is bitter grapefruit and leaves a slightly tannic quality on the palate.

From the bottle. Pours a surprisingly dark orange-brown with a fizzy off-white head. The aroma is somewhat mellow, peaches and apricots, some orange/pine hops. The flavor is disappointing, strongly metallic walnut-shell bitterness instead of the delightful hop resins that I�d expected or at least hoped for, mixed in with heavy-handed cola malts and some slightly rancid pecans and. The biggest problem comes in the mouthfeel, though - the beer is badly overcarbonated, making it prickly and unpleasant to drink.

The IPA pours a dark amber color with a fizzy, white head. Body clarity is clear. Aroma is of moderate flowery hops, which are very nice and airy. Where this IPA really shines is in its� taste. An unexpected curve is thrown in with this one, as there is a slight coal taste and a creamy texture that remind us of a porter. Initial taste is slightly bitter, but it is very mellow for an IPA. That slight bitter continues tbrough the finish. Light to medium weight on the mouth, with a dry and oily finish. This is not an IPA for a bitter IPA lover, but it is a great change from the usual IPA. A good blend of an IPA and a porter.

Red amber ale with a thick moka head. Herbal, green hops in aroma and sweet malt. the same is found in mouth, lots of grassy hops, nutty notes, but could do with some more malt to couterbalance. Mondial 2005.
NERAX '02 My favorite beer at this year by far.Greats tout from start to finish.Huge roasted charcater,chocolate and full bodied.
CASK- Nice tasty beer. Definate cocoa flavors, and also the oak as noted in the descripition. A very well done stout with some very distinct interesting flavors.

NERAX '02 Definite woody charcater in this brown ale,touch of acidity with a nice malt body.7/4/7/4/15 Rerated 12/16/03-Cask version at WCB Deep amber color with highlits of ruby brown.Aroma of oak and citrus.Fruity,oak,malty with a lingering bitterness.

Cask conditioned. Medium-dark brown, with a big frothy tan head that lasts forever, leaving a ring of lace with each sip. Aroma is very malty, fruity, and has some pretty strong floral hoppy notes. Flavor is very big - starts slightly sweet, turns to some woody and grassiness, and ends with a floral, piny hoppiness. Very big mouthfeel, chewy, and long lasting flavor. This very well could be WCBC's best beer.
CASK- one of my favorite brown ales, I love the wood, earthy tones on the palate, and the deep malt aroma. Beautifully dark, with a beige head. Excellent beer.

On draught at the micro-brewery tavern/campground near Unity, Wisconsin. Pours a clear golden blonde brew with a creamy white head that has some nice retention and excellent lacing. Aroma of golden grain malt, a touch of citrus and some fruity character. Taste is light to medium bodied, light carbonation with flavors of golden grain malt, some green vegetables and a touch of pear. Finish has a natural mild bitterness with some golden grain malt aftertaste. LogJam Lager is not as hoppy as I remember from the old location but the natural bitterness is a nice attribute to this beer.
Straw pale yellow, medium thin white head. Thin aroma of grain and light honey. Flavor is wheat with honey. Thin palate.

Thanks to hopdog. Pours a golden amber with a small big bubbles in the white head. Aroma of grain, like when you walk into a feed shop for horses. A slight sweetness. Flavor was very thin, sweet and watery.

12oz bottle. Poured a medium golden color with a small sized white head. Aromas of honey, light grass, and somewhat of a graininess to it. Tastes of pretty much the same - honey, wheat. Thin, watery and weak body.

Poured a dark gold with a little hint of orange. The thin whte head stayed around. The aroma was light carrots along with some sweet gingerbread. The taste was oddly old caramel with some light notes of hay. There was a light mouthfeel that fit in the with the style. Very lightly hopped. A decent beer.

not much aroma. i say there is a bit of a honey flavor, but cornfield says corn syrup. he�s probably right. amber color with no head, no matter how aggressively you pour. a bit oily with a sugary aftertaste.

Pours a hazy pale amber with very little head. It�s actually a little low on carbonation to start with. Mildly malty aroma. Slight grassiness. The flavor is mostly malt, but definitely watery. Finish is a lingering finish. Not bad, but doesn�t really seem a very graceful lager.

Weak, watery, off-tasting, a little sour, leads me to wonder if this bottle was slightly infected, however I wondered the same thing with several other of their beers.. Needless to say, I was not overly impressed !
Pours a dark yellow with a small head and little carbonation. There is slightly sweet aroma tht seems a little odd. Finishes slightly bitter with some mild hops. Very forgettable.

There seems to be a quality control problem at this brewery, since the eleven reviews preceding mine are all over the board. What I drank from the bottle was thin, gold, headless, and corny with a metallic finish. No more, thank you. Thanks & a tip o� the hat to El_Borracho and RAYBOY01.

May 2016 - Cask HP at The Green Man JDW, City, during the May 2016 job hunt. As �Mauldons Cuckoo�. Amber orange, clear, still, small bubbly off-white head. Aroma is bready, apple. Body is smooth, low carbonation. Taste is bready, apple peel, twiggy, sugary malt, honey, resinous finish. Basic. (3.0)

Hand-pulled pint in my local Wetherspoons on 22nd June 2016. Like some others, I found this �a little off�. Looked fine, old gold/amber body, full, lasting head. Strange aroma, hops and maltiness within the nose but sulpher like esters too. Taste similar, decent enough blend but again something not quite right.

Handpull cask at the Townhouse, Ely. Honey brown and clear with a big white head and lots of lacing. Smells of apples, brass, rust. Tastes bitter with a fruity hint and some vinegar. Harsh almost acrid finish. Not all that pleasant, I�d wonder if it was off but I�ve never had an off beer from this pub so I think it�s just not very nice. I really,really struggled with this one.
Cask@bloxwich showman, Bloxwich. Amber beer with small head. Aroma is light malt. Taste is malts and some dry herb. Ok.
Golden. Hops English. Citrus with bitterness. Not my thing. Old socks taste poor.

Cask, Alehouse, Chelmsford, half, 6th June 2015. White lacing and a golden and amber appearance. Loads of UK hops. Blackcurrants. Old socks. Taste is blackcurrants, thistle, lemons and faint citrus. Not my thing.
My favourite beer from Mauldons. Spring seasonal. Hoppy golden light session beer. Perfect for spring sunshine ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Amber coloured ale with a thick head. It has a malt aroma with hops in its finish.
Handpull, The Felix, Nuneaton, 16/06/13. Brassy orange lacing with each sip. Grassy, sherbet and apricot aroma. Mellow orange aniseed and herb notes;. light bitterness and soapy pine. Decent.

Tasted this in the Salt Cot, Saltcoats (JDW) in May 2013. Cask, handpump dispense. Pump clip shows a cuckoo? but it looks like a blue version of Lichtenstein�s Oriole to me! Clear pale amber in colour with a thin white creamy head. Slight note of fruity lychees in the short floral aroma. Thin resiny mouthfeel and poor lacing. Pale malts give a zesty fruit note of citric fruit with pink grapefruit and gooseberry dominant. Cereal flavour evident in the bitter hoppy aftertaste. Finish is tart with sweet notes fleeting. An ok summer session ale but I would stick with Black Adder!
Simply dark lager. Low in sweetness and bitterness but not thin. Malty body. Low in taste but high in drincabillity. Best for the food at the restaurant.
Nut brown. Roasty, slightly fruity aroma. Light bodied, rather sweet, really roasty flvaour. Lively. A nice rather flavourful, but uncomplicated dark lager only served from tap at the brewpub.
Sweet and thick in the beginning. Malty in the mouth and dry balanced bitterness in the end. Dangeruos because only low alcoholic taste.

Brownish amber in colour. Fruity aroma. Full bodied and very malty. Thick, filling mouthfeel. Malt sweet start, dry finish with balanced bitterness. A true-to-style, well made and tasty double bock. I spent 5 hours in train seeking it out, and it was worth it.
Draft - Pale light sweet grains. Clear gold with a rich white head. Light grains and sweetness. Not bad.

[2482-20090913] Tap. Leafy yeast aroma hints at wet doughy bread crumbs. Clear, bright orange gold body with a quick foamy white head. Doughy wet bread yeast and toasted leaves flavour. Light-medium body. Not great. &#40Called "Tracks Light" @ Tracks; Brampton, ON&#41

2009-09-13. Crisp yellow body with a tiny white head. Muted aroma, light grainy malt. Flavour is mild, light grainy malt, grassy straw bitterness is quite mild. &#405+&#41 Average palate. Okay. On tap at the brewpub as �Light lager�

. A drop better than national brands, watery. Little hop, some malt, no color, sickly aroma. And this was fresh. Touch of lemon mid-sip, like lemon in a water glass. Some bitterness, not awful, but was mostly poured out.

Their one and only "house brew" draught has a sweet aroma. Hazy chestnut colour, small head. Roasted malt flavour, a slight maple syrup like after taste. Nice mouth feel, smooth and creamy, great tongue tingle. A decent pint!

On tap on the rooftop of the Castanheiro Hotel in Funchal. Wow, what an amazing view and beautiful island. Speechless. Beer looks like a pale lager... straw golden. Good effervescence. White head. Nose is grainy like your standard domestic offerings. Taste follows suit but I'm definitely going to overrate this slightly because of the setting. Grainy sweetness with just enough bitterness to let you know this contains hops. First Portuguese beer rated!

Served ice cold and fresh from tap a sunny day at the waterfront in Madeira. The occasion might have some influence here, but I find it rather decent and refreshing like most other macro lager when served at the right premises without any faults. Nothing special, nothing extra, just another thirst quencher but nothing wrong. Would not do any effort to taste it again, but if the choice where between this and Heineken, Carlsberg etc, and I was in Madeira I would go for the local one.
Helyi nagyuzemi. Szigoruan jeghidegre hutve, ketdekas kiszerelesben, hideg uditokent fogyasztva.
Backlog. Clear gold with a small white head. Yellow and fizzy. Decent hops.

Many thanks for this beer from Madeira Island to Jacek Wigier (wineofdreams@gmail.com). Piana spora srednio trwala, Typowy lager miedzynarodowy ale lekko sie wyroznia, nie byl az taki fatalny jak sadzilem. Byl w swiecie lagerow nawet wyrazisty w smaku.

19/2/2019. Gift brought back from Portugal by a friend. Pours golden with a foamy white head. Aroma of grain, sweet corn, hops and grass. Moderate body, slight oily and thin texture, average pale lager carbonation. Not very good really.
Clear golden beer with light white head. Aroma is light malty and grains. Taste is weak sweet malty with light bitter touch. Light body, watery. Ok to drink but nothing more.

Aromat: utleniony w nieowocowy spos�b, mocno kartonowy, Wygl�d: barwa z�ota, piana bia�a, drobnoba�kowa, �redniotrwa�a, zostawia taki sobie lacing Smak: s�odowy, bardzo mocno kartonowy z przyjemn� zio�ow� goryczk� Podniebienie: nagazowanie �rednie, pe�nia podobnie, ca�kiem pijalne Podsumowanie: karton karton kartonem pogania, ale jest te� ca�kiem przyjemna s�odowo��, w okoliczno�ciach Madery pewnie smakuje lepiej
Golden with a white head - Malt aroma - Malt body with some hints of hops to balance - Malt finish with hints of bitterness - This was boring
Beer with black color, fuzzy aspect, soft bitterness, toast flavor noticed, average carbonized, some foam on top, (drunk a 33cl bottle beer with PG at "Casa da Vila", Quarteira, PT #1027)(#96 PT).

Fresh bottle in apartment, Funchal. Clear, dark brown, not far from black body with a nice, lacing tan head. Aroma has mild, smooth dark roasted malt with a hint of licorice. Flavor is also quite smooth with mild roasted dark malt, rye bred, dark chocolate and hint of coffee. Moderate but distinct bitterness. Medium body and decent aftertaste. Nothing very special going on here and no stout at all as the label says, but a tasty, smooth, easy drinkable black lager that goes extremely well down a hot summer day.

Bottle from a random shop on the island. Jet black pour, brown head. Nose is roasted malts, some earthy notes. Taste is pretty much the same with short, coffeeish, earthy finish. Pretty light, almost watery body, soft to average carbonation. Not that terrible.
Golden coloured. Rather malty, and surprisinlgy not overly sweet. Medium- to full bodied, and a bit of bitterness in the finish. Not bad at all.

Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy, dark ruby-brown with a modest, egg-shell head. Sweet, lightly roasted malt aroma with nuts and caramel. Flavor too is sweet, with notes of chocolate, roasted malts, hints of rich bread, more caramel and faint, earthy hops to finish. Light to medium in body with average, fizzy carbonation. Finishes lightly sweet and roasty. Very good.
Dark pour in glass. Taste has slight chocolate and coffee in it. Rated 5/19/04

pours dark with off-white head. Smells a little bready, toffee and nuts. Medium body and quite smooth. Toffee and caramel with some bitterness on the finish. Very nice going down, quaffable and pairs well with food.

Pours a nice dark brown into the glass with an off white head. Aroma is a combination of sweet malt and lager skunk. Beautiful taste combination of bitterness and sweetness. It is most likely dangerous how easy I can knock back this beer.

This pours out dark with a foamy beige head. The label has a nice banner and images of Mittel Europen towns. The aroma is of malt, yeast, and honey. It is a little watery, but has a pleasant taste of roasted grains, malt, and just the right touch of hops. The aftertaste is very nice. I can�t think of a better beer of this kind, but I havent tried a lot of dunkels.

POWERS YOU ARE FROM A DIFFERENT ERA! THIS IS A GOOD BEER, NICE COLOR GOOD FLAVORS BUT A BIT WATERY WITH A ASTRINGENT BITTERNESS THAT LACKS CHARACTER IN MYBOOK. THE NUTTY TASTE IS A SAVING GRACE ALONG WITH THE INTERESTING MALT BACKING. I WOULD LIKE TO KNOW THE AL/CONTENT. CLEAN BURP ANYWAY! NICE CARBONATIONS SOLID AND TINY! NICELY SWEET!
Ruby red color, stout like roasted malt aroma. Solid carbonination, bready. Roasted malty almond like taste subtle hopiness
A nice import dark reddish lager from Czech republic that was supposedly crafted for the US market. Smooth and medium bodied with a mild taste (slightly sweet).

12 oz bottle. Deep dark brown, thick tan head. Aroma is very nutty and toasty with cocoaish notes as well. Maltiness is very deep and rich. falvour is also sweet and malty, toffee/cocoa, toast. Complex sweetness. Hops have faded significantly from what I can tell were once here. A little bit soapy. Also notes of a bit of vanilla. Full, sweet mouthfeel and some light, lingering earthiness. Pretty tasty, although not as fresh as it probably could/should be.

Pours mahogany coloured with a thin foamy head. Beautiful caramel and roasted malt aroma with a nice touch of floral hops. Great taste of lightly roasted malt with some initial sweetness. There�s lots of hop bitterness but it seems so much more refined and balances compared to the high test IBUs.
Light, golden, clear and sparkling, thick light head, few lace. Flowery nose. Bitter aroma. Long and bitter finish.
Pale amber. Neutral aroma. Clean, medium bodied rather sweet, not much bitterness.
Mild, sourish aroma. Opens very sweet and sour, the middle is sweet and hoppy. Finishes with sweet maltiness, leaving a cucumber aftertaste.
Reddish color, thick light head and nice lace. Malty and bitter nose. Light to medium body, smooth and balanced, fizzy. Moderate bitter, rye-like flavor. Bitter, rye-like and long finish.
One of my favorites during a recent Scandinavia trip. It's on the weeet side and has noticeable rye flavor to it. Malty and very enjoyable with all its yeasty goodness.
Pale amber. Rather neutral aroma. Fruity, quite light bodied, rather sweet with a pleasant bready touch. Slightly bitterish finish.

Hugely overcarbonated. This beer has a really big head that is unwilling to stay in the glass while the beer is being poured. Soft, sourish aroma. Very neutral taste, hardly any malt or hops. Finishes unpleasantly bitter. You would expect more from a special 100 years anniversary celebration brew, but that's what you get...

Backlog. Pale yellow, fizzy head. Maltiness and hops with a nice sparkly carb. This was one of the best finnish beer�s I�ve tasted. The taste was very balanced with a very lively and fresh mouth feel.
Light, pale yellow color, thick head, nice lace. Flowery nose. Light body, smooth, moderately bitter, carbonated. Bittre and long finish.
Pale yellow, airy head. Fruity aroma, light bodied. Some vanilla aroma. Smooth with low bitterness. Uncomplicated but refreshing.
Not very good. Didn't like the aroma. Pretty light tasting, very few hops. All in all a boring beer.

Light, sourish aroma. Opens up yeasty, with not much taste. Overcarbonated. No taste to speak of. Finishes really nondescript, no aftertaste. Another special occasion beer that leaves much to be desired.

Color amarillo, con mediana neblina y part�culas en suspensi�n, transl�cida. Espuma blanca de m�s de dos dedos de espesor y buena retenci�n. Aroma a cereal, ligero pl�tano y, m�s ligero a�n, notas de hierba lim�n, al atemperar desaparece lo c�trico y gana presencia e intensidad el pl�tano. Sabor en esa l�nea, escaso y con notas met�licas reci�n servida, m�s intenso y redondo al atemperar, final corto de liger�simo amargor herbal, alcohol bien integrado. Textura entre acuosa y sedosa. Carbonataci�n media baja.
0,5l Flasche. Typisches Weizen, sch�ne Schaumkrone, Aroma nach Banane, aber es fehlt Tiefe.
Bottle @ B&T Brewery Tap, Shefford. Clear amber with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and caramel. Flavor is medium sweet and light bitter. Dry and light bitter finish. Watery. 120219
Bottle @ B&T Brewery Tap, Shefford. Nice head with good duration. Color is amber. Aroma and taste are caramel, grain, malt, hops and has a malty finish.

12/2/2019. Bottle at the B&T Brewery Tap, Shefford. Pours dark amber with an off-white head. Aroma of caramel, malt, light hops and fruit. Moderate sweetness, medium bitterness. Moderate body, oily texture, soft carbonation. Ok, considering.

275ml bottle (3.2%) at home on 13 Jan 2018, present from Brendan G (bb 31 Jul 2018): sweet malty, grain aroma, pale golden brown, good off-white head, caramel, biscuit, grain, faintest vanilla, moderate fizz.

Bottle. The highest selling light ale in the UK, according to the bottle. Gold body with visible carbonation. Medium white head. Nose is dusty hops, red fruit and blackberry. Biscuity malt. Dusty bitterness. Light body with a watery palate. Dry finish. Meh.
Cask at JDWs in Surbiton. One of those things you see in bottles and assume you must have had at some point, but never did. Weak palate, very light malt, watery, not good.

Bottle from Beers of Europe. Appearance - amber with a nice fluffy head. Nose - light toffee and shortbread. Taste - caramel biscuits. Palate - light bodied with a creamy texture and a long dry finish. Overall - decent for the low ABV.
Bottle, 330 ml at The Four Ashes, Takeley. Pours amber with off-white head. Malty caramel and very light and bland. Not something I�d like to drink again.
Bottle from Wine & Beer Direct, Halifax. Clear copper amber with no head. Bitter with a light malty-sweetness. Not too flavoursome though.

500ml bottle from Beers fo Europe. Pours clear amber, couple of floaters, thin white head. Aromas of stewed apple, malt, caramel. Faint spice. Taste is watery, more apple, mixed peel. Medium body, clean finish. OK.

Bottle from Beers of Europe. Mid orange brown, cloudy, lots of yeast sediment. Bleh, flabby, cabbage. Neither malts nor hops manage to express themselves here. Basically crap homebrew, I�m embarrassed to share a name with this beer.

500ml bottle. Brown amber colour, off white foam head leaving lacing and aroma of sourish malt. Taste is tangy fruity, sweet malty with some bitterness. Medium bodied, medium to high carbonation, dry tangy finish. Quite OK.

Bottle 500ml. Clear medium orange yellow colour with a small to average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, toasted, sweet malt. Flavour is moderate sweet and light to moderate bitter with a average to long duration, fruity, earthy. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft to flat. [20120808]
Bottle. Medium head with medium duration. Color is amber. Aroma and taste are malt, caramel, grain and hops.
Bottled@chriso. Golden colour, small white head. Aroma is fruity, floral, mildly raisins. Flavour is fruity, floral, raisiny, a bit earthy and caramelly. Mild sweetness as well.

Bottle �conditioned�. Slops muddied brown with a suggestion of a head. It doesn�t last. Some decent Bertie Bassett and brown sugar notes on the snout. Disappointment beyond; low condition, slightly rancid walnut, liquorice Allsorts, a strange pippy fruit smoothie note, rum-like booze.
Cask in the market porter. Alround rating: Sweet toffee malts, fruity rum and raisin toffeeness, light nuttyness, its on the sweet side of balance, but its still drinkable.

Cask, gravity, at Bedford Beer Festival �08. Slightly hazy copper. Sweet malt aroma. Very sweet malty taste. Then nothing. Upfront beer with no afters. Quite interesting. Later on I detected some chocolate. 15.6.11 Cask at Wellington Arms. Marshmallow aroma, gradually developing chocolate. Flat, grim malt taste, rather watery. Slight bitterness. Rating: 6,3,6,3,12:2.9
Cask. Mild aroma of malt, dark amber, small tan head and lace. Taste is soft malt, light bodied, balanced. Fair.
cask at guilford ...copper ... thin white head ...sweet fruity nose ... dark fruity malts ... light bitter linger ...

Cask by air pressure dispense at The Bow Bar. Pours a half pint with no head and an amber coloured body. Mildly hops to the nose. Hints of caramel malts joining a rounded taste of hop bitterness. Creamy mouthfeel [Edinburgh, 26.10.2008].
Tasting notes from 2002 Harbury beer festival. Copper-amber with thin head. Notes of fruit, malt, and carmel aromas. Carmel malts, dry fruit and hop finish. Lasting bitter finish.
Cask at Bedford BF �06. Amber, no head. Malt aroma and taste. Sweet and easy drinking. Low bitterness. Not a stand out.
Veyr bitte,r but nice brew, the fom takes a while to settle which is nice. The colour is golden.

Cask handpull at Market Porter. Deep copper colour with thin beige head. I really just don�t like these earthy caramel dominated bitters. The caramel dominates too much and it is just not to my taste. Nothing wrong with it at all, but not my style of bitter.

Cask, Rugby Fest 06. Amber/brown with a small head. Aromas are lots of sweet toffee with cookies, dough and earthy hops. Flavours are sweet malty toffee and caramel with come citrus. Earthy, dry and spicy hops towards the finish. Quite flavoursome.

Striaght from the Cask at the Erewash Beer fest in Sandiacre on Sat 20th Nov 2005. Mid / light brown colour. A very odd smell & a taste that suggested it was near the end of the barrel (still clear though), if so then fair enough. But if that�s what it was supposed to be like then it�s not good.
Cask Conditioned at Harbury Beer Festival. Brown amber beer with flufy head. Malty fruity caramel bitter with a minaral dry background. Fruitiness lasts to the end with a refreshin bite.
Bottle from Systembolaget. Bready malty smell. Similar taste with a light spicy touch in the finish. Light bitterness. Doesn�t stand out.
500ml can. Clear golden body with a low head. Light bread, grass, hint of corn.
Ljust b�rnstensf�rgad v�tska. Br�dig doft. Neutral och hyfsat stram beska. Iskall �r det en bra t�rstsl�ckare.

Pours a clear gold with white head. Malty, euro-lager aroma with saaz hops and a hint of minerality. Light to medium bodied palate with mostly maltiness and very low bitterness. An ordinary lager, nothing more, nothing less. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bread of the fragrance. Otherwise pretty scentless. Taste is a bit malty but with most alcohol taste, I think. Quite poor at the time. Bitterness, there is plenty of. A heavier bitterness that finishes the beer back in mouth for a long time. This beer did not appeal to me at all. Follow me @ Kung av �l @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.
500 ml bottle, rated from backlog. Golden with white head. Aroma malty, fresh and with faint hop notes. Taste is of crisp malt, some fruit, grain and honey.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Pours clear golden with a one inch frothy white head. Aroma is grain, some floral hops and some sweet corn. Taste is medium sweet with a medium bitterness, finish is sweet with with some crips bitterness to it.
Bottled. Pours golden with a huge white head. Smells abit fruity and stale malty. Tastes grassy hoppy with a very bitter finish.

440 ml can sampled in 2007. Reddish brown body with a medium sized beige head. Not much aroma, some caramel malt. Flavor has very light roasted, mild caramel malt and that�s more than less what there is to taste. Not much bitterness, thin watery body and short aftertaste.
440ml can. Brown with a creamy persistent head. Little aroma - bit of malt & caramel. Ditto flavour. Sweet and smooth but very uninteresting.
Can. Copper colour with beige head. Aroma is fruit, berries. Flavour is pleasent, fruit, caramel, malt. Ordinary beer.

Can. Clear, copper body, and a beige head. Malty-sweet aroma, with caramel, but it is quite weak. The same goes for the flavor, but it is a bit more evident. Considering the low ABV, it is a nice one, but I would prefer it beefed up a bit, and a fuller body. (070914)

(draught keg in Baiborne Lees) not retired apparently. Dark brown with hints of red, small off white head. Malt aroma. Mild biscuit malt flavor. Actually not a bad session beer - I think it�s underrated here.

Unretired, 440ml can(s), Morrisons. Pours deep ruby with a creamy yellowish head that sticks around. Biscuity malt prevails with notes of chocolate and malted milk. The subtlest hint of roast and just enough sourish woodiness to keep you lifting the glass. Creamy palate. Shames bottled beers twice its strength. More 2.6% beers please that don�t compromise on body or flavour. Tasty Mild.

440 ml can - "brewed and distributed by InBev UK Ltd, Luton" Dark brown with almost no head; a spicy malt aroma; sweet, thin and malty in the mouth; almost no body; slightly bitter aftertaste. Not unpleasant.

Canned(49p to clear Morrisons) Dark with a big bubbled off-white head. Slight aroma of roast malt, little else. Smooth and fairly malty, sweetish/grainy finish. Ok but nothing great..prefer draught mild, but those are thin on the ground around here.
(draft) No head at all, but somehow managed to have very good lacing. A hint of caramel in the flavor. A slightly lagerish finish but not too fizzy. Not bad at all.

Canned. A decent aroma of caramel and maybe some sweet toffee. The appearance is a buttery brown with a creamy �smoothflow� head. The taste is difficult to find as it is very thin. However there is a little caramel sweetness as it warms up. It�s a bit like a sweet Shandy Bass in a way; beer for the playground.
Typisch Engels bier+ niet al te sterk van smaak, maar goede doordrinker; licht bitter.

Clear copper color, small off-white head, stays a while, some lacing; sweet roasted malts nose, light floral hops; light body, creamy to watery texture, soft carbonation; light bittersweet, hint of fruit; smooth light bitter finish.

Keg. The Bridge Inn, Preston, Dorset. Brown with a thin foam. Aromas are toffee and brown sugar with dark treacle. Flavours are mixed fruit of some sort with sweet treacle and a light nuttiness. Slightly herbal with a cardboard and pepper finish. Mediocre.
From the archives: Had this one from many places on tap when I was in England. When you choose a bitter for the evening, that was a good choice for me. Drinkable for the price and looked OK.

On-Tap at Hotel in Southampton, UK. Light copper color with a small head and bit of lacing. Mild aroma of some malt, not much else. Mild malt flavor and a bit of bitterness in the finish. Fairly light body and quite smooth. No real character present. A bit disappointed, just a run of the mill beer. I am off in quest of some real cask ales while in England.
Keg at the Hope Inn, Hythe, Kent. Copper with a ring of white head; very lightly carbonated; simple malty aroma; malty, smooth and gently bitter; sweet to finish. Pleasantly drinkable.

Pint can from Brit Shop in Leipzig brought home to Toronto! Pours med-dark amber clear minimum head and carbonation. I am tasting rounded light caramel malt profile, rounded lightly bitter hops finish medium-light body, slight vinegar aroma above palate on some sips. Not much going on but drinkable fare.
(draught - keg Woolpack in Braiborne Lees) Medium amber with small off white head. Malt aroma. Malt flavor with not much hops in the finish.
