Finish is average, malty and dryish, faint caramel and light bread, light roasted malt, light - some grassy - herbal hoppy-ness. OK bitterness for ESB - not too sweet/not too much caramel. Aroma has light notes of barnyard.
250513. Bottle at home. Pours slight hazy copper with a small head. Aroma earthly floral notes, bread. Very strange odor. Malty body. Weird but does getter better once it settles.

Bottled (from AbM). Amber colour with a small off-white foamy head. Aroma is caramel malts, some wood, resin, mild grass as well as some floral notes. Flavour is floral, wooden, a bit crystal and bready malty with some slight herbal notes. Nice and smooth bitterness in the finish.
Bottled, Pasteurised. Red beer with fluffy head. Fruity malt beer, rounded and sweet with caramel notes. Plenty of alcohol nose and strong roast flavours.

Bottled. Ruby red/brown with a moderate head. Aromas of fruity esters and syrupy sugar. Burnt malt and toffee in the mouth give way to a christmas pudding + fruit note and a hint of hop. Dry toasted aftertaste

Cask Stillage at the Metropolitan Centre, Bury 18/11/2005 Brewed to commemorate part of the Welsh Marches History according to the programme notes so this is possibly a one off or irregular brew. Golden coloured beer with some hoppiness and subtle fruity and floral aromas. Slight dryness and bitterness in the finish.

Bottle conditioned. This one went down really well, right down the sink. Initial ripe fruitiness in the nose developed into a sourness in the mouth that decame undrinkable after a few sips. I have now tried enough English bottle conditioned beers to have spotted the reason why so many of them are undrinkable. If I can spot it why can`t the producers of these beers?
Grassy herbal nose with some mild malt notes. Softly honeyed and fairly dry palate with mild bitterness. Clean finish.
Tasting Notes from Fall 2000: Only available at the brewery. True to name, and well-rounded as well.
Canned, 500 ml, shared with Miro B and JFK10000. Cear golden no head. Malty, watery, bit grainy, sweet. Bitterness in after.
Can from a local store next to the hotel. Pours clear gold with thin off-white head. Sweet corny nose. Tastes corn syrup, sweetish, empty, bit boozy. Efes did better job, still not good though.
50cl can. medium carbonation. yeast and malt aroma. Non-balanced metallic, acidic, bitter and sweet taste. not refreshing not fruity. average lager with medium/ high alcohol content.
intense golden colour, herbal aroma, neutral, not bad ... ..................
At Odi's place, pours yellow with a small head, aroma of lemon, caramel, flavor of caramel, toffee, medium bodied

Klarowne, piana �adna, cho� nie w 100 % sp�jna. Aromat zbo�owy, lekko cytrynowy. W smaku chlebowe, kwaskowe, wodniste, ale nie ma a� takiego dramatu. Nawet delikatna chlebowa goryczka gdzie� tam si� przewija. Gdzie� tam przewija si� te� lekki cytrus.
F�a�ka zo Zanzibaru. V��a kukuri�n� smradlava. Farba bled�. Chu� ned� sa op�sa�. Odporn�.
Flasa od Jingisa. Vona slaba sladova. Bledomedova farba. Chutsladova sladkasta nezaujimava
0,5 bottle, taken in Tanzania. Light body with small white head. Light collaboration. A common lager. Good for a sunny hot day.

2019-01-17. Pale yellow body, small quick white head. Aroma is muted, light cereal. Flavour is mild, light bitterness and cereal notes. Average to light bodied palate, soft carbonation. Better than expected but quite boring. 5/3/5/3/10 Bottle shared by fiulijn at mcberko's.
375ml bottle at Matt's. Appearence: clear golden Aroma: malt and typical lager hops Taste: similar with bready notes Overall: regular mass market lager

375ml bottle @ Matt's. Pours a clear pale golden colour with a thin white head. Nose is lightly vegetal, corn, mild skunk, with a cereal malt. Flavour is lightly vegetal, mildly herbal, and a trace of skunk. Light bodied, light carbonation, and a mild sweetness. Meh.
Honey and cardboard. Clear gold with a small white head. Cardboard and pale malts.

375mL bottle, pours a clear pale yellow with a small white head. Aroma is quite skunky, with vegetable notes, straw, and cereal. Flavour is fairly skunky and vegetal, with straw, herbal notes, and skunk. Not too horrifying, but it's a generic, shitty, industrial lager.
Bottled. Clear golden, mid sized head. Aroma of corn bread. Mid dry with light body and rounded mouthfeel. Corn and some hay. Rather low bitterness. Relatively clean and drinkable.
A: Clear gold with a small white head. N: Faint hint of pale malt T: Faint malty profile with a hint of bitterness. P: Thin O: Standard light lager.

Bright yellow colour. Aroma of high gravity brewing, like sticky malts and too malt alcohol. Sticky and with a bit of alcohol, and that alcohol stays with your palate through the finish. So sticky, sourish, and not all that much i
Not the worst beer you can have around Zanzibar and Serengeti... does not mean it is a good beer.

Bottle. Light golden, small and mostly diminishing head. Light, malty - some corn and lightly sweetish - sweetish aroma, light cereal and faint hoppyness. Body is light, malty and lightly sweetish - sweetish flavor, light cereal and faint hoppyness. Finish is short, malty and lightly sweetish, light cereal and faint hoppyness, faint alcohol. Sweetish lager with almost no bitterness.

column4: Soci�t� Frigorifique et Brasserie de Tunis (SFBT)
column5: Puszka 240ml, zakupiona w Magasin G�n�ral Kantaoui. Jasno-z�oty kolor, klarowny. Wysoka, bia�a piana, szybko opadaj�ca, ale pozostawiaj�ca sporo �lad�w na szkle. Aromat �aden. Nie wyczuwam, ani chmielu, ani s�odu. Bardzo wodniste i pozbawione smaku.

column4: Soci�t� Frigorifique et Brasserie de Tunis (SFBT)
column5: Pours yellow white head - nose and taste of corn, metal and malt - light bodied.

column4: Soci�t� Frigorifique et Brasserie de Tunis (SFBT)
column5: Van tap in Port El Kantaoui. Maltig, zoet, beetje kleffig, grainy. (11-10-2019).

column4: Soci�t� Frigorifique et Brasserie de Tunis (SFBT)
column5: Pours a clear golden color with white head. Standard lightly sweet light lager aroma and taste. Notes: can in the Tunis airport, Feb �19

column4: Soci�t� Frigorifique et Brasserie de Tunis (SFBT)
column5: Color Straw yellow The aroma is not strong, hop just a little bit malt. Taste a bit malt light hop bitterness
golden colour, nice head, seafruit aroma, smooth, unpleasant aftertaste ....
Drank once from a can. Savage night followed it hence the 5*. Memories made from an elite sesh.

Botella en monton de ocasiones sobre todo en el Mare Oviedo. Color rubio transparente con espuma blanca. Refrescante y poco mas con muy ligeros sabores a casi nada. Como mucho quita la sed. De lo mas corriente.

I had this beer many years ago at one time when I was only giving ratings to the beers but was too lazy and stupid to write down my thoughts. I will update this as soon as I get my hands on this beer again.

Keg at the Rose & Crown, Birchalls, Walsall. Mahogany, translucent, with a big creamy head. Lots of lacing. Metallic smell, a bit sour with a good hit of liquorice. Sweet taste with a bit of sourness on the finish. Watery body. Liquorice, malt vinegar and oak chips in the aftertaste. Really not a lot to it but it's a somewhat passable old-fashioned mild.

Ked, half pint, at The Winning Post, Worcester. Off-white head blanketing the glass. Clear coal black body. Vague creamy malty nose, slightly roasted. Lightly roasted malty sweetness to the flavour character. Soft ending. Easy to drink, thin bodied. Okay. (Sunday pub crawl with TheCellarer and Snegurochka 08.07.2018).
chestnut brow/red with fine head. aroma of malts, caramel, toffee, creamy, soft carbo, chocolate, light roasted malts.
Keg at the Red Lion, Llanrwst. Pours clear brown with a creamy off-white head. Aromas of creamy chocolate and light caramel. Taste is watery and light. Thin finish.
Draft Keg. Chestnut colour. Cream colour head. Light toffee malt and caramel tones, thin body. Probably used to be a good mild back in the day when brewed in Wolvo. Rare to find though.

Draught at The Blue Mugge, Leek. A clear brown colour with a creamy off white head. Subtle aroma of caramel, some chocolate and subtle roasted malts. Taste of caramel, chocolate, a little coffee and subtle roasted malts. Light bodied, smooth texture but watery. A short, soft, roasted bitterness in the finish. Never tried this, is watery and bland but better than some commercial lagers and bitters.
Keg at the Warriors; dark brown pour with a creamy off white head, aroma has a hint of fruit and chocolate, taste has a hint of nuts, fruit and light roast, creamy mouthfeel.

Dark almost black color with a fine creamy off white head. Mild intensity in the aroma. Medium light body and a soft carbonation.tad sweet and a moderate bitterness. Mild creamy and a bit thin roasted malt, coffee and toffee flavor. [On tap at Prince Alfred in High Str Liverpool, England]
Drank this for the sake of nostalgia. Pretty feeble - quite watery with a taste of grain and cocoa powder.
On tap at a pub in Woolaston, 21/11/2015.Dark brown with a thin, beige, head. Very easy drinking mild, with a touch of chocolate and toasted malt. Watery in character and rather dull all round.
From a beer hawk mystery case. Light sweetish lager. It�s lager , better than standard 4.8% lager but it is lager ! Serve very cold on a hot day.

Draught at The Hand Beer Bar, Falmouth, Cornwall. Gold with white head. This proved to be quite a light, cereal, grainy, malty beer. Hints of lemon, quite yeasty. Simple but a little lacking. It's okay.
Klassisches Pilsner mit etwas Hopfen. Relativ mild. Gute Perlung, Durstl�scher. Wenig Aromen jedoch sehr s�ffig und bittermildes Ende.
Prima pilsener die je niet vaak tegenkomt. Licht moutig van smaak en een fijne hop smaak. -backlog de BierApp-
Fles 30cl thuis. Heerlijke pils. Lekkere volle smaak. Fris bitter. (12-2010).
Draft beer. Ok pilsner, but not great quality. A bit hoppy maybe even for a pilsner.
Van de tap in Arti e amici tijdens de cd-presentatie van JOE. Veel bekenden, leuk. We kwamen er met Yukie. Goed doordrinkbaar pilsje, fris.
Fairly inoffensive pilsner which appears to be quite common in the Netherlands. Cool, refreshing and crisp. Not my favourite, but very drinkable. Nice head on draught.

From old tasting notes. Radiant gold; crystal clear. Little bubble carbonation with a lingering foamy white head and lace. Dry hop aroma. Medium dry, grainy malt flavor with adequate malty background. Flavorful and drinkable.

Tap en fles. In Lindeboom pilsener proef je altijd de arme zandgronden lijkt het wel. Een heel aardse smaak - en daarmee een pils met een heel eigen smaak. Dat valt te waarderen (waarbij ik me goed kan voorstellen dat anderen dat niet of minder waarderen - ik heb dit vele malen liever dan het gewone doorsnee-pils). Erg licht van keur. Goed voor een pilsener.

Cask - Pours a clear yellow gold colour with a small white head. Aroma is light toasted malts with some apple notes. Moderately sweet and malty taste, some citrus and hop notes give a little bitterness and a drying finish.
On Cask at JDW Briar Rose in Brum. Pours a light golden colour. Fruity aroma. Pleasant zesty taste. Gentle bitter aftertaste. A good first pint of the day.
Enjoyable light, golden ale, good zesty fruit flavour, a little sweetness and a subtle malt too. Finish is satisfying, hops and bit of oiliness to coat the mouth.
Pint on tap at the old Market Hall. Thin creamy white head. Clear golden pour. Light bitterness.
Cask at the Edward Rayne, Rayne�s Park. Pours clear yellow with a white head. Aroma of malt, a little buttery. Sweetish taste and finish.

On tap at spoons. Pale hazy amber with a thin tan head residing. Scent is mild apple. Taste is soft, mild pale ale. Semisweet. Very easy drinking. Consistent apple. Shame about the Apple. Finish is a tiny bit sour. Good.
Cask at Falcon near Clapham Junction. Very citrusey, moderate hop, some zest, sweetness, slightly oily. Decent beer.

Cask (4.7%), 1/2 pint by hand-pump at Drum & Monkey, Glasgow on 17 May 2018: earthy, fruity aroma, pale golden, thin creamy white head, excellent fine lacing, earthy, biscuit, fruity flavour, creamy, sweetish.

Pint off cask at the Lord Abercrombie. A rich golden ale in a very English style, with lots of malt and not much at all in the way of hops. It had more oomph about it than many other golden ales, but it just wasn't that exciting. Perfectly drinkable though.
Strong fresh citrus hoppy taste great blonde beer a tad strong for a session ale but we'll worth a crack if you like your blonde ale

Good buttery czech style hop aromas, sweet body with a fruitiness that seems out of place. A strange off flavour develops that reminded me of the taste of an Indian "whiskey" I once had. Once was enough. Still better than some indian lagers I`ve tried.
Pretty substandard, really. The waitress said that Buck Light was comparable to Bud Light and I couldn�t agree more.

Draft @ Alpharetta. Color is almost white with a nice malty aroma. Taste had a nice grain feel and taste to it with a touch of smokiness and mellow malts. Lively mouthfeel with an obviously thin body. I usually dismiss these types of beers but I liked it.

You know this was refreshing light and easy to drink, but had very little character to speak of. A microbrew that will appeal to the unpalatable rolling rock types. Re rate: This beer has gotten a little bit better than I remember it, a refreshing light beer with a solid malt backbone and some light grassy hop notes. Actually really good for a light beer.

Thirst quenching and easy drinking and beats the macros for what it is trying to deliver - definitely not a blond ale though - but more complex than an American Standard - subtle hoppy flavor going on here. Not my first choice at Buckhead - but needed to add to my list - and was pleasantly surprised. Good beer to introduce a novice beer drinker to the joys of craft brewed beer - which I did. Clean and clear and nothing offending here - no real aroma or thick head.

I guess that they are brewing this to offer BudMillCoors drinkers a beer that won't shock them too much. Straw gold color and highly carbonated. This one pales in comparison to this brewery's other offerings. Most of the women at the bar seemed to enjoy it though.

For a light beer, it's not bad at all. It just pales in comparison to the brewery's other fine offerings. Hoppy and slightly funky nose. Very pale gold. Clear, sweetish slightly watery flavor. Palate 'light' and a little watery.

Note: I tasted this at the Alpharetta, GA (metro Atlanta) location. Cloudy yellow with an orange tint. Head has unusually large bubble, but it fades to a thin small bubbled foam later one. Very citrusy, mild spiciness with some estery notes getting stronger towards the bottom of the bottom. The fuzzy mouthfeel from the carbonation (similar to Chimay Red) makes it a little more difficult to drink that it should for such a light beer.

Date: 08/31/1996 Mode: Draft Source: Brewpub clear red-amber, whispy head and nice lace, sweet malt aroma, with just a touch of hops, sweet malt flavor with good balancing hops that start mild and then come on strong, good bitter finish -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Date: 11/13/2000 much dryer Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 8/10; Flavor: 7/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 16/20 Rating: 3.5/5.0 Score: ***/4 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.

A beautifully copper ale that is one of the finest session beers I�ve ever had. I could have drunk endless pints of this stuff. Mild, flower aroma that is reflected in the taste. An unobtrusive hop and a pleasing malt balance. This is a gorgeous beer. Very similar to Atlanta�s Dogwood Pale Ale. Loved it!
Rich amber color with not much head to speak of. Light caramel aroma. Burnt molasses taste with a mellow roastiness.

Deep red color with a medium thick head. Sweet caramel malt aroma, and the taste to match it. Very light hoppiness. Delicate and slightly spicy, and the best of the year around offerings from Buckhead Brewery that I�ve tasted yet. Goes great with their prime rib.

Dark leatherized ruby. A nice head fades slowly but completely. Just looking at it, I probably would have guessed a brown. The aroma and flavor wouldn't have dissuaded me either. Warm malts, a slight hop bite and a tad tart. The flavor is come cocoa, caramel, slightly metallic hops. Good beer, but the aftertaste drives down the overall quality.
Expected a Killian''s clone, but was pleasantly surprised. Lot going on in this brew - nice copper color - fruity undertones, malty finish.

This was the dregs of the vat, so I'll need to re-rate someday. Strong bittering, mild caramel. Wood in the finish, and the dregs bittering threatened to overpower anything else towards the bottom of the glass. I've liked their other amber beers better.
Beautiful dark amber color with a lasting head. Very well balaced flavor. One of my favorite beers.
A nice well balanced amber ale, that is not overly heavy on the toasted malts. A solid malt character and some refreshing cascadian hops. Very nice caramel and toffee flavor.

Wow Im still finding notes from the Atlanta Pub Crawl! A reddish orange appearance with a moderate head. Aroma was floral with a citrus tone. A slightly bitter flavor with a huge malt background. This was quite the hoppy amber ale. Enjoyable brew and one that would be a good session ale.
reddish in color. pleasantly bitter but not overmuch. a very smooth finish

Nice hoppy surprise. Clean, crisp citrusy aroma. This is an amber just dying to be an IPA but prevents itself by its balance of malt flavor. Very drinkable session type brew. Nice bubbly amber appearance - crips hoppy flavor lasts to the end. Buckhead continues to improve.

Name: Octoberfest Date: 10/26/2001 Mode: Draft Source: Brewpub slightly hazy amber, solid white head, fresh bread aroma, rich complex malt flavor, touch of sweet carmel, slightly fruity, dry finish -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Name: Octoberfest Date: 10/07/2003 lots of dry bready biscuit malt flavor, Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 6/10; Flavor: 7/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 16/20 Rating: 3.4/5.0 Score: ***/4 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.
Poured a clear copper color with a medium white head. Aromas of caramel and light hops. Flavor is malty, a little sweet. Light to medium bodied crisp and semi dry.

This was the Best of Show from the Georgia Craftbrew Challenge, although that only applied to the Oktoberfest from the southside Buckhead Brewery. Clear copper/amber with a small head. Slight hops in the aroma. Good caramel malt. Crisp and refreshing.

Gold Medal all-around winner at the Georgia Craft Brew Challenge Pours beautifully - like a pumpkin-colored caramel soup. The aroma is mildy spicy and mildly hoppy. The malting is ample, but not particularly interesting. The finish is clean and crisp.
A very nice take on Oktoberfest. This was very enjoyable with a dense coloring and a light aroma, but the flavor has a nice malt complex that is very appealing.

Caramel, malt and Cascade/Centennial hop nose. Orange-tea color with quickly fading head. This is a pretty stereotypical brew for this brewery -- lots of citrus hops, extremely clear and colorful. Mouthy brew with a silky palate. Cascade and nut finish.
Clean, malty aroma, nice orange appearance. Malty-sweet flavor that goes down smooth - strong to the finish. Good representation of the style.
Tap at brewpub. Clean pilsner but it does not stand out from the more mass produced ones in UB. Too bad.
Draft @ brewpub. Brassy gold. Smells like spicy Sprite. Thin, sweet, still spicy. Inoffensive but could easily live without it.
Draught @ the brewpub. Golden, with a thin, large head. The aroma has a light bready-malty character. Soft body. Has a slightly funky yeast character and also seems underattenuated.

Can (brewed in Europe). Pale golden colour, mediumsized white head. Aroma is pretty much nothing at all. Flavour is slight hints of salt and some hops. Not very much else to be found in it. Quite clean, but yet watery.

Can, brewed in Europe (BB 09/2007) Clear golden color, small white head. Light papery aroma. Light sweet malty, grassy vegetably hoppy (hop exract). Reasonably clean, but is it same quality or recipe in Mongolia?
Draft at the Khan Brau Haus in Ulaanbataar in 2003. Actually not too shabby for Mongolia. Pours yellow w/medium head, some hops and malts to taste. Better than your average asian pale yellow stuff.

Cask - The Cottage, Norwich. Fine, slowly fading white, bubbly head; clear coppery amber body. Tangy apple, yeast and some sweet generic malt tones on the nose. Yeasty with a toffee apple tang on the tongue. A bit damp tasting really with a slight nuttiness. Light to medium body, soft mouthfeel and a short earthy bitterness.
Cask Stillage at the Ship & Mitre, Liverpool 21/04/2006 Slightly fruity aroma. Copper coloured with some sour fruit flavour. Slightly bitter and dry on the palate with a full malt finish.

Cask gravity at The George, Bethersden. Copper colour with off white head. Well balanced aroma of earthy hop and caramel malt. Reasonably juicy in mouth with a good hoppy finish that errs on the earthy citrus side. Good balance of flavours
Gravity At The East Anglian Beer Festival.Chestnut in colour,small head,nice malt,quite dry,an ok session bitter.

column1: Buckhead Hop Island India Pale Ale
column5: Date: 02/01/2002 Mode: Draft Source: Brewpub Clear amber, frothy beige head, thick lace, fresh cascade aroma, cots of great hop fzavor, well bananced on a not too sweet carmel malt base, long lasting bitterness fdom mid flavor until next week, and a touch of carnel sweetness on the final sip -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Date: 07/15/2003 good sweet carmel malt flavor to balance the hops -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Date: 11/04/2003 Score: iii+ to ii Words: Draft Words: Brewpub Clear amber, frothy beige head, earthy hop aroma, dry malt flavor with a mild hop character, slight lactic twang, lots of bitterness in the finish, nothing like last years version in Cumming, average at best Aroma: 7/10; Appearance: 8/10; Flavor: 5/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 10/20 Rating: 2.9/5.0 Score: **/4 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.

column1: Buckhead Hop Island India Pale Ale
column5: A very typical IPA, nice and hoppy with a great floral aroma, flavor is acidic and hoppy with some nice bitterness coming through in the finish.

column1: Buckhead Hop Island India Pale Ale
column5: Best of the Buckheads so far. Aroma - thought I was in a South Florida grapefruit warehouse - nice and citrusy to say the least. Flavor was the same - and lasted throughout. Hoppiness was not overwhelming though in that it did not leave a bad aftertaste. Nice copper color appearance as well. Buckhead has really improved itself in the last year or so I must say.

column1: Buckhead Hop Island India Pale Ale
column5: The hop bitterness hits you right between the eyes from the first sip to the last. Nice amber color. Hopheads will love this one.

column1: Buckhead Hop Island India Pale Ale
column5: Citrus/pine. Not as tooth-peeling as it could be, which is good; I like hop flavor, but excess bitterness can sometimes be irritating.

column1: Buckhead Hop Island India Pale Ale
column5: Aroma is grapefruit and caramel. Medium copper color with laced head. Very citrusy in flavor, with butter/caramel finish. A very warm brew.

Date: 12/14/2002 Mode: Draft, Nitro Source: Brewpub Black, creamy tan head, light roasted malt aroma, creamy body, rich malt flavor, lots of coffee-like roasted character, medium bitterness that starts taking on a burnt grain aspect towards the end Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 6/10; Flavor: 5/10; Palate: 7/10; Overall: 10/20 Rating: 2.7/5.0 Score: **/4 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.

This is my new favorite dry stout. After romancing over Guinness for many years before I know what I was missing, I realized that sweet or milk stouts are my favorite form of that venerable style. But now I�ve sampled the supremely coffee-and-dark chocolate-accented Black Diamond Stout and suddenly dry stouts are again an option. Great, rich color; fabulous aroma, wonderful mouthfeel (though not all that dry). This is a phenomenal beer.
Well balanced flavor that is dominated by roasted chocolate malt. Medium bodied with lots of carbonation. Coffee flavors come through in the finish.

This was an aswesome dry stout. Not overly dry or overly sweet. Perfectly balanced, with just a little too much carbonation. Lots of coffee, creamy roasted richness and subtle dark chocolate flavors in the aftertaste. This one really leaves you wanting another pint.

Came from the tap with low carbonation, and an attractive dense black appearance appropriate for the style. Aroma heavy on roasted coffee, and the taste was also dominated by roasty nutty flavors. There was a faint undercurrent of bitter chocolate. The mouthfeel was dry and medium thick. I downed my pint quite easily.

(Nitro) Deep brown with riby highlights, produces a creamy tan head and very good lace. The aroma has a lactic sourness, burnt malts, caramel, floral hops, and dusty yeast esters. The taste reminds me of bittersweet chocolate with that noticeable lactic twang which works well on the nose but not the palate. The finish has nutty, coffee grinds, and bitter notes. Thin-bodied with a sticky quality but too fizzy. The sour taste overpowered the mocha and made this beer not fully enjoyable.

Pours an opaque black with a thick pillowy tan head with good lacing. Mild aroma with a touch of tartness and roasted malt. Body is thin, sour, and disappointing. Finishes somewhat malty and tart. It looked so good, but just didn't taste that way.
Black appearance with a moderate head and good lacing. Chocolate and coffee flavor with a hint of smoke. Medium bodied with a bitter finish. A good dry stout.

This is a fairly uninteresting stout, I thought. I had it on tap at the brewery, and it was nitro tapped. I don''t know if they changed it since the other reviewer tried it, or what. It was quite watery for a stout (kind of dark amber red colored), though the flavors were quite good. Some chocolate and malt flavors, with a bitter aftertaste. Not bad. Overall, it just wasn''t that great though.

Murky brown-black with stiff camel foam. Chocolate and coffee stout aroma. Bitter chocolate, expresso and fairly hopped flavor. Velvet palate with sharp nutty finish. Quite good. Compares favorably, in overall quality, to Heartland''s Farmer Jon Oatmeal Stout.

Date: 11/13/2000 Mode: Draft Source: Brewpub opaque, thin tan head, roasted malt aroma, rich roasted malt flavor, smooth character, slightly sweet -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Date: 05/11/2001 thin body, more of a light stout, needs chocolate to be a porter Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 5/10; Flavor: 5/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 10/20 Rating: 2.6/5.0 Score: **/4 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.

Excellent porter from the Alpharetta location. Very dark body is almost black, but with reddish brown light around the edges. The chocolate-milk foam head is soupy and leaves behind a nice lacing. The aroma is chocolately, with a burst of grassy hops. This perhaps could use a little age to get rid of the grassiness, but it�s not objectionable. The flavor is very low in bitterness, with a full, but not quite rich chocolate malt taste. Very drinkable.

This stuff was great and definitely something I could drink over and over again. Not very consistent from glass to glass though. The first glass was just chock full of chocolately goodness while the later glasses were like drinking a cup of coffee. Very roasted and nutty, incredibly creamy and rich, full of flavor.
Maybe I got the bottom of the barrel - but this did not do a lot for me. Almost skunky in aroma and flavor - will try again on another visit - hardly rates as a porter except for the dark color.
Very nice. Rich, coffeeish, but stopping just shy of being a stout. Excellent with the restaurant's venison.
My favorite of the Buckhead beers I have tried. Deep brown color with a rich, malty flavor. Very smooth and easy to drink.
Good coffee and vanilla aroma. Deep rootbeer brown, with short head and good carbonation. Very smooth frontend with char flavoring on the backend. Medium body.

Until someone proves otherwise: The label mentions both �Red Panda Lager Beer� AND �Red Panda Special Weissbier�, which means the 2 entries in Ratebeer could be the very same beer. Have posted my ratings under Red Panda Weissbier because of it�s more obvious weissbeer character

on tap at silo 102 in bern, 5 fr/0.33l. pours a clear pale golden with a dense head and a nice lacing. strong aroma of green apples, hay, a hint of dough. flavour of grass, soap, peppercorn. lots of grassy bitterness and some malty sweetness in the finish. nice and round.
On top of a hill in Bern: Pours gold without much head. Aroma is grainy. Taste is sweet and pretty minimal. Almost no hops. Meh. Not exactly bad, but far from good.

Recht strak hopfige Aromen. Dursichtiges, gelb, typisch langer Lagerschaum. Hopfig bitter zu Beginn, etwas malziger und fruchtiger am Schluss. Besser als Feldschl�sschen! ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottel. A clear golden colored beer with thick white head. The aroma of malts and grainy. Watery.
Bottled 33cl. Courtesy of Bov. White pepper, spicy hops and pear most present in the nose. Good bitterness. A nice surprise. Thanks a lot Bov!

Yellow colored, medium sized white head. Thin aroma with some fruits and esters, lemon dominates. Thin to medium bodied, slightly watery palated. Flavor is fruity with some sweet caramelly character, aftertaste dries only with slight hops. Not very interesting.
Golden beer with a flat appearance. The aroma is hopped and dry with a good hint of malts, and the flavour is very dry. Overall a bit if a disappointing effort.

from Bierh�tte.ch - clear and pale golden colour with a modest white foam left; a gentle aromatic hoppiness with notes of corns, slightly oily and medium-bodied, a low tart bitterness and some malty and flowery notes in the finish
50 cl bottle. Pours clear and golden yellow, lasting and white head. Aroma is grassy and light toasted malt. Mild sweet, light grassy. Bitter and slight toasted malt finish. Medium dry far finish.

Sweet grain and bread malts, light caramel, oat, wheat. Clear gold, medium, frothy, white head. Light sweet. More grain and cereal malts, bread, light bitterness coming up, lively carbonation, medium bodied. The Pale Lager I grew up with, boring yet quire quaffable. Bottle at some random mountain hat in the Bernese Oberland.
Kurze Review von Untappd: "Unverbesserlich seit 1864" steht als Header. Wohl eher "Besser weder n�t sit 1964" Aber besser als Fledschl�sschen!

Bottle in Bern. Clear yellow pour, thin white broken head. Seemed like more of a wheat beer than a lager! Medium sweet with quite low bitterness and not much at all on the palate. Quite drinkable on a hot summers day and deserves a higher rating IMO.
Bottled (thanks omhper!). Golden colour, small white head. Aroma is grainy, mild rubber, fruits as well as some herbal notes. Flavour is cardboard, some mild tartness as well as grain and hay.

Bottled, thanks Bov! Clear pale golden, rich firm head. Slight aroma of husk and grass. Dryish with light body and clean mouthfeel. Grainy and slighly citric. Low bitterness. Highly inoffensive lager with some refreshing qualities.

Tap at Gurten Music Festival. Darker yellow color that nearly had a muddy quality closing on amber in some ways. Fluffy pure white head. Aroma of next to nothing, little bit of an herbal hop that�s about it. Flavor is a bit more hoppy than expected and certainly a bit better than other pale lagers out there. Very thin, watery body. Only palatable when one is very thirsty, tired of Cardinal, and/or the brew is served very cold.

Bottled 50cl. Appearance: It pours a clear pale yellow beer. Not much lacework. Aroma: Chestnuts, lemonade, soy sauce and ginger showing up. Soapy. Flavor and palate: Cider-like with hints of lemonade and ginger. Watery. Acidic. Low bitterness. Soapy. Very poor malt and hop profile. Reminiscent burnt plastic in the finish. Overall impression: Very poor. Probably rather easy drinkable.

Light yellow colored, little white head. Basic lager with fruity nose and mild hoppy character. Thin to medium bodied, slightly watery palate. Flavor is more German-hopped with lemony fruits. Basic one.
(Tap) Pours golden with almost no head. Rather bland, with some hoppy and malty aromas. Watery, and seemingly unbalanced.

Bottled 50cl. Courtesy of Bov. It pours a clear yellow beer with a small white head. The aroma is fairly hoppy with hints of DMS, potato and herbs. More bitterness than expected. Bready, sweet pale malts. Nicely drinkable. Medium bodied. Marzipan and potato sneaking in. Medium bodied. Dry finish. Not bad. A decent thirst quencher in summer I suppose. I didn�t dislike this beer. Thanks a lot Bov!
Sweet fruity aroma with thin grassy hops. Thin to medium bodied. Flavor is also nicely fruity with some dry lemony note. Aftertaste dries, but not much. Refreshing one.

pakle golden beer, with a quickly dissapearing head smells of some hops and hidden malt tasts of hops aftertaste hoppy bitterness and a bit cereally is a thirstquencher, not a beer to enjoy for itself
Pale blond color. A simple example of Lager, quite ok, with a strong bitterness.
very slightly hazy golden colour under a bright white foam; fresh but a bit restrained herbal nose; crisp and medium-bodied, some late bitterness before a quite long herbal finish - not bad at all
bottle, bought at the brewery just before they closed down. Golden yellow, small head. Malty and hoppy, flavours reminiscent of herbs and honey.

(33cl bottle, received from quack-duck) Clear, yellow colour with a foamy white medium head. Slightly sweet and grainy, strawy malt aroma with a touch of hay and shy herbal hops. Light-sweet flavour, medium to light bodied with a crispy mouthfeel. Malt-accented taste, strawy with a tinge of honey; moderately dry, still malty and slightly bitter finish with a rather shy herbal hoppy touch; a metallic tinge disappears after a few sips. Okay but not world shaking.
Aroma of hay and some herbs. Hazy, yellow color, white head, good lace. Sweet, light bitter, malty, little fruity, quite full and soft.
cloudy orange colour, few head, aroma of peanut and solvant, sweet, dry and strange, notes of orange in the finish

Pours very hazy ruby red, topped with a thin and just slightly off-white ehad, not lasting. Gentle fruity nose, berries and raspberries, slightly soury. Quite malty, a bit sweet with slight herbal bitterness, terrible leathery presence. Medium light body, almost a bit watery and no carbonation. Very gentle but something is off.

I bought this beer at the Coop in the L�man Center and I drank it with friends at Lausanne. It is a good amber, in my point of view. The body is red and orange, troubled. The carbonation is regular, the taste is malty, plum, apricot, some hop, a bit watery, well-balanced, nice side of sweetness and fruits. Thanks Fred to share this beer at your chalet, Arbaz, Valais province. More the time is getting ahead more I appreciate this beer, it is a perfect amber ale, well balanced and perfectly malty and bready, fruity with a touch of apricot, hop, well balanced during all the sips, delightful brown and orange body, slightly troubled, white foam, good job.

Bottled 250ml. -from Coop Sion Switzerland. Batch or bottle No.71. Clear amber coloured, small off-white head, dust and caramel in the nose. Sweet malty, caramel, notes of dried fruits and spices with peppery notes in the finish. Not bad. 5.4%ABV.
25cl bottle, 5,4% ABV, batch N�70. Light bodied, red-brown with a roasted taste. There is a very faint taste of burned starch. Not sweet like a lot of amber/brown beers.
A bit explosive. No head. Hazy amber. Light carbonation. Roasted cereals, acidity, watery. Subpar.
Backlog from sour fest. Thanks to whomever brought this bottle. Pours brownish with a tan head. Nose is sweet. Taste is ok.

Bottle 330ml. w. swing top @ home. [ Trade by fiulijn ]. Unclear hazy dark amber light red color with a large to huge, frothy, good lacing, fully lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, caramel, dusty cacao - chocolate, vintage notes, green potatoes notes. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet, light light plume - grape acidic and light to moderate bitter with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is watery to oily, carbonation is soft. [20100825]
Bottle share at stone sour ale fest, thank you. Amber pour. Bread, caramel sweetness, fruit, and light hops. Ok.
Bottle thanks to cquiroga. Pours with a orange body and a tan head. Aroma of brown sugar and wheat. Taste is caramel, oatmeal, and maple. Fizzy and dry.
Appearance: No 47. Hazy brownish red. Tiny amount of head. Aroma: Ripe fruit, malt. Slightly roasted. Taste: Lots of malt, still smooth. Some bitterness. Info: 250ml bottle, 16/11-2009

column1: Marin Tripel Dipsea Belgian Style Ale
column5: Tap at SF Beer Week Opening Gala. Pours cleae yellow. Ah, here come the Belgians. A Triple indeed, sweet, but rather unrefined. Body is medium, also sweet, with a low bitterness and a lively carbonation, but it�s not adding up. Candy palate, too long for its flavours. Quite okay.

column1: Marin Tripel Dipsea Belgian Style Ale
column5: Keg at the brewpub, 29/01/16. Clear golden with a decent off white head. Nose is caramel, sweet malt, trace of lemon, dark fruit rinds. Taste comprises Belgian yeast esters, straw, caramel, sweet licks. Full bodied, fine carbonation, light warming boost in the close. Ok for style ... The sweetometer doesn�t go to mental !

column1: Marin Tripel Dipsea Belgian Style Ale
column5: Draft: Poured a golden with white head. Aroma is fruity. Taste is fruity, esters, a mild spice.

column1: Marin Tripel Dipsea Belgian Style Ale
column5: On tap @ brewpub during RateBeer weekend, January 2016. Light, hazy yellow-orange appearance with a nice sized white head. Banana, peppercorn, citrus, spices, clove, pepper. Moderate light body. Moderate high sweetness and moderate bitterness. Decent.

column1: Marin Tripel Dipsea Belgian Style Ale
column5: Draft at the brewpub, served in a flight. Pours a clear gold with a small white head that settles into a ring. Sugary, with pale and sweet malts, hay, banana, wheat, and clove. Light-bodied, with moderate carbonation and a sweet mouthfeel. Overly sweet and one-dimensional. Not bad, but lacks complexity.

column1: Marin Tripel Dipsea Belgian Style Ale
column5: [1/29/16] Draught at Marin Brewing in Larkspur. Clear golden. Aroma of fruity esters and light spiciness. Sweetish flavor with malt, fruitiness, and a bit of spiciness. Medium-bodied.

column1: Marin Tripel Dipsea Belgian Style Ale
column5: Sample on tap at the brewpub. Clear gold pour with thin white head. Yeasty aroma, belgian tripel, spicy, light booze, grainy, fresh bready notes. Taste is lemony, grainy, nice classic tripel flavor. Palate is med bodied, dry, with good carbonation. Reminds me (slightly) of tripel karmeliet, good stuff.

column1: Marin Tripel Dipsea Belgian Style Ale
column5: Draught at Marin Brewing Company. Clear light golden liquid with medium white head. Aroma of jenka, lemon peel, white pepper, bubblegum and grain. Taste is light sweet and light bitter with notes of white pepper, jenka and grain. Medium bodied with medium to high carbonation. Decent. Bit sweet.

column1: Marin Tripel Dipsea Belgian Style Ale
column5: Draft at source. Very perfumey nose almost like a wit. Taste is full of coriander. This is like an imperial wit. Weird.

column1: Marin Tripel Dipsea Belgian Style Ale
column5: Draft at the Marin brewing company larkspur. Clear golden yellow coloured pour with a lasting white froth. Aroma is decent clean Belgian yeast, some spicy hop, coriander, orange. Flavour is composed of quite sweet grains, orange and spicy hop, hint of medicinal hop, a bit too sweet. Palate is semi sweet, highish carbonation, semi drying spicy finish. OK triple, but what is the point in a triple.

From tap at the brewpub. Pours cloudy yellow with a small, dense and chalk white head. Aroma is mild acidic, cornish and vague butterish. Mild citrusy note. Perfumed fruity flavoured from back of the nose. Light citrusy. Mild citrusy finish. Milky infection.
hazy orange colour, big creamy head, apricot in the nose, smooth and very flat with a touch of sourness in the finish - very weak

Brewed using liquid malt extract and dry wheat malt extract. Gold wheat ale. Strange aroma, some malt and hop. Light body, lightly sweet, poor malt, some aromatic hop, no wheat ale features. Poor palate. Beers of Switzerland

From tap at the brewpub. Pours cloudy dark orange with a small white head. Aroma is mild citrusy, roasted malty and vague grainy. Sweet caramel malty flavoured, vague milky touch. Lingering fruity and mild citrusy into the finish. Also close to undrinkable.
dark orange colour, fine head, almond and orange aroma, smooth, almost no carbonation, sweet and very flat, no finish, desperately nothing here ...

Brewed using liquid malt extract. Gold 'pils' (so called, but it's top fermenting), cloudy. Light abricot aroma. Light body, poor malt and hop, lightly fruity taste. Ordinary palate. Beers of Switzerland

From tap at the brewpub. Pours cloudy dark amber with a small off-white to tan head. Aroma is roasted, light breadish and mild fruity. Sweet fruity flavoured with a good roasted malty base. Mild citric to acidic flavoured finish with a persisting malt flavour but with light milky sourness although less than in the other beers.
cloudy amber-brown colour, fine head, light strawberry aroma, sweet and watery, some sourness, very weak - poor, poor brewery ...
Brewed using liquid malt extract. Red-amber pils, misty. Strange aroma, indistinguishable; syrup aroma. Sweet, some malt, phenol, not enough carbonation. Poor palate. Beers of Switzerland
Zwakke tripel. Geen opwinding. Geen alcoholgevoel, enkel wat mouten. Zeer zwak voor een Belgische tripel.
The beer has got a deep dark hazy brown color with a steady head and medium body. Aroma of malt and bread. Taste of yeast, bread, flowers, fruits, caramel. Floral finish

Appearance: Amber color, volatile, with a beautiful frothy cap. The Belgians are able to make a gorgeous foam! Aroma: Not bright. A little belgian fruit sweetness and hops. Taste: Ohhhh, everything here is high quality. Very nice body of beer, I call it like creamy)) a little bit of fruit sweetness and some spices. In the aftertaste pleasant hop bitterness, and dryness .. Chic taste !!!
S��-holziger, w�ssrig bitterer Beginn. Weiche Herbe, alkoholisch, feine Karbonisierung. Leicht metallerner Abgang. 10/8/8/8/11/8
pretty low in flavour but easy to sink and enjoy............................

tangy, fluffy, and slightly tart stuff - quite refreshing. sits somewhere between a gueuze and a blonde tastewise. nice big head gains an appearance point which is then deleted for the very silly label.

Carbonation, spices and little orange aroma. Light amber color, white frothy head, fair lace. Too watery, carton, light sweet, some spices. Short finish. Made me think of an unbalanced homebrewed beer.

Name: Amsterdam Blond Lager Date: 04/12/1996 Mode: Draft Source: Taco Mac, Sandy Springs slightly cloudy amber, scant head, sweet malt flavor with a tartness, sweet finish -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Name: Amsterdam Blond Lager Date: 11/05/2004 clear dark yellow, whispy head, sweet candy aroma with crist hops, sweet malt flavor followed by a dry finish, very low bitterness, Aroma: 6/10; Appearance: 8/10; Flavor: 5/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 10/20 Rating: 2.8/5.0 Score: **/4 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.
Bottled. Pale amber coloured. Slightly fruity aroma. Very sweet flavour of honey and malt. Bland.
Very sweet brew! Brown sugar and caramel combined in flavour and finish. Slightly alcoholic palate. Too sweet in the aftertaste.

First off, love the bottle - looks like a lighthouse - or maybe a baby bottle? Aroma has a slight licorice bent to it, otherwise, nothing really jumps out - not unpleasant. Light amber appearance, with a very thin white head. Flavor has some candy sweet notes to it with some syrupy sweetness. Good sticky mouthfeel, coats your mouth and your belly. Overall, a decent light Belgian Ale.

An interesting and nice straw malt aroma. Dry, tart, a bit astringent, some bocky qualities. A brooding back-malt on and edgy alcohol palate. Good light bronze coloring. Gotta give them props on the bottle, but it came off looking like a baby bottle or a big brown glass condom.
(Bottle) Pours an amber color with a very thin white head. Strange looking bottle. Has a vanilla flavor with some hints of carmel, malt and yeast.
An amber beer with no head. The aroma is sweet dominated by caramel. The flavor is also dominated by sweet caramel combined with honey, yeast, and hints of hops. An OK beer. Beutiful bottle.

Poured a dark amber color with no head whatsoever. Aroma is primarily of malt. Flavors consist of some sweet maltiness that is followed by hints of vanilla and some subtle fruit tones. Overall this is not a bad beer.

Apperance is a deep amber and the bottle looks like a lighthouse I kid you not. Aroma is a bit musky with some malty notes. Flavor has a slight sour character with a vanilla and sour fruit flavor. In that strange Orval kind of way I enjoyed this beer!

Light-medium golde. Like other posters, it was the bottle that caught my eye. I was expecting a blonde ale, and was pleasantly surprised that it wasn't. Light-medium gold. Hint of yeast flavors with a mild hop finish. A bit sweet for my tastes, but not bad.

column4: Unicer Bebidas (SBG Super Bock Group - Carlsberg)
column5: Aromat s�odowy, bardzo s�aby. W smaku wodniste, nie za wiele czu�, goryczki brak. S�abo

column4: Unicer Bebidas (SBG Super Bock Group - Carlsberg)
column5: 330ml bottle at the beach, Praia do Cordoama, Portugal. Aroma is light hops, light malt. Appearance is clear golden with a small white foam. Taste is bitter and very light sweet. Lively carbonation, dry. Refreshing and good.

column4: Unicer Bebidas (SBG Super Bock Group - Carlsberg)
column5: Luckily only 0.25 l bottle. Pours clear golden with no head. A: Hospital desinfection,T: thin body, no malt, weird bitterness, harsh taste,

column4: Unicer Bebidas (SBG Super Bock Group - Carlsberg)
column5: Melhor cerveja comercial em Portugal! E para al�m disso tem um pre�o bastante amig�vel.

column4: Sociedade Central de Cervejas e Bebidas (Heineken Group)
column5: Tap version is the best one for this beer. It's light, refreshing and good choice for hot summer days.

column4: Sociedade Central de Cervejas e Bebidas (Heineken Group)
column5: Halmgul med tunt vitt skum. Doftar lite malt och gr�s. Smaken mellanfyllig, lite s�t. Eftersmaken kort och s�t, ytterst liten beska.

column4: Sociedade Central de Cervejas e Bebidas (Heineken Group)
column5: Tap (random bar, Lisboa). Clear dark golden color. Small size, white head, stays. Sweet, booze, malty in aroma. Harsh acetone, sweet, caramel and malty in taste. Dry papery aftertaste. Messy and nopey brew.

column4: Sociedade Central de Cervejas e Bebidas (Heineken Group)
column5: Bottle from supermarket in Portugal. Golden color, white head. Pretty common lager, refreshing but not special

column4: Sociedade Central de Cervejas e Bebidas (Heineken Group)
column5: Bottles from Intermarche, Budens, Portugal. Pale golden coloured with a very thin white head. It has a sweet, slight soapy and grassy flavour with gentle herbal notes and a thin sugary fruity finish. Bland.

Bottle from Pacific Liquor in San diego, CA. Pours brown/black with a foamy tan head. Smells kind of like a schwarzbier. Pretty sweet taste. Not getting much bitter. Seems like more of a sweet dark lager than a burnt malt stout. Ok, but not something I�d seek out. The label subtext is "cerveza malta". Malty beer. That pretty much fits.

Very dark color with a quickly disappearing head..very very malty and sweet, touches of caramel and slight traces of smoke..Not bad for peru..yet more of a super malty dark scottish ale than a stout, no roastedness...actually, i taste lager yeast in this one...So i don�t know what I�d call it.

I had this beer many years ago at one time when I was only giving ratings to the beers but was too lazy and stupid to write down my thoughts. I will update this as soon as I get my hands on this beer again.

column4: Cervecera del sur del Peru (Backus & Johnston - AB InBev)

column5: bottle, bought at the brewery just before they closed down. Golden yellow, slightly reddish colour. Large head. Nose: roasted malt, reminds me of a Dunkel. Malty start, fruity and malty middle, hoppy finish and aftertaste.
clear golden colour, few head, hoppy, floral, full and oily, dry and slightly bitter finish with notes of peanut - quite heavy

After spending 5 months on assignment in North Africa I find myself longing for another. The beer itself is the equivalent of Bud Light however in the same was a Bud light reminds you of college Flag Speciale reminds me off the Sahara and sweating through every piece of clothing I own. All in all i wish they sold it in the states.
Given the climate and circumstances in Morocco, a very drinkable and refreshing beverage.
Highly drinkable. Light and refreshing suits perfect for the hot climate. Available on tap and in cans and usually in 250ml bottles. Only had it in morroco. And is the best out of the 4 local beers
Not the strongest hefe. Golden with a slick mouthfeel. Wheaty and sweet. Banana and clove are pretty muted. Tried in Grasten with Anne and her family for the first time in 2007.
Mainstream all over this beer experience. No need for a "special" serie, i you don�t make a "more" special. This one promise more in the nose, that you get on the tounge.
Tap @ Sct. Clemens, Aarhus. Unclear dark yellow with a lasting off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malt, rye and light hoppy. Flavor is quite sweet and light bitter. Sweet finish. A bit unclean. 270913
On tap (0.1 l) at brewpub, Aarhus... Clody yellow-golden color, average head... Odd hop aroma, typically for a pale ale... Boring flavor, unnatural hop aftertaste... Unspecial ending...
Draught. Medium high lasting white head. Clear golden body. Herbal citrus aroma. Nice hops bitterness on a solid malt base in combination with dry gass notes. Low carbonation. Long bitter finish.
St. Clement, Aarhus, DK. Tap, 200613. Amber with white head. Aroma of spices. Flavour with some caramel and fruit.
Draught at the brewpub. Clear golden coloured with a medium sized white head. Fruity aroma of hops, grass and rye. Fruity flavour of hops, pine needles, rye and grass. Hoppy finish.
At Apollo in Copenhagen, Nwe Year Weekend 2010. Golden with a nice head. Yeast and bread aroma, a bit sourish flavor. A boring beer.
Draught at the brewpub. Pale golden color, small head. Hardly no aroma at all. Malty flavor, spicy, mash, bready with some grassy hops.

On tap. Lightly hazy amber golden with a creamy off-white head leaving laces. Sweetish, malty nose - unfortunately also with quite some diacetyl. Medium body, very sweet malt and caramel yet somehow almost balanced by a fairly distinct and bitter hoppiness. 230111

Draught @ Bryggeriet Apollo, Vesterbrogade 3, 1620 Copenhagen, Denmark. [ As Apollo Rug Ale ]. ABV. 5.8% Hazy medium grey yellow - amber orange color with a large, frothy to creamy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, toasted, rye, grain, light hoppy, light to moderate yeasty, apollo yeast - grain, toffee notes. Flavor is moderate sweet and bitter with a average to long duration, strange bitter, burnt bitter ! Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20110114]

Tap @ Apollo, Cph. Pours hazy dark yellow with a big, lovely, staying, creamy, off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, light spicy. Not much power to it, though. Medium carbonation, dry and fairly light mouthfeel. Flavour has a lot of rye, spicy, some rye bread, sweetness, light peppery, dryness and mild citric tartness and some mild buttery notes that both detract. Long, lingering dryness.

Bottled (from old bottle at the brewpub. The lady brewer popped one of these, as they had a tasting in the evening, where it would be opened, so I got a 4 cl taster). Quite much pitch black colour with small brown head. Aroma is chocolate, some liquorice, mild alcohol, some vanilla as well as mild madeirawinelike notes (aka oxidized). Flavour is chocolate, liquorice, mild alcohol, vanilla, some roasted malts as well as mild honeyish notes. Mild notes of madeira, but not disturbingly much. Lovely, and probably was even better when fresh.
From an old bottle (2003) at the brewpub. Unfortunately, it hadn�t stood the test of time but had a clear acidity to it. Great aroma though with dark chocolate and dark fruits.

We were offered a bottle of this brew from 2003 on April 25, 2009, as the end of our fantastic beer tating. When I smelled it my thoughts ran wild, oh my god! Very rarely do I smell a beer and immediately think I do not want to taste it, because the taste can�t be as perfect as the smell! It wasn�t. Unfortunately it had gone sour, though in the back you could still hint a nice chocolate tone. How I would have liked to try this at it�s peak, it must have been amazing! Thank you very very much to Petra at the brewpub to go the extra mile and giving us this free sample, it was most excellent and awesome service! Black color, brown head. Chocolate, roasted, sweet scent. Also alcohol and wood. Very very very nice! Acidic taste, also chocolate. Medium mouthfeel, low bitterness.

A pitch black beer with a beutiful dark brown head. The aroma is sweet roasted with notes af coffee, chocolate, and oranges. The flavor is slightly sour, but malty with roasted notes combined with chocolate, leading to a very dry end of roasted malt.

Draught @ the brewpubPitch black coloured. Brown fluffy head. Coffee, chocolate, fruit and light spicy aroma. Was just what I had hoped for. Flavour of strong coffee, chocolate fruits and hops and unfortunately a very irritation sourness in the background. Probably because its an old keg (the brewpub just opened after 2 weeks holliday and the waitress said the beer had been on the tap for quite a while). Has a nice and creamy end. Would love to taste this fresh.
The best chocolate stout I have had! Simply fills your mouth with a balanced taste that last very long
This is a "kick ass" beer. The best choccolate beer i've tried. It ought to be more known in the general public.
Pours a pale golden color with white head. Light straw like color and taste, slight earthy finish. Notes: bottle picked up in Switzerland, Aug �19

Clear golden body with a large, creamy, white head. Quite strong aroma of grains, citrus, and hints of caramel. Moderate flavour of grains, cereals, corn flakes, citrus, and a touch of caramel. Moderate to light sweet taste with a light bitter finish. Quite light body, moderate carbonation. Fair enough. [33 cl bottle, enjoyed 6 months before BB date, from Spar Davos Dorf, Switzerland]

Naturtr�b, hellgelbe Farbe. Leicht fruchtige Note, leichter s��er Malzgeschmack,, der nicht aufdringlich wirkt, eine feine Hopfennote ( grasig), die ebenso feine Bittere runden den vollen K�rper hervorragend ab. Wirklich tolles Zwickelbier.

(Monsteiner Huusbier) Bottle 330 ml from microbieren. New country! Served into a shaker, ABV 4.8% Deep orange coloured body, clear, with lazy activity in the glass. Small and thick snow-white head on top, with average retention. Aroma has malts, grass, straw, light earthy notes, sugars. Sweet tastewith old grass, straw, malts, sugars. Medium body, good carbonation. Quite okay.
Clody pale yellow color. Hardly no aroma. Flat, thin body. Not much taste. Low bitterness. Boring. Nice bottle though.
330ml Flasche. Klar und dunkelgolden. Kleine Schaumkrone. W�rzig und malzig im Antrunk. Mittlerer K�rper. S�sser Abgang.
Butelka, piwo z�ote, klarowne, piana �rednia, do�� g�sta. Aromat s�odowy, smak lekko kwaskowy, dro�d�owy. Goryczka lekka, przyjemna. Dobre piwo.
On draft at several occasions in Davos, Switzerland. Golden colored, lasting head. Hoppy nose, minerals, some malts. Hopbitter flavor, keller-like. Great drinkability, a beer i could drink all night.
---- personal review, no claim to be representative or neutral ---- repost undesired --- ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Appearance: Hazy golden color with a fine white head. Some lacing. Aroma: Mild malty, mild fruity and mild citric. Palate: Medium body. Moderate sweet and a moderate bitterness. Average carbonation. Taste: Mild malty, herbal mild fruity and mild citric. Overall impression: Nice fresh beer. Personal stats: Bottle Mr Gundersen bought in Davos

column2: Atlantic City, New Jersey, United States
column5: I only tasted the Atlantic city water. Not good. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

column2: Atlantic City, New Jersey, United States
column5: Sampled at the brewpub pours a murky amber with some ringing eggshell head. Uh oh, some diacetyl on the nose, apple, caramel, mild butter, some hints of pepper. Flavor is also messy, caramel, breadcrust, carrot, butter, cardboard, pepper. Messy finish.

column2: Atlantic City, New Jersey, United States
column5: Draft. Pours reddish amber with white head. Nose and taste of grain, burnt pine and burnt candy. Medium body.

column2: Atlantic City, New Jersey, United States
column5: On tap @ Tun Tavern Atlantic City. Pours a clear dark amber color with a small foam of tan head. Not much aroma. Some toasted malts, light fruitiness. Taste of earthy bitterness, toasted malts, and a hint of grapefruit.

column2: Atlantic City, New Jersey, United States
column5: Light bodied red Ale, thin head, lacing throughout my pint. Business lunch sipper, bitterness is here with thin malt backbone.

column2: Atlantic City, New Jersey, United States
column5: Draft. Clear red. Nice caramel, toasty, and hop aroma. Mild sweet taste, decent balance. Pretty good overall.

column2: Atlantic City, New Jersey, United States
column5: The aroma is caramel, nuts, slight chocolate. The appearance is clear red, off-white head. The flavor is like the aroma, but more nutty, lightly smoky. The finish is noble hop bittering, some resin. Medium in body. Not bad.

column2: Atlantic City, New Jersey, United States
column5: Tap at Tun Tavern with Fantasy. Poured a dark, hazy amber color with small head and lace. Notes were hoppy, dry as shit, really ashy. Just hard to drink this red in quantity.

column2: Atlantic City, New Jersey, United States
column5: On tap at brewpub. Pours a dark clear amber color with a small off white head. Light malt aroma with a touch of hops. Taste had only a small caramel like roastiness with a light hop bite. Some mild sweetness lingered through the finnish. Medium bodied with mild carbonation.

column2: Atlantic City, New Jersey, United States
column5: With a ruby color, and hints of chocolate, this beer offered a nice balance of malts, with an equally nice appearance.

column2: Atlantic City, New Jersey, United States
column5: on tap-pours a minimal white head. Color is hazy gold-yellow with lots of effervescence. Aroma is wheat, banana. Taste is wheat, banana, alcohol with a little spice. Good carbonation.

column2: Atlantic City, New Jersey, United States
column5: This is more likea Belgiun Wheat beer than a Weizenbock but nothing to write home about. I�m just going through my notes from the NJ Brewers fest and there�s not much on this stuff. I can only assume it was average, so unless I find a way to make it to the Tun Tavern, an average rating it is.

column2: Atlantic City, New Jersey, United States
column5: On tap at NJ beer festival. Cloudy yellow in color with a white head. Nice banana clove aroma. Good beer. Refreshing. Hops are subtle. Enjoyable.

column2: Atlantic City, New Jersey, United States
column5: Tap at NJ fest 04. Typical cloudy yellow, white head. Nice banana clove aroma and flavor. Gentle hops on smooth malt making a nice refreshing beer.

column2: Atlantic City, New Jersey, United States
column5: Unfiltered, again served with a lemon slice, lightly carbonated, very nice creamy head that laced the glass, had that fruitiness that the other wheat brew lacked, this one was much much better

column2: Atlantic City, New Jersey, United States
column5: Cloudy peach. Fat creamy head. Light carbonation. Nice Weizen aroma laced with light tart fruitiness. Thick body, fat and chewy. Loaded with banana, cloves and soft crab apple tartness. Sweetly fruity aftertaste. The best and most impressive brew I sampled. True to form and downright incredible, despite the low(er) ABV and the fact the server thought I wouldn't like it. Guess most people send it back. Idiots.

column2: Atlantic City, New Jersey, United States
column5: on tap-pours a light golden color. Taste is mild, slightly dry. Good middle of class flavor. Nice finish.

column2: Atlantic City, New Jersey, United States
column5: 1/2 gallon growler. Semi-hazy chestnut. Foamy tan edge head. Moderate carbonation, a bit excessive. Serious sugar daddy malt aroma. Medium body, lightly airy. Caramelly sweet with a noticeable alcohol spiciness. Soft nuttiness. Light tangy peat flavor. Effervescence lightens as the brew sits. Finishes a little drier but still hefty and solid. Very impressed with this little brewery, considering they're the only one in town. They have no one to compete with and still maintain a high standard. My hats off.

column2: Red Bank, New Jersey, United States
column5: Draft at Basils. Clear gold. Light, clean, refreshing. Bland nose with some grain and wheat. The taste adds faint citrus. Easy, smooth mouthfeel with no aftertaste. Nothing special but, it went well with heavy pizza. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

column2: Red Bank, New Jersey, United States
column5: From tap. Pours clear and golden yellow with a small white head. Aroma is light toasted malty. Bitter, mellow malty and light fruity. Dry and light fruity finish.

column2: Red Bank, New Jersey, United States
column5: Draft. Pours golden yellow with a white head. Grainy sweet aroma with some light off notes. Similar flavor, grainy, a hint of sweetness, and ight off notes. Not bad.

column2: Red Bank, New Jersey, United States
column5: sample: pours pale yellow, clear, very thin head... no hint of lemon as the description suggests. Very thin beer mostly wheat tones... refreshing but no summer brew.

column2: Red Bank, New Jersey, United States
column5: Yellow pour with white head and lace. Light aroma of corn and malt. Unique flavor of malt and a light bitter. Good carbonation and mouthfeel. A very clean easy drinker.

column2: Red Bank, New Jersey, United States
column5: On tap at Basil Ts Red Bank. Super clear faint yellow virtually no head, looked like BMC. Sight aroma of cereal grains and hops. Flavor is similiar and very bland. I guess this is their Coors Light option, it�s drinkable I guess.

column2: Red Bank, New Jersey, United States
column5: Clearest light blonde. Quickly fading white head. A very simple, most accessible ultra-clean golden ale. Kinda bland really, its hops remain inaccessible and the malt bill is simplistic and very thin. Barely grainy, tiny bodied. I don�t know where the idea of associating light beer with summer came from.

column2: Red Bank, New Jersey, United States
column5: Tap. Pours a clean yellow with a minimal head. Slight citrus aroma on the nose. This a pleasent brew, especially for summer. Crisp and refreshing, it does not take a stand on flavor since there is not much going on.

column2: Red Bank, New Jersey, United States
column5: 6/25/05 Garden State Brewfest. This was under the name "XXX Summer Ale" at the brewfest...typo of some sort? Whatever, this was a fairly forgettable beer. Good for mowing the lawn style drinking but not much else.

column2: Red Bank, New Jersey, United States
column5: on tap-pours a yellow color. There is no aroma that I could find. Good carbonation. Taste is dry, maybe a little lemon and not much else. 080411-rerate

Date: 08/31/1996 Source: Brewpub clean yellow, scant head, light hop aroma, light with a hint of sweetness, slight bitter afytertaste Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 5/10; Flavor: 5/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 10/20 Rating: 2.6/5.0 Score: **/4 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.

I was EXTREMELY disappointed in this beer. After hearing the waitress extoll the virtues of its golden hue (true) and honey notes (where) I was struck by the blandness of this beer. Nothing to note in any way, shape or form. I could have been drinking water. Not even any skunkiness to displease, just nothing or more correctly, not anything. A blank slate.

Has a faint floral aroma - but hard to detect. Light Golden appearance - little to no head - lots of bubble action. Sweet honey flavor very apparent - makes for a very delectable ale. A bit of grapefruity hopiness rounds it off nicely. Excellent buttery mouthfeel. One of the better on es from Buckhead - has not been on tap in quite a while. Had at the Tallahassee location.

Buckhead makes some surprisingly good blonde ales. The Buck Light is a surprisingly flavorful blonde ale despite it's super light appearance. This one was a bit darker, but definitely within the style. The head was nice and soupy and hung around for a bit. Crisp straw malt is bigger than you'd expect from the style with a slight sweetness. Not as much honey flavor as I expected, but not a bad beer. Gets points deducted from being boring though.
Mild lemon/hop aroma. Very yellow with little head. Mild lemon and honey flavor with solid palate and caramel finish.

Date: 10/22/2002 Mode: Draft Source: Brewpub Dark ruby, whispy tan head, sweet roasted chocolate aroma, full malt flavor, lots of dry chocolate, hint of roasted, clean finish with just a hint of bitterness, -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Date: 10/07/2003 Score: ii+ to ii Words: Draft Words: Brewpub ruby, whispy tan head, rich chocolate malt aroma, light clean chocolate malt flavor, slight malt bitterness in the finish, Aroma: 7/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 5/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 10/20 Rating: 2.9/5.0 Score: **/4 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.
Like sticking your head into a smokehouse. Mouthfeel is sticky and sweet, with alot of phenol, and that takes away lots of points in my book. Had a bit of a chemical like aftertaste.
Smokey coffee aroma. Smoked almond flavor with plenty of patent malts. Slightly phenolic. Dark cola colored with little head.

Date: 10/07/2003 Mode: Draft Source: Brewpub clear dark yellow, whispy white head, light sweet malt aroma, light sweet malt flavor, touch of carmel, light bitterness, Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 5/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 10/20 Rating: 2.7/5.0 Score: **/4 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.
Another light but refreshing beer from Buckhead, lively mouthfeel with some bitter spiciness, and a slight hop bite in the finish.
Gingerale colored, not much aroma. Lively Hallertau hops. Simple but refreshing with a buttery palate and finish.

Date: August 31, 1996 Source: Brewpub Appearance: cloudy yellow, whispy head Aroma: sweet spicy aroma with lots of orange character Flavor: lots of banana flavor with just a touch of clove, spicy finish Date: February 01, 2002 Mode: Draft Source: Brewpub Score: iii to ii Appearance: cloudy yellow, whispy head Aroma: clove and banana aroma Flavor: light wheat flavor, hints of clove and banana, just a touch of bitterness before an otherwise dry finish Date: July 15, 2003 Appearance: opaque orange, whispy head Aroma: big sweet banana aroma Flavor: dry banana and clove flavor, light bitter finish Aroma: 9/10; Appearance: 5/10; Flavor: 5/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 10/20 Rating: 3/5.0 Score: *4 The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.

Served much too cold to me at the Alpharetta location, in the totally inappropriate pint glass, with a wedge of lemon stuck on the rim to add insult to injury. The beer itself is slightly cloudy with a tiny head, which is completely atypical for the style. At the sub arctic initial serving temperature, the beer lacks a lot of phenolic character and comes across as overly sharp and bitter. As the body warms up, it gets more of the clove flavor coming through, but by that time most of the beer is gone. Little to no banana or other fruit taste here, and almost no creaminess to speak of. The tart lemon peel taste is however nicely represented. Passable offering on a hot summer day, but will disappoint the purist.

This one isn�t so cloudy as most and that detracts from the appearance. It�s a pale coppery color with a bit of haze. the head is ok, but not huge. The aroma is nicely clove-phenolic, less estery than that. The wheat is big, cereal-like and crisp in the flavor. Very refeshing hefeweizen.
This is what it's like to get hit by the banana truck. Good mouthfeel, vanilla, banana and that wheat twang. I'll have to re-rate someday as I'm doing this one from distinct memory.
Bright gold and cloudy. Distinct banana aroma. Flavor is smooth and balanced with a lingering sweetness. Overall a very good wheat beer.

Date: 11/13/2000 Mode: Draft Source: Brewpub pink, white head, soft sweet raspberry aroma, rich raspberry flavor, not too sweet, hint of tartness, better than your average raspberry beer Aroma: 6/10; Appearance: 5/10; Flavor: 5/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 10/20 Rating: 2.7/5.0 Score: **/4 -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.

Fizzy, hazy, rosy-apricot colored. Understated raspberry flavor, with sour-citric west coast hopping. Finish was smooth for the most part, with hop bitterness hanging on through the mid-term. Well-balanced for a specialty brew.

Funky aroma - akin to day old socks - faint reminiscense of rasberry. Cloudy, orangerish appearance makes up for the aroma however. Faint rasberry flavor lasts throughout - a little bit too artificial for my taste. Will give another try sometime.

Date: December 29, 2000 Mode: Draft Source: Brewpub Appearance: dark brown with ruby highlights, frothy tan head with solid lace Aroma: sweet malty aroma Flavor: slightly sweet rich malt flavor, hint of peat, a bit thin at first, no bitterness Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 8/10; Flavor: 7/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 16/20 Rating: 3.5/5.0 Score: **4 Date: January 19, 2003 Mode: Draft Source: Brewpub Vintage: 2002 Appearance: Dark with ruby highlights, frothy tan head Aroma: rich earthy peated malt aroma Flavor: rich malt flavor, lots of peat character, too much?, no real sweetness or bitterness, not alcoholic, but warming Aroma: 9/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 5/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 10/20 Rating: 3.1/5.0 Score: *4 The score was calculated based upon the notes and an old scoring system.

The head is full and a bit soapy in appearance. The body is a dark brown, hazy, but showing hints of red. The aroma is richly malty maybe a little alcohol, but it covers that well. The flavor is very earthy and rich, but not cloyingly sweet. You notice a little heat after you swallow and that's the only time the alcohol fully reveals itself, although it does add a slight peppery bite to the flavor that balances the rich malty flavors out nicely. Nice.

Enjoyed this with lunch -made me not want to go back to the office! More like a dopplebock than a Scottish Ale in my opinion - reminds me of Celebrator. No real discernible aroma - just a pleasant maltiness. Cola colored with light brown head with a fair amount of lacing. Alcohol is hidden well until the last 1/4 but by then - who cares! Flavor is malty with a bit of hoppiness to balance it out. Detect raisins and prunes. Overall - an excellent brew by the fine folks at Buckhead.
A huge, warming beer. Very sweet and peaty, with complexities that come out as the beer warms and as the ABV kicks in. Roasty and toasty. Deep ruby brown with lacey head.
cloudy pale orange colour, fine head, floral, buttery nose, fresh, too much carbonation, sweet and slightly tart, notes of paperboard in the finish
Pours amber with a thin white head. Smells of citrus and perfumy. Tastes resiny and bitter with some caramel on the finish.

Bottle. Pours a murky amber with a thin white head and good retention. Aroma was hoppy, with sweet citrus. Tasted very hoppy with East Coast hops and the citrus hits in the aftertaste. The palate was full bite and carbonation.

Bottle. Light amber / gold pour with some white head. Aroma is citrusy and a little malty. Toasted malt, citrus hop, and earthy hop flavor. The mouthfeel is nice and light, but the hoppiness is a little metallic. Slightly dry finish with a little bitterness.
murky orange with a white head that leaves some lacing.nice hoppy aroma and flavor.a bit under rated i.m.h.o.

12 oz bottle from Alldaydrinker; nose of flowery hops with some light pine and background caramel; hazy copper with a medium straw head; flavor of light to moderate hop bitterness and a little caramel balance.

An above average IPA with three hops: Cascade, Centennial, and Kent. Bitter and full bodied, a good palate cleaner. Golden peachy colour with moderate white head. Fresh and refreshing. Some leafy mintness in finish. Appropriately carbonated.
Poured yellow with a medium head. The notes of hops on the nose seemd a bit grassy. Teh mouthfeel had a deep bitterness with a long bitter finish but some odd metallic flavors.

Bottle. This poured bright yellow-orange with a massive barrier of rocky, firm foam protecting the beer below. Little aroma can penetrate this fortress of foam, but eventually there�s a bit of a fruity, grassy waft. Onto the tongue, the initial impression is a very dry and acidic hoppiness. As I go, the bitterness mellows a bit but still rears its head as the final bit of aftertaste on every swallow. Added to the earthy hops is a caramel appleyness. Could�ve done a bit better with the balance on this one, as it comes off a bit harsh. This would still pair nicely with my wife�s spicy humus or some nice firey chicken wings. (#3101, 9/23/2007)

Date: 02/01/2006 Mode: Bottle Source: Tasting opaque orange, sweet and tart citrus aroma, light body, plenty of hop flavor on a dry carmel malt base, long bitter finish that�s too long and too bitter, Aroma: 5/10; Appearance: 5/10; Flavor: 4/10; Palate: 4/10; Overall: 6/20 Rating: 2/5.0 Drinkability: 5/10 Score: *+/4

12oz bottle shared courtesy of TomDecapolis. Poured a medium orange color with an averaged sized off white head. A bunch of small floaters. Aromas of citrus, orange peels, pine, and a little earthy. Tastes of mainly citrus with a trace of caramel. Medium bitter finish.

Bottle. Really quite disgusting. Vegetable water, cardboard and glue. All those people who give bland products like Ice Lagers a score of 0.5 should really try something as foul as this to realise that bland is still drinkable. Third world lagers can be so offensive as to be genuinely revolting rather than simply tasteless. I don�t know what this is made out of, and I really don�t care. One thing is for certain, I am not putting any more of this abomination in my body.

A strange cardboard flavour was present which was quite distracting. The bottle claims that it has won a lot of medals at various beer exhibitions.Perhaps for being different especially if you are a cardboard fan.

Dull gold colour, dull malt aroma (with plenty of adjunct evident - rice?) , dull flavour and dull thin mouthfeel. Dull in fact. No hop presence at all. Poor stuff. Mine was called "Bombay Beer" and 4.9%, but I�m assuming it is basically the same stuff. Hardly worth setting up a new entry for anyway. It may have pilsener in the name, but no way is this a pilsener - more like a typical, hot climate pale lager. 650ml bottle from Tesco. BBEJuly 2004.
might have been nicer cold. malty and with no real hops in there. still, after 2 hours walking around delhi trying to find a beer it was satisfying
golden colour, few hop aroma, light-bodied, vegetal finish..................
Clear golden color, little white head, little cereal and malty aroma, no taste...hint of bitter...watery. Cheap and crap.
Pleasant fresh hoppy aroma but largely went downhill from there, malty, quite corny, not particularly clean tasting or enjoyable.

Draft sample at MBGSF from old backlog notes. Pours a clear copper color with a small off white head. The aroma and flavor have pale toasted malts, caramel, light resiny and citrus hops, mild bitterness, meh.

Devil�s Peak IPA is supposed to be their "monster" beer offering for the big flavored beer aficionado or, perhaps blatant hopheads. Unfortunately for them, "big" apparently means "bitter." Deep orange in color, it has a thin, watery body and very low carbonation. The nose is pungent herbal and, using a selection of domestic bittering hops, it�s very dry and bitter from the initial sip to the long, dry, never-ending finish. There�s almost no balance, as bitterness overwhelms any sense of malt or sweetness. Did I mention it was bitter? Serving type: on-tap
sampled at MBGSF�10 - caramel malts, dry piney hops with a touch of citrus. Nothing to write home about, but solid.

Tap sample at brewpub. Poured clear copper color with an average fizzy white head that was mostly lasting with good lacing. Moderate citrus and earthy hop aroma. Medium body with a slick texture and soft carbonation. Medium bitter flavor with a medium smooth bitter finish of moderate duration. Solid drinkable brew that went well with my calamari app.

Surprised at the low rating here- This is a citrusy ale with a clean smooth finish-- The aroma is outstanding and the finish is as clean and balanced as any IPA with a 6.8% ABV would or could be! Truly a fine IPA and worth trying.-All this is a most relaxed setting! You will not be disappointed!
